review_body: On this stay I encountered the rudest hotel staff during my 20 years’ hotel-staying experience. A front-desk clerk, Lauren, snapped at me on the phone. Note that I am even a HHonors Gold member. . ..At the front desk, I heard that another Hawaii resident got waived for the resort fee (the amenities are closed anyway due to the virus situation) so I asked for the same thing. The manager agreed to waive the fee for this stay only. Because I never used any of the amenities and for being a Hawaii resident, I asked for adjustment of the resort fee to my stay 7 days ago. The manager declined my request. So I headed to my room. The room does not even have an ocean view, even though I am a Gold member. But due to reluctance to bother the staff again, I did not ask to change room. Instead, I unpacked and started a basic cleaning and disinfected the surface areas as I routinely do. Then, I noticed the glass shower door was covered all by streaks of watermarks, looking like it had not been cleaned. The cleaning staff came for a look and said it should not be like that and he would return and handle it. Since I already went over the floor with the disinfecting wipes, I was reluctant to let people in and mess up again. So I told the front desk that I could wipe it myself, given that it is just a one-night stay, but asked again for waiver for the resort fee from last week’s bill. After an hour, I checked again, which was when Lauren started her craziness. She said either the cleaning staff would clean the door or I need to change room. I was saying even that was inconvenience for me since I already unpacked and disinfected the area. But Laurent cut me off and yelled : “No, it is not inconvenience”, “No, there will not be any compensation”, “It was only just A water spot” (that was not true; it was not one water spot; the whole glass door had streaks of watermarks, or calcification of something, or soap scum), “We provided a solution and YOU would not take it”, ……. She has a higher voice and obviously a language advantage over me, an immigrant (she talked much faster than me in the least). The result was that I never got to finish my sentence and was choked effectively. And that set the miserable tone for my stay. Later the cleaning staff came but were not able to remove those calcification marks on the glass door– another first-time finding for me, since I never saw glass shower doors with stains that do not come off after cleaning in other hotels.Cutting people short is impolite even for everyday conversation and Lauren was doing that to a HHonors Gold member paying for the stay. It IS INCONVENIENCE for guests to check in and find that cleaning was not done properly. When I check in, I expect everything taken care of. Lauren single-handedly ruined my stay. The hotel adjusted for the resort fee, but they did not lose anything since I should have been given a lower Kamaaina rate for both stays. The hotel staff just acted as if they did not see my Hawaii ID.

I will never forget the incredible stay at the Hilton I went with my significant other who is now my Husband. The staff made me feel special the location was awesome and the amenities were awesome. My next trip I will stay at the Hilton !!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

I enjoyed my stay. I appreciate that we were accommodated at the last minute for 15 days. With such a wonderful experience and the messages asking if everything was going fine with our stay. I feel guilty asking about my points and days that don't show on my account. Other than that can't complain about parking everything around is walking distance and the public transportation stops right in front of the hotel for $5.00 you can get a day pass and for $2.75 a one way fare. I rented a car 2 days which I had no problem parking on the street.

After 20 hours of traveling, maybe I was a little critical but I expected more. Things started off great with a bottle of water and a cookie for all 6 of us. Since I reserved a room for 6 people, I expected the room to be ready for 6 people. The sofa bed had no linens and there was only 1 tiny bottle of shampoo for all of us. After 3 calls to the front desk we finally got all of the sheets, pillows, blankets and shower products that we needed for a traveling family of 6. Next morning, only 2 get the complimentary ‘continental’ breakfast. Doesn’t matter that my reservation was for my husband and I, and 4 of our kids. So, only the small selection of muffins and bread to make toast and bananas. All of the hot stuff around the perimeter is extra. The omelette bar, potatoes, bacon, etc is an extra charge. By the time all of us ate a hot breakfast My room cost me almost another $100. Add in another $40 for parking and my “bargain” $325 room ended up costing me $475. Should have gone with my 2nd choice that probably would have turned out less expensive.One good note, the bed was super comfy!

I can't say enough good things about Hilton Garden Inn....the customer service is outstanding and care towards guests. The location in Waikiki is obviously perfect near to everything, the rooms are lovely and well maintained. I highly recommendand will be back in September.

Near to lots of shops and decent eateries. Modern decor and rooms. Staff were nice. They have a laundry. Just make sure you tell room keeping to do your rooms in the morning. Try and get higher than level 2 if you would like a decent view.

Diamond head city rooms have a loud unsightly construction pit. Quite loud workings. Not visually pleasant and sadly you can’t sit on your balcony as your full view is over taken by mud and dirt do machines. The rooms are very corporate and don’t feel very holiday like.

We were pleased with this hotel - service was good, room was clean, close to restaurants, shops and short walk to the beach. On our first night, we had an issue with late night noise from people in a connecting room - in the morning, we asked for a change of rooms; staff were very apologetic for the noise issue and moved us to a new room that same morning; the cafe on the ground level is convenient for "grab and go" items; there is a resort fee of almost $30 per night but that appears to be similar to hotels in that area so you need to be aware of that cost before you book. Concierge staff were helpful in answering our questions; bus stop and trolley stop are right outside the main door; overall, we would recommend this hotel as a good place to stay in Waikiki.

I would not recommend this if you are bringing children. The pool was filthy. Our son always wears swim goggles and after one day, refused to go in the pool because it was very dirty. The extra charge of $25 a day for amenities is a joke. We also got taken on booking a few tours after agreeing to attend their “time share” (Hilton Grand Vacation) presentation to receive a discount on the tours. I checked the same tours with the same companies on line and found it would have been cheaper if we had book on our own. Real scam.

This is a slightly upscale Hilton Garden Inn in the heart of Waikiki- 5 minutes from Waikiki beach. The location is excellent with shops and restaurants in abundance. Our room was small but nice. The bathroom was extremely small. We had a balcony with partial ocean view. But beware if your having a rental car. The hotel charges $45 per day for parking (valet only) and street parking is diff it to come by. Also the hotel (like all Hawaii hotels) charged a resort fee - not sure why. Maybe because they have free yoga classes!!! All in all go for it if you are into name brand hotels and get a room for under $180

Stayed here for the remainder of our long weekend trip, 2 nights. The check in was quick. Only valet was available as a parking option and it was $45! That is pretty steep but its Waikiki I suppose. The valet people were great! One even offered us a buggy board and beach toys for the kids. We just have to return it before we leave. We reserved a double room but got a king with a sofa pull out which was fine. That room seemed much bigger than the typical rooms from the pictures. We had a handicap accessible room and the shower sucked! Water was everywhere every time someone showered. We chose this hotel because of the location. It was right across the street from International Market and having been here multiple times, my favorite coffee shop, Kona Purveyors. Lots of places to eat and shop at around here and the beach is only 2 blocks away.

Between the rude staff, lack of amenities, and the construction next door I do not recommend this hotel. They also over charged my booking and only corrected it once I brought it up. The same issue happened with another in our group, leading me to believe it was purposeful.

we had an excellent stay overall. very good service and the rooms are clean. but beware of resort fees -- it wasn't explicit enough at the time of the booking and i only realized they charge resort fees (~$30/night/room) after i got the bill!

The best part of this hotel was the cleaning staff, they were friendly and always willing to be helpful and get whatever you need. Sadly the front desk staff was quite underwhelming. There was no Hawaiian ambience in the lobby sadly. With the construction right next-door starting at 7 AM and the very loud elevators double ring every time the doors open, I honestly couldn’t wait to get out of the very small room. A phone at the little desk would be helpful, the coffee maker was a nice touch as was the little fridge. The Internet went off and on all day every day for the 9 days I was there. I’ve been very fortunate to stay at Marriotts, Hyatts but even when I stayed at less expensive resorts all over the world I have never encountered such uncomfortable pool lounge chairs, the two bars under the chair would stab your neck area and back, one man stood up and he had the imprint of the bar across his back. They did have a pool bar serving drinks so that was an added bonus but not able to order food from there which was too bad. The general manager who was serving that day was very nice. The location was good being close to the international marketplace and just a 2 to 3 block walk to the beach. For an extra 40-50.00 a night you can stay at a much more comfortable, quiet and friendlier hotel closer to beach.

This was my first stay at this hotel since it became a Hilton. I stayed before but it was still the old Ohana West. We stayed for 3 nights in February 2020. We have Diamond status and booked using points. We checked the available rooms online a day before and also before going to the hotel. A 1 bedroom suite was available on their app on the date of check in so we quickly locked that in. We were surprised that the suite was available on points. It was a big corner room on a high floor. We liked how spacious it was. The only problem we have (which is true of almost all hotels) is the lack of lighting. The room was too dark after sunset even with all the floor lamps on. We also got free breakfast during our stay due to Hilton status. The selection was pretty much the same everyday. So if you’re staying a week, and eating breakfast on status daily then it can get old. The hotel was renovated a few years ago when it became a Hilton so things look new for now. The staff were friendly.The location is convenient. Its close to bus stops, restaurants, shopping. The International Market Place is across and then the Royal Hawaiian Center is the street across that. Its not beach front but I don’t think that’s a deal breaker. The beach is about a block or 2 away. There is construction across the street. I didn’t think it was too noisy but I’m sure the experience is different for those whose room is close to the noise.

Over all good experience. Helpful staff etc. Pool is pretty small/shallow 3.5ft, can't see the beach, maybe if on the 20th floor not sure, have to pay to park here 45$ a night. Despite all of this, the beach is only 2-3 blocks away, not a bad stay if wanting to stay by waikiki but not pay a whole lot.

Had an extra night to kill in Honolulu and didnt want to spend another $400 at some fancy resort, thought this Hilton property would do the trick. It did: my room was large and clean, i slept like a baby. The property itself is well located near the International Market Place and has a lovely pool area (that i didnt get to use), but this isnt a beach property or a resort. Just a convenient clean hotel. Great shower and I slept like a baby.At a Hilton Honors Gold Member, I did get free breakfast downstairs which was ample and pretty good. The app told me I could choose my room- but then offered three floors of the exact same room, facing the back/parking lot area. This is my only gripe- I should have been upgraded if available, and the hotel did not seem full, but i was automatically put in a basic room. But thats griping about the program, not the property which was solidi.
user_name:
nb424
New York City, New York

review_body: The hotel is located across international market mall and other shoppings. The room we had were not very clean and smells slightly. If you are only looking for location, this is the one. Otherwise look for something else!

I was on a business trip for five days and was told to stay in Waikiki area of Honolulu. Booked a ocean view room and had to pay few dollars more for the same. However, upon checking in could not stop laughing at the ocean view. It was ocean view from 7th floor but with nearly two decent sized properties in between the hotel balcony and the ocean view. Location is okay but need not book and pay more for ocean view. Breakfast options after paying 16 USD are not that great. So one can have much more options in cafes nearby. Room size is okay and good for two people. Net net a good option but may be I could have saved more money.

We had requested a city view room and paid extra for it....but the only city view we had was if we were out on out the balcony and hung over the rail and looked to the left. I asked at the front desk about this and was told it was a 'city view room'. So I guess we had a difference of opinion on that. We had reserved a king size bed room and that was fine but the room didn't look anything like the one in the website online. The lighting in the bathroom was awful There was no light over the sink....it was impossible to put on makeup inn there...they had a lamp sitting on the bathroom credenza with a very low wattage bulb. Also the restaurant down in the lobby kept adverising a diner special but when we went there for dinner, it wasn't available anymore due to some obvious bogus reason. Luckily this hotel is across the street from the International Market place and there were several good restaurant there that got our business.....some had great happy hours, as well. The hotel is located just about two long blocks from the beach which was nice. And most of the people at the front desk were helpful.

This a nice hotel BUT there are some issues that I discovered on a recent stay. First off, the rooms! There is an elevator shaft that runs directly next to the hotel rooms and if you are unlucky enough to get a room anywhere near these beasts get ready for a sleepless night. It sounds like fighter jets taking off all night long. Really bad. We were able to get moved the next day and it helped somewhat. You could still hear them but at least the noise didn't knock my fillings loose. The room were ok accept I really thought they could have been cleaner. For my money, I would spend the extra $$ and stay nearer the beach. MY main gripe was the we booked our stay through COSTCO and the Hilton staff would not let us accumulate Hilton points because we booked through costco. I felt that was a tad tacky on their part. Next time, it's a different hotel for us. One last issue was the complimentary breakfast. Dear God, it was bad. Really bad.....It's not hard to put out a decent breakfast. They took the easy way out with institutional eggs and cereal.

I spent 8 days at HGI Waikiki Beach.Here is the download:Pro's:Location-close to shopping, tons of restaurants, and a short walk to the beach, pretty clean room, amazing shower pressure, and a small balcony with a nice partial view of the ocean about 2 blocks away. There is also a small fridge and microwave in the room. The cons-Lot's of fees- Valet is $45/day and there is a resort fee that's $29/day. The pool is very small. Internet was pretty spotty on my phone. I couldn't get access to the Wi-Fi. I was able to get to the Hilton website but not much more. It did work pretty well on my laptop. The breakfast was $16. Luckily, I have Diamond status so breakfast was included otherwise, I would not bother eating there. There is a convenience store on the first floor adjacent to the Lobby, the prices were pretty reasonable. The room has a table but not a desk so if you plan to work in the room, it will be difficult.

Our room was clean and comfortable. Breakfast buffet was really well done. Location is across from Saks and top shopping. Short walk to beach. Lower resort fees than other hotels in area. We will stay again.

Everyone was very friendly and courteous. Kudos to bell man (people) who helped us by calling for transportation to the airport. Also want to give kudos to Beverly who cleaned our room. Great location easy access to TheBus.

I stay on average 125+ days per year at Hilton brand hotels and this at the very bottom of all the ones I have stayed at worldwide.Rooms are old and tiredBalcony is super loud, uncomfortable and not invitingSame breakfast served day after day after day where you write down your egg selection on photocopied paper with pencilStaff never once acknowledged Diamond statusMaids are tired and do very basic for cleanliness Received zero extra as Diamond member even though I had emailed a request weeks in advanceLots of prostitutes in this block starting at 10pm daily handing out business cards haha

Room was clean. Ample space for one or two people. Located near a canal with plenty of restaurants and the international mall right across the street. Small convenience located in lobby was very convenient and priced reasonably. About a 10-15 min walk to the beach.

Ive stayed at every Hilton property in Waikiki and this one is by far the best location. Each room has a balcony, and it is within perfect location to beach, and the shopping centre across the street with majority of Waikiki's major restaurants. The rooms are very comfortable and the hotel staff are great. Pool area is lovely as well. I especially appreciated the hospitality rooms that the hotel offered for late flights. Many hotels find this an issue. I would stay here again anytime I return to Waikiki.

Close to everything, great little place. Clean, safe and comfortable. I was worried it would be noisier as it’s close to the busy street, but quite the contrary. Unless you sleep with the windows open, you might hear the delivery trucks in the early morning.

We stayed here for 5 nights. It is an a pretty good location, you can get to the beach by cutting through the shopping centre across the road. The hotel pool is pretty good, obviously not like the pools looking out over the beach but it is a nice area with a bar. The only let down is that we would have loved a spa/hot tub. Lots of food options nearby. The staff were friendly, especially the room stewards. Beds were comfy although on the smaller side. Overall a good stay.

Sometimes flights arrive in the morning. Many hotels in Waikiki like to lecture you about early check-in. Not here. The smiling front desk staff could probably tell I had been in the air for 16 hours. “I have a room ready for you now” she said handing over 2 bottles of water. Room was clean. Small lanai but nice view. I can’t give 5 stars because of the resort fee. This is a hotel, not a resort.

I use Hilton properties on a regular basis and have never had a major issue. When I have encountered a problem the staff has been more than accommodating. I will continue to use the Hilton brand over all others.

All hotel staff we encountered were friendly. Check-in was smooth. Our room and balcony looked out towards the Ala Wei Canal through some buildings. The balcony had two chairs. The bed was very comfortable. The size of the room was small. Getting up and down in the hotel take some time as there does not seem to be enough elevators for the amount of rooms. The breakfast buffet was included with our room. It was just adequate but all the servers were friendly. The location is close to shopping, restaurants and to Waikiki Beach. We did not use the gym or the pool.

For what you pay for this hotel, it really isn’t anything special. Wifi drops out constantly, the ‘continental’ breakfast is very limited. We paid full price for a room that was facing the construction zone next door - loud machinery starting from 6am every morning. Rooms are clean and modern, beds fairly comfortable but again nothing special/ luxurious. Location good. Overall just an average stay, probably wouldn’t choose to stay here again.

The place was very good. Great location. Short walk to all that you can ask for. Friendly & efficient team members who care about others. The free Yoga class was very much appreciated. All hotel amenities were well appointed. Thanks for caring. Keep up the good work.

The hotel is very nice, well priced, and centrally located. It is less than a five minute walk to Waikiki Beach. You can see the beach from the higher balconies and walk ways. It is across the street from the International Shopping Market. There are plenty of restaurants and shops within walking distance. The staff are helpful and professional. The Concierge was helpful with directions and activities/tours. The rooms are modern, updated, and clean. The beds are comfortable. There are plenty of outlets and storage in the rooms. They provide Neutrogena toiletries. There is complimentary coffee and tea in the lobby in the morning and juice during the day. Upon check-in you are given a complimentary bottle of water for each family member and maps of the area. There is Wifi. The upper floors have balconies where you have partial views of Waikiki Beach and Diamond Head. The pool provides towels and has a bar. There is also a nice gym we used. We had a family of five and the two bedroom room was the perfect size. We had a mini fridge and microwave oven. There are also large flat screen televisions in the rooms. We had views of the beach and partial Diamond Head views from our balcony. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay.

Had a pleasant stay at Hilton in downtown Waikiki.We were lucky to be able to check in to our room at 10:30 am (regular check in is at 3 pm I believe). The staff was exceptionally polite and helpful during initial greeting and all the other times we needed to interact with them.Location was perfect, less than 10 min walk to the beach, International Market Place, and numerous restaurants/cafes. I was surprised to find the room freshly renovated with modern appliances, furniture, and linens. Didn’t get a chance to use their rooftop pool and gym as we preferred to enjoy the beautiful weather outdoors. There was a great convenience store on the first floor that virtually had everything from quick bite to water/beverages, travel necessities and beyond. Was a real lifesaver for my teenage daughter during my one day sickness and inability to take her out for meals. Overall definitely recommend for mid price vacation in Waikiki area!

Amazing location near to everything and very convenient. Staff are warm and welcoming. Rooms are clean and beds are so super comfy. I would definitely recommend this hotel to everyone and I will be back for sure.

Hilton Garden Inn is at a great location, service and room was very good, the three problem was we had problem with the coffee maker, elevator were slow and made difficult for coming and going and if you have a car, the cost of parking is unbelieveable

The hotel is in a great location, near everything. It is a clean, modern facility. Staff is friendly and professional. The pool area is comfortable.Valet Parking has room to improve, specially about waiting time for the car and helping with the luggage.My room was near the gym and sometimes there was too much noise like they were dropping the weights (?). Overall it is a very good hotel.

I just stayed here & had a great experience. I stayed once before I’m August and knew how easy it would be- so i decided to come back for my short trip to Oahu. The check in was easy with the same front desk agent i had last time! Kerry was awesome! She was kind and professional and happily welcomed me back from my August visit. It was nice to feel like a “regular” and was confident I’d get a comfortable and clean room. I knew I wasn’t going to be spending too much time in the room, but of course it’s always nice to walk in to a newly renovated & spotless hotel room. There was enough space for two double beds with plenty of moving room and a nice seating area, mini fridge, keurig and microwave. We didn’t spend too much time on the balcony, but it was nice to catch a glimpse of the ocean over the international market place- and even could see the beginning of the sunset! It was super easy to walk across the street to the international market place and cut thru to Other shops and to Waikiki beach. Also, having The convenience of a food/small grocery store for necessary amenities in the lobby was ideal. The bell desk and valet guys were all great! They happily held our bags for us after check out so we could continue to explore the area! That was a huge convenience and they were all very friendly and nice and even took our bags all the way outside to the curb to our Uber ride when it was time to leave!My friends and i had a great stay and love the convenience and location of this hotel and friendliness of the staff. Mahalo Hilton

This was the worst hotel experience of my life. I suppose it's my fault for having decent expectations for a Hilton establishment.First, there were ants in the room, an infestation that the hotel did not take seriously. Someone investigated during the day, found the ants even behind the bed (!) and just sprayed some supposedly "odourless" chemicals and asked us to check when we returned to see if there were any left. Concerned, I asked to change rooms, but I was told the hotel had oversold so no rooms were available. Fine, we crossed our fingers.It was NYE so we did not return until past midnight and lo and behold the ants had climbed onto our luggages. The room number is 1766, please for your own sake avoid this room, the chance they will actually clear the infestation (which was promised to me would happen) is next to 0%. I suspect this for two reasons: 1) the housekeeping manager Jon told me they would take the room out of circulation and that he would send me an email that day to keep me updated on the progress - hasn't happened, and 2) when I briefly went back into the room to look for sunglasses I thought I left in the room, I found the room had been cleaned for the next guest, sheets changed and everything. Maybe if the hotel was less overbooked, they would actually fix the problem... but who knows?Anyway, here I am pinching/killing these fast moving ants on our luggages at 3am on the first day of 2020. Thankfully, because it was so late, we were able to move to a room vacant due to a no show - so we could at least sleep a few hours in peace.Second, the attitude of the guest services manager Alana Drew was horrendous to me, as she did not seem to empathize at all with this inhumane situation, making it sound like I should be grateful for getting some compensation (their first suggested compensation was 1 night's resort fee... laughable, in a depressing way). Though the compensation in the end was somewhat acceptable (unpleasantly I still had to pay the rate of the ant infested room), it felt like the staff (especially Alana) didn't think it was a big deal - which is mind boggling and caused me great frustration. Maybe it's just me, other people might be cool with sleeping in a room with an ant army.Side note, when I came down to the concierge at 3am to get our room changed, I overheard someone asking the concierge how many stars the hotel had as they had discovered cockroaches in their room.I booked this hotel because of the great reviews here, and it's possible that in fair weather (aka no problems with the room, etc.), this hotel would match those expectations. My advice is to either hope for good luck, or stay away.

Recently stay at this hotel for 2 night before the new year and overall the experience was good. The biggest benefit of this hotel is the location. It is right across from International Market Place that was plenty of shops and restaurants. The front desk was courteous and generous with water as we had ask several time during our stay. Elite benefit were also explained which is a plus. The bed was soft and room was adequate size for 2. Few down side of the hotel, elevator was slow. Every time going up to our room, the elevator section on first floor always had tons of people waiting. We stay at the 16 floor and I feel like the railing when you get out of the elevator is too low and needs to be taller since there is a lot of kids running around. Beside that, overall a good experience and would definitely stay again in the future.

During the stay, elevators will close, stuck people inside and wait a very long time to react.Need to wait for only one working elevator.....Besides the elevator, good location for shopping, eating, and beach.

You will pay a $33 a night resort fee. This is not a resort it is a hotel. No hot tub no sauna, etc. $45 per night valet charge. We took a picture of seven of the valet staff standing around the podium as we waited 20 minutes for our vehicle. Pictures will be posted later. I am the highest level of rewards status,Diamond with Hilton. We were stuck in what we called the dungeon. A floor with only four rooms surrounded by storage and the hotel laundry room. Complained to the manager several times and he did nothing to help. I can’t imagine how we would have been treated if I wasn’t a diamond level. We should be getting free upgrades, etc. Please do yourself a favor and stay away from this hotel.

Review floor layouts to avoid inner room balcony views which are dismal. Major construction on east side of hotel puts a daily damper on any activity on balcony or just having the door open to enjoy the day.Staff is very welcoming and attentive.

We are happy with our stay at Hilton Garden Inn with special mention to Josie in the lobby who is very friendly and helpful. Location of the hotel is perfect. It is just across International Market. There is also a convenience store on the ground floor of the hotel which is open up to 12 midnight. We were just hoping that there will be complimentary water in the room everyday. The lobby is very nice with modern furniture. However, we noticed some guests who put up their feet on the sofa.

I've stayed in a few different Hilton hotels at Waikiki, although room and facility are relative new, I did not have a very good experience with my stay. I was told by the staff that the rooms would be ready at 11am, but one of them was ready at 2pm. After check-in, when I was in the bathroom, the cleaner enter my room without any notification. And the switch of the shower fell off and almost hit me.

Well located and great value for this Hilton property. Close to the beach, right across from the international marketplace and a number of restaurants. The in-hotel restaurant had great food - the shrimp dish and the poke were favourites with my gang!

Better choices out there. Hotel was old and rooms were tired. The major issue was the lack of elevators for the number of guests, then one broke. The housekeeping staff were using the guest elevators sinc the service elevator was always in use. Not unusual to wait 3-6 minutes for an elevator and then stop on every floor.

Stayed here in early summer for a quick island hop getaway from Maui and truly enjoyed my stay. The rooms are great and you don't need a car to explore Waikiki when staying here. Their location can't be beat and the service was excellent. I would highly recommend staying here if you're wanting to be in the central of everything Waikiki.

If you want to be near everything Waikiki, this is a great location; it's expensive so if you can use partial Hilton points to buy down the per night rate, it's great; you can walk to all shops, restaurants, there's a lot to do, easy beach access; the hotel has a small but nice pool area, is pretty quiet, has laundry facilities, is super clean and the staff are very attentive and friendly. The bar is nice. The only surprising thing given how nice everything else was, is that the breakfast wasn't that great - best to order the custom omelet and not rely only on the buffet. Would definitely stay here again!
user_name:
Peggy H
San Francisco, United States

review_body: Hilton Garden Inn is no match for the Hilton Waikiki. Better view, nicer restaurant staff, better processes, benefit descriptions/use at check-in, faster valet, much nicer lobby, better selection of food. I can say one nice thing, it’s nice being close to the mall since the food selection was so poor I didn’t have to walk far for options.

Enjoyed staying here even though it was just 1 night. Got off the cruise ship early and when we got there they had our room ready. We were leaving for the airport later that night but lived the location and the room was very nice!

We visit Honolulu often and this time chose the Hilton Garden Inn, Waikiki primarily because of the rate and the fact that we could use Hilton Honor points. The hotel exceeded our expectations. It has a great location, directly across from the International Marketplace. Our room was not luxurious but it was utilitarian, clean, and convenient. It had a safe, which I always like. The staff was great. The one downside is that the hotel's restaurant, The Fire Pit, is very pricey...$58 steaks, etc.

The location is close enough to the heart of waikiki to walk from the hotel. From the moment of my arrival, the Valet Service, Bell Service and Front Desk was friendly and very helpful. The location made it easy to leave and return to.

this hotel is within walking distance to the beach and all the other places in waikiki the zoo and the beach are only a few blocks away it is clean and friendly you can store your luggage for free if your are staying at the hotel there pool and bar is clean and available to hotel quests there is a resteraunt on site and a small store

It is centrally located to everything you need while in Waikiki with restuarant and shops right outside. The beach is only a short walk away and towels are provided. Ample room to store luggage and shopping

Everybody at the Garden Inn was warm & friendly. Valet service personnel where so attentive. Not sure who will open my car door for me at home! Best of all was the cleaning staff! Not a pleasant job but they ALWAYS had a kind word and a lovely aloha smile. Irene took care of us for most of the 10 days we were here and she was always on top of our needs. Thank you, Irene, for cleaning up after us!

For me the most important thing in a hotel is cleanliness, services and location. This hotel was excellent on these fields. Plus friendly staff makes our stay very pleasant. They have a safe in every room which is a plus. Has a pool, gym, etc. The location is perfect, just two blocks from the beach, in front of a mall, restaurants, etc.

The hotel staff where excellent and super helpful, especially with someone who was using a wheelchair. the rooms and hotel in general were clean and inviting. the use of a comfort room was exceptional for my family before we headed to the airport.

I booked the place a few months ago not sure of what our plans would be.1 st the positive Excellent breakfast, very well located if you appreciate shopping night live and a large/ diverse choices of restaurants.I was disappointed because as a platinum member I received nothing special or different than a gold member which was a breakfast no room upgrade or special thank you gift.Room was cleaned but on the older/tired side. We spent as little time as possible as the hotel since we enjoyed the area around Oahu. Be aware that they are building a new construction right besides it. We were given a room on this side of the building. I wouldn’t book there again if I want Hilton’s recognition

Top notch accommodations in a great area for a reasonable price when compared to similar local hotels. Staff was very friendly and full of the "Aloha" spirit. Hotel was immaculately clean. Tons of food and shopping nearby.

The l]ocation of this hotel is excellent. Close to the beach and across the street from a large shopping mall. The room is very clean. All the staffs we have encountered are courteous. I am very happy with my stay and will come back in the future.

I liked this hotel and was able to easily redeem my Honors points with the app. Nice location across from World Market, strip and the beach. Remodeled rooms were very nice, restaurant and market downstairs was very convenient and good food.

Pretty standard for a Hilton. Nothing fancy. Annoying the only choice for parking is valet parking. It makes the overall stay very expensive .There was building work next door. Drilling noises and construction activity is going on for the near to long term.

1st- if you are 5' 10" or taller watch your head. You will hit your head on a smoke detector or light fixture in some of the halls. I'm 5'3" & could touch the ceiling without effort. Tiny beds, tiny bathrooms, just small everything. Good central location & fine for a crash pad. Won't be back & poor rating primarily because they left a note on our door Thursday that they were shutting water off on Friday from 9am to noon. We had to get up earlier then preferred after late night out to get showers & use facilities before the shut off. No offer of discount, compensation of any kind - but hey the note said they were sorry for any inconvenience!

First time at this particular Hilton, and it was a work trip. The Bus stop is right out front and very convenient to get downtown and back. Room was clean, bed was comfortable. Patio was small and view is just city stuff. Coffee machine worked great. Wifi was iffy.

Stayed here for vacation. Convenient access from and to Waikiki area.Within short walking distance from restaurants, shopping and the beach.Friendly and helpful staff.The room was average for this kind of hotel, with most standard amenitiesEverything was functional. The AC .ran quietEasy access to the pool on 3rd floor, including towels and sunscreen.The convenience store at the ground floor has all the basics to enjoy your stay.The breakfast restaurant at the ground floor provide a great price/value performance.

This was my first experience staying at this hotel but I have stayed at other Hilton properties in Waikiki. I have to say that I was impressed. Although I was traveling on business, I like that the hotel was conveniently located in the hub of Waikiki. The hotel is surrounded by great restaurants, shops and other attraction in addition to being close to the beach. The rooms were clean and well maintained with nice amenities such as a microwave, small fridge and a tea kettle (nice bonus for me as I am a tea drinker). The staff was extremely courteous and extremely helpful. The only two drawbacks for me was a lack of a hot tub and the valet parking which was slow and overly high in price as compared to other hotels in the area. Overall I would definitely consider staying there again for my next business trip.

Great hotel, recently renovated,everything smells fresh. Rooms cater for every traveler need including providing extra electrical outlets for charging phones etc. Reception was warm and inviting, everyone smiling like they enjoyed their work even at midnight. Concierge staff definitely knew about the local tours and went above and beyond to help us straighten out a tour reservation incorrectly booked by previous hotel.Convenience store is next door to the hotel which closes 1:00 am.

loved our stay, will definitely come back again next year. fantastic location, good value, excellent staff and service all around! All staff members went above and beyond when handling all our requests during the stay.

This hotel is in a great location and is very clean hotel. The bed was comfortable and the room was small but quite good, TV was good and overall was good value. The lady who cleaned the room was very friendly and did a great job, Nolan at the concierge was extremely knowledgeable and helpful. I was disappointed that the photos of the bathroom on their website didn’t match the room, I had a tub with a shower but the picture showed a walk in shower and also showed a balcony. I was offered a room without a balcony and I accept that I chose a lower floor room but the pictures on the website clearly showed a balcony. The staff member was very accommodating and was able to find another room for me so that wasn’t an issue. I do believe the hotel should stipulate if the room has a tub/shower combination as it wasn’t easy to step into the bath. The bathroom was very clean and no complaints but please have the correct information for the room type. The resort fee is a money grab, they offer sunscreen, yoga, a discount book for the International Market and a tea kettle and coffee maker in the room. A tea kettle should be standard, I could have purchased one for a lot cheaper than the resort fee and also the same with sunscreen. The discount book wasn’t much value. I know most of the Waikiki hotels charge this fee but it is a total rip off.no choice. The staff were friendly and quite helpful but the fee is a joke.

Stayed with my friends during this vacation week. Tried to power nap on the couches during the check-in process but service was so fast I couldn't. Our room was located on the 9th floor close by to the elevators with a decent balcony view. Rooms were clean and spacious with very good lighting for bathroom selfies. I only wished the fitness center was a little bigger or had more equipment, but I made it work with the free weights. Shout out to the valet team for pulling up the cars quick, we were running late to see the Backstreet Boy Concert but still made it in time! Hotel location is very convenient, we were pretty much located in the heart of all the eating and shopping festivities!

Service was outstanding, with a smile. Rooms are okay, a little on small side, but shower is nice and balcony view is amazing. You shouldn’t be in your room in Hawaii anyway. Only a block from the beach. Only downside if you drive a rental, there’s no self parking only valet for $45 a day. You might be better off Uber or Lyft. There’s a ton in walking distance to hotel

Room was immaculate, customer service was flawless and they have a 24/7 convenience store downstairs which was SO convenient! Only thing I would say was, I mentioned that it was our honeymoon and I was hoping to walk in to a congratulations message with chocolates or just a small decorative .... something like I’ve seen in some of their photos but we didn’t which was meh but other than that place was amazing!

This hotel is quite convenient to the beach and shopping and our room on 5th floor had been updated and was comfortable. However there is a large construction site next door which is very noisy, work starts at 7am so no sleep in. The pool area is affected by this constant noise.

The hotel is very nice and placed conveniently in the center of everything and close walking distance to Waikiki Beach. Most of Hilton Staff is friendly and they cater to your needs very quickly. Very nice hotel.

This place was absolutely amazing. So clean and inviting, perfect location, friendly welcoming staff. So easy to organise all types of different tours through reception. I literally wouldn’t stay anywhere else in Waikiki.

There should not be an allowance for saying there was a partial view, let alone paying extra for it. Ocean was Two Long blocks away and you could barely distinguish boats there. You got to peep between three high rises located between your 12 inch wide balcony. The vanity was located outside the bathroom in the bed as if washing your hands was an afterthought The shower was nonexistent. A slippery bathtub from the 70s was all that was providedCheck in was an argument over what was booked and the clerks interpretation of it. I was promised and paid for breakfast. He aid they did t have a restaurant and gave me four vouchers worth $3.99 at an attached convenience store. Check our was a “bait and switch “ scam. I was told I could check out late, then charged $125 on my card for checking out before the 3pm deadline

The best place to stay. I can't say enough about the staff members were superb, room were the cleanliness, very organized. Love the shower space. The restaurant on first floor is fantastic with food selections and wonderful staff members. Thank you for Everything! ☺

Hotel is in a good location on Kuhio Dr. However, the staff is not very nice or accommodating, especially considering that the amenities fee is charged. The gym is very outdated to be almost useless. Noise from neighboring rooms was loud- poor insulation.

Been frequenting this hotel the past month, and I gotta say....the location is great. However, several things (also noted previously) would help make the stays more pleasant.1. the niche where the coffee maker is located, is pretty dark. With the outlets at the rear, and black in color, it is almost impossible to find them. Thus, one would end up poking around with the power cord. Installing a light in this niche would be great.2. there are 2 fitness room. one for cardio, the other for weights. Why these are not connected baffles the mind. And the doors are accessed with your room key card too, so one can't just go out from one and into the other easily. Duh ! And, the weights room is not accessible before 6am.....why so ?3. in general, the lighting in the room is poor. Even with all the lights turned on, the room is not bright enough. Otherwise, great poke around the corner, 1.5 blocks to the beach, pretty decent deal. Now, if only they'll recognize my HH #. (sic)

Great hotel central to everything & close to all shopping precincts. Room fitted 4 people comfortably. We arrived from Australia so early 6am staff were fantastic gave us a room straight away which we all slept for a few hours to recharge batteries after our long flight. Would stay there again.

We were in room 850 - all "50" rooms are against the bank of elevators and are extremely noisy. Had cockroaches in the bed. Checkout went terribly. Parking for mandatory valey was way high. Will never stay here again!

Had a great stay at Hilton garden inn. All staff was friendly and helpful. (Josie was so kind and lovely to my kids). Pool area was quiet..lots of chairs and bar! Location is great! Walking distance to lots of shops restaurants And beach.

Had a room on the 11th floor that looked into a parking garage for the International Mall, but also looked to the ocean. Loved the patios with chairs and a table to sit in the sun and watch the action below. Great location that is a two block walk to either Waikiki of Kuhio beach. The rooms are very nice and modern! I had a king bed, and the rom included two couches, one as a sleeper, and the other kind of a reading/day bed.I will definitely stay there again on future trips to Honolulu.

my ist time to stay in this hotel.experience was awesome.the staffs are really helpful ＆ friendly.especially the housekeeping staffs Filipino are trust worthy.the place is great near to shopping beach ＆ bus station.my family will surely come back here .i really recommend this hotel .its safe ＆ clean ＆ bell boys ＆ housekeeper are great.thank u for great experience.Hilton garden INN.racquel nakano ＆ saina nakano from Tokyo japan ❤️

I’ve stayed in this hotel a few times, each time something new is updated, or something. Extremely friendly staff, and centrally located to everything downtown Waikiki. Will definitely continue to use this and only this hotel when I visit.

Location: center to Waikiki. A few blocks from the beach. 5 starsHotel: modern compared to most hilton hawaiian village towers. tiny outdoor swimming pool overrun by kids. outdated and very limited fitness equipment. coffee and tea are self-served in the lobby every morning. the paper cups are 8 oz and not worth the trip to the lobby. room interior: odd design. bathroom faucet is located outside the bathroom. the bathroom has a sliding door with no lock. beds are comfortable. cheap amenities. inconsistent replacement of amenities if you stay more than one night. Resort fee: $29 plus tax per day!!! this is a ripoff. this hotel is NOT a resort. they try to pull it off as a resort by offering a tiny swimming pool and fitness room. otherwise, you’re out $29 plus tax.Internet: $4.95/day. Complimentary for Hilton Honors members. Extremely slow. 1-3 mbps download speed. Dining: Breakfast is complimentary for Hilton Honors members who booked directly with Hilton and not third party travel agencies. $15.95 breakfast buffet. Dinner is $$$ and not good for the money spent.Parking: $45 plus tax per day. Valet only. Add $1-2 tip. Hilton Honor members: ***this hotel is extremely stingy and will NOT offer complimentary room upgrades. Diamond members are expected to pay $$$ for upgrades. Receptionists have different upgrade policies that don’t align with corporate policies.Save $. extra amenities (i.e. toothpaste etc) and gifts? go to walmart (opens 24 hours a day) take the public bus #13 located in front of the hotel to keeaumoku st (about 10min trip). don’t buy from abc store. most nature and sightseeing areas in oahu are free and accessible by public transportation/bus. no need to pay a tour company $$$ to drive you there. All in all... 2 stars. overpriced and not hilton honors members friendly.

We had very pleasant experience at this Hotel. It is about one block away from the famous Waikiki beach and in middle of most happening place, very close to all famous restaurants and shops. Rooms were clean, big and has all the amenities, staff are friendly and very responsive. The pool is clean, very well maintained. I would highly recommend this to everyone

Great location. Super close to everything including the beach. Will be staying again in the future as the value and location were unbeatable. Could even see the ocean from our balcony. We had the one bedroom suite and it was perfect for our family. Allowed us to put the little one to sleep while we hung out in the other room.

We loved this hotel. it had everything we could want. Close to shops, restaurants, beaches and transport.We stayed for 5 days and our rooms were cleaned every day. The hotel has a restaurant which we had breakfast at a few times but found it expensive for what we got. There are lots of restaurants that you can eat at outside.

We have just checked in and I noticed that there is a huge construction site just across the street. The noise is excruciating and non-stop. It’s hard when you are so jet lagged and trying to rest. Not a good start. The location is great and near the beach. I guess we won’t be staying at the hotel that much.

Excellent location and great staff. Rooms are a bit small but comfortable. Pull out bed is not for adults, can feel every bar. But the location is to die for, literally across the International Market and one block from the beaches.

I spent over $4500 plus taxes and fees for 17 days. No buffet breakfast included, no hot tub, the "extras" you pay for under the heading of "resort fees" are a joke. That said, housekeeping was good. The room was clean and the staff friendly. A/C kept shutting down and the shower wand was broken. Maintenance did come by and fix both during my stay.Breakfast given was not the nice buffet I saw online, but instead a "grab and go" from the little market next door. People at the market were friendly but some mornings it took up to 20 minutes to get your food. They ran out of or never received deliveries of items several times during my stay, which made the very limited selection allowed even more restrictive.

I got a great deal on a January stay and a terrible one in Oct. From personal experience it should have been the opposite. The rooms are nice and simple and the service is good. The location is excellent so I will shop dates as much as possible going forward.

Really enjoyed our stay here. Nice hotel in a great location within walking distance to everything. Lovely pool and outdoor bar area; the bartender Immee made great drinks for us. As it's quite warm and muggy I would suggest to the hotel to let your female bartenders wear sarongs to keep them cool and carry on the Hawaiian tradition. All in all we had a great stay.

We came for a wedding and the lady at the front, Kerry, made sure we were all as close together as possible. Unfortunately we were on different floors, but she did her best. The hotel has a great location, next to nearly everything. It was a very cute hotel, the room wasnt very large but that was ok, we didn't spend much time in the room any way. A bellman, his name was Nolan? I think, was super nice and had a great smilt.

Great location, great staff and an overall great stay. They were accommodating and followed up with very aspect of the stay. I liked the attached market next door and the breakfast I was allowed to chose.

Our travel agent picked this hotel for us. I usually research my own, but were very happy with this hotel. Cannot fault location, room was very clean and staff very helpful. Right opposite shopping mall and bus stop right outside.

If you’re in search of a great location in the heart of Waikiki, this Hilton property is directly across the international market with walking distance to beach and easy access to all Oahu destinations. The rooms are recently renovated with very pretty modern decor, immaculately clean and cozy. Recommend if you’re planning to spend most of your time outdoors which should be the priority given you’re in Hawaii!

Great Location , Literally next to everything and in Good Price ! Clean Hotel and Friendly Staff ! The Holoholo market is open till 2300 so you can find anything almost anytime , the ladies there are adorable ! Cannot wait to be back to this hotel soonest possible and we travel fm Greece , 21hrs flight time !!!!

Clean, comfortable, and quiet. Great location with shopping and restaurants across the street, nice general store on site. Friendly, helpful staff make this a great stay. Waikiki Beach is a 5 minute walk. I would not hesitate to stay here again.

Brenda was amazing. Greeted us with a smile and was very tentative to our needs. Thank you for making our stay here so comforting and relaxing, Brenda!!!! Hilton Garden Inn conveniently looked in downtown Waikiki made getting places easy for us. Only used Lyft to get from Airport to Hilton, and to friends house in Aiea. The rest of the time we just walked everywhere.

We truly enjoyed our two nights at this convenient hotel. The staff was friendly and respectful, our rooms were clean, large, and comfortable, with Keurig, hair dryer, and safe. The restaurant food is delicious, but pricy, as is most food in this area. We enjoyed making purchases from the shop and appreciated help from the bell staff in travelling to different venues. They were also kind to store our luggage upon our early arrival and after we had checked out. As a Hilton Honors member, we would have enjoyed complimentary breakfast, but it was not offered to us. Recommend.

This hotel is quite nice, rooms are small but comfortable. Hotel staff are super friendly, hotel is clean and beds are comfy. Location is epic for shopping and quite close to the beach! The pool is small but does the trick if you need to cool off.

We had a wonderful stay at this hotel. The hotel was very clean , staff was very friendly especially Josie the Lobby Attendant, she made us feel very welcomed when we first checked in. Rooms are very clean and great views of the city and ocean. I would definitely recommend this property and stay here again.

Went to Oahu, Hawaii last year. The island is exceptionally beautiful.......but the Rooms were small. The ocean view is not an ocean view, it’s essentially a marina view with the very partial ocean (need to pick oceanfront room if you want the ocean.

We have been to Waikiki many times and have stayed in many of the hotels in the strip, this will have to be one of the faves...the rooms are clean, great service, the pool was just what we needed. Our room was in the middle so it was very quiet. With the older hotels the walls are so thin you can hear everything. Not with the Hilton Garden Inn, at least where we were. The parking was a bit high, it is valet so we get it. Thank you for making our stay great, mahalo!

Great location in the center of Waikiki, near restaurants, shopping, the beach. wonderful staff,very welcoming and attentive to guest needs. Check in and out very fast and efficient. rooms are beautiful and equipped with all you need. Loved it.

This newly renovated hotel is fantastic. Rooms are very clean and up to date. Restaurant is located inside the hotel. Hotel is located across the International Market Place. Walking distance to Waikiki Beach and to main strip at Kalakaua Ave. Service here is excellent so you don’t have to worry.

I have stayed at this property on several business trips. The staff are always great. The rooms exceed expectations. The hotel is nearby to many choices for dining and entertainment. The restaurant, although not part of the hotel, is terrific. They have a great happy hour snack menu that actually met my dinner needs. The restaurant staff are also top notch.

My wife and I stayed at the Hilton Garden Inn in September 2019 and we had a wonderful stay.Due to hotel at capacity we did have an issue with our room location but after contacting Jacob manager on duty this was sorted and we were moved to a room of our liking. The staff who checked us in at the front desk Suzette was very nice and was able to check us in before check in time.The Hotel staff are really friendly and especially Nolan and Wade in front of the hotel. But the staff in general are helpful and nothing is too much for them.Hotel location is ideal, right across the road from the International Market place and only a block from the beach. There are plenty of places to eat nearby. There is a Holoholo convenient store underneath the hotel, we found they were bit expensive compare to the ABC store right across the road from Holoholo. For example Holoholo charging 89 cents for a banana and ABC I paid 69cents. This hotel provides free internet and also sun block by the pool, which I thought is a nice touch, it’s the little things that counts that make this hotel nice place to stay. Our room had 1 King bed and a sofa bed, room was a nice size with plenty of room and we had a balcony, which was really great to have our morning breakfast sitting in our private balcony and people watching as we opted for a City view room.Pool is bit on the small size but there are plenty of chairs to sit on and they also have shade if you prefer to stay out of the sun. Hotel provides beach towels. This hotel is only 5-8 minute walk to the Waikiki Beach.We took an UBER from the International Airport and it we paid USD27 one way, you can also take transfer from the airport which will cost you USD26 return but they make stops to drop guest off to hotels along the way.There is a Kona Coffee shop across the road, it was really nice coffee and pastries. For example for a coffee and a pastry we paid USD12, which is on average for Waikiki. Food in general is bit on the expensive side in Waikiki.We went to a place called the Steak Shack, and you can get a steak meal for USD8.95, in this meal includes salad and rice. Which is great value, and I recommend you go to Steak Shack, which is near Outrigger Reef Hotel and watch the sunset it is beautiful.We would definitely stay at this hotel again as the location is ideal and staff are nice and rooms are comfortable.

DO NOT book this if you have stayed at a Hilton before - or set your expectations LOW. I have been a loyal member and this hotel is a joke - they should take the Hilton sign off the building. Do not expect the usual special treatment if you are an Honors member. Do not expect as clean of a room as usual. Do not expect MUCH is what I am trying to say. I have stayed in hundreds of Hiltons and this is the worst one.

We stayed in 3 rooms for 5+ nights at this hotel and were hoping to get a good room with a view as this was our first visit to Hawaii. However, we were given a room that overlooked the dump site and construction. See below pics. Kind regards,Fatima
user_name:
Fati2013
New York City, New York

review_body: We stayed at the hotel for 5 days with my elderly parents on there way back to Australia from Alaska. We had a suite which we needed since their were three of us in the room. The room was large and the balcony was huge with some water views. The room was recently renovated, comfortable and clean, the pull out sofa bed was okay but not the most comfortable. The hotel was in a great location and the beach was easily accessible. The service was generally good overall. The pool and gym was reasonably basic. The pool was very small but this was due to it being an older building that has been renovated. My only small issue was with the constant debiting off funds on my card. Due to an issue i had to use a debit card and everyday Hilton took different amounts up to a couple hundred dollars. By the time we checked out there was over 600 in Debited charges that needed to be refunded. These took over a week to come back onto the card, so being a debit card it was funds i did not have. Having mainly spent time in Asian i have never encounter this daily debiting before in Hyatts and other Asian hotels, was a little frustrated.

Last month we, 12 family members and friends, spent eight wonderful days & nights at the beautiful Hilton Garden Inn in Waikiki! The people were friendly and helpful in every way. The Little Store attached to the hotel was great. It was clean!! The location was outstanding! International Market Place was right across the street and the beach just 2 blocks away. We had a perfect vacation and stayed at a perfect place.

Me and my guy stayed at the Hilton for one week. We loved it here!We enjoyed our stay, the hotel itself was very clean, and so was our rooms.a reminder when staying at this hotel as well as most of the others is the resort fee.The resort fee for this hotel is a bit pricy considering there isn't much EXTRA that you get for the price. The pool area is small and could be maintained better. The pool bar is alright, not open early enough and the selection is small with higher prices.The rooms were kept very clean, however most of the time our rooms weren't cleaned until far afternoon so we had to stay out well after breakfast time. Not a huge deal though. There are no extra little designs or surprises after the rooms are cleaned even with a tip, however they clean very well so no complaints there.They offer complimentary water and coffee on most days in the lobby which was a great touch, just not vey consistent day to day. The restaurant TR fire grill that is attached is absolutely amazing. The store that is also attached has very friendly staff and is great for when you are to tired to walk across the street (literally across) to an ABC ;) haWhat we loved most about this hotel is the location.. its in the heart of all stores, food places as well as the Waikiki beach! IT literally takes about 5 minutes to walk to the beach or the main strip. There is also a convenient bus stop right outside for distant travels!We would stay here again in a heartbeat because the prices are good, the staff is great and the rooms are cozy and cute with a wonderful view of Hawaii!

We had a room on the 10th floor facing the main street and overlooking the pool area. The room was quite spacious and very clean and comfortable. It had a small balcony, a small lounge area with a table. Also had a coffee machine, kettle, bar fridge, toiletries, iron. Shower was very good, bed was comfy. The only complaint I had (which I usually encounter at all hotels) is that the pillows are too soft for me. It would be lovely to have a firmer pillow available.The pool area is small but nice and has a bar.The location was great. In the midst of all the shopping and only 2 streets back from the beach (5-10 minute walk)The staff were excellent and very friendly and helpful. We actually had a 10 hour stopover the week before our stay and they allowed us an hour in a hospitality room to have showers before our flight. That was great service.I would definitely stay at this hotel again and would not hesitate to recommend it

I was more than impressed having stayed at Hilton Garden Inn Waikiki Beach for the first time! Upon my arrival, Derek welcomed me with a handshake and a smile along with two bottle of waters. As I entered my suite on the 20th floor, Paul texted me asking how everything was going so far. I replied back saying everything was going great! I honestly must say that Hilton has treated me much better than Hyatt. If I get another opportunity, I will definitely stay at Hilton Garden Inn Waikiki Beach again and highly recommend others to here too!

I stayed here for four nights with coworkers while in town for a work trip. I would never choose to stay here on vacation, but for work purposes, it was great. Even facing the street with a partial ocean view, the room was quiet, but best of all, it was CLEAN! The room wasn't huge, but I was very comfortable and had plenty of space. The shower was so nice being a walk in, and had great water pressure. I loved that the sink/vanity was outside of the shower and toilet as it definitely gave much more room for me to spread my stuff out. The bed was very comfortable as well. I'm Diamond and was upgraded and opted for the free breakfast. The breakfast options were great, but service was a little slow. I know we are on island time, but when I'm there for work, I just give myself some extra time so I don't get behind. The location was fantastic for walking to shopping, the beach to watch the sunset after a long day working inside, and lots of great restaurants. The staff was great, room was great, and I would definitely stay here again for business.

The room is comfortable, the check in was smooth, there is a gym and pool, pool bar for adult watching over the kids in the pool.Nice touch - yoga available early morning. The sad thing is the rooms are using disposable cups for coffee and cold drinks, also is the one off plastic use bottles of shampoo and conditioner. Coffee machine in room, no milk provided in the refrigerator. This place is walking distance to shopping and restaurants and the beach. The facility is a reasonably clean hotel. Tried the Hilton Honours check in, but upon arrival was allocated a different floor and room.

The hotel is quite nice, in a good location, and has a wonderful convenience store attached. Staff is very friendly and helpful. Room was okay...nothing special, but certainly not a bad place to spend a week. The TV was nice and it was a good shower. Staff was generous in stocking toiletries, which is appreciated.So...why not a 5-star? Breakfast in the attached restaurant was meh. Not anything you don’t get at every other Hilton. But what bothered me was the mandatory $29 resort fee. As a business traveler, I don’t have the time to enjoy the pool, exercise on the beach or the free yoga. So, big deal, they added two Keurig Kona coffee pods in the room...that is not worth $29/day.

If you are after a clean and comfortable stay with no fancy extras then this is the place for you. Conveniently located right in the middle of all shopping and entertainment and a 5 minute walk to the beach.

I've stayed here at least 3-5 times over the last 3 or so years. First time was splendid! Excellent service. Second time, rude front desk staff. But that was ok, because after I complained to a manager who happened to be walking by, she smoothed everything over and apologized. This last visit, after a flight from Japan, the front staff member was neither cheerful nor helpful. Front desk staff set the tone for the entire stay. Why on earth would one be terse and off-putting to a guest? Do better, please!

Had a great time staying at the Hilton Garden Inn, Andrea, who checked us in was amazing and gave ups a comp upgrade due to my husbands birthday for us to get a better view. Their pool and pool bar was great, they have happy hour all day, the lady bartender (I didn't get her name) was really attentive. She even gave us popcorn. What I though was really cool was the sun screen and the after sun ale vera lotion that they provided at the pool. Not only did it smell amazing but I can tell it actually is a really good quality since you don't feel sticky at all. If you do want to do your laundry though, go across the street to the coin laundry. Their washing machines are not that good and barely use water so you'd probably have to wash your load a few times if you really want to get your laundry clean and not just semi wet. Maintenance came and looked at the machine but the 2nd machine I used did exactly the same thing. Didn't effect our trip and experience though. Just a recommendation. We had a great time and great experience and would would most certainly return.
user_name:
Esmee88
New York City, New York

review_body: Before I arrived, the Hilton Garden Inn staff sent me a welcoming text. This allowed me to start communication about having two reservations and making sure they kept me in the same room my entire stay. They gladly accommodated my request. My check-in was quick and efficient. This property recognizes Hilton Honors Gold members with free breakfast and a couple bottles of water. This is awesome and one of several reasons I return to this property. My room (1535) was extremely clean and had a much desired balcony from which I could see the ocean. Speaking of clean room, the housekeeper (Mary Grace) was outstanding. Mary always welcomed me with a friendly greeting and never disappointed me with the superior cleanliness of my room. The room is equipped with a coffee/tea station, iron/ironing board, mini-fridge and a safe. The hotel is a short walk to casual and fine dining, shopping and the beach. I plan to return to this Hilton property. It is a great value and newer than many of the Waikiki hotels. The front desk staff is much improved. They resolved my dillemas on the spot. I appreciate two options for breakfast. You can have a breakfast buffet at the restaurant connected to the hotel or you can have an informal breakfast from the store connected to the hotel.
user_name:
Rod1906
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: The location is perfect, we couldn't have picked a better spot. I had payed $3,000 aud for a single room in advance, but upon arrival had to pay another $1,300 I think it was, and I didn't find that in the fine print or terms (booked via Qantas). Cleaning staff are adorable. Front desk staff aren't as nice. Pool is tacky, rooms are clean but boring looking. Overall average experience.

Great hotel clean and perfect location the staff was so friendly. Rooms very clean spacious! Nice views from the balcony and very quiet place to get good night rest. Kids friendly. For sure I travel with a 19monyh son so everyone was very helpful and friendly specially on the restaurant for breakfast thank you.

First of all, nothing can be wrong in Waikiki. Best place for vacation. Lots of shopping, restaurants, and great beaches.Hotel is about 5 mins walk to the beach. Right across a mall and very close to all the great restaurants Waikiki has to offer. ( 0.9 miles to Leonardo's Bakery if you are into Malasada ).However, rooms have a very bad smell. They checked us into 455, and we called in a few hours to move the room due to bad smell that did not go away even with the windows open. Then, got moved to 554, it was the same, but we were tired of moving and we weren't planning on spending a lot of time in the room ( did not count the sleeping time, which was a mistake..... )Overall, 5 stars for location, 1 star for quality of the rooms.

Clean and tidy big rooms with no street noise Great air conditioning but it’s noisyPool is greatLocation is a block from the beach but not on a busy road Would recommend getting breakfast included as it is expensive on its own

We stayed here after visiting the big island. The suite was very nice with 2 rooms and a large bathroom with big shower! They let us check in early which was fantastic! The parking fee and resort fee were excessive. Pool was small. Very clean and good maid service! Would recommend.

Not beachfront but about 10 minute walk. Construction going on across the street on left of the hotel. Not a nice view. Check In was swift . Room was modern and comfortable. Microwave and fridge. Extractor fan didn’t work in the bathroom. Sink was outside the bathroom- little odd. Staff were friendly. Place was clean. Free yoga. Free sunscreen, water and pool towels. Drinks at the pool bar were good considering. $5 specials. Gym was ok. Towels and water provided. Pool is small for the size of the hotel. Always had sunbeds to use. Never busy. Jason contacted me about my stay. I discussed with him my issue and he granted us a nice complimentary service at the hotel. Much appreciated and great customer service. Thank you! We would recommend and stay here again!
user_name:
scouseinthehouse
New York City, New York

review_body: Durling our visit to waikiki a week ago, we really impress that our maid Brenda is go above and beyond her duty. she made sure that our room extremely clean. she provides everything we needed. shes very nice. we really like her and hopping that next year when were there, she will be our maid again.
user_name:
ธนิดา น
Highland, California

review_body: We stayed in a wheelchair accessible 1 bedroom that had plenty of room for 2 wheelchairs and 3 suitcases. We had a view between the building of the ocean and the little balcony was great for storing beach stuff. Wheelchair bathroom had roll in shower and lots of space to maneuver around. Sink was outside the bathroom so was great for others to use if the bathroom was occupied. Microwave and fridge were great for leftovers or making own meals. Coffee maker in room also. Some comments:Fresh Towels were provided daily, same with soaps and shampoo stuffCoffee pods provided dailyHousekeeping was awesome- girls were really nice if you spend a minute to chat with themBellmen were great- here’s a tip: ask if they have any beach chairs, umbrellas, beach mats, boogie boards, snorkel gear left behind by other guests to borrow. We did and didn’t have to go buy anything for the whole trip. Then remember to tip them!Yoga daily- great yoga teachers (actual trained teachers)Walking access to everything. Lots of restaurants just outside and the bus outside the hotel too. Some bad:Sofa bed Mattress was really thin so our daughter slept in our bedroom Daily parking is expensive and it’s the same every where. Rent a car by the day if you don’t need to go out dailyConstruction next door. Yes it’s loud and starts before 8am and ends around 3 pm. Luckily our room wasn’t facing the construction. Yoga is outside so it’s disrupting. Enjoyed our stay and would recommend to families. Also flight crews stay at this hotel so you know it is comfortable and clean.
user_name:
lg123082
New York City, New York

review_body: The hotel is in the heart of Waikiki close to the beaches and all of the stores and restaurants are in walking distance. The rooms are a bit on the small side, but they are extremely clean and have all the amenities that you need. The heart of this hotel is the customer service. They are friendly and go beyond to greet you and help. We really appreciated Andrew who we asked for help for small issues that we had and always obliged willingly with a smile. It was wonderful to hear him keep telling us, "that's my job." Thank you Andrew for doing such a wonderful job!

We had an excellent experience with friendly helpful staff especially Miss Josie and to the staff that help us with our baggages, Our rooms were very clean modern and very accommodating and although beside the main road there was no noise at all. Will defiantly be staying again...

I booked this room for my dad and stepmom for his 57th birthday. They were able to check in early and get an upgraded city view room. They loved the room, this is their first time to Hawaii. They loved the location being so close to the eateries and three blocks from the beach. They kept talking about the lady who was more than accommodating Brenda, anything they asked for she provided she was very helpful and even checked on them later to be sure they had everything they needed. I highly recommend this hotel. The location is great the staff was amazing and its definately much cheaper than the hotels directly on the beach. Thank you to the entire staff to include the front desk clerk I think her name was Lauren and the Brenda the housekeeper on the 14th floor who treated my family with nothing but respect. My father kept saying this is the best birthday. Thank you for helping to make my father's birthday even more special.

If you are planning to have child staying with you, plan to squeeze with your husband on a full size bed as they don't provide rollaway bed. They do provide a free buffet breakfast while food quality is on the low end but acceptable their coffee is the awful. You can however pay $3 to upgrade get fresh waffle, pancake or eggs benedict which they are very nicely done considering you only pay $3 per order. The bright side is everyone of the wait staffs are very nice!

The bellman were great in helping us out, but apart from that the service wasn’t exceptional or anything. There was construction noise above our room and the staff never had the courtesy to tell us in advance or anything. No benefits of being a Hilton Honors member. Didn’t get offered higher floor or premium internet access or anything.

I don't rate very many hotel stays simply because they all seem to be just "okay", a clean room and a place to rest my head. The location was great, check in and check out was fast and seamless, the room "spic and span", the bed was comfortable, the air-con effective and quiet (vacationed in Honolulu). BUT, what makes a GREAT hotel experience is the responsiveness of the staff, their relationship with you and the effectiveness of their services. Thank you Hilton Garden Inn Waikiki Beach STAFF; each and everyone of you!

We had a great experience at this hotel! Kerry T. at the front desk was amazing! She was kind & helpful & made an effort to ensure our stay was relaxing & easy. You could tell she genuinely cared. The front desk was pretty hectic with people all around- both when we arrived & departed- it is obviously very popular to stay here...but Kerry (& all of the front desk agents) remained calm & pleasant, no matter how many people where lined up.
