I saw Kerry escort the other guests to show them where to go to find the elevator or a bellman and she was even helping a man figure out how to work the ATM bc he only spoke German & needed help. I was truly impressed by the level of hands-on service. I stay in Waikiki a lot for business and pleasure and it was so nice to arrive to a clean and modern looking hotel after a long day.My husband and i were very pleasantly surprised by the nice clean modern/newly renovated condition of the room! We had a standard king room with a view of the International marketplace-but it wasn't too loud and you couldn't really hear too much hustle and bustle once the sliding door was closed and the AC was on. It was in a perfect location to walk everywhere we wanted: We could cut thru the marketplace to get to Kalakaua street and the beach super easily. It was nice to not be on the main strip so we could be a little off the beaten path, but not too far. We could walk to all of our favorite restaurants in less than 5-10 mins. *Make sure you talk with the concierge (yes there's a nice concierge desk here!) and/or the front desk agents to get accurate tips on walking distances to places, food options and other attractions. Ideally, These people are here to help you have the best trip to oahu!Other notes: The bath amenities were nice mini Neutrogena products and there was even a hot water kettle and a single cup Keurig machine (with pods supplied, but powder creamer only- you can get cream in the shop in the lobby). There's also complementary coffee set up in the lobby in the morning, which was a huge plus! Attached to the lobby is a Holo Holo (general store, like an ABC) with a full service coffee bar and regular bar (open late with beer on tap!!)- also equipped with fresh pastries in the morning. There is nice looking restaurant connected to the lobby, the Fire Grill,which we didn't have time to eat at, but looked very trendy and offered a nice looking breakfast, lunch and dinner!I feel like if you are prepared to not be staying literally in the beach and know that you will not have an ocean view, you will be pleasantly surprised by this hotel and location. Waikiki is crowded all day and night, so if you come with a go-with-the-flow attitude, your experience will be enjoyable. Be prepared to walk a lot, wait in some lines, and experience a one of the most beautiful (yet packed) beaches in the world. You have to be ready for a lot of people around, but there's so much to see and enjoy- beauty & food & culture- just be kind and grateful to the hardworking local people there and you will feel the Aloha spirit!**It is important to get accurate directions on how to pull into / checkin to the valet (there is no public parking for this hotel- so u must be prepared for the valet charge)- the valet /checkin location is on a one-way street, so make sure you are arriving on the correct road (which is not the same street as the address listed online)- it is called Walina Street! This is helpful info to get for your arrival process, especially after a long day of traveling.

Location is great, close to food and beach. Staff very friendly and helpful. Met our housekeeping lady Brenda, very friendly and helpful was a pleasure dealing with her. This kind of service from staff makes us want to return!

Arrived in Honolulu one day prior to setting sale on Pride of America Cruise ship. We stayed at the HGI Waikiki Beach for one night. Rooms are clean and comfortable, but on the smallish side. Breakfast buffet was very decent for a small additional charge. Price is very reasonable for Waikiki. I would stay again for a short stay. On a longer stay I would opt for a larger room, if money was not a concern.

We arrived after a long flight and were put in room 1850. It was a disaster. The room backed onto the lift shaft with 3 lifts clunking and clanging every time they moved (which is pretty much all the time in a busy hotel!). We complained, and after a pretty long negotiation, we were moved to a quieter room and then moved again the following night so we could actually have the bedding configuration we paid for. To be fair, the Hilton didn’t charge us for the first night, which is why we haven’t rated the hotel “terrible”, but we paid a lot of money for our room and we just wanted what we paid for. It did ruin the first part of our long awaited 3 day holiday. The hotel is in a good location, and the room we were transferred to was pleasant and very comfortable, but you need to be prepared for it being very busy (we often had to wait a long time for lifts) and it’s not a quiet, classy hotel - it’s noisy and an old apartment building converted and refurbished into a Hilton. Also, avoid any room ending in 50 (eg 1850, 750 etc) - these back onto the lift shaft and, in our opinion, shouldn’t be sold as “standard” rooms - the Hilton should be honest with customers and disclose that they are noisy and either sell them as “budget” rooms or change them into a store room until they can install some more modern, quieter building services, which make those rooms inhabitable.

My family of 3 stayed here for 3 nights. The rooms were nice & clean and had a great balcony. The staff were nice as well. Not much of a view from the hotel but there are very few hotels right on the beach so we decided to save a few bucks as it was 3 blocks from the beach. It was across the street from the Mall which had some nice quick places to eat. There is so much to see in the area, both right outside the hotel as well as around it. The trolley went by the hotel and stopped 1 block away. The area was, in my opinion, very safe. The pool area had a nice bar and was busy but not crowded. The market downstairs was a bit pricey compared to nearby markets. The market downstairs had food, seating areas and snacks to bring to the room which we used for breakfast.Bottom line, this is not a resort. There are nicer, true resorts in Waikiki if you want to spend more. If you are going just for the beach and beach views, this may not be the hotel for you. For us, this hotel was what we needed as we were out and about most of the day. Thanks for a great stay!!

We stayed at the Hilton Garden Inn as it was part of a package holiday we did with Air New Zealand, which included flights, 5 nights accommodation, airport transfers, buffet breakfast, resort fees and a bus to the Waikele Outlet Centre.We have stayed at hotels on the beach before which of course is really nice but costs a lot more, so we were happy with the package. Because we arrived in the morning we were not able to check-in straight away so we stored our bags and went for a walk, returning later and being able to check-in at lunch time.The Hotel has been renovated a couple of years ago, we had a king city view room and had asked for a room on a higher floor, we were on the 14th floor, we were happy with the size of the room and facilities, good air-con, coffee machine, kettle, fridge, hairdryer etc. The room was clean and well serviced every day before we got back. The only thing for us was that we found the bed a little too firm. The breakfast buffet was good, although the same every day but you could get your eggs cooked a different way or have an omelet. There was a pool on level 3, although we did not use the pool we got towels to take to the beach. The location was great being able to walk through the International Market Place, then over the road and down the beach walk (near the Cheesecake Factory) to the beach. The hotel is central to all the shops and restaurants, the staff were all helpful and friendly so overall we were very happy with our stay.

The staff are nice and accommodating , hospitality all over especially your staff Josie Castillo for being so nice . She ushered us and so patient explaining all the details in the hotel . Even help us where to go as we are visitor in the island . I commend her and thank her for being so nice to us .

We stayed for 8 nights at the beginning of August. The service we received from the very start of our stay until the end was consistently fantastic.What a fantastic location, so central to everything on Waikiki. Nothing seemed like more than a 10 minute walk away. The beach is a block from the hotel, and there are many restaurants and shops nearby to choose from. There is also a Starbucks Reserve store a mere block away- they have amazing service and we went there daily.We booked a city view room and got a room on the 4th floor facing the International Market mall. Even though we were facing the very busy street, we didn't hear any street noise from inside our room, so we slept soundly. The room was a good enough size for us and our luggage to stay for the week, and the bathroom vanity was quite large. There is a mini-fridge that works well, a Keurig coffee machine, and a kettle. A safe is also provided. There was a small balcony that fit a little table and 2 chairs, nice to have coffee there in the mornings. The room was clean, and was a comfortable place to recharge. Tina did a great job cleaning our room daily.One thing to note- there is construction going on across Walina street that can be very loud and starts early, so I would request a room not facing that direction if possible.We are Diamond members so the breakfast buffet was included. A very nice assortment to choose from: bacon, sausages, scrambled eggs, potatoes, rice, oatmeal, cereal, fruit, yogurt, juices, and a variety of pastries. They also did 'cook to order' omelettes and eggs as well, and were delicious.The only thing that was a pain was parking here is valet only, and we like being able to just jump in the car and leave when we want. So we avoided the valet for the first few days by parking on the street, we would just have to remember to plug the meter every two hours. But one night we just couldn't find street parking so begrudgingly went to the valet for $42/day. We asked about the waits in the morning, because it always appeared to be utter chaos. They said they could have us on the Express list for a specific time, and they would have it in 10-15 minutes. It wasn't the "jump in and go" that we like, but it wasn't as bad as it appeared. And the valets were all so friendly, polite, and always smiling. And alot if them working which helps. But there really needs to be a "self park" option for guests.We had a late flight out, and the HGI was able to give us a later checkout for 2pm, and also gave us a courtesy room for 45 minutes for whenever we needed to shower and change before our flight, which was a nice gesture. The bellboys were able to keep our luggage is a secure area before our flight as well, so it didn't have to sit in our car.Overall, this was a fantastic stay at the HGI Waikiki Beach. The service and amenities were amazing, Hilton just needs to change the parking policies and allow self-park options to their guests. Mahalo HGI and Hawaii!

From arrival with the Porters to check in, to housekeepers to pool / bar staff to leaving everyone has been awesome. Our housekeeper Pam was amazing as were the weekend staff. Room was light and airy, AC was brilliant. International Market across the road. A block from the beach with so many easy ways to get there. The tours we did pick up was either outside the hotel or a short walk to the Hotel you needed. Would recommend you stay here. We had a wonderful time and will defiantly be back. THANK YOU ALL

Drive around downtown trying to find where valet parking was( not listed in directions). $52 to park your car! Room was $260 for a street view. Walk in shower leaked all over bathroom floor. $16 hamburger in the restaurant. No complementary breakfast area. Staff very busy.

The was a fantastic 3-night stay and likely the best Hilton Garden Inn (HGI) I’ve experienced in the last 10 years. (Though, around 2011-2012, I stopped patronizing HGIs because those awful adjustable beds were so uncomfortable.)This property was the former Ohana Waikiki West Hotel, which originally opened in 1970, and remained stuck in the 1970’s throughout its lifespan. I remember visiting the Ohana in the early aughts as a possible place to stay, but the property was severely outdated. The Ohana closed in 2015 and re-opened in mid-2016 as an HGI.Check-in: Kudos to Kerry at the Front Desk. She did an excellent job in making me aware of the room location, potential noise from the next-door construction site, views (partial ocean or city), etc. We had an extended conversation (because I can be pedantic about my room) and she placed me in a perfect location. Thank you, Kerry.Room: I had a king suite, but I’m not divulging the room number. If I mention it, everyone will want it. :-) For an HGI suite, this was probably the best I’ve had in 10-plus years. Yes, every HGI is different in regard to room layout and room location, but I don’t think I could have done better than this one. The suite I was originally assigned was occupied when I arrived and would not be available until early evening. After my discussion with Kerry, she placed me in a different suite – excellent choice. The bedroom was a good distance from the living space; the living space was small and quaint but had enough room for me. The living space had the usual uncomfortable HGI couch, a coffee table, and another small table and two chairs. On the small table was the Keurig coffee maker and a tea kettle. (I didn’t have to request a tea kettle – yeah!) The TV sat on top of a cabinet and the cabinet contained a refrigerator which chilled items sufficiently, a microwave, small storage, and the large flat screen, which was sized appropriately for this space. The bathroom had a single sink, toilet, and shower (no tub, but a tub is never a requirement for me). The bedroom had the obligatory king bed, which was OK. I like a firm mattress and this one wasn’t that firm. The bedroom had a desk(!) with a chair, and another lounge chair. Quite remarkably, the bedroom (at the desk and night stands) had sufficient electrical outlets for the phone, iPad, and computers – a huge win for me. Some reviewers have complained about storage, which is, indeed, limited. The tall closet armoire in the bedroom had only two drawers. However, in this particular suite, there was another tall closet armoire in the entry hallway. Even then, if you’re a family of 2+, you’ll likely have to use your luggage for storage.I had a partial ocean view, but having an ocean view isn’t significant to me. The bonus, however, was the two balconies: the balcony off the bedroom had the partial view to the ocean and the other balcony had a view to the city and Diamond Head – great photo ops across various times of the day. On the bedroom balcony there was a table and chairs. If you’re into sunbathing (I’m not) and you don’t need a pool, there was plenty of space on the balcony off the bedroom to accomplish that. At this time of year, the warm, fading light of the sunset was a great view from the bed. I was taking a nap and happened to wake up as the sun was setting and it was quite nice. A note about the partial view of the ocean: Even if you have a room that faces toward the water, your view will be obstructed by the neighboring buildings, so you’ll never have a pristine, unobstructed view of the ocean. This HGI hotel has 20 floors. One neighboring building which obscures the ocean view is taller than the HGI building.I can’t comment about their restaurant since I had all my meals off-site. I loved the Holoholo Cafe and Market right next door, which you could enter from the lobby. Expensive? Yes, but I’m visiting, and it is Waikiki. The good news is that the grab and go fresh fruit was great on this visit and none of it was spoiled or past its expiration date. The papaya, mango, and pineapple were outstanding. I also found some rosemary/olive oil macadamia nuts – wonderful.Service: This was one of those visits where everything worked. Front Desk, Concierge, housekeeping, and even (what a surprise) valet parking – they were all fantastic. Of course, Kerry at the Front Desk was superb - friendly, knowledgeable, very helpful, and courteous. Even when I saw her helping others, she was always friendly and working hard to accommodate a guest. Housekeeping did a fine job of refreshing the room and honoring a specific time of day (thank you). The Concierge on the second day was quite helpful.Parking: Valet parking, which is usually my sore point at a hotel, was great. There’s the usual juggling of cars in a limited space, but my car was retrieved in a timely manner upon each request and all the parking attendants (except one, who’s name I can’t remember) were friendly, smiled, and had a positive attitude. I liked the fact that, upon my initial arrival, they inspected the rental car for dings, dents, scratches, etc. Good idea and should avoid the proverbial “Valet parking dented my car.” I think I paid $42/day. Expensive? It’s all relative (and it is Waikiki where parking and space is tight). It’s much worse in other cities – Chicago, Los Angeles, and New York come to mind.Location: It’s in Waikiki so there’s the noise, people, traffic, etc. You have to accept that the hotel is located in a densely populated area of Waikiki. It’s directly across from the updated and chic International Market Place (which was a dreary and sad place years ago) and a quick walk over to Kalakaua Ave. for the upscale stores. From the hotel, everything you could possibly want to do in Waikiki is walkable. Food? Well, it’s all tourist food in Waikiki. Most of it is passable; some of it is pretty bad. One day, a neighboring hotel was having some sort of party/get-together and the music was very loud. I could hear the music at the elevators, but surprisingly, it never made it to my wonderfully isolated room. :-) The hotel is within walking distance to the beach. It’s not right on the beach, but it’s a 5 minute walk to the beach.The hotel is 3 years past its renovation. I hope they maintain the rooms as well as the level of service I experienced on this visit. It’s a tourist hotel and no telling what it will look like in another year or two or three. Before that happens, though, I’ll have to return. :-)

We stayed here for a medical trip to Queens hospital as the outer islands have limited medical facilities. The room was clean and staff was very friendly. Didn’t eat at the hotel restaurant after I saw the prices however and there’s no way to get out of the resort fee of $29/day. Most all the hotels will charge this even if they just have only a pool and even if you don’t use it! We didn’t rent a car but parking is another 40/day here. Being that Waikiki and Honolulu is an expensive place to visit whatever the reason I would stay here again. I’ve had unpleasant stays at other places but this was not the case here.

I highly recommend this hotel. The attentiveness and friendliness of the staff was remarkable. My room was immaculate. The bonus was free yoga in the mornings. I would definitely stay at this hotel again.

Great hotel. Room was clean and very modern. Enjoyed our stay and had a friendly staff. Jayson Juan toom care of us and the front desk staff were all great. The breakfast buffet was satisfactory but the staff all were so helpful. Will come back again.

This hotel was great. Room was more than adequate with a small balcony.The service we received from all the staff was fabulous. The house keeping team were so efficient. Beverley and Christina, a big thankyou to you both for taking care of us.The location was a winner. Best coffee and happy hour right across the street. Mahalo!We'll be back.Bec and Bobby

New hotel in the heart of Waikiki. Just a block from Waikiki Beach and across the street from the totally renovated International Market Place. Restaurants are located everywhere so you might want to avoid paying for an included breakfast. Staff was friendly and attentive. Hotel had washing machines, swimming pool and a free pool table near the outdoor poolside bar. Valet was efficient, helps to call ahead. Overall a good value for Waikiki.

My first vacation in Hawaii and we booked our stay at Waikiki Hilton garden inn. Great staff and helpful bellmen, Nolan and Wade, that stood out for us every time we were out for a tour. Highly recommend this hotel for family - pool, bar, restaurant and short walking distance to beach and restaurants.

My daughter and I stayed for a two night staycation. It was a perfect location on Kuhio Avenue for shopping and there were tons of eating options. The beach is a short 2 block walk (short cut through the International Market Place). The hotel was nice clean and the staff was wonderful. There was two downsides: 1) the pool was small and often crowded and 2) the evelators were not secured with key access. Anyone could access the room floors. Overall it was great for a quick stay and close to many restaurants and shopping.

Could heart others in the bathroom. Valet service sucked for $40. Half the time no one answered the front desk. Sparse and dull entry way. Waikiki just sucks period. It's like a 2nd world county going there. Beaches aren't very good.

This hotel is in a great location and easy to get to. It is close enough to walk to the beach and right in the middle of great shops and restaurants. If you're looking for well priced hotel in a great spot, check it out. Only valet parking or street so that is something to take into consideration.
user_name:
Guadalupe M
Federal Way, United States

review_body: Company recently changed our hotel to this. Downside is we dont' get points - due to the contract negotiated.....bad !Rooms are newly renovated. Design looks good, but in practical terms. ...not so. Work space is ok, but the bench is too unwieldy. No luggage rack was available, had to request for one. Coffee maker and microwave in room were standard. Beds were very comfortable, pillows super comfy.Shower area was spacious...but the glass door opened to barely miss the toilet bowl.....minimal space. The sink area was spacious though. Big screen TV was adequate, but not adjustable.Fitness room was separated into two....one for cardio, other for weights. Troublesome to have to use your key card to enter, as the rooms are NOT connected. Duh !Didn't get to check out the pool area . ...but it looks relaxing. 3 blocks to the beach. Awesome !

This hotel was wonderful! The beds were comfortable and the walk in shower was huge and amazing. There was complimentary coffee in lobby hallway in the morning and flavored water in the afternoon. Across the street were several coffee shops and the pineapple crescents were delicious. We got an upgrade due to being a Hilton honors member so that was really nice. The pool was refreshing and complimentary towels to take to Beach or pool. They also had sunscreen by the pool and a water dispenser. Waikiki Beach was about 10 minute walk with lots of restaurants and shopping. I enjoyed my stay here very much....oh and a little smoking area on the side street close to where the parking and taxis stop.

Have stayed here for work several times. Very nice, clean rooms. Very convenient location. Only a couple of blocks off of the beach, surrounded by awesome food and shopping choices and the International Marketplace is right across the street. The staff is extremely friendly and helpful. Very good value for the $.

Located across the street from the new International Marketplace which has medium and high end retail and restaurants. We like this property for the ease of a getaway when we plan to spend little time at the hotel and more time adventuring. The marketplace across the street has a rental car agency and I prefer renting a car as needed rather than for the entire trip and dealing with parking fees and all the other hassles. The rooms are good, the amenities are okay. The pool is small with an adjacent bar. Avoid the restaurant if you wish to get better food at a better price anywhere else around the hotel.

This property has undergone renewal recently. Beds are very comfortable and furnishings appeared to be new. Conveniently located in the shopping area and only three blocks to the ocean! Staff is very customer oriented and extremely courteous.
user_name:
Jacqueline T F
Charleston, United States

review_body: HORRIBLE! My husband and I were unable to sleep. We could hear a banging metal sound all night. She didn't think anything of it during thr day and thought the banging sound would stop but it went on all night. We informed the front desk but their response was "we'll remove the resort fee and tax" for a whopping $27???!!! The lever on the bathroom commode was broken. We called guest services to fix it but no one came to our room. My husband got it to work but there was still a missing piece to the lever. We also saw a bug in the room crawling on the desk. I would NOT recommend this place!

The room and price came with a breakfast for 1. I was expecting a sit down breakfast, instead it was a grab and go...a little disappointing. The parking needs improvement, not a lot of room to maneuver.

There are many hotel in the Waikiki area but this one is perfect. Next to shopping along with a great market as well as off the beach makes this hotel ideal. However, parking is premium but the views from the top floors are amazing.

I recently stayed at this hotel and initially had a great check, but while up in my room I forgot a lot of what the young lady said about the perks for the resort fee (not really a resort but ok), and I phoned down and reached the most unfriendly person I have ever had the misfortune to talk to. When I asked about the wifi and my connection she gave a huge sigh and gave me instructions, which were also wrong but ok. I mentioned breakfast and got another smart reply, when I apologized she said the person who checked me in should have told me all this. And I told her she did I just couldn’t remember it all as it was a lot of information. She then said under her breathe thinking I couldn’t hear her “maybe you should have paid attention then.” At this point I was livid, I am paying to stay here. I chose this hotel because I have stayed here before and had an amazing experience. I am a little on the “old” side and forget things easily. To hear this type of response and to receive this kind of attitude was unacceptable. When I asked her name she told me it was Sarah. I then went down to the desk and spoke to one of the other people at the front desk and asked them if I could speak to “Sarah who answers the phones” and I was told, “you mean Sydney? We don’t have a Sarah here, Sydney is or PBX operator. Not only did I have to endure this attitude, but I was lied to on top of that. Needless to say I will not be back again if these are the types of people you are employing. No ALOHA spirit at all.

Our flight was cancelled in Hawaii on a Sat. morning. We were stranded at the airport. We were able to get 2 rooms and this Hotel checked us in early. They were very helpful . The pool area is beautiful and rooms were great! A great experience here

A great hotel to stay in. The price was reasonable, the location was convenient, the rooms were clean, and the staff were efficient and friendly. Kenia and Noelani were especially helpful with our travel itinerary and Maria (housekeeper) always tried to make sure we had what we needed. The bellmen were very courteous and willing to help. I recommend this hotel to anyone.

This was a great trip with our family. I would highly recommend this place because it is located in the heart of Waikiki. Easy walking distance to many restaurants, shops, and the beach. Very kind staff. I was very happy with this vacation to Honolulu.

it has a very convinient location but the downside is the service and the people that works here for the guest services are not happy to serve you and i would say there is no ALOHA.. calling customer service hard to get one in touch they dont answer as it needed when you call them you need to re call them.

We stayed 2 nights here prior to flying out, We were upgraded to a suite which was awesome and gave us lots more space. However I did not feel overall that this was the usual Hilton standard. My husband had been informed the hotel was brand new when he booked it but the hotel looked quite tired and in need of a face lift (apart from the lobby area)The beds were double, I don't understand any hotel having double beds in this day and age- the minimum should be queen size for good comfort.The pool area is ok, a little cramped and the pool was quite cool, the sunbeds were really uncomfortable- the support of the seating has gone in many of them meaning you rest back directly on the bars underneath (another sign that the hotel is not new).The breakfast was very average, it cost $14.00 but again not Hilton's usual standard.Most staff were helpful and friendly.We ordered our car to be ready for 06 00 on the last morning so we could be away on time for the airport- it was not ready and the lady dealing with us did not appear overly bothered either. This was the only member of staff who was not helpful.Great location for getting to restaurants and shops. It took about 10 minutes to walk to the beach

Pleasant hotel with a fantastic location, across the road from the International Marketplace and a short walk from many restaurants and the beach. The staff were very helpful and the rooms were always perfectly cleaned. However, if you are after a quiet room make sure it is not near the lifts as they are quite noisy.

Stayed here for few days. Everything was great and the room was clean and comfortable. It has great location for transportation and shopping! We also met the friendly staff Josie who gave our each child modern sunglasses. Also took posture with us. We had a lot of fun at this family trip. Hope we’ll back soon.

Stayed her with the family for a few days. Everything was great. The location is close to everything you need. The kids loved the pool and we loved the food and shopping surrounding us. We'll be back soon.

I was here for 9 nights on business. This was a solid choice. Clean and comfortable. Appreciated the in-room amenities (safe, fridge). Housekeeping was meh - a bit spotty from day to day. Really missed not having a desk though. And the room is a little tight. Had I been here with my family we might have been on top of one another. Concierge was wonderful - appreciated her quick work to find a sailing cruise for me. Restaurant was solid for dinner, disappointing for breakfast. I believe the lobby layout is bizarre. 9 days in and still not always obvious where each hallway runs. Elevators were Overcrowded - this is a large hotel and could use more/larger elevators. As you can imagine, business travel in Zooey Waikiki is kind of strange. This hotel made it work and I’d be back if I had to stay in Waikiki again. Great location. Thanks for a nice/solid stay!

The staff were very friendly. Pool towels were easily accessible. The room was very modern and comfortable. The pool area was very nice. They even provided sunscreen. There was a bar next to the pool. It never felt crowded. The location was close to restaurants and shops and only a couple of blocks from the beach. We had stayed at the Hawaiian village for a few days but this hotel was much more worth the money.

Good location, pool was never too crowded which was great. Friendly helpful staff. Fabulous cleaning staff, special mention to Tina who looked after our room on the fourth floor, the room was always spotless. Only negative was the shower over the bathtub very weak pressure but after speaking to frontdesk they sent up an engineer who changed the shower head but not much difference but appreciate the prompt service. Would have been good to have glasses in the room had to ask for wine glasses but water glasses would also have been preferred as opposed to paper cups. A couple more washing machines in the laundry would also be good as always seemed busy. But all in all a great stay in a very friendly hotel.

close to the beach nice and quiet my only complaint is that there was no self parking adding an extra 200 bucks to my stay i wasnt planning on. breakfast buffet is pretty good i really liked the store too.

We loved this hotel. The service was excellent, staff was very helpful. Loved the morning omelettes upon request. The location was very convenient- less than 5 min walk to Waikiki Beach, and just across the street from the International Marketplace. Would definitely stay here again. Highly recommend!

Good location in Waikiki, walking distance to beach, through International Marketplace and down laneway and on Waikiki beach, bus stops either side to connect on TheBus network anywhere on Oahu, tour buses pick up out front. Rooms large and quiet, couldn’t hear neighbouring rooms which is always good, maid Jasmine service was excellent, greeted us every morning and arranged time for room to be made up. Booked tour at concierge late one evening for next day and all went as scheduled. Easy access beach towels to use from level 3. Valet parking available. Would stay here again.

This hotel was just okay.Pros:~Two gentleman that worked there in the evening were very nice and informative. ~Good breakfast on site.~ Walk-able location (but we rented a car, so location didn't matter) That's it.Cons:~ Rooms are VERY small (we visited Spain, Italy, and France last month. The rooms here was smaller than any room we had in Europe - and Europe is known for small hotel rooms). The room was about the size of our room in NY last December (Hilton Garden Inn Times Square Central), but not as well laid out nor up to date.~Lady at the front desk seems like she needs a training in customer service. It doesn't matter if you call or stand in front of her, it seems like guests are an issue for her. Which means she probably needs to be in a different field.
user_name:
LaToya J
West Palm Beach, Florida

review_body: This hotel is located in the heart of everything with lots of food and entertainment options close by. The beach is 2 blocks. The mini mart is great and well stocked. My only complaint is that there is no where to hang wet bathing suits and towels to dry. No one likes putting on a damp bathing suit!

This is our third year coming and we love how easy going everything is! The staff, from the parking to the rooms, were all wonderful! We will definitely be back, in fact we’ve already booked our next two stays!

Booked one night here due to a mix up in our holiday booking. The rooms were horrible chipped furniture with stained mattress. It was really just a dorm room. For the price same as Sydney Hilton which is amazing this was very disappointing. The breakfast was terrible coffee from urns with not even real milk. The food selection was below Hilton standard. The location was however good. Worse Hilton I have ever stayed.

Hotel room was good enough for a family of 5. (Includes one 3 yrs old). Room was very clean Staff were friendly. From valet parking attendants to front desk clerks and housekeeping staff. Location was across from International Marketplace. Very convenient if you want something to eat or just go to the beach. The beach is only a block away!
We stayed 4th floor.Noisy.We got some noises from fitnesscenter from 6AM to 10pm.There is a microwave. You can eat some frozen foods bought in the shop in your room.There is not bathtub.Only shower.

Great Hotel! Conveniently close to the beaches and surrounding restaurants. Would reccomend this hotel to friends. Located close to THE BUS stop if you decide to use public transit. Would definitely booked this Hotel again when we return to visit this beautiful state!

This hotel is the place to go if you’re wanting the cornflakes version of hotels - the Hilton Garden Inn is plain, a bit boring and lacks a bit of character but it gets the job done. The kitchen service/ breakfast is provided by Fire Grill (a place likely improved if it did actually catch fire) but the Hilton itself is good enough. The bellhop/ valet staff are excellent along with housekeeping however the check-in desk staff are a more ‘Aloha’ than they are ‘helpful’. 50/50 I guess. Ultimately the rooms are basic and clean with comfortable beds, basic appliances and a combined shower/ toilet room with the sink near the door (oddly).The biggest win for this hotel is the air conditioning. We set the A/C for max upon our arrival and 10 minutes later we were chipping icicles off the nightstands. Seriously, if all you need is 4 walls and a roof with an air temp of -10C, you’ve found the right place.

The number one reason for staying at this HGI Waikiki Beach is the location, which cannot be any better. There are plenty of supermarkets, restaurants, and shoppings within a fifteen minutes walking block. There is a Japanese supermarket right across the street, and the hotel's convenient store is actually cheaper than the ABC store across the street. The service was also very good and I like the texting system. I am able to ask for a few items through texting the wonderful staffs at the hotel. However, the room, despite a modern decor, is really on the small side. The room really cannot accommodate more than two people comfortably. There is no sofa area because there is no room to put any additional furniture. The bathroom is okay and I like the huge walk-in shower. The premium/high-speed WIFI works very well. For gold and diamond members, they are free, and for other folks, it costs $5 extra, which is well worth it. I also want to post a warning about the elevator situation. Despite having 20 floors and four elevators, the wait time was still very long. I don't understand it. Finally, there is a really ridiculous resort fee. I am really going to write my congressmen and women because this kind of fee is outrageous. Come on this is not Hilton Hawaiian Village. It is just Hilton Garden Inn and it is no resort. The fee includes 2 Hawaiian juices at the bar (not even canned drinks pre-placed in the fridge, basic WIFI access, complimentary local, 1-800, and domestic long distance calls, complimentary sunscreen and after sun lotion, in room coffee, in room hot pot [that is definitely for Asian guests, who drink tea, and I call it a PLUS] with tea, daily morning yoga classes, and a discount book for International Marketplace, which is across the street. I don't mind staying here but at the same time, I will look around for other hotels to try.

Perfect location, easy access to Waikiki Beach. I was not thrilled with the 1st room, smell funky. They have relocated me to a much better and cleaner room within minutes. Front Office are attentive but the restaurant below needed alto of improvement. Service was not great at the restaurant. I had free breakfast and made me pay for the left over wanted to take to the room. I was not feeling well that morning and decided to eat in my room but i had to pay extra person enable not waste my left over.

We had an excellent accessible room--actually we had a suite with a bath and a half. It had a sofa bed; so 4 people could have stayed. The staff was friendly and helpful. We ate at the restaurant twice--great prime rib sandwich very flavorful and nice quantity of meat. They have a pool and a gym..

I've stayed at the garden inn hotel at waikiki with my son for 2 weeks in June. I've stayed at another hotel in the previous years I have visited Hawaii, but thought I should try a different hotel this year.Rooms are nice and clean. The cleaners are very pleasant and always friendly, but the staff at the desk and bar staff at the pool don't seem to enjoy their job nor have any interest in their customers. At one stage, I ordered a couple of complimentary drinks at the bar from vouchers they give you when checking in. The first drink they topped up the cup with ice so there was little juice in the cup. The second time, I asked for only a little ice as they were filling the cup with ice. So they emptied the ice from the cup and gave me a very small cup of juice. Very stingy.I only had 1 all you can eat Buffett breakfast at the hotel which was was pretty ordinary, and not much to talk about.In conclusion, the hotel was ok, but would have appreciated more friendly staff especially at the pool bar. The amount you pay for the compulsory resort fee is ridiculous especially for the very little you get in return for the resort fee.

Brenda was awesome, she helped me out immensely. The hotel was nice, and within walking distance of Waikiki beach and all the tourist shopping areas. My suggestion is to not rent a car if you plan to stay mainly in waikiki. These hotel only offers valet parking so it's a bit of a hassle to have a car for long.

The Hilton Garden Inn Waikiki Beach itself is in a fantastic location, and this was the biggest reason for our booking this hotel (budget considering). It's opposite many stores and very close to several restaurants as well as walking distance to the famous Waikiki beach, so really does put you in the heart of it all. For location I'd definitely give 5* without a doubt, but especially having Island hopped and directly comparing the Hilton to some other less reputable hotels, it felt a bit sterile. We went for a basic room which we were allocated pretty high up, so had no issues here. The balconies are quite small and not really usable in my opinion, and the room sizes are not too generous, but not extremely cramped either. The beds were super comfy and I will give credit to Hilton for giving us a freebie box of Hawaii Cookie Company treats as it was our honeymoon! That being said, if they knew it was our honeymoon you'd perhaps expect that when we checked in the receptionist would mention something (as we'd experienced previously) - our check in wasn't bad but our host surely had no clue. It was a simple check in here are your keys, now next customer please situation. The pool isn't too large, but it does get a good amount of sun and makes a nice area. It's just a shame there's no food service around this area, particularly given signs showing no outside food is allowed - we could really have made an afternoon of chilling here! Speaking of food, we thought one day to try the breakfast and it wasn't half bad... just perhaps not worth the price tag! There was a selection of the usual buffet breakfast options but I've been to other Hiltons and this would rank near the bottom relatively. Again the service and atmosphere just felt lifeless and uninviting. We decided for the remainder of our stay to dine elsewhere (which was super easy given the plethora of options literally across the street!)Now onto check out... we had a 10pm flight so checking out at 11am and leaving bags in the reception was our plan. However, in the past I'd heard of "amenity rooms" that can be booked for 1 hour slots that allow you to have a quick shower before a long flight so at asking at reception the night before check out were firmly told was not available as the hotel was fully booked. We decided our luck to ask again at checkout and the manager must have heard and confirmed there was space indeed, so booked us in. Returning to the hotel at 4pm the staff informed us this was impossible as the hotel was booked, so saying those dreadful words "can we speak to your manager" ended up in the manager confirming the space was available which clearly shocked the person we were speaking to. Whether it was lack of internal communication or just a misunderstanding, it really should not happen. We're super grateful that we were able to use the room given it's clearly subject to availability, but our booking was by no means chump change! Overall, our stay was pleasant where we didn't really have any issues. The hotel reception has a booking.com counter for excursion activities and we were fantastically suited to see some key things in Waikiki, e.g. Hanauma Bay and Diamond Head - more of which you can read at Bhik Adventures. I just felt that given the title of a Hilton there should have been more effort to make every guest feel super welcome in the land of Aloha, especially as it was so emphasised elsewhere. I'd still recommend this hotel, but purely on location and a no frills type of holiday. If you want uber luxury, perhaps look at the Sheraton on Waikiki beach - the infinity pool and other pools looked incredible! I'm sure the budget is too... but for a more reasonable place, you can't really go wrong here.

Not helpful on checkout. I requested help with my luggage and was told it was not available until 0600 despite there being two staff members at the time. Whilst waiting outside there were three staff members attending to the car park, they didn’t offer to help either.

From Bell Wade very helpful Wade took us on a tour to where is the pool and the fitness center, to front desk Michael who was willing to help us settle to our room earlier than expected check in, to housekeeping very welcoming .I highly recommend this place to stay.Its nearby to a lot of restaurant and the famous waikiki beach. Janel very friendly person who have help us set up our sofa bed for the kids. I will definitely return to this property.

After it was clear that Anna, the owner of our airbnb, had never cleaned her studio apartment (no fault of the company, only the owner of the home), my family and I were out a safe place to stay at midnight during the first night of our trip. We phoned a few places, but the employees at Hilton were the only ones who sounded like they gave a crap. So, we went there. We were astounded by an employee by the name of Holly (Holiday?). Despite the grievous late night shift, she was incredibly poised and friendly. She provided us with 5 star service, empathy, and professionalism. Please give her a raise! Additionally, this hotel is spotless, modern, and well located. All of the employees are exceptionally hospitable.Thank you again Holly for going above and beyond to provide us with a lovely experience!

We would love to visit this location again soon. We had everything we needed in each room thanks to the whole team. Good location two blocks from the Beach and the ABC store we had a microwave and Refrigerator also and across from the Mull

It's new and very clean and a great location right across from a nice mall. We got a 1 bedroom suite so we'd have some extra space and that was a complete disappointment. It was insanely tiny. The free breakfast at the restaurant (if you are a gold or diamond member only, and only for 2 people per room) was pretty dreadful. No variety and dismal food. They are also a little ridiculous about other people coming in, no taking coffee out, they made me feel like it was high school and they were all hall monitors. The front desk staff acted like I was putting them out whenever I needed anything. There are a lot of extra fees that they tack on to the nightly rate, resort fee, etc. Valet is $42 a day. We had to use that because there is NO parking anywhere close. There is no hot tub, only an outdoor pool that was quite chilly.

First time at this place, but multiple times in Oahu:Here are a few highlights:Location: This is a great location if you like being in the heart of the action in Waikiki across the street from the International Marketplace with lots of shops, and restaurants. It is a little walk to the main beach, but not far.Happy Hour: Great "all day" happy hour at the bar..with great tasting apps and very fair priced drinks. Everything is tasty, but recommend the prime rib sliders.Pool:The pool area leaves a little to be desired. It is small overall and doesn't get a lot of sun, but it was rarely too busy.Fitness Center: They do have two rooms of fitness, but for one of the largest Hilton Garden Inns, the gym should compare. It is relatively small overall. Random note, they didn't have any elliptical machines, just free weights, treadmills, and bikes.Rooms: Very nice modern upgraded rooms on the small side. Balconies are nice, but the street side can be very loud so keep that in mind.Parking: Parking in Waikiki is expensive and not always convenient, so the fact that this hotel is the same is comparable to the surrounding hotels. If you are not going to use a car the entire time think about the parking costs.Fees: A major plus to waive the resort fees for government customers (at least they told me sometimes).Overall, I would consider staying here again as a Hilton member, but would would look at at a couple of other Hilton's in Waikiki first depending on what I was interested in.

Perfect location across International Market Place for shops and food!Staff was wonderful! Very attentive to our needs and always greeted us with a smile. The walk to Waikiki Beach was so close and made it easy for us to catch the sunrise and sunset every day!

a modern resort style hotel a short walk to Waikiki beach an all shops and food outlets check in was easy as was check out all the staff were extremely friendly and helpful, across the road from this hotel is the recently built international market place a giant shopping mall with many well known shops and food outlets a very welcoming hotel and I would recommend as a place to stay.

Very nice hotel in a good location. Quick check in Pleasant Staff Ekey worked well. Lots of elevators so no long waits. Small C Store attached to hotel. Short walk to the beach. A little pricy but it is Hawaii.

Just returned from Hawaii and stayed at the Hilton garden inn. The location is great as it is close to everything and there are no safety concerns walking around at all. The rooms were fine although my son's room was near the lift and he said that it was horrible. The shop downstairs is good for all you need. The worst thing about this hotel is the staff. Apart from the ladies from Expedia at the concierge desk the rest of the staff ( especially at the check-in desk and in pool bar were nothing but rude. There was one particular last at check-in with red hair that was INCREDIBLY rude and in all honesty is in the wrong profession. She doesn't know service or manners at all. My experience was that no-one was prepared to help with anything apart from the concierge desk. The staff at the pool bar obviously had lost their voice as they couldn't even be bothered to open their mouths and acknowledge us as guests at their hotel. I could go into more about the experience we had with the staff but it adds little value. Nice hotel good location needs new employees

I was very pleased with my stay the comfort level on point I felt safe slept well that was a plus property in a great location everything in walking distance from the hotel and the hotel offer amenities

This hotel is within walking distance to eateries, shops, the beach and transport. The bed was comfy!!However, you will hear the lift if your room is near it. If you need your room clean at certain time please ring up to make a booking. The staff are very helpful. Shop downstairs has most things you need, including drinking water at a good price than other store.

Near shopping, rental cars, beach, kayaking. Variety (in terms of cuisine and price points) of restaurants within walking distance. Pool just 'ok'. Staff was friendly and helpful. In room coffee maker did not work, but the hotel offers coffee in the lobby. Coffee maker was replaced in our room.

We have a wonderful stay at Hilton Garden Inn during our visit to Honolulu in the end of May. It is modern, clean, quiet and provide good service. All in all, a great Waikiki hotel in a convenient location, it is close to shopping and dining with International Market Place across the street; and only a short walk to Waikiki Beach. The room is comfortable and nicely appointed. We have a view of Ala Wai Golf Course and Canal from the lovely balcony in our room. Wi-Fi works really well in the hotel. Coffee and tea are being served every morning in the area outside of the elevator lobby. In late afternoon, it switched over to serving favored water, which is very refreshing welcome to have after being outside the entire day in the heat.The valet staffs are very accommodating. They are always busy and the staffs work very hard. We will call 15 minutes ahead of coming downstairs to have them retrieve our car, and the car is always promptly ready for us.Adjacent to the hotel, there is a grocery store, Food Pantry, which is very convenient for us to hop in to get drinks and snacks.Overall, highly recommend this property!

The location was really great. Only about a 10 minute walk from the beach. The pool was nice and clean, but could get crowded with kids and families during certain times of the day. Breakfast left some to be desired. House cleaning was great. Staff was always friendly. Would stay again.

The hotel is standard with no issues. Room was clean and well looked after. Location is convenient. Beds were comfy to sleep in and bathroom was always clean. The pool was disappointing though and I never saw it being cleaned. The sun lounge chairs were shocking and need replacing because when you lay on them, they were that worn out that I could feel the metal bars underneath(and I'm not even a heavy person). They were very uncomfortable.

I have stayed at other hotels but I chose to go back to this one because of the location. It’s right across from the International Market place and Walking distance to the beach , the stores and restaurants in Waikiki. The staff are very friendly. Rooms are clean and roomy. I just wish the pool was bigger but perfect size for the kids. The hotel rates are so affordable and economical.

We definitely enjoyed our stay here. The rooms were bigger than I expected (although the balcony was very small). There were many restaurants, shops and bus stops around this hotel. Do note that there's no free breakfast or dedicated airport shuttle to/from the hotel. I'd stay here again.

We stayed here for 5 nights in May 2019. The staff were friendly, the room was clean and conveniently close to most of the places we want to visit in Waikiki. The parking (valet only) was kind of stiff, $42/day. Oh well! I am on vacation, I don't mind. Just want to mention.

Ms. Lauren Nakamura was able to upgrade myself to a suite facing Diamond Head and looking at a partial view of the Moana Surfrider Hotel where I had my daughter with an oceanview room. The service was very good and will be back the first week of June!

Although it was definitely busy during our stay, overall this Hilton property was very accommodating and comfortable. Great view from pool (we selected our room based on the pool/gym level for convenience)! This location is VERY close to many amenities and only a couple of blocks to the beach. Restaurant downstairs is nice and a good size. We especially appreciated the little market downstairs for goodies.

This hotel continues to be one of my favorite hotels in the Waikiki area. It is across from the international market. The staff is very professional. They also have fresh coffee available in the lobby every morning. The hotel has a store and restaurant attached to it. There is a very expensive daily valet parking fee charged to the room. Also a resort fee is added. Issues: If you are faces certain parts of the city there is a big homeless corner located within view.

Almost $900 for a 3 night stay w/ $42 a night for valet. No self parking.Room was very small with the sink right when you walk into the door. Good location but doesn't make up for the price.Pay the extra money and stay at the Hilton Hawaiian Village instead.

The staff were very welcoming, gave us great advice on places in the area to visit or eat at. The rooms were neat and tidy, had everything you really need and more. I’ve never had a bad experience at a Hilton and will always book through them if they are an option in the area I’m visiting.

Received attitude from restaurant staff and valet Staff. Showerhead kept falling down . They also put a hold on two of credit cards but never could give me a answer on why. They offered a free tropical drink each day which came from a bottle which they made off like it’s something special.

Right at the international market. 5 minutes approximately to Waikiki beach and all the shopping near there. Rooms are spacious and clean, views are lacking.Pool area is nice and large. Elevators are always slow.

A decent hotel a little off the beach.Rooms are good..but seaside is only visible from one side above the 5th floor.Almost on the market place and lively surroundings. It has two restaurants ,one is actually a cafe with general store.it has a pool on the 3rd floor which is also small getaway if one wants to stick to hotel(why?)

Great hotel for first timers like us. Clean, modern, good service and close to shopping, dining and a short walk to Waikiki beach.There is a shuttle that goes to a huge shopping center on another part of the city. It’s free and you can walk across the road to a lovely park and beach. All in all we’d stay there again.

I have to say I enjoy my overnight visit last Saturday night. However I was largely disappointed with the pool bar. I was only on a one night stay, paying a babysitter for a relaxing night away with friends and the pool bar closed at 430pm. This is seriously not ok, It will certainly make me reconsider staying again. The pool bar situation is unacceptable as I’m sure you can understand, under staffed is certainly no concern of mine in a justification. I paid good money for the experience that was lacking.

Easy to navigate to meetings with clients. Only a 5 minute walk to beach. Very clean with very liltte noise. This is my second stay in 3 months and I would stay here again. The service is excellent and there is always Hawaiian coffee!!

Terrible service and the housekeeping staff needs to be fired. The food quality consistently went down over time. Lack of attention to guest service phone requests. Parking very expensive.The homeless vagrants need to be dealt with. Bring down the value of the stay.

We have been to Waikiki Beach before and stayed at other hotels with a higher resort fee for which we did not use resort activities so decided to shop around for a hotel this time. Since we are Hilton Members decided to try one of their hotels and was not disappointed. When I noticed the price for this hotel was cheaper on Expedia, I called Hilton Office and ended up getting the 5 nights we stayed for the lower rate plus 25% off for finding the cheaper price - great deal. We loved the location - across from International Market Place. The staff were very friendly and helpful. I liked the layout of the room.

We booked this hotel because we wanted to be close to the main action on Kalakaua avenue but did not want to pay the prices of being directly on that street. The location was amazing, directly across the street from International Marketplace which you can cut through to get to Kalakaua and Waikiki Beach in 5 minutes. There was also a grocery store next door and many restaurants down the street giving us plenty of food options (I recommend Marukame Udon for cheap and delicious udon, we ate there twice in our 3 day stay!) The rooms were small but clean and we only used it to sleep and shower after long days of exploring so it was fine. Wifi wasn't the fastest but it worked well enough to send pictures to our friends back home and post on social media. They also have breakfast buffet for around $14 USD per person which you truly can't beat especially in the Waikiki area. The pool area was nice but small, luckily we were so close to the beach that we didn't need to use it other than to get our free juices that the pool bar provided. Overall I recommend this hotel if you want to stay on the quieter side of Waikiki but be close enough to all the main action as the location truly was convenient in that sense.

As a place to sleep: good. As a place to vacation: it is unremarkable except for its location.Check-in and concierge staff are fabulous. Room cleaning staff, not so much. The first room we were assigned had not been serviced from the previous guests. On the first day, our room was not serviced until we had gone out for a late dinner. On the second day, the beds were poorly, sloppily made.We didn't use the pool, but it looked nice enough. Our room balcony overlooked a reasonably gross courtyard parking lot. The breakfast buffet is overpriced both for what is offered and what you can find on the street.

Hotel was very clean. Staff was great. Will definitely stay there again when we make it back to Hawaii.The location was ideal. We were able to walk to beach, shopping and restaurants.Valet parking was a bit expensive at $42 per day, but there really was no other parking in the area, so no other options.You don't get much for your "resort fee."

The Hilton Garden Inn is right in the heart of Waikiki. Not only do you stay at the Hilton but you walk across the street to the newly renovated International Market with its shops and restaurant choices. The hotel staff are friendly and prompt. From the valet & bell hops to the restaurant and housekeepers this Hilton is a great place to stay.

... and maybe even Japan. When we made our reservation, we were offered an upgrade to a city view room for a few extra dollars, which we took. Well, we were surprised when we saw the room. It was maybe 150 sq ft with a shower/toilet room. The “living area” was just big enough for the King Size bed. One side of the bed had about a 32 inch space and the other side of the bed about 18 inches. There wasn’t even space for our suitcases.Then there was our city view ... which was basically the back of a condo building to the north of the Hilton. If this is considered an upgrade, God forbid I can only imagine what the first room looked like.The service / amenities here is not as good as the Hilton Garden Inn on Kauai, or the Grand Naniloa Hotel in Hilo, but it is situated in a prime location and the room rates are reasonable for Waikiki.

This hotel was better than I imagined and the staff was very accomodating and friendly. The wet bar/pool area was beautiful. The expereince was so good, I honestly left and did not recall one bad thing that would have affected my stay!I'd definetly recommend it to my friends...

Beautiful hotel, well staffed, polite, informative. It is located just a couple short blocks from famous Waikiki beach, restaurants, nightclubs etc. Beautiful active location. It was our 50th wedding anniversary and they sent complimentary cookies, drinks, and a lovely card signed by staff to our room. It was a very nice thing to do.

I will be definitely be back there at the same hotel in my future travels! Continue to provide the great customer service, the cleanliness, the joyable staff, the good food and drinks from restaurant, and to each person working inside, outside, back and front office, thank you!

I normally stay at the Hilton Waikiki Beach, but thought I’d try this one. I much prefer the Waikiki Beach to this one, even though it’s older. The rooms are nice but the bathroom layout weird with the sink outside the bathroom, don’t forget to grab your towel before the shower! The mattress was uncomfortable, at least there were the usual Hilton pillows! The location was very convenient to all of Waikiki.

A truly great and memorable experience, while staying in Hilton Garden Inn at Waikiki, Honolulu, HI....... Outstanding Staff with an excellent Customer Service with a Smile !!!!!!I highly recommend this Hotel if you are vacationing in Oahu, HI....... You will not be disappointed!!!!!!!

Very nice renovated hotel. Small rooms, but that’s usually the case with city hotels. OK, the resort fee is a real turn off. I read several reviews where the fee was removed, so you have to complain first? This is not a resort, it is a city hotel.Pool advertised as heated, but it was absolutely freezing. Our stay was in April, so perhaps it is only heated during winter months? If so, it should be made clear. If not, it is false advertising.The free yoga class was very appealing to me, however it was done on an outdoor landing and was anything but zen due to the intense noise of traffic. One could not hear the instructor.Otherwise, the staff were very nice (as we usually find with Hilton), the location was good, the buffet breakfast was quite nice (I usually stay away from buffet breakfasts but this one offered some unusual options).

I booked this hotel as part of an Australian group running in a local half marathon. My friends stay there two-three times per year and so the recommendation was high. The property is directly located opposite the International Market Place which not only provides plenty of shopping and eating options, it's also a thoroughfare onto the main drag of Waikiki and only minutes to the beach.Accommodation is modern and comfortable and when I mentioned an issue with my room, staff swiftly sorted the problem, for which I was most grateful.An afternoon swim in the pool, and relaxing with a book, cocktail and something to eat from the onsite shop is the perfect way to end a day of exploring Honolulu. There's also a pool table where teenagers in our group spent time unwinding at the end of the day.Without the high costs of beach frontage apartments, this is probably a fab family hotel which also provides coin operated laundry facilities that many hotels don't, though many of us traveling for long periods appreciate.A shout out to the cleaning staff, staff in the shop and porters who all demonstrate the hospitality that Hawaii is known for.

We stayed for 1 night for our daughter's prom. The room was clean and the entire staff was very friendly and welcoming. We didn't realize we forgot a water bottle in the room and I received an email that evening that it was found and they could either send it to us or we could pick it up. Since we live on island, we decided to pick it up. Located across the street from the newly renovated International Marketplace that has new eateries and shopping choices.

I stayed one night and checked out yesterday morning. After checking out I was waiting for my husband to come by with our rental car so we could continue with our journey. My husband wasn’t able to find parking so he parked on the side street of the market which posed a problem because I had two 31” luggages that were 50lbs each plus a smaller luggage and backpack. Initially, I asked for help with the staff at the Hilton Vacations desk to watch my luggage while I would move these one by one to the car. My husband couldn’t come in to help as he feared getting a ticket and waited with the car. Instead of having Bell services help me, Noelani jumped to the rescue and helped me with all our luggage to the car. It’s not even her job. She wouldn’t even accept a tip and wished us well. I was so grateful and appreciative of her help. She really went above and beyond. This is a beautiful property and very central in Waikiki to everything. Thanks for the Mai Tai’s!

I normally stay at the Waikiki Beach Hilton when I am in Honolulu. Unfortunately they have instituted a resort fee (which gives me nothing I wouldn't already redeive) and I was able to get a rate at this hotel that did not charge a resort fee (HGI usually does), and included tax (or so I thought). The only thing I was concered with was the cost of the parking (valet only). There is no other parking lots in the vicinity (is mall parking accross the street) so I parked at the hotel. While I understand parking is a scarce and there will be a heafty fee, but $42 is a lot higher than other hotels in the area (I paid $20 at lot near Hilton (now $25). Outside of that my initial impression of the hotel was positive. HGI Waikiki Beach was an upgrade from other HGI's I have stayed at (I am not a big fan of HGI). The lobby area is much nicer than any other HGI I have stayed and the room was clean and updated. Better than most Hilton rooms (but unfortunately same hard HGI bed). My only complaint was the view. As a Diamond member I usually get upgraded to an ocean view, but understand many people book these rooms (West facing rooms don't really have great ocean views - blocked by other buildings) and have no problem not getting this room (I was only there for 1 night). But, at least I thought I would get view facing the opposite way of the water and facing the mountains. Instead I got one facing the side of the hotel and an alley way. I honestly didn't think there was such a view in Waikiki. But again, I was only there for 1 night so it wasn't that big of a deal (rather not get a view when I am alone and on business). The pool area was nice and you could get towels to take to the beach (just bring them back or you get charged). The wifi was better than most Hilton's so I was happy about that and the Diamond breakfast was by far the best breakfast I have had at a HGI (in the US). The only other issue I had was when checking out there was an issue with what I was being charged, but that got taken care of after I left. Would I stay here again? If I have a car, probably not. But if you don't have a car (which most don't) and can find value in the resort fee (most hotels charge this now) this is a nice place to stay in a very good location (2 to 3 blocks from the beach). One note, it is not well marked. I have been in this area a few times since the HGI Waikiki Beach opened and I didn't even know it was there.

The location, for our purposes, was good. It was close to so many restaurants within walking distance. The pool was nice and I enjoyed it a couple of times. The room was fine, but for a long stay (2 weeks) it wasn't comfortable because there was nowhere to put clothes. There is no dresser or shelves within the closet, so I hung up what I could/needed to and had to leave the rest of my folded clothes in my suitcase. Further, there was no light in the closet or near the closet, so it made it difficult to see. (I provided this information to Hilton when they sent a request for feedback post-stay.) The shower was large with good water pressure, the bed was comfortable, and I found the store at the ground level useful for laundry detergent, etc.

The hotel is a no frills in a good location in relation to the beach and night life. The rooms were clean, with an obstructed view of the water. We were there for a half marathon race, which was convenient. The store in the lobby was great to pick up snacks and small items. The staff hotel staff was friendly and helpful.

This hotel is fantastic....just a short walk through the International marketplace....about a block......and you are on the beach. Much quieter than the beach......but you can be there in minutes by foot for the shows. We walked to the Hula show on the Mound.....about 4 minutes.....got to watch 2 year olds dance the hula to their own beat....and direction....really cute.

We've stayed here before and find it has a great location off the beach, clean rooms, very comfy beds, nice room layout, lots to like about it.This trip wasn't so good. We booked 2 rooms months in advance and requested they be close together.Unfortunately they were not close to each other. One had a city view while the other had a nice balcony overlooking a parking lot and other tall buildings. We had not noticed these views on previous stays since our views had been outward. Since we really had no interest in sitting on the balcony looking at the parking lot we requested a change in room - one closer to our other room.We were told there were no other rooms available until the next day. We agreed to move the next day and were told we had to "check out" at noon and wait for our room to be ready around 3:00pm. Meaning we would be without a room between noon and 3pm. The next day we went to ask about staying in the room until the new room was ready and the person at the desk easily said of course. Not the same message we got from the day before.We moved to the new room and were shocked to see a note in the room saying our water would be turned off the next day between 9:00am and 5:00pm!We again called to request a new room that would have running water. The manager was extremely nice and helpful and found us a room on a lower floor since the water was to be turned off between the 10th and 20th floor! Imagine all those rooms with no water during the day while you are trying to enjoy your Hawaiian vacation.Not sure what to think about this hotel going forward. Lots to like but this trip really was a huge disappointment. Too much vacation time on the phone with the front desk and moving suitcases from room to room to room.

Recently stayed at the Hilton Garden Inn Waikiki. It’s a stand alone hotel with a pool, pool bar, and cafe in the lobby. Nice, but nothing special. Near the International Market Place but a couple of blocks from the beach. My issue is that they charge a Resort Fee of $28 per room per night. The Hilton Garden Inn is not (repeat NOT) a resort in any way!! Hilton is praying on you for your vacation dollars while not offering anything resort-like in return. You’ll also pay $42 a day for parking. That’s more than you probably paid for a modest rental car per day. You are paying $70 on top of your room rate per day for a resort fee and parking. So factor that in to your planning if you decide to book at any of the Waikiki Hilton properties. The resort fees and parking are even higher at the other Waikiki Hilton’s. Are you a Hilton Honors member? Great, you get a fabulous two bottles of water at check-in. Really too much!! (not). Just an FYI, I complained to the Desk Clerk about the Resort Fee and he admitted there was really no reason for the Resort Fee and removed it from my bill !! So they (Hilton) know they are gouging their guests. If you are planning to stay a few days, you’ll be living out of your suitcase because some of the rooms don’t have a dresser or drawers to put away your clothing and personal items. Needless to say, I was not a happy camper, but with good reason.

Stayed in this hotel for a couple of nights before heading to a rental house on the North Shore of Oahu.It's a nice, medium rise hotel a couple of blocks from the beachfront.We had a room with a king bed on he 8th floor with what they call a City View - so no water views (no big deal for us).Check in was quick and easy (and we were in a bit early).The room was fine with a good bed, good shower and plenty of space for everything.Pretty big TV and good channel selection.Ok Wi-Fi in the room.There was a small balcony with chairs / table that was pretty good for sitting and watching the action from the main street and cafes below.The room also had a microwave.Breakfast / restaurant downstairs that was the usual hotel style buffet for brekky.Probably as usual for hotels here, there was a nice pool area with a bar.You're in downtown Waikiki, so there's a myriad of dining / shopping options on the doorstep.It was a fine hotel, not as flashy as some of the others (on the beachfront) but good value for money and sometimes I think it's better to spend a bit less on the hotel so you have more to spend on food / entertainment.

We stayed here 1 night in March 2019. The photos we saw were suggestive of a larger suite (which we thought we reserved). The room had two double beds for a family of four and was a bit cramped but otherwise functional. The pool has a nice bar next to it and the lobby is a nice place to sit - with a sundry store attached with basic items, a bar, and some food options. The location is pretty convenient near large shopping centers, restaurants, and the beach.

Check in was quick and simple. Our room was ready and we went to the concierge to plan our trip. We had nothing preplanned. This is where we met Blayne the concierge. He was truly amazing. He walked us through everything and planed our whole trip. I Highly recommend asking for him. Throughout the trip the staff offered advise and recommendations.

My boyfriend and I stayed here in February of this year. We had a great stay. When we arrived they only had a room with two double beds however we stayed in that one night and they moved us to a new room the next day and it was lovely. Upon arrival they give you coupons for free cocktails at their pool bar. The hotel is pretty quiet so there is not much noise. The pool is small enough but it was never packed so it was nice. There is a shop and restaurant / bar in the hotel which is handy. We only ate breakfast in the restaurant once and to be honest it wasn't the best but there are plenty of cafes and restaurants nearby so it didn't bother us. Towels were changed everyday and sheets were changed every two or three days. I would definitely return to this hotel if we go back to Waikiki. It is a great location and only a 5-10 minute walk to the beach.

We had a view of the ocean and the sunset which was awesome! The room was spacious and had a lot of storage space. I like their choice of toiletries and there was always a generous amount available. Coffeemaker and coffee was good too! soundproofing was very good as well.

We stayed in a one bedroom suite and was pleasantly surprised. It had a very large balcony next to the pool. There was a wet bar with plenty of counter space and a dining table. The toilet was separate from the shower and sink which was a plus. Check in was quick. I loved that there was coffee in the lobby every morning. There was a small pool table near the pool. Hotel provides sunscreen and self-serve beach towels. Parking is Valet and the going rate for Waikiki so we had our family drop us off. Across the street from International Market Place, Marukame Udon and lots of eateries near by. Great Holoholo market downstairs reasonably prices and Foodland across the street. We got a great room rate, not as pricy as the Sheraton or Hilton Hawaiian that we usually stay at. Will be back in Sept.
user_name:
Shelly K
Ewa Beach, United States

review_body: The hotel is reasonably new however the rooms are quite small and basic. They are clean and well kept & the staff are very courteous and eager to help. The hotel has a restaurant and a convenient store attached and the pool looks OK but we didn’t use it. It’s 10 min walk to the beach. We had no view but you can see the water walk to the lifts.

The moment we stepped through the doors it was quiet and felt like a sanctuary from the busy city. The views from the upper floors were amazing! Our room was nice and updated and always clean when we returned!

Clean and well located. Room value for money. Breakfast disappointing with hot food only luke warm and lack of variety of fresh fruit and bakery. despite resort fee, not a resort. pool tiny and nothing else "resort like".

We’ve stayed in Waikiki every year for the last 6 years staying in a different place on most visits... I’ve finally found the one. Modern , clean great bathrooms- no shower cutains thank you Staff were great breakfast buffet yum little pricey. Located right in Waikiki with everything near by short work to the beach quick bus ride to Ala Moana. The beds are so comfy you’ll enjoy it here, I’ll definitely be back

The Hilton Garden Inn Waikiki Beach is conveniently located across the street from the International Marketplace. It's in walking distance to great restaurants and shops. The staff at the property are very helpful and they even have a hospitality room if you need a place to shower before a late flight!

I had a maintenance issue with my room. I noticed Brenda cleaning an adjacent room and she was so wonderful to call maintenance for me. She also checked in to see if they had arrived. Brenda is pleasant and has a lovely demeanor and smile that makes one feel very welcomed.
