I couldn't find the parking place. It took me almost 10 times going in circles. Comes to find out its only valet parking pretty pricey and its on the side of the building soo its pretty fustrating finding it. But the overall stay was amazing.now that i know where to go for parking I'm excited to come back again!

Everyone was so nice. Location was perfect, just across International Marketplace. Coffee at the lobby at 6am was so good, wish it was all day. Valet excellent. Able to take beach towels to the beach and return at the end of the day. Definitely will stay here when in Oahu.

This hotel is beautiful and located in a very prosperous shopping area. The desk staff and bell hop were very courteous. The fireworks on Friday nights are amazing. Looking forward to revisiting this hotel after our cruise.

A great place to stay if you want to be in the heart of Waikiki. Walking distance for anything and everything. Friendly staff and great rooms. Not directly on the beach bit it's a short distance walk.

We had a wonderful stay at the Hiltons Garden Inn. We were welcomed by a happy and smiley Wade. The staff at the hotel were so friendly and helpful. The hotel is clean and was renovated so it doesn't look old like some other hotels. The view was amazing from the 15th floor. The hotel is situated central to the International market where you do shopping and eating and it was convenient to get to other places. The trolley which cost USD$2 per trip to Ala Moan Shopping mall is just in front of the hotel. If you get hungry at night or want to get some snacks the ABC store which is like our 7Eleven stores in Australia is located pretty much next door to the hotel. Overall we loved the stay at the Hiltons Garden Inn and I highly recommend it. We would come back next time!

After a short scenic ride in from the airport we arrive downtown Waikiki right in the middle of the activity.We change take a look over at their pool on the 3rd floor and head out into the bright blue sky and warm tropical sunshine.Ah Hawaii...love it.We cross Kuhio take a peek in Kona Coffee Purveyors (see review) walk through the center looking at the shops eateries ABC and other supply stores and Nordstrom Rack.Another block south and we’re at Paia Fish Market (see review) for a late lunch of fish tacos and local craft beer.Across Kuhio we see Marukame Udon Noodle House (see review).Yes it seems that our hotel located conveniently between the canal and a short walk to the beach is truly in the middle of things with folks everywhere.We head back to the Hilton for a little afternoon pool time and happy hour ($6 mai tais) at their cozy poolside bar.Their 4ft. deep pool is a comfortable size with easy access steps perfect for kids ledges for sitter soakers like me and a little waterfall. There are lots of very comfortable adjustable mesh chaise and sitting chairs located both in the sun (careful) and shade (get there early).You will find a lively grill/lounge by the front door that looked like fun with a tasty menu and usually full of folks.The rooms were generously sized bright clean in good repair a balcony with a nice roomy shower double vanity and firm comfortable beds...cudos.Like the main switch by the door that turns all of the lights off on your way out.Now here’s the thing about hotels in Hawaii...you are not there much! Change sleep shower and gone again.Consequently I can’t tell you much about their food exercise workout area banquet/conference rooms reception valet concierge and service.I really do want to share one amazing people thing though with you folks about this Hilton.Every person on their staff that I encountered throughout whether the pool bartenders house keeping maintenance service reception and others greeted me with a warm smile eye contact and a freindly sincere “aloha”.Every one...day or evening busy or not coming or going to each Hilton team member did this and I in return. They made me feel welcome to their hotel and Hawaii and that alone certainly makes me want to return there when in Honolulu. Folks this is a testament to their hiring team their training and their people.WOW!When you are making your reservations to come to this tropical paradise for business or pleasure for your first visit or one of many returns I suggest making your home at the Hilton Garden Inn Waikiki.Aloha,Ricardo y Julia

I’ve stayed on this property for my last few visits. I visit quarterly for business purposes and especially like this location. The hotel is very clean and well run. The restaurant has a very broad menu with good food.

I really enjoyed the facility. The rooms were clean, nice and relatively large this close to the beach. Valet parking was good with only one day where we had a bit of a wait for our car. Otherwise, I totally thought Hilton delivered on expectations.

Great location. Walk to the beach, major malls. Great valet service. Staff was professional and helpful. Only issues were the water pressure and hot water. The shower's water pressure and heated water SUCKED! Disappointed for a "Hilton" hotel. Basic necessities!

The staff at the Hilton Garden Inn Waikiki Beach is excellent! Everyone goes above and beyond to make you feel welcome. Special thanks to Sean at the check-in desk for making my parents feel so valued! He gave them a room upgrade for their loyalty when they checked in and was always exceptionally helpful. This hotel is also located in a great area near International Marketplace, Nordstrom Rack, and the city buses. The rooms have Keurig coffee makers, and a complimentary and very delicious breakfast is included for HH members with gold or diamond status. They also have a very nice happy hour!

We booked two nights here with our hilton points prior to taking a cruise out of honolulu. Check-in was fast and efficient and our room was updated. They have a pool on the third floor overlooking the street. Theres a bar next to the pool, towel closet, gym, and restroom adjoining. The hotel itself is behind the international market place, so its a quick 2 block walk to the beach. There are many restaurants within walking distance, and there's a convenience store right off the lobby selling everything from sundries to hot food at low prices. Valet parking is mandatory but quick and easy. We never had to wait for our car if we called from the room. All in all, it wasn't on the beach like the main hilton, but the price was much cheaper and we enjoyed being away from the Kalakaua Avenue madness.

If you are a HH Gold/Diamond member do not expect much in the way of an upgrade. Also, if you are traveling with a family beware that only 2 guests are covered for free breakfast. If you have kids you will be paying for them - once again a sign of just how stingy the hotel is. Better value at other hotels in the area, even at Hilton Waikiki Beach.

My family and I stayed here for 5 nights - the best thing about our stay was that the awesome breakfast buffet was included. If you it's included in yours, get the omelet! So freaking good. Also the hotel staff was very helpful and friendly especially the housekeeping staff. They did a great job remembering our specific requests from the first day.One thing they could work on is to add a heater the pool. We were charged a resort fee which includes the pool but we weren't able to use it since the water was so dang cold.

Recently stayed in a suite at the Hilton garden inn Waikiki.....although the rooms are a bit small they are all recently renovated and they are clean and quiet. We have stayed at the Hilton Hawaiian village prior and found it noisy and a bit of a zoo. In the older towers there you have to wait 10 minutes for how water in the AM. No problems like this at the well located garden inn. Nice pool area too without having to fight for chairs like some resorts

This hotel was in a great location next to shops and restaurants. The beach is a five minute walk away too. The main stop for the Waikiki Trolley line is a short walk too. The room was a good size and we comfortably fitted a port-a-cot next to the bed. The rooms and the hotel were clean and the complementary tea and coffee each morning in the lobby was an added bonus.

My husband and I stayed here for 2 nights, and here’s our review.Pro-1) there are a microwave and a small fridge in the room, so we were able to buy cheaper food from the markets/other non-tourist places and heat up food. It helps to save money.2) Neutrogena shampoo/conditioner/lotion products. Makeup remover sheets in the room too!! 3) Resort fee covers sunscreen and after sun lotion. They are communal so bring your own containers. 4) Staff was friendly.Con- the carpet felt scratchy and dirty. I’m sure they don’t power wash it often. Wish they had slippers in the room.

My wife stayed at the hotel for three nights and gave them 5 stars on Yelp!. Then told me to do the same (the wife said, so here I go) on TripAdvisor. I spent one night there, but have to say my short time there was really nice. The service is nice and their buffet breakfast (free for us as Diamond members) was really good. Yummy omelettes :).My one issue is that we rented a car and the hotel offers valet only. Not a problem except Googlemaps did not locate the valet desk which is on a different street address than the hotel. I had to call Hilton 800 number for them to patch me in with the hotel front desk, who then assisted with directions. A lot of one way streets in Waikiki which makes maneuvering around challenging. If you rent a car and are staying at the hotel, get directions to the valet beforehand.Enjoy this nice hotel which is close to many things in Waikiki.DK

As seniors we appreciated the $2 per person all day bus pass you could purchase from the driver. You need to ask the front desk staff for bus information. They have a great sheet that gives you the bus number & approximate time to destination for most of the sights & locations on the island. Ask for a room higher up because the street in front of the hotel is quite noisy at night. We paid for a partial ocean view that was just a few slivers of ocean, so think about this before requesting this type of room. We did like the sun angle because we could sit out on the balcony in the afternoon sun. We were celebrating our 60th wedding anniversary, so the front staff gave us one free buffet breakfast. It was good to have this experience because the breakfast was not what we usually eat, so we found other breakfast spots in the area that we enjoyed more. The service staff is friendly and helpful, which we appreciated. The room safe, micro & fridge are pluses I always look for. The free standing shower (not over a tub) was great! No messy shower curtain or slippery tub floor to deal with. One thing my husband missed was having a few drawers to put his clothes in as we were there for 7 nights. He also appreciated the Fitness Center--which is housed in two rooms--so look next door for free weights & other equipment besides the usual treadmill and elliptical. With all the taxes and $25 resort fee--our $240 a night room became $310 per night, but they did provide the correct amount with all the extras when I booked on line, so that was not a surprise. We did enjoy our stay--the elevators were numerous and fast, but the wifi was slow & the service kept dropping. So if you know all of this and adjust, you will have a great time.

Location was convenient, service good, room was clean enjoyed the pool connection with shuttle was easy enjoyed pool and refreshments the lobby. Provided. Was easy to do shopping and go to beach. Will go back o this hotel

This has been one of the better hotels I’ve stayed in so far in Waikiki. It has been quiet, not to much strange activity outside the hotel, professional, and nice. The staff is courteous. The cleaning staff does a great job, my room was serviced by Tina and she has been amazing. No free breakfast but it does have a restaurant in the lobby and a little store attached that has a small little pastry shop. Pool is on the 3rd floor.

This is a first-class hotel in the heart of Honolulu, about three blocks from Waikiki Beach and within walking distance of many stores and restaurants. The staff was friendly and very helpful from the front desk to the bell service staff. Our room was spacious, in good repair and clean. In-house is also a convenience store and restaurant. The restaurant serves a hearty buffet breakfast with gracious wait-staff, especially Taylor. Would definitely return to this hotel in the future on any return trip to Oahu.

Just got back from this trip and we stayed at this hotel for 6 nights. The hotel itself is very clean and the room was also clean and well kept. The staff were friendly and we felt safe with all the security staff walking around. The hotel perfectly located behind the International Market Place and it is within waking distance to many amenities including the beach without the outrageous prices some of the other hotels ask. The pool was quiet the few times we went down and we never had an issue getting a chair. We will be back for sure.

This was my first time staying at a Hilton Garden Inn, and I was quite impressed. The last time I visited Hawaii, we stayed at the Hilton Hawaiian Village. I was attending a conference this time, and the HHV was too far from the conference hotel. I booked this hotel based on price (much cheaper than conference hotel rate) and location to the conference hotel.The location of this hotel was great. It is literally right across from the International Market (so lots of food options), Starbucks is nearby, a Food pantry is across the street, and the hotel has a coffee bar in the lobby, it's own store, and its own restaurant. In terms of proximity to Waikiki Beach, it is a few blocks, but an easy walk. I packed a tote bag in our suitcase, so we packed up beach towels (provided by the hotel on floor 3), goggles, drinks, and headed to the beach. My boys are 11 & 13 so it was easy, and since I didn't need to return to the hotel for any naps, the proximity was a non-issue. The room wasn't huge, but it was nice. It had both a microwave and a fridge. Since I booked on price, we got the cheapest room with no view, so we faced other buildings. It had a balcony, but we did not use it. The room had a Keurig coffee maker in the room which was well stocked, so we really enjoyed this perk. The pool is located on the third floor, and it is small. Despite the size, my kids used it everyday. The sun shines on the pool (so it has a good sun deck), and there is plenty of sun chairs, so if you want to relax poolside in the sun or shade, you can. There is no hot tub. Also, the fitness center is impressive, and I did use that. Equipment was clean, towels and water are provided. Finally, it was quiet (even with our non-ideal view).The staff was great. From check in to check out, they were amazing. My husband forgot his toothbrush, and they brought one to our room complimentary. We needed a bottle opener, and they graciously allowed us to borrow one. The activities desk was helpful in getting us booked on adventures, and the bellman was awesome in getting us a taxi to the airport at a flat rate.As others have mentioned, it is a reasonably priced hotel, great service, and a good location. I definitely will return again.

The hotel is convenient located to the shopping mall. Very friendly staff. Would recommend this hotel to my family and friends! Had a lovely stay. Thankyou for the upgraded king room! We will be back next time!

Great location. Awesome staff and facilities including the restaurant, gym , bar and pool bar. Nice rooms with terrific showers. Digital check in / check out and room key. Have no negatives to report and will most definitely be back.

Are there fancier hotels in Honolulu? Yes but there are going to cost you. This Hilton however, is a clean, reasonably priced hotel in a great location - close to the beach and to plenty of shopping and food options - and features everything you need. Our room was a bit on the small side and consisted of two double beds instead of the usual queen (we were aware of this ahead of time). It was enough space for a family of three but it might be tight for a family of hour. Though small, the space was very well used with plenty of storage and seating and there was a fridge and microwave. Our room was on the third floor and looked out on a parking lot/back of another hotel. It wasn't scenic but it was quiet. And even better, we were on the same floor as the pool. This was extremely convenient as it meant that we could quickly and easily jump back and forth between the pool (and the sunscreen dispenser) and our room.I need to give a special shoutout to the housekeeping staff. My daughter peed on both beds at two different times on the same day, after of course, housekeeping had been by. The first time housekeeping was still on our floor and I just grabbed some new sheets right from them. The second time I had to call housekeeping and they came down while we were out at dinner and not only brought new sheets but made up both beds. Thanks guys and sorry for all the pee sheets!

Enjoyed our stay here. We found the hotel and room clean, great balcony with a beautiful view, good location to stores, restaurants and beach. Would highly recommend. Would stay here again when in Honolulu.

Close proximity to Waikiki Beach, shops, dining, buses, and a grocery store. This hotel is centrally located, and great. The staff are extremely friendly and ready to assist. Rooms are very clean, and well appointed.

Spent 6 nights here. Kuhio Ave is just a street behind the main shopping street (Kalakaua Ave) which made it the perfect location.No problem walking to the shops and eateries.The International Marketplace with its free nightly cultural dance show is just across the street.The Waikiki trolley buses stand are all within 5 minutes walk or less.The famed Marukame udon stall with its long queues is practically 3 doors away.It is not a big hotel comparatively but comfortable and the staff friendly although the reception service could be improved.We had arrived early and despite several enquiries, our room only available at the stated 3pm. Also for 2 days after being out till 3pm, came back to discover our rooms were not yet cleaned. Shortage of housekeeping staff?Having said that, we enjoyed our stay. We even managed 2 of the free daily yoga classes at 8am and the small gym which was well managed with clean towels, water and even head phones.Be aware the pool is pretty small on the 3rd floor which hanging out at the pool all day is your thing.

I spend 2 nights here and had a great time from check-in to check-out. I was upgraded to a suite on the 19th floor due to status and the view was awesome. The king size bed was lovely, huge bathroom. The breakfast on the first floor was lovely too. Great place to stay where everything is from walking distance. I used to live in Honolulu to as I was picking this hotel, I knew I wouldn’t be disappointed and I would be close to everywhere I needed to go.

The hotel is well located in Waikiki and a short walk to the beach. The lobby and staff were pleasant and the room spacious. Well priced for the area. The room had a small lanai that overlooked the International Shopping Mall.

Service has been excellent from every single staff person we have met. Front desk agents, maintenance in the hallways , housekeeping; everyone has been very very kind. The hotel is clean and modern - all up to date. The coffee is excellent ! The elevators are plentiful and don’t take a long time to arrive ;) the pool is nice as well as the bartenders and staff at the pool area. The exercise rooms are fantastic (the weight room is a bit small and could be made larger to accommodate more people - I would say it is good for 3-4 people max at a time ) and morning are busy. The equipment is good though and the rooms are stocked with towels and water. The hotel is conveniently located and I would recommend for any one to come stay here. It’s been great.

Rooms are very quiet if the fan is left on in the room. Staff is friendly and always helpful except when issues with washer or dryer. Don’t waste your money in the restaurant for dinner but breakfast buffet is worth the $14.

We stayed here one night before heading to Kauai. We used our Hilton points to stay and as Gold members we enjoyed the free breakfast. It was very good. Our room was clean. There are quite a few nice restaurants within walking distance and you are only 2 blocks from the beach. We would stay here again.
user_name:
Velma P
Saint Albans, West Virginia

review_body: The Hilton Garden Inn is located about 2 blocks from the beach. There are several restaurants located nearby, and the hotel was clean and maintained. Staff was pleasant and the bar/restaurant of the hotel was small, but good, and prices were reasonable. I was charged a $26.00 resort fee each day, even though I was there for government work. They would not waive this fee. Parking was valet only and cost $42.00 per night. I thought this was a bit high for the area. Other than that it was an acceptable hotel.

This hotel was an excellent choice. We used our points to book the stay. As Gold Level Honors Member, we were given daily Breakfast at no charge. Excellent Breakfast Buffet. Hotel is very close to the Waikiki Beach. Other hotels nearby were Royal Sheraton and Sheraton Waikiki and Hyatt Regency. Walk to the Beach was only 5 minutes.

Who can ask for more in a hotel. It was clean, restful and service was exceptional. Right behind the International Marketplace so it was easy walking distance to beaches, shopping, buses and activities.

Very quick and easy check-in process. Nice quaint room, clean and functional. The breakfast is very good, with made to order omlettes. The valet staff are quick and friendly. We would stay here again.

This Hilton Garden Inn is a thoroughly decent hotel. Good location, helpful staff, recently updated. Why do I avoid going to a top rating – without going into “too much information” there is very poor soundproofing between the bathroom and bedroom – manageable if you are travelling with someone very close?

We stayed 4 nights over the Martin Luther King holiday weekend (Jan 2019). We arrived around 12:30pm and our room was not ready yet - check in is at 3pm. The front desk clerk took my phone number and said he would call us as soon as a room was ready. We checked in our luggage and went to walk around. No problem. We still had not received a call 2 hours later, so we went back to the hotel around 2:30pm to check to see if our room was ready. There was another clerk this time he said they had several, so we finally got our room. Given that a room was ready, but we didn't get a call, I'm not sure we ever would have gotten a call. Our room was basic with a King Bed, microwave, refrigerator, big flat screen Samsung TV, and Keurig coffee machine. It was very clean.Here are things we liked:- The King Bed was very comfy and we slept pretty good- The TV was nice and it allowed us to use the HDMI port on the side to hook up our Amazon Firestick so we could watch TV just like we do at home.- The bathroom was nice with a big shower.- The Keurig coffee machine had 6 pods of different coffee as well as some tea.- It has a microwave and refrigerator (however our fridge didn't work too well)- it has USB ports on most of the electrical plugs. This was super convenient for charging our phones and ipads.- The room was pretty quiet, but we could hear some neighbors talking occasionally.- The location is great. It's a 7 minute walk to the beach and there's food and stores everywhere nearby. There a supermarket literally across the street for any necessities you may need.There were just a couple things we didn't like in the room. - Our thermostat didn't work right and simply wouldn't turn off no matter what temperature was set. This took us 2 nights figure out after the second night we woke up freezing. Our thermostat was set to 74 degrees, but the room was at 69 degrees and the way the fan is situated, it blows right onto the bed. I told t he front desk the morning about the issue on our way out the next morning and he said it would be taken care of. We came back to our room around 5pm and it looked like someone had done something to the thermostat as the settings were different than when we left it. However, it still didn't work right and still wouldn't shut off. We just learned to deal with it.- The refrigerator was barely cold and there's no adjustment to make it colder. I got around this by filling the ice bucket with ice from the ice machine and putting our drinks in ice in the fridge. - The fan in the bathroom was loud. You can hear it sounds like a bearing is going out and the fan turns on each time the light is on. It's loud enough to be annoying and I would have thought the maids would have noticed it. Not a big deal, but probably should have fixed.Overall, we enjoyed our stay here and would stay here again. I can recommend this hotel, just make sure your thermostat and refrigerator works on your first day and not halfway into your trip like us.

This is a 37 story high-rise hotel. The building itself is older. Rooms have recently been updated or a nice modern clean look. The beds and furnishings are in new condition bathrooms are completely updated. This is a quiet restful hotel roughly 2 blocks off of Waikiki. Easily accessible to the beach. The staff at this hotel are exceptional! They are friendly and very helpful. I would definitely return to this hotel in the future.
user_name:
Jackie W
Louisville, Colorado, United States

review_body: The hotel is located two blocks off the beach which is a five minute walk at most, and walkable to shops and restaurants. There is a nice pool and pool deck at the third floor level with a bar and free suntan lotion. Free yoga classes are offered some mornings. Parking is by valet only, $42 a day (!); skip the car and take public transportation or walk. We had a very nice room equipped with a safe, microwave, mini-fridge and coffee maker which meant we could buy breakfast supplies at ABC and store our dinner leftovers for lunch, saving a lot of money since food is expensive. There is a restaurant attached which has a good buffet breakfast for $14, and a convenience store which has snacks, cut fruit and sandwiches, drinks, and souvenirs. WIFI was spotty at times but mostly ok. Only complaint was the "resort fee" tacked on like all hotels in Hawaii, you don't really get anything resort-worthy for the money. Still, a good choice, good value for the area and we would stay here again.

Spent 5 nights in very small room at high price rate. Buffet but limited breakfast. Our kingsize beedroom "featured" new concept of having a nightstand only on one side of the bed. My wife had to hold her hot tea until she finished. CHEAP!

The hotel is in the heart of Waikiki, few steps from the beach and all the shops. It is modern with a nice decor. The rooms were compact but nice and with comfortable beds. Free wifi and nice reception staff. We had breakfast at the hotel's restaurant, it was okay, not a huge selection though, but at a good price. There is a shop with food and souvenirs next to the lobby, very handy. A nicer pool and some wellness would be nice. Very enjoyable stay, would come back!

The Hilton Garden Inn is in a great location in Waikiki; two blocks from the beach, across the street from the International Market Place, lots of good food around. The staff was very nice and helpful.

Clean & modern - overall great stay.The location was fantastic, although you couldnt see the beach it was only a short walk through the city to get down to it. Other than the beach you're centrally located to all amenities - restaurants, shopping, etc. A nice feature was the small market located just off of the lobby of the hotel, and the grocery store right next door - extremely convinient.For anyone whose new to Hawaii or who has not had a chance to explore outside of Waikiki, I highly recommend the Ohau full island/circle tour as well as the day tour of Kualoa Ranch - incredible day adventures that will keep you talking about for years to come.

We booked this hotel for 7 nights and had a remarkable time! We had a room on the 9th floor. The room had a balcony, sofa bed and king size bed. It was spacious, well maintained with a well stocked mini coffee bar, fridge, and microwave. The beds were comfortable, towels were plentiful and we could not be more pleased with the service and staff. Everyone was so friendly and helpful from the check-in desk, to the bell staff and housekeeping. We felt genuinely appreciated, welcomed and will be back to this same location again in the not too distant future!There is a pool with a poolside bar, onsite laundry and gym. We enjoyed the pool, found the laundry to be busy, but convenient. Did not visit the gym as we got plenty of exercise out exploring the island!The location has a Holo Holo market attached in the lobby as well as TR Fire Grill (great breakfast location). Across the street is the Food Pantry grocery store as well. There are plenty of restaurants and shopping within easy walking distance. The hotel is about three blocks from the beach.

Clean, modern and extensively remodeled. However, you will have to pony up for the upper floors to get (and I'm guessing here!) any kind of Hawaii view. The room itself is great, just keep the curtain closed. Great shower and amenities as well. The valet parking was a little expensive, but the staff that run it are top notch and very quick to retrieve your ride. Same goes for the rest of the hotel staff, very friendly and accommodating. A great experience, and a convenient central location on Kuhio Ave.

Don't go for buffet after 10 am. They shut down at 11 am and you will be an annoyance.Factory food, have had better buffets at Best Western free breakfasts.Never before been charged for waffles or anything else at a buffet. Here the cost is 3.00.No service as it's all serve yourself including coffee and water. Bill came with precalculated tip at 18%, 25% etc. A little heavy for self serve.

We had a excellent time, staff was available when needed. Pool was great, breakfast was not exactly worth the $15 but this hotel is in a great location so eating is definitely not a problem. Easy walk to the beach. As said before the location is amazing excellent walk to anywhere!

This hotel was in a great location. Off the main strip just enough but not too far. We were able to walk to anything we wanted.... the beach, shopping, restaurants, etc. Highly recommend this location for families.

This hotel has a pretty good location. No views of the ocean. Pool is super small. The room was really small. To small for three people. Room had two beds, both full size. Not even a queen bed. Love my wife but neither one of us had a decent nights sleep because it was so small. Valet is $42 a night. I guess if you don’t care about your customers you can charge $42. It’s a complete rip off! The restaurant in the hotel is really bad too. Breakfast is a really bad buffet. Skip it if you can. The only good thing about this hotel was leaving.

Amazing hotel. Brand new, just opened two years ago. Wonderful staff. Am still there and enjoying every day! Staff friendly and helpful, housekeeping staff very helpful and wonderful. Nice little gym.All the corridors are on the outside and you get a wonderful view from wherever you stand. Amazing location. Can walk to Diamond head every morning. Had a convenience store attached to it and right across the international market.Yoga every morning outside. Free coffee in the morning and flavoured water in the afternoon. Great addition to the Hilto hotels. Am for sure coming back next year if I get a good rate. Would definetly recommend. Bathrooms and room modern and super clean

My husband and I loved the location of this hotel. It was close to shopping and the beach. The room was updated and nice. Our only complaint was the mattress and pillows...they weren't the best. We loved the convenience of the shop for groceries and snacks in the lobby.

This hotel was well located, steps from International Market Place and two blocks from Waikiki Beach. That's where the good comments end. It took around 30 minutes to check in because of a line since they did not have enough staff. We had two rooms, they were clean enough but beds were soft and no view. Pool was kiddie pool at best. Breakfast buffet was expensive and terrible service and food. I will never bring my family here again. Shame on you Hilton!! Our stay was very disappointing and we are elite members. No acknowledgement for that either.....

A shout out for the three instructors and the free yoga classes offered each morning overlooking the pool deck. What a great "extra" and way to start the day. Each of the instructors had a different style, but all were really excellent and the centering and exercising were the perfect way to orient each new day on the island.

Generally I love the HGI product with their breakfast and quality accommodations. This was not one of those visits. My main issue was that my room was dirty and needed a deep cleaning. There was a film on the shower glass and the walls were not cleaned off. Also, I experienced a constant mechanical noise that was not related to my air conditioner. Finally, the breakfast was not up to par and they used the cheapest and almost inedible bacon though the omelet was cooked to order. It was very much self service as the wait staff did not even bring the coffee. The pool is very average. There are better options in Waikiki for a similar price.
user_name:
PerksAdvisor_NYC
New York City, New York

review_body: Comfortable rooms, convenient to shopping (across the street) and the beach (2 blocks); several eateries within walking distance. Rooms equipped with a small fridge and microwave. No drawer space to unpack - we lived out of our suitcases for 7 days - small closet.Daily “resort fee” - outrageous; fee for “valet only” parking - outrageous.Laundry room: not enough machines and not maintained properly. $3 per wash & $3 per dry ... should be FREE as part of the daily resort fee.Staff throughout the hotel and attached convenience store were very friendly and helpful.

Super friendly staff and Top sushi poke shop next door doesn't hurt! Hilton Garden Inn Waikiki is a value combo with location, hardware, software and many and many more! Highly recommended! We will visit again soon!

This hotel was very nice and the hotel staff was very friendly and helpful. Valet parking was very efficient and friendly. On site restaurant was a little cumbersome so we just used it for breakfasts. Food was good.

We stayed for 8 nights.The make to order omelettes were burned most of the time.The sofa bed is old and uncomfortable.The carpet is old too.When we arrived on 12/24 late afternoon the front desk were busy.They didn't have too much patience to answer our question.

This hotel did not meet my expectations for Hilton standards. I was quite disappointed given that I have previously trusted Hilton at Xmas time and everything was excellent. I would not go back to this hotel.

The hotel itself is very clean, modern, and comfortable (although the beds are a bit too hard). The rooms are on the smaller side, but very comfortable for 2 people. They are also very clean, fresh, and modern. Ours had a fairly large balcony with table and chairs.Staff are attentive and welcoming.We stayed in the hotel for 9 nights during the Christmas period, so I assume we would have paid a peak period price (even though we got a good deal). So because of that, the value for money was not that great.The pool area is large enough, however the pool is on the small side and was crowded at times... and it's not a very interesting area, it's lacking character, and doesn't make you want to hang out there for long... maybe that's the plan.Also, be aware that they have introduced a resort fee of US$25 per day which you have to pay the hotel directly. In my view, it's not worth it and holds no real value, but it's mandatory. As we had booked the hotel just as the change was being made back in May 2018, we managed to negotiate not paying the fee (which the hotel was very good about).Having said all that, I would definitely recommend this hotel and gave it a 7.75/10.

Hilton Garden Inn properties are usually pretty consistent with their service and lodging but the Waikiki location leaves something to be desired. The service and accommodations fall short of what is to be expected.Here are some things I've experienced and that you should take into account when considering this place.1. In addition to the nightly rates, there is a mandatory $26 a day resort fee and if you are driving your own vehicle, a $39 a day valet parking fee with in and out privileges. There is no self parking. Both fees for a seven night trip will be around $500. This does not include the tips to the valets and cleaning crew.2. Check in experience - Wait times can be from walk up to 15 minutes. When we arrived, there was a line to check in with regular customers and airline crews. I needed to use the restroom while my wife waited in line. Most hotel restrooms in Waikiki need an access code or key. I asked a counter clerk if there was a code to the restroom. She said there was a line and pointed to where my wife was standing and that was it. Okay, so I went to the Hilton Vacations Club desk and asked the rep there who walked me to the bathroom and opened it. Thanks a lot for nothing, front desk clerk.3. Thoughts on room. We got a double double, two double beds. If you have a family of four with teens, good luck...it can be a tight squeeze. The room is on the smaller side. Room was refurbished recently and the furnishing has good and bad points. The good - There is an adequate sized fridge but you cannot adjust the thermostat. There is a microwave and Keurig coffee maker with coffee and tea. An electric water pot heats up water for tea, etc. The wash basin is located in the room so bring an eye mask because when the lighting can be a bother if you are sensitive. The bathroom has a single toilet that has a decent flush and the shower only compartment is roomy and the shower head has good flow. The bath amenities are basic (Neutrogena). The towels not so plush but serviceable. The fixtures are nice for the most part. The bathroom door is a sliding door that does not lock but has a soft closing mechanism that does not slam. The same goes for the closet and fridge doors. Lighting is decent but could be brighter in some areas. Now for a warning.... our room had a bench fixture rather than a couch. One section under the television is probably meant for placing suitcases and other things on and not meant for sitting. If one did not know and tried to plop down in that area, the result will surely result in a bruised tailbone. It is rock hard. The covering is the same as the area to the right which is meant for sitting but also very firm. Very strange design concept. Another warning, the room door does not have a closing restrictor and will slam shut if you do not hold it. We have been awaken a few times by our neighbors who allowed the door to slam shut at 5:30 am in the morning. Why did they not install restrictors on the room doors????4. Now for the not so good and nasty. Upon arrival, my wife always checks the bedding for unwanted crawly guests. None were found but the bed linen had brown specks on them (blood?) We called for housekeeping to change out the sheets and pillows. The next morning, my kids saw on the mattress cover a stain that looked like vomit or some other bodily fluid. We, again called housekeeping and were told they would contact us. Got a call a bit later and was told that all linen in the room were exchanged. Hhhmm, the housekeeping staff didn't notice that? That takes us to housekeeping. They are friendly but horribly inefficient. First and second day already mentioned here. On Day 3, came back at 5 PM to find they just started cleaning our room. On Day 4, no housekeeping...my wife had to track them down to exchange towels, take our trash and replace the tissue box. They skipped our room. Day 5, they cleaned our room at a decent time and we came back to everything nicely made up. Day 6, they, again, skipped our room and again my wife had to call at 4:30 pm to get room serviced. On Day 7, we saw them down the hall and asked the room to be cleaned. Nope, there is no notice that rooms will be cleaned upon request, our neighbors' rooms were cleaned daily. We must have had some bad jujues.5. Air conditioning - Worked great...according to my wife, too efficiently. The room was cold at times where we had to turn up temp. 6. Some high points of staying at this property - We drove so we paid for the valet parking. Those guys work hard and always were smiling and cordial. Remember to tip them. When you call for your car, make sure you allow about ten minutes for it to be ready. Not sure where they park it but it takes some time. An important note, the entrance to the valet driveway and hotel is located on Walina St, not Kuhio St. There is no stopping on Kuhio.; Very convenient location. It is literally at the front entrance to the International Market and other shopping venues and eating establishments. There is the Food Pantry market right across the street so if you need anything from the grocery, it's right there. Very easy location to walk around Waikiki.7. A final note about the elevators. Even though there are four elevators, it can be slow. We were on the fifth floor and found ourselves walking it both up and down because of the crowd or wait time. Yep, those elevators must be on local time.Would I stay here again? Not sure...the staff is friendly except for that clerk on the first day. It can get noisy and bothersome with the slamming doors. The sliding doors to the balcony are very well insulated so you don't hear any street noise. If you get a good price for a room, it can be a nice and convenient place to stay.

Hotel location was great just across the street from the International Market and center of Waikiki. The hotel was closed to everything. Although it does not have ocean view but only about 3-4 short blocks from the Waikiki Beach. Wish the 2 beds in my room were Queen Size instead of Full-size. It is difficult to fit 2 adults on a full-size bed. Great Staffs and were very helpful. The laundry facility could have been larger (equipped with 3 washers and 3 dryers) since people were in line doing laundry.

We book a night here because it has reasonable price and good location. We were pleasantly surprised by how good value this hotel offers. Yes it's not right on the beach and it takes about 10 mins walk to the beach (has to go around building). But otherwise everything was over my expectation. The hotel is roomy and clean. It has many amenities including Pool, pool bar and store downstairs. The location is great because it's close to all the shops and restaurants. I will definitely come back next time and stay here again.

Had a wonderful stay at this hotel. Booked thru Costco Travel and was pleasantly surprised! The location was great. Close to everything! A couple blocks to the beach and there you were living the dream! Many restaurants in easy walking distance and fantastic shopping. The staff were very friendly. Having the cafe/ gift store off the lobby was super handy. We used it alot! Would stay here again in a heartbeat.

Clean rooms and nice staff. Hotel is located in a great area, it's walking distance to beach, shopping, and restaurants. Hotel staff is very friendly and rooms were always clean and beds were comfortable.

This hotel is located downtown Waikiki. Well within walking distance to most places to shop, eat and view lots of attractions. The staff was wonderful and very helpful and accommodating. I do recommend this hotel.

Central location, just walk 5 minutes through international market and you are on Kalakaua ave with all the shopping and restaurants and access to Waikiki beach. Hotel itself has decent rooms, slow elevators or at least very busy.

Room is really clean and modern and the location is really good, right in font of hotel there is international market place, lots of restaurants and convenient stores, and it’s 10min walk to wakiki beach! The only thing that i dont particularly love about this place is staff. Especially the person on the reception was slightly rude to me when i asked some questions, and requested for small things ..- kind of shame- as the first impressions of the this hotel wasn’t really great because of the staff (although its really nice hotel) - not all the staff were bad, staff at Concierge were extremely helpful, but again the bartender were not that friendly too..so i think in general staff here are not that friendly compared to other hotel. I have stayed in different kind of hotel in honolulu from cheap to slightly expensive hotel ( trump hotel, la croix etc) but this is the only hotel i felt that staff are unfriendly. But besides that it’s all good!

The room was very good, but at balcony has a lot of bird's dropping and there was always bug in the room , the three nights of the bug also accompanied me for three nights. Room cleaning has never been found to be incredible, reacting to the front desk and only saying that it will ensure that the cleaning staff knows. Other than that, you can
user_name:
TangJuiY
New York City, New York

review_body: The room is so clean, coffee is good and the location is perfect as start point everyday.The staff are very cheerful and helpful. The concierge provides great assistance for toursHousekeeping is so hardworking. The onsite coffee shop offers great hot meals.

The good: nice and clean rooms. The bed was comfortable. Excellent shower! Friendly cleaning staff.The not-so-good: the room was tiny (a king city view room). The room hallway was so bright I thought I was "seeing the light" on my way to heaven; way too much. The hallway was also loud; whenever a neighboring room opened or closed their door, it sounded like someone was breaking into our room; a very loud noise that sounded like it was at our door. No evidence of any "green" initiatives. Check-in was not necessarily pleasant. The greeting wasn't very warm, and while this might not be this property, but a reason for me never to stay at a Hilton again, they wouldn't put this on my Hilton Honors because we booked through Expedia. I still chose to stay at a Hilton, but was made to be felt "less valuable". I also walked away from check-in without knowing what the daily resort fee was. I realize I should have asked since it was a long time since we'd booked, but I shouldn't have had to ask. The desk clerk went through what it covered (stupid stuff), but didn't mention the amount. Not a big deal, it's $25, but again, felt like I wasn't being treated like a valued customer.The attached Halo Halo market was actually quite nice; better than the ABC stores all around, and many items a little cheaper.According to the hotel booklet, we were supposed to receive an email on our checkout day with our bill, but we did not. We had to go check-out in order to find out what the daily charge was.Basically, why the stay was nice (you can't have a nice time in Hawaii) but the beginning and end weren't.

We enjoyed our stay at this hotel, the staff were very helpful. The room was clean and the beds were comfy. Check in was seamless, I used the app to choose a room. Check out was also seamless. The location was close to everything, Food Pantry across the road was perfect for amenities, snacks and drinks. Noelani the Expedia representative on site was very helpful, we hired a car through her cheaper than doing it online. Waikiki Trolley stop was right next to hotel. Ala Moana Shopping centre was about a 30-40 mins walk or you could catch the trolley for $2.00. This hotel may not be right on the beach but it took us only 5 minutes at most to walk there. Our room was clean and had great amenities such as the vanity kit that had make up wipes, emery board, cotton buds etc. Food trucks close by had a good variety of food. There is sunscreen and after sun cream by the pool. The pool was small but never felt busy. Laundry was very convenient $3.00 wash and $3.00 dryer. Valets organised a taxi for us, we left on the morning of the marathon everything went perfectly and as there was three of us it was cheaper then a shuttle. We had a wonderful experience here and would stay here again if we could save up to come to Hawaii.

I booked the Hilton Garden Inn Waikiki because I believed the hotel to be close enough to the beach yet far enough away from the crowded centre of Waikiki (just a couple of minutes walk) to enable my wife and I to enjoy the area without being constantly overrun with tourists just like us. And it was spot on, a perfect location for our needs. The hotel is located a couple of blocks off Waikiki Beach and only a block from Waikiki’s premium shops and restaurants. When staying here you’re still close to everything but pavement foot traffic is about 25% that of a block closer to the ocean… not fighting to get by other pedestrians is always a bonus…Our king bedroom with partial ocean view was typical for this type of Hilton and other hotels in the area and was comfortable enough and well fitted out with all the usual facilities. The bed was very comfortable and the bathroom just adequate but small with a washbasin in the bedroom itself. The room was also complete with complimentary tea/coffee, flat screen TV and Wi-Fi. Fixtures and fittings were all reasonable quality too and generally the accommodations were fine.We did not eat in the hotel so we cannot comment on the catering services. However, I must say that all the staff were extremely helpful and nothing seemed too much trouble.Overall we had a very enjoyable stay and we would recommend this hotel to anyone wishing to visit Waikiki in the future. Many thanks Hilton Garden Inn Waikiki Beach…

We stayed for three nights at this hotel before moving to Hyatt Place down the street. This used be an old, run-down looking hotel ; but Hilton had upgraded and updated to a beautiful hotel. The location is ideal. It is in the middle of everything. I give this hotel a 2 star because of its lack of customer service.We had issues with the hot water not working properly, but the front desk didn’t seem to care. In contrast, we were treated like VIP’s at the Hyatt Place as soon as we walked into the lobby. We are members at both hotels but definitely did not feel we were treated the same at Hilton. Love the beautiful rooms and lobby, but will not stay here again.

It is too bad this hotel is expensive. Consider other options before you book this hotel. Hard to park and retrieve your car. Valet system sucks. Rooms are not clean and food items are horrible. The service staff sucks.

We booked this hotel though an online booking website as a full flight+hotel package. Subsequently, we were not offered early check-in even though rooms seemed to be available by the number of early check-outs witnessed. Nevertheless, we were given a room slightly ahead of the afternoon check-in time by a sympathetic front-office guy (unlike the other rude ones who ignored our requests).Room was nice and clean; included a fridge and microwave as well as a Japanese whizz-bang toilet. Shop downstairs was good value, but don't bother with the over-priced breakfast as there are much better and cheaper places around, including the shopping centre just across the road.

This hotel was reasonable points stay for Waikiki. The hotel also waived all resort fees since I stayed with points. As a Hilton guest, I was treated to free breakfast at their restaurant every morning of my stay which was a very nice buffet with fried rice, meats, eggs made to order, fresh fruit, yogurt, french toast, and other common breakfast items. Outdoor pool located on the 3rd floor was small and the towel "vending" machine was a turnoff so I just used room towels. I did not see a hot tub at the property. Room was comfortable and spacious.

perfectly located hotel, couple blocks from the beach, intimate pool and a very convenient store (reasonably priced!) in the hotel. the restaurant is delicious and has great happy hour prices and specials. also right across the street from shopping dining, also a short walk to the main strip for more shopping and dining

The hotel is not a luxurious as others. But the price rate for downtown Waikiki is decent. The location sets itself in the middle or Waikiki, walking distance to pretty much everything down here. Quite large sundries shop and nice little coffee food bar. Defiantly considered a return location

This hotel charges a 26 USD resort fee which was not notified on booking.com at the time of booking and gives the guest 2 "free" fruit juices per day and unlimited sunscreen use. The guest has no choice but to pay because their accomodation was pre-paid and they are not aware until they arrive at the hotel

Great Location in Waikiki, however, the resort fee was outrageous. We were helped by Kerry, who was kind enough to explain all the places to eat and was very sorry about the resort fee. Unfortunately there was nothing she could do. Location was across from the international marketplace which had too many high end shops, not much local. all in all, good hotel, not very many amenities, no cups or plates. But morning coffee and yoga

HGI Waikiki is on a very good location. A few blocks to the beach and surrounded by ABC convenience stores and upscale shopping. The breakfast (free for Gold and Diamond honors) is very good. Ask for an upgrade to an ocean view suite on a high floor. Nice small gym and pool. Ask for a floor that has an ice machine. No glasses in the rooms - only plastic - and you won’t get one from the restaurant because it is not part of Hilton.

After a long flight we were very happy our room was ready at check in. The room we were allocated was disappointing as I had paid for a partial Ocean view and we got building views!I returned to reception to ask if we could change the room. Long story short we were upgraded to the 20th floor with great views and a very spacious suite.We enjoyed everything about the hotel-amenities, location, pool, and convenience store on site.The only reason for not giving 5 stars is housekeeping was a bit inconsistent.We would definitely stay there again.

We spent four nights here. 8th floor, view of the main street out front which was noisy, so get a HIGH floor for a view and escape from the noise. Found the balcony unusable due to vehicle noise. Room was clean, service was great, but the room is small. There is no real "desk" in it, just a little portable table, so not good for doing work on the laptop. DIamond member so we had free breakfast, which was not good (buffet). Tried it two days and just found it was not good, fruit was old. We opted to do the "grab and go" at the connected market and that was MUCH better. Get the Bubble Tea Smoothies, Iced Coffee, Iced Latte, etc with the fruit or breakfast sandwich...it was good. We really did not "hang out"" at the hotel at all, instead we had a rental and drove all over the island, but the valet service was great, friendly and quick. Overall, good for a business or other type of stay, if this is your vacation, not sure I'd recommend it as it is not really next to the beach at all and there is no view, etc (at least from our floor). I would have hoped as DIamond member we would have gotten a better room....

The location is great and service is friendly. But we got a horrible room on a second floor right below the swimming pool. Noise from the pool kept me up the whole night. Very disappointed. Had to switch the room at 4am.

We stayed at the Hilton Garden Inn on a quick overnight trip. We live on the Big Island and while my boyfriend had to fly over for business, I came along to do some shopping. We got a decent deal on a room through the Hilton Friends and Family program. Now, let me start with what is good about this hotel, this is from what I could tell from a very short stay. The location, while not right on the main drive, is located right across the street from the International Marketplace, so a short walk through the Marketplace will bring you right out onto the main Waikiki strip. I think the rooms in this hotel were recently renovated, so the decor is nice and modern, and the room was very clean. The room does have a Keurig for your convenience and a microwave should you need it. We hardly spent any time in the room, but if we did, the nice flat screen TV would have been a plus to watch some Sunday football. Now, on to what is odd about this hotel. The entrance. If you arrive by car, you will most likely come in through their porte, which is on the side of the hotel. When you enter, it brings you into this hallway, you have to walk down this hallway, past the elevators, to get to the main lobby and to the front desk. So entering this hotel is not the most pleasing visually, but the lobby is nice once you get to it. Also the rooms do not have great sound proofing, we could always clearly hear doors opening and closing near by. It sounded like our door was opening, but it was rooms close by. The only meal we ate in this hotel was breakfast, it was ok. The breakfast is fairly cheap, so it's a nice deal since you can get made to order omelettes as part of your buffet, which I believe was only $12.95. It's hard to rate service in a buffet, but we had to wait a while to get our bill, in fact, we had to ask the host to find our waitress because we were in a rush to leave.Now, here's some good with the bad. We did utilize the valet parking because it was just more convenient. The valet appears to be outsourced to a third party. I did find them to be very thorough and professional, but so overpriced. This seems to be a regular trend with Hilton hotels here though. $38 a day plus tips for parking. Plus the hotel charges you $25 a day for this "resort fee". I'm not sure what you get for this fee, but I am pretty sure we didn't use any of it during our overnight stay. So even if we got our room for just under $100 for the night, we paid over $60 in parking and BS fees.We did not use the pool, but we did see it several times on the elevator, apparently it's on the 3rd floor. We know this because when the elevator opens up on the 3rd floor, you can clearly see the pool. It looks small, but it never looked overcrowded when we looked at it from the balcony.Overall, it was a pleasant stay at the Hilton Garden Inn. We would stay here again.

Centrally localed in Waikiki easy walking distance to shops, the beach and transport. Really good restaurant and bar on the ground floor - excellent service. Well stocked grocery/cafe on the ground floor. Easy access for bus/taxi/car pickups. Our room was on the 8th floor, with a lovely small balcony with seating for two. The room was spaceous, very clean, with a good size walk in shower, fridge, TV, large wardrobe, huge bed and good air conditioning. We would definitely stay there again.

Staff friendly and helpful. Good location. Biggest gripe was there was only one room available at that price and it had two small double (not queen!) beds. Valet parking is your only realistic option. Room design was unusual in that entry door opened between sink and shower/toilet, but doubtful all rooms are that design.

This is a very nice centrally located hotel with a mediocre restaurant. No free breakfast and internet threw me off many times per day. Rooms were very clean, they have a consierge desk and can set up tours and dinner. Best part was convenience to shopping. Many trendy, high end stores if that is your thing. Two blocks to beach through the Outrigger. This hotel was NOT on strike. This was a huge blessing. Picketers made a ton of noise!

I booked this hotel for my family vacation. 3 senoirs and 3 adults. The hotel is newly renovated. Bright and spaceous lobby. Great location. Room is "clean", large tv, equipped with fridge, kettle, fancy k-cup machine, microwave oven. Bathroom has shower and toilet, sink is outside the bathroom. Not enough racks inside the bathroom for hanging clothes or towel unless visitors don't mind walking in and out of the bathroom naked. The only problem was that ants are found walking around the sink and on the floor near the sink. The staff explained to us that it's "unavoidable" due to the tropical weather on the island. I had options of either have the room sprayed with organic chemical, non toxic to human, or change to a different room the next day as there was no other available room right now. I chosed to have the room sprayed the next morning. I left the room 10am in the morning, told the staff again to spray the area we found ants as a reminder. Guess what happened at 5pm when I returned, nothing was done. Asked the front desk to follow up and finally housekeeping showed up. The staff was holding a bottle of bug spray consists of citric acid as main ingredient. The bottle was almost empty so he added more tap WATER to the bottle in order to make the bottle spray. As you can predict if you're still reading, the ants are back the next day. I call the front desk the N times and finally we decide to change room. I don't know if it is just an isolated incident but we are not drinking any beverage or eating any food in the room. All the amenities are just for show. Is the staff friendly? Maybe but things are not followed through.

Had a beautiful first stay in Hawaii, thanks to Hilton! The hotel is right across the shopping center , 2 min walk to beach’s and walked all the way to hike up Diamond Head. Rooms were pristine. Will visit again soon.

My wife and I stayed at this hotel in Waikiki. It is in close proximity with a lot of shopping centers and restaurants along with Waikiki beach. It is also nearby the international marketplace. In regards to the hotel, the service was great and the staff was friendly. It just seemed slightly overpriced for the type of hotel it is, but relatively inexpensive compared to the other hotels we looked at. Overall, the stay was great, the staff was friendly, and the check in/out process was smooth sailing. You can practically walk to a lot of places from there unless you want to go out and about to the rest of the island. In this case, your best bet is to use Uber/Lyft. Lastly, Hawaii is by far one of the most beautiful places we’ve been too so I’m sure it will be enjoyable regardless!

Stayed at this hotel for 12 days in November 2018. Can't beat the location as it is adjacent to the Food Pantry, very popular Marakume Udon, HoloHolo store within the hotel, and right across from the International Market. You can take a shortcut to Waikiki Beach through the Intl Market. Hotel rooms were clean and Maria from the cleaning staff was very attentive; asking if I needed anything whenever she saw me. Hotel front staff and concierge were also very friendly and knowledgeable. There were some complaints earlier on the slowness of the elevators, but, being on the 17th floor, I found no problems at all with the wait times. Also, the location of the sink being right there when you open the door, is not that big a deal. You get used to it. Overall, a very satisfying and relaxing stay. Would stay here again.

The hotel is just a block or so away from Waikiki beach, is central to many shops and dining options and the hotel staff were all very nice and accommodating. We definitely recommend this hotel to anyone vacationing or visiting Honolulu.

Had a terrific room on the 17th floor looking out towards Waikiki Beach. So wonderful sitting out on the balcony early morning and late evening. Missing it now as I write!The room is on the small side, but space for shelves, drawers etc are nicely optimized. The bed was excellent and the room generally clean (I did find quite a bit of dust on the top shelf areas. A worker would need to be tall or get a footstool to reach these areas. Management needs to ensure that is done at least a couple of times a week.)The location is absolutely perfect for walking to many, many restaurants and shops. Just 5 minutes walk to the water of Waikiki Beach. Right next door to the hotel is a true grocery store (more than just a convenience store) where supplies can be picked up for a reasonable (at least for Hawaii reasonable) cost.The only downside is the buffet breakfast. As a Hilton Gold Member I have had many Hilton G.I. breakfasts through the years and this one is to a much lower standard than what I have experienced elsewhere. As best I can tell Hilton does not actually operate the restaurant (unlike other Garden Inn's). If only the breakfast buffet pictures you see in the lobby matched what you actually see in the restaurant. After experiencing what was offered I sorely wished I had declined the buffet, taken the bonus points instead, and bought my own breakfast elsewhere.I'd definitely stay here in the future, but I would not take the breakfast.

More a family place than a couples retreat. Good location. Very easy to rent a car at the international market. Avis Budget Alamo near by. Try for rooms above the 15 floor. They seem to have more room.

The location was literally across from the International Market. The room we stayed in was a bit small, however it was clean and updated. The staff was great, as usual at any Hilton. We typically stay a Hilton hotel and they never let us down.

Great hotel! Modern and clean! Great location and staff! Very please with everything about our accommodations. Beautiful views and nice pool! Would definitely stay here again. Highly recommended! Great value

We went here for our honeymoon. The staff were amazing and very helpful. The room was very clean and was filled with standard amenities. We will be going back for sure. The staff made us feel comfortable and helped us find attractions near by.

Great hotel. Convenient location. Room was great and we had a decent view for the cost. Staff friendly and helpful and nice convenience store that had a great diversity of products that camenin very handy for the stay.

There is nothing I can fault about this hotel. Well priced, has been refurbished. Every room had WiFi and a two minute walk to the beach. Staff at the pool could be more friendly. Best coffee across the road. Very central

Stayed at the Hilton Garden for 9 nights, what a beautiful clean and modern hotel, close to everything you need! International Market place across the road, Nordstrom Rack and Saks and the Beach is walking distance! There’s also $2 Tacos and $4 frozen margaritas at the Mexican accross rd!

The hotel is in a great location -- right across the street from the International Marketplace and also next door to a great food truck/food vendor area that has an incredible variety of international foods at reasonable prices.We reserved a suite room (highly recommended) as the rooms are a bit small, but very nice. The lobby is modern and they have a convenient and affordable store that sells just about anything you might need (including take out food and alcohol). I was surprised at how reasonable their prices were (for Waikiki). Their café serves a great buffet breakfast with a nice view of the sidewalk for great people watching. Ask to be seated in this area rather than the back room (no view).We didn't get an ocean view room, but we could see a bit of the ocean and had an awesome view of the hills. It was very pretty at night.There is also a pool on the roof of the 3rd floor. It was very popular.The hotel is also located one block from the "The Bus" bus route. We took this to Hanauma Bay ($5.50 round trip).

Property is newish and facilities clean and well maintained. King bed and feather pillows very comfortable. On 18th floor so street noises not really a problem. Having International Marketplace (B's Patisserie -- excellent coffee and pastries) and Food Pantry (only real market in Waikiki) across the street was very convenient. Within short walk to beach, although striking hotel workers at nearby property made it noisy at their beachfront. Also a small open market within a couple of blocks with lots of food trucks. Did not use car because parking $35/day.Biggest property-related complaint was Roku stick would not work with TV because of requirement to re-sign in every 24 hours. This is known issue with Hilton properties. Biggest non-property-related complaint was phone reservation rate was not honored at property. Neither confirmation email nor website invoice gave breakdown of rates, so unaware of this till check-out time. Charges were only a little over what I was promised on the phone, so did not argue. However it was an unpleasant surprise.Staff was very professional and helpful. Room pretty small but had a balcony and big TV. Small pool, no hot tub. Pretty good gym. Would stay here again as long as I could get a special rate.

This hotel is right across from the International Market Place and conveniently located. It's less than 10 mins walk to the beach and lots of food options around. The Food Pantry is across the street if you want to get some groceries. The room is clean and the housekeeping service is quick! We would go back and stay at this hotel.

We have stayed here 3 times. always a great feeling to get Great Customer Service.. There is eatery all around, the beach is about 2 blocks away a short 5 minutes walk. The breakfast buffet is very good. there is a lot of tours that pick up from this hotel and surroundings... I highly recommend this hotel!!

The ONLY parking option was valet at $30/day! There were homeless people literally at the door to the hotel sleeping on the sidewalk - not Hilton's fault, I know, but unsettling nonetheless. There was no "desk" or "desk chair" in the room and the Internet was so slow that it was useless. Only a short walk from the beach however, and several great places to eat right nearby. AC worked well. Hotel pool was nice although the pool furniture was VERY uncomfortable. A full service grocery store is located just outside of the hotel. There is NO room service.

Stayed two different times…first stay got upgraded to a sweet corner room…giant with a huge wrap around balcony, lots of sliding glass doors, and a big bathroom. Second stretch was their standard room, still very nice but quite a bit smaller (the room, balcony, and bathroom). Still, both were nice, and had cranking ACs. The store/bar in the lobby was convenient, and they let me check a bag while I was away for a few days in-between stays. Only complaints were the $200 max withdrawal from the ATM and the sort-of-slow elevators. Nice place to stay right in the heart of it all.

This is a hotel past it's prime. The staff and management are also past their prime. Supposedly, there was a recent multi-million dollar renovation. As you can see in my picture, doors don't fit. This is a "Hilton" in name only.Our reservation was screwed up when we checked in. At first, they claimed the room we reserved was what we were given and didn't budge, until we proved them wrong. The room they initially gave us was like a college dorm room, very small with two double beds. They refused to correct their mistake until the following day. They also gave us the run around on moving our luggage into the correct room. Very disappointing. Very unprofessional.Once in the room we reserved, things were better, but not great. This room was bigger, but still smaller than you would expect at a Hilton. Quality of craftsmanship in the room was poor. The room was dark at night, even with all of the lights on. The bathroom was not laid out well. Sliding door that didn't lock or latch. Poor lighting. All the lighting is aligned behind your head, so you have shadows when you use the mirror. There are two hooks to hang your things on, both very close to the shower curtain and only about 3-4 inches apart, so not a good place to hang clothes. The shower water temperature started hot, but gradually cooled during my showers. There is a master light switch by the entrance door and a regular light switch. The master switch shuts everything off. Our maid would always shut off the master switch, so if we left anything plugged in to recharge - forget that. The air conditioner was aligned to blow on the top of the bed - not the most comfortable alignment.So, I really don't think I would ever consider staying here again. There are a lot of other choices.

Very good location though not on the beach but it is a 5 minute walk away. We walked everywhere to the International Market Place, Cheesecake Factory, Mai Tai Bar, Musubi Cafe IYASUME, Maguro Brothers, DFS etc and many many other places. The hotel is also near bus stops which has buses to take you to Rainbow Drive-In and Leonard's Bakery for malasadas! Every staff we met was friendly, truly basking in the Aloha spirit! The only aspect that I didn't really like about the hotel room was the weird layout of the toilet where the sink is by the entrance and outside the toilet. But this is just us. Overall, a good property to stay at with reasonable hotel rates!

Stayed two nights at this location. Very friendly Front Desk. The room was modern and clean. I have stayed in many Hotels and this Hotel had the best bedding.Lobby was nicely decorated. Location is in the center of the shopping strip and just a short walk to the beach. I will recommend this property!

We had two stays at this hotel during our October visit and we were quite impressed with the Hilton Garden Inn. We like to stay on Kuhio Street as it is just one back from the main road and beach, but a little quieter and there are some really good restaurant options close by. And this hotel is almost directly across the road from the International Market.On both visits we were accommodated on the 16th floor with a reasonable sort of view thru the other high rises to the ocean. The first room se stayed in wasn't as clean as I would expect from Hilton - dusty surfaces, the glass door to the lanai needed a thorough clean and the back of the toilet seat had been overlooked as had the tile floor in the entry. Second stay however, the room was spotless, but one of the USB connections didn't work, along with a bedside light. The bathroom could do with a towel rail as there is no where to hang towels once you have used them. The electric kettle was a very welcome surprise. Quite like my cup of tea in the morning!I wish Hilton would look at providing proper cups, glasses and spoons though, rather than all the disposable stuff that is in the room. There is such a global push now towards reducing plastic, Hilton needs to get on board with this.We enjoyed the pool area - the pool isn't large or deep, but it's fine to cool off in. There were certainly plenty of kids enjoying it whilst we were there and making use of the inflatable's that the hotel provides. i thought the sunscreen and cooling cream were a great inclusion. However, the pool loungers are the most uncomfortable things I have ever sat in.The bar and restaurant downstairs were good value - the bar has happy hour that goes on all night!On our second visit we had a car for a couple of days, which we parked (probably illegally) across the road at the Food Pantry carpark.There is also a guest laundry (yay, always makes me happy) and I must give a big shout out to the two male staff that came and helped us out (sorry don't remember their names) when the washing machine we were using wouldn't operate on the cycle we had selected. One of them went off and got a tool to open the machine and an instruction book on how to reprogramme the machine, and within a few minutes, they had that washing machine all sorted out for us!We would definitely stay here again, the good certainly outweighed the few issues we encountered.The Good:Lovely staff, especially the guys that helped us out in the laundryElectric Kettle in the roomNice modern roomsGreat locationNice pool area including a pool bar (with great staff)Bar & restaurant downstairs with all night happy hour :)The Not So Good:Room cleanlinessDisposable cups & stirrers grrrrSlooooow elevatorsNo towel rail in the bathroomUncomfortable pool loungersLate afternoon servicing of the the room

This is a nice hotel, and I would stay there again. This is not the fanciest hotel in Waikiki but it is a good place to stay with clean rooms and a good location to all of Waikiki. It is also very reasonably priced compared to the competitor hotels for the value. The rooms were always quiet, even right next to the elevator. The restaurant and cafe/convenience store in the hotel were nice.

Called twice to make a reservation, both times worker was rude, rushed me to get off, and hung up on me. My room had a king bed, but it made the room so small, it felt crowded. Should of and for 2 queens just for space

Not my idea of a restful stay. Called the hotel weeks before and asked about parking and wifi. Turns out they lied about both. It ended up costing me dearly. Beds are hard. Rooms are small. Elevators are slow.

This hotel location is outstanding (right across the street from the new International Market). The staff is great. My only bad comment is the lack of space for clothing in the rooms. There are no drawers for unpacking in but honestly that is the path that Hilton is going at many of their new hotels. Plan on living out of your suitcase. Valet parking only at $39/night.

This Hilton Garden Inn is new, and the rooms are large, comfortable and well furnished. The lobby and common areas are nice and the pool is really pretty as well. There's a bar by the pool and their guava juice drinks are delicious. It's a little over a block from the beach and across the street from the International Mall. There are a lot of good restaurants and shopping within walking distance, so the location is great. The buffet breakfast is good and varied and typical of a Hilton Garden Inn. The desk clerks were friendly and helpful as were the valet staff. Definitely a good place to stay if you don't have to be right on the beach.

I had a great time. A great experience overall. Fantastic staff. The breakfast was very nice and many restaurants were available in the area. I would stay here again in the future if I can. Thank you!

Well located to the Beach, Shopping and Restaurants and next door to the Food Pantry (grocery store). The Night Food Market is one block away and a worthwhile experience.The staff are helpful and the hotel and room was clean. The pool deck offers free "Reef Safe" sunscreen and after sun gel. It was convenient to be able to help yourself to Pool/Beach towels with the use of your room card. Our room had two Queen beds and a sofa bed. There was a kettle and microwave and complimentary coffee and tea each morning.

This was a remodel of the Ohna West Hotel. With over 500 rooms largest Garden Inn in Hilton chain. Well position in the Waikiki area for walking.Taxi ride is $30.00. Ride to the cruise terminal is $18.00 using Black Star Taxi.Room was good size with a King bed. We had 4 large suit cases and easy lay flat on the floor. with room to walk around. Ice machine not on every floor. We had to go down 1 floor to get ice. Yes with Frig and micro wave in room. Good size safe.Bathroom was good size with plenty of hot water and good pressure. Ours had a large glass enclosed shower enough for 2 people and or a few kids......... Two people could use room at same time.
