Shower head would easily fit a 6 ft person There are several markets within a block. Local bus stops within a block. Car rental within a block.Dukes & Hula Grill is 2 blocks away. Great shopping within 2 1/2 blocks. Yes, International Market across the street. Check out is 12 noon. Being a Gold Hilton member we were allowed extra hr to check out.Happy hour in pool area - has TV to walk sports...........nice lounge area Has sun care lotions in pool area for use. Products are in large pump bottles.........Has good size lobby with computer table and plug ins.We arrived early for check in and we placed luggage in locked room. When room was ready they brought cases to roomThere is attached to the hotel a local small market and coffee area - off the lobby Note the 4 elevators are in one area. So ask for a room at lease several rooms away so you do not hear the noise

Centrally located in Waikiki. Across from International Market Place to entertain and eat and you can walk to the beach in 5 min. It offers daily free Yoga class in the morning and the best is the daily buffet breakfast.

Our room was clean and modern, very comfortable and everything worked. Convenience store with well priced beer wine and snacks and close to restaurants. Main shopping centre a bus ride away ($5 all day tickets) if wanting to do tours use the front desk staff - they are excellent and go out of their way to make your tours memorable.

I have frequently stayed at this hotel because it is well priced and in a great location. It is behind the Intl Mkt Place; so lots of restaurants near by and you can just stroll thru the Market to get to Kalakaua Ave. The hotel has been updated and the rooms are very modern and extremely clean. We were very pleased with the way Tina, our housekeeper, cleaned our room. She did a great job and could not do enough for us, Tina was so friendly and helpful in telling us where to get the best Milk Tea! That being said we found that all the Hotel staff went out of their way to make our stay pleasant. This includes the front desk staff too,. So many thanks to Yuki (who also helped us out many times) and Tina. See you next year!!!

Great hotel in a great location. It is not on the beach, but in the heart of Waikiki - action zone. The beach is a couple of blocks away - easily walk-able. The onsite restaurant is great with an all-day happy hour. Rooms were great and staff courteous at all times.

We loved this hotel....extremely clean. Very central to everything..we walked to most places. The bed was very comfortable and excellent a/c as it was very hot outside and to come back to our room was like a retreat.. great views of Diamond Head and the golf course..

1. Fitness Center does not open till 6 AM. Limited equipment. Need at least one Elliptical and one Rowing Machine, so ditch 2 treadmills.2. Pool does not open till 8 AM unless they are cleaning it.3. One elevator not operational for 3 days.4. Clean room, super location and super staff.

The staff was excellent. They were on point from checkin to helping us get to room with luggage, The pool guava juice is real good ( it’s free) and refreshing. The breakfast is also good buffet and made to order omlets and pancakes or waffles. They are downtown close to dining shopping and beaches. They help you set up tours and also have a coving store hooked to hotel with reasonable pricing. We stayed 2 extra days after being at the Hilton Hawaiian Village and stayed at the Hilton Garden Inn for the 2 extra days great and fast service

I have stayed at almost all of the Hiltons in Honolulu (Not the Grand Vacation). Hilton GI was a very pleasant surprise. While the Hawaiian Village location is clearly the Mecca for tourist travel, as a business trip, being central is key. The staff is abundantly friendly and the hotel offers two breakfast options. A sit down typical Hilton breakfast (Omelettes to order/and buffet), the walk away bar was quite good and offered smoothies and coffees.We were able to use the Walina conference room for our meeting inside the GI and schedule working dinners at the multitude of bars/restaurants within walking distance.If you are here for business or pleasure, the GI makes for an affordable, just a block away from the beach, option for you.

Clean room, great location and quite possibly the nicest staff. Perfect hotel for a great rate. We really loved it here will stay again if we come back to Hawaii. Now I'm just trying to get to 200 characters

Location excellent - one street back from the beach, a quick walk across the road through the International Market and you are on Waikiki Beach without having to pay beachfront prices. Room great, service great, I stay here whenever I go back to Honolulu.
user_name:
Sheryl W
North Shore, New Zealand

review_body: We stayed here initially and extended our stay.Bar pool staff were rude which was a shame but the reception staff and concierge was a huge help.Good wifi and facilities, TV stations etc all worked.Great location, restaurant was convenient. Also has 2 food stores near by as well as car hire etc which was handy for day adventures

Hotel was awesome. Rooms clean. Staff friendly beyond friendly. Location to beach insane. Two block walk through the Waikiki center mall. Breakfast buffet fabulous. Loved this property. We will definitely stay here again when we come back in December!

First time stay in Hawaii and stayed at this Hilton Garden Inn , reception area was very modern and vibrant but we had an early flight in which the hotel tried to accommodate us but kept telling us to come back at a specific time when we did the time had changed yet again which was very frustrating. Rooms were small but well appointed pool area felt really dirty , floor never looked like it had been cleaned or washed the entire time we were there , with dead cockroaches yes dead cockroaches around the pool area and trash on the floor which was really disappointing. This hotel feels expensive for the room rate we paid but I suppose that’s the pain you feel for going to Hawaii because everything feels expensive.

今まで泊まった中で一番最悪なホテルでした。リゾートfeeがかかるので、その代わりにプールサイドでのジュースの提供があるのですが、出発準備中にジュースをとりにいったらプールバーが開いてなくて、しかたなくまた部屋に戻ってフロントに電話し、プールバーが開いていないからジュースを持ってきてとお願いしたら、「バーテンダーが遅刻している。部屋に持っていくことはできない」と言われ、さらに電話の途中で電話を切られました。さらに、滞在中、まるまる2日Wi-Fiが使えませんでした。サービスも設備も最悪です。海までも遠いです。It was a terrible hotel Ive ever stayed. The staff were not kind. The service was bad. We couldn’t use wifi for whole 2days because of the system trouble. Save your money.

Located in the center part of Waikiki near shops. The Hotel has a great open modern concept design. Great open balcony view for guests and certain floor levels. Love the guest room design. Valet parking is pricey but is a great hotel over all.

Enjoyable hotel with all the facilities needed. In the centre of town so close to all the shops and eateries. Back from the seaboard so is great for couples but still caters for the kids. Everything you need is very close. Great staff.

Hotel was in a great location. Very close (walking distance) to really good restaurants, the beach and shops. Really enjoyed the free yoga in the mornings. Only wish I could have taken advantage of it everyday.

I booked a suite for my family here for our first family vacation to Hawaii. I was recommended to stay here by my good friend who said she had a wonderful experience. It was affordable and conveniently located nearby an amazing International Food Market & Shopping center, as well as the beach! I would definitely come back and hope to come back again soon! I will continue to book Hilton hotels after having an amazing experience at this one in particular.

Warmest hospitality with a very friendly staff. Convenient location with fine restaurants, shopping, and convenience stores nearby. I've stayed here more than a dozen times and will continue to choose this fine hotel.

This hotel is conveniently located within easy walking distance of the beach. Handy to bus stops and shopping in general. The staff were friendly - one staff member was particularly helpfully - a young guy named Kuzo - he was in charge of luggage - a really busy guy but he went out of his way to help us. I just wish I had had the chance to thank him for everything he did for us. He need to be employee of the month.

We stayed 6 nights. They had the cleanest bathrooms I’ve ever seen! We enjoyed the continental breakfast and especially the morning crew. Just a short walk to the beach. We used the small store attached and found it quite useful. Great location!

We wanted a hotel that would have a reasonable price, and that would be near to Waikiki Beach. This hotel was a short walk to the beach, and we could see the beach fireworks from the balcony that was on our floor. The room was neat, clean, and comfortable. Really appreciated the Neutrogena toiletries, which in my opinion, were of a higher standard than the usual hotel toiletries.

We stayed 6 nights first, flew to maui for 3 then another 2 here. Very impressed with everything, the staff, the cleanliness, the pool but the best feature is the location. Enough said by others in that regard. However Steve Y talked about missing out on the $25 resort fee by prepaying. We prepaid everything so I should pursue this further with management as we were given an account to pay on exit. Very interesting !

Certainly Hilton standard. Pre-paid to avoid resort fee. Room was comfortable and mostly well serviced. Close to everything you need to see or visit. One minor maintenance problem which was fixed immediately. Would stay again.

The hotel is seated one block away from the beach, so beach access was easy. The hotel was great and staff was friendly. I would recommend it to any traveler. However, be aware there is no drawer in the room, just a basic closet.
user_name:
Peter W
San Jose, United States

review_body: Hotel is very clean and comfy. We stayed in a 1 bedroom suite on the 15th floor facing the International Market place entrance and did not have any issues with noise at night. So so many wonderful places to eat and shop right there!! Walk to famous Waikiki beach is just a few minutes also. Food pantry is right next door for necessities that are sometimes hard to come by on vacation, and food trucks just one block down the road!

Great place to stay. One street back from Waikiki Beach so nice and close to the beach. Opposite the International Market Place and plenty of shops around. Room was nice with good views from the 19th floor. Pool setup was good, always able to get a sun lounge to enjoy the sun and pool. All staff were very helpful, particular mention to Lezza and Jesse on the concierge desk for helping us book tours and shuttles. Wifi was a bit slow and lifts took a while to come (not major issues) but apart from that everything was good.

The room & bed were great. We got upgraded to an “ocean view” room on a higher floor, which was barely a view at all. The lifts were an absolute joke, taking at least 5 minutes to get up and down each time. We were on the 17th floor and I asked to be put lower so we could use the stairs as the lifts were so slow. The front desk were very accommodating to our annoyance. Great location, nice and central, super comfy bed too! Also, no stupid resort fees. Happily would stay again, but not on a higher floor.

My Wife and I stayed here for a week. Absolutely best hotel for those looking for somewhere central and walking distance to the beach. We had a corner room facing the mountains the view from the balcony watching the rain clouds approaching every afternoon was amazing. Room was clean and serviced daily.

I have stayed here twice now and would stay here again for sure.It is in a great central location in Waikiki, a short walk to most things such as shopping restaurants etc.There is also a convenience store attached to the lobby which comes in handy. The staff have always been friendly and the rooms clean, price wise it is reasonable for Hawaii as well.

Nicely kept hotel! Stayed at the 16th floor and had the city view (east side - picture with no sun due to impending storm). The room is clean, no complains here. The picture with sun, is during sunset viewed from the elevator. BTW elevator section is open, interesting design.Hotel is around 5-8mins to the waikiki beach and across many shops and restaurants. Really situated in a great location!Parking is valet only not unless you can find parking on Ala Wai street or other metered parking. If you park in the mall across the street you will pay $7 per hour.There is a restaurant at the lobby which offers happy hour menu. Highly recommended.Enjoy and stay safe.

The Hilton Garden Inn Waikiki Beach hotel is worth the money. The price was very fair and the staff were all very nice. Our room was always clean and the front desk was friendly. The only issue was the view we had was terrible and the location was not beach front. But you get what you pay for and I would stay there again.

The hotel location was ok no problem with that, the lack of preparedness for hurricane Lane was a concern with me. The room I stayed in was the smallest room I ever stayed in by any Hilton owned hotel. I asked to be upgraded on my room because of my Diamond status and they would not do it. The room was kept clean by the cleaning staff they did a great job.

We arrived HGI Waikikiat the same time that Hurricane Lane was arriving. We saw several people evacuating as we were checking in! The General Manager (Stephen Hinck) kept us updated on the weather activities so the we could be as prepared as possible. Hurricane Lane passed and we experienced a wonderful time at HGI with management & staff.

I typically stay at Hilton Garden Inn's when I travel for business on the continental U.S, but was unaware their was a Waikiki property. My office made a group reservation with them and I was pleasantly surprised to find all the standard comforts I expect from the HGI but in the tropical paradise of Hawaii. Additionally, I was staying with them while Hawaii prepared for the arrival of Hurricane Lane (later Tropical Storm Lane). The staff was VERY well prepared the property was cleaned of debris for safety reasons and information was posted all entrances/exits. They also were very accommodating when I needed to adjust my stay due to the airport closure. Thank you for a great stay and the excellent customer service. I will continue to use your company for both private and professional hotel stays!

The Hilton Garden Inn Waikiki Beach was a beautiful facility in a great location. The staff was extremely helpful and professional. The fitness center was well equipped and the pool was lovely. Our stay exceeded our expectations.

I enjoy the pool, the nightly manager's reception and the room was comfortable. Thanks to the staff for making it a great trip. On certain evening during the manager's receptions there is a great family band that plays all kinds of music. I consider that the best part of my stay.

First time here as I usually Stay at the Aston Waikiki. It was nice, very quiet, rooms are neat & tidy and just the right size. A block back from the beach, but still central enough to walk almost anywhere or catch the Bus to different activities / adventures. So close to food, shopping and great Balcony view. Rooms have everything you need to be comfortable, including Microwave, fridge, safe and lots of towels.

I would highly recommend this place based on its location and price. It is a 5 minute walk to the beach. You might not have the best views of the beach but why do you need them when you can be there in 5 minutes. The room was clean and comfortable and the staff were nice. There is a nice store attached to the hotel as well as a grocery store across the street. We really enjoyed our stay here.

Stayed here with family . Just the best location so central for restaurants, shops, buses. Food pantry next door awesome prices and variety. Hotel shower to die for but struggled a wee bit with bed too soft

PROS: Located directly across the International Market Place in Waikiki which offers lots of shopping and dining options. Check in process was quick and efficient. Breakfast buffet in the morning was delicious (and free if you have a gold status or higher Hilton honors). Bed was comfortable and the room had lots of amenities -- Keurig, hot water pot, microwave and fridge. CONS: Valet only --- although the guys working there are very professional and helpful. If you are a late riser - curtains did not keep out the sun (at least in the corner room I stayed in). Again unsure if it was because a corner room -- but desk was located directly in front of tv and was unable to watch while doing work. When I first checked in (late at night) I noticed the sliding door to the room was broken and wouldn't lock. Thhe front desk couldn't switch my room because they were fully booked. They did send maintenance and although he wasn't able to fix the lock, he (Brian) was able to cut a piece of metal to lock the door in place which added extra peace of mind to sleeping at night.

This hotel seemed stretched out between business and vacationers. Hilton Honors membership means diddly squat. The rooms are clean and nicely accommodated for those that only need to bathe & sleep. But be prepared to see a wall of windows, concrete (and even naked people just 20 metres away). Do not book this hotel for a view, or the pool. Customer service is meanial American, that don’t care about much here. They might boast about being the biggest, but it’s just too big and too busy. People are just ‘in & out revenue’ at this hotel. I even had the front desk hang up on me when requesting one special accommodation for a friend’s birthday, what does a personalized note, or complimentary cocktail really cost? This hotel sucks.

Hotel conveniently located in the center of Waikiki. Lobby has a bar, store and restaurant. However the pool is very crowded and small but the deck is large. The hotel and room deco is nice and welcoming. This hotel was rebranded so it is an entirely new hotel from the ground up. You only only have the option of valet parking. For breakfast you have to find something off property

From our initial check-in, we were greeted by Kazu who was extremely helpful. Even though we arrived early, he gladly took our bags, held them and told us where there was parking available that suited what we needed. The Check-in process was seamless and only took a moment, the rest of it was filled with refreshing conversation with the front Desk Suzy and Michael.Upon entering, the rooms were extremely spacious and pristine. After staying at other 4-star resorts on the island, this was definitely on par. We were specifically impressed by the level of cleanliness of the bathroom and showers which were spotless. As we only stayed there for one evening (transit on our way home to Sydney, Australia). It was a perfect spot with plenty of food choices and things to do around us without having the need to drive unless we wanted to go further out. I'd definitely recommend the Hilton Garden Inn, Waikiki Beach. Cheers,Dave

I enjoyed my time there with my wife and our 17 year old. The hotel is convenient to the beach and the other area attractions. It is a good combination of location and value. The only thing that caught me by surprise was the charge for valet parking the car of almost $40 per night. That was a bit expensive, but there is really no other option if you have a car.I would stay there again.

I decided to have a staycation W/my12 y/o granddaughter before she returns to school. We decided to try Hilton’s Garden Inn. Much to our delight, we found it to be a very pleasant experience. It is close to everything in mid-Waikiki. We didn’t have to walk far for shopping or restaurants. We found lots to do right in the area, it’s across the street from the International Market Place. The rooms were adequate for two people, very clean and filled w/ necessities (refrigerator, micro, Keurig coffee maker, tea pot, Neutrogena products)....Their staff was great, Jasmine in Housekeeping made us feel sooo special with her pleasant “Aloha” greeting as we walked to our room on our first day. She didn’t know we were locals so it’s just the way she treats ALL guests! The restaurant & Sundry shop were most convenient...incidentals, snacks, fresh fruit and a whole lot more were right at our fingertips, including smoothies, great coffee & morning pastry. We can’t wait to have another staycation here!!

My family stayed here for about a month and were happy with the service and amenities, but the rooms are very small as is the lanai. There are only partial ocean views from the hotel. The convenience store had fairly priced snacks and fresh fruit while the bar in the convenience store had a great happy hour! I would not recommend the restaurant adjacent to the hotel. There is a poolside bar, but it does not serve food. If you have diamond status with Hilton, there is no real benefit here. You won’t want the breakfast and upgrades are scarce due to high occupancy.
user_name:
YvonneN249
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: This place is decent with nice rooms, really no views but the location is very good. 5 minute walk to the sand. Right across from lots of shopping and food. I like the in hotel store. Check in area is well staffed and staff is friendly.

This Hilton Garden Inn Hotel has a different style of room - with the sink in the main living entrance area. The bathroom door is hinged like a barn door. The room is roomy but I found the design made me more "messy" than in a usual Hilton Garden Inn. We had a very small balcony which was too small to sit on, it was standing only. Other rooms had balconies with tables and chairs. If I was staying more than one night I would have made sure we had that option. Room was relatively quiet despite being near the elevator. Staff at check in was very friendly as was the valet area which was always busy. The restaurant offering breakfast (we are Diamond) was not as good as the usual Hilton's we stay at. The buffet line casing (it was wood framed) seemed worn and not as clean as we are accustomed to. , However, quick and fast dining options can also be made at the Holoholo convenience shop which is attached. It is like an ABC store but has some different types of items, especially for gift items. The pool was clean and refreshing. Towels were readily available. It could be a bit breezy at times but we enjoyed our time here. There was a bar by the pool but we did not spend time there.

The service of the staff is horrible. They seem to think because they gave a prime location, they don’t have to work as hard to give quality service. The food was not that good and the service of some the staff was unfriendly and patronizing.

My friend and I stayed here for two weeks (for a shopping trip) so it was the perfect location for this. The hotel is opposite the International Market Place and really close to the pink trolley stop.The positives:- Great price for a great location- large rooms (comparative to other hotels) with an unusual but acceptable bathroom set up (the 'bathroom' which has a door is the toilet and large shower) the sink, mirror and towels are all in what is really a hall table as you walk in. The bonus of this is that someone can be brushing their teeth while someone else is using the toilet or showing. The negative is that it's the same area that the hairdryer, kettle (slowest kettle in the world to boil) is, so you end up with coffee, toothpaste, soaps etc all sharing the same spot. But overall, quite an efficient use of the space.- beds were OK - a little bit soft but not badly. The negative was that while the top sheet was cotton, the duvet cover is a poly mix, and already pulled and ripped in places. The sheets were only changed once while we were there, which I didn't feel was enough, given that you are often sandy.- the TV was OK - no movies of anything other than TV stations and a very slow TV guide, but functional to catch news and weather and you're not in Hawaii to watch TV- the microwave was a bonus and was used a lot- the mini fridge is a good size and, thankfully, empty, i.e. no silly minibar at stupid prices- the towels were always topped up and clean and the amenities were OK (Neutrogena)- there was a decent wardrobe (many other hotels we looked at didn't have this at all) and included an ironing board, iron and safe, as well a some hangers which were thankfully not attached to the rack.- on each floor near the elevators there was a waste and recycle bin (and a phone) so it was good to be able to recycle plastic food containers, milk bottles etc. It's the first time I've seen recycle bins in a hotel, so points for that.- is opting for a room with a lanai (balcony) it's small but has a small table and two chairs and is large enough to hang a washing line- the hotel has it's own coin operated laundry ($3 for a wash cycle or a dry cycle and there are three of each machine. The coin machine was broken the whole time we were there but it doesn't take long to accumulate $3 in quarters, which is what was required and the front desk would change if needed (there was no washing powder but you can buy a one pack from the store opposite the hotel for $1- the hotel is opposite a Food Pantry which is a far cheaper way of buying milk and snacks rather than the ABC Stores. There is also a market off the hotel foyer, which is well stocked (everything from milk through to beer and prepackaged meals and souvenirs) but not cheap- you can book tours in the hotel and the two that we booked were great and the same price as you'd pay if you booked directly with the provider.- the gym was small but well set out - a small room with 3 or 4 treadmills and a couple of bikes and another weight room - both had antiseptic wipes, towels and water provided The negatives:- the rooms have air-conditioning, but it's the older sort that has a large unit next to the balcony door, It works well but is quite loud and ours had a weird whistle as it turned itself off. - when you get out of the lift, the hall to the rooms are 'open air', i.e. you are walking past a balcony overlooking the pool and Saks 5th Ave, then turning down halls that have the room doors off that. Odd and when rainy and windy, you get wet returning to your room, although to be fair that only happened once.- while there is a pool, it's small, was quite cold (which sounds odd for a tropical location but it was REALLY cold) and was always full of kids that were screaming and throwing balls. The pool area has a bar but due to the endlessly screaming children, it was not a restful place to be. There were lots of deckchairs though, if that's your thing, which are in shade at certain points in the day.- The biggest negative was the restaurant attached to the hotel. We thankfully didn't pay to have breakfast included as the one time we ate there on the first day, it was disappointing. It was a $13.95 buffet, but the choices were quite limited and of a fodder food quality. My friend did the eggs menu (a card on the table that you write up for eggs/omelette etc) and enjoyed the (small) omelette but the rest of the food (including the Hawaiian Ham - a stewed ham in a pineapple sauce?) was ordinary. The staff were rushed and not particularly friendly. There are much better and cheaper places to have breakfast nearby.- there was a false emergency evacuation while we were there which was not well handled - no staff at the exit points but they handled our comments well when we advised of our concerns, They advised that there was a PA announcement that it was a false alarm but this could not be heard in the stairwells (which they undertook to review).So overall a good hotel which had more good features than bad and we would stay there again given it was good value for a perfect location.

In a ok location. Close to shops and restaurants and food trucks,but few blocks from ocean. No Jacuzzi and beds too small. Pool very small. I would not recommend if u are vacationing. Stay elsewhere!$

I would stay here again in the future. Hotel is centrally located to the restaurants, etc in Waikiki. Hotel entrance/valet parking is on the side one-way street. Hotel has other entrances on Kuhio. Free coffee/tea in the mornings next to elevators (4). Guest restroom on Lobby floor near elevators, room card required for use. Wanted this suite over the others since bathroom door is between living area and bedroom. In the other suites a guest would have to enter the living area to reach the bathroom (possibly disturbing the person sleeping there). There were 3 of us in the room, so 1 was sleeping on the sofa. I think 4 would be too crowded. Note the Hilton reservation system has a bug concerning this room. If searching based on 3 persons, the room didn't show up, but searching on 2 persons it did. Do like we did, book for 2 and then on arrival change to 3, hotel rate will be higher due to extra person. Living area and bedroom are small. Bedroom had a king bed with just enough walking space around the bed and TV is wall mounted on the side wall. There is a small open walkin closet with a low counter that can accommodate 2 carryon size suitcases on it. Your suitcases are your dresser, there are some shelves in the counter, and small drawers in the 2 nightstands but no normal dressers. There is a narrow outside seating area the length of the bathroom-bedroom with a small table and 2 chairs. There is also another small table and 2 chairs on the outside area by the living area. Ice machines are not on every floor and the ice is large shaved vs cubes. Bathroom is small but the shower is large (no tub). Living area has a electric hot pot, Keurig coffee machine, microwave and mini-refrigerator. In my opinion the refrigerator does not get cold enough to store leftovers, so we used gallon size ziplock bags with ice on the top shelf and on/next to the food, which worked well. Bag of ice in the evening and the next morning, still had a half bag of ice (rest water). Front desk and valet parking staff were helpful and friendly. Housekeeping did a good job. 4 stars instead of 5 because of the mini-refrigerator.

Great Location, Personnel and Facility. A block off the beach and right next to the International Market! Everything needed is within walking distance. Would definitely revisit in the future. Had stayed at Hawaii Village earlier in trip - which was super busy, so would recommend this location over that location, if staying again.

We ended up staying at the Hilton Garden Inn through a package we booked with Air New Zealand. We arrived very early in the morning as check out at this hotel isn’t to midday our room wasn’t ready. They went out of their way to give us maps, bottles of water and told us they would ring us when our room was ready hopefully by 3.00pm. We wondered down to the beach which is a 5 minute walk to find somewhere for lunch upon return around 3 the staff as promised had our room sorted. We upgraded at $75.00 per night to a suite with seperate living area and partial sea view which I’m pleased we did as we could check out the action on the water from our veranda with a drink in the afternoon. House keeping were very thorough lots of clean towels left each day. A couple of things we didn’t enjoy no glasses in room which I thought very odd only paper cups to drink out of and a coffee machine with no instructions which I had no idea how to work. Although there was a jug there was no tea bags or coffee sachets not even a tea spoon so a bit odd really as to what the jug was for. The pool was a bit sterile with no sun umbrellas and loungers lined up in rows very close to your neighbours which felt a bit weird so we didn’t use the pool area at all. I’m not sure if the restaurant/bar was part of the Hilton or seperate but the service was rubbish we went in there one morning for brunch and felt like we were an inconvenience we were told to find a seat and someone would bring us a menu 15 minutes later we went to the bar and got our own menu they couldn’t provide us with earl grey tea and the sandwich was pretty average needless to say we didn’t go back for food. They also have a small shop/cafe which was handy however I was turned away on day of arrival when getting an iced coffee as they couldn’t break my 100 dollar note and went to no effort to try dispute there being several other tills around them. All and all the highlight is location and staff who were all very friendly. Would we stay here again probably not as for the price there are many places in the 300-400 dollar per night price bracket.

Modern facilities which is hard to find in Waikiki. The hotel is walking distance to everything you need, <10mins to the beach. Nice rooms, clean well looked after. Great bar downstairs and great pool area. Can't go wrong with this place

We were here from 07/27/18-07/30/18 and I just wanted to say the service was top tier! First of all I’m only a team member from another property, but the staff made me feel like a king! Kevin R. and Joann D. greeted me and my family with big smiles when we checked in. 1538, that’s the room to stay in!! Sean at the front desk has a positive attitude and went out of his way to help me look for safety pins for a wedding dress emergency we were having. The housekeepers on the 15th floor that weekend also had great positive attitudes and were very special. Kai and Imee at the pool bar made our drinks extra special on a hot day! And I want to give a special shout out to the bellmen and Elite crew out there in the driveway hustling to make sure the guests get to where they going on time! Great stay and will definitely come back more often!(pic is of our son on the balcony)

The front desk staff are not the friendliest. I think before I go there again, I'll stay some place else. Location is okay if you don't mind walking. Valet staff are very helpful and always at your service. The outdoor pool is cold. Bath tub is very slippery.

We used our HH points to stay at this property and we were not disappointed. We stayed in a King Bedroom Suite which had a small lounge room and large bedroom. The hotel is in a location, only two blocks from the beach and has recently been renovated. The room large enough for two adults and one 18 month baby. It was handy having the separate lounge and bedroom area. This set up is hard to find in a hotel. We ate breakfast at the restaurant once, it was a great price however wasn’t much to write home about. There wasn’t much variety. The buffet breakfast at Dukes won our belly’s. There is a convience store downstairs which was very handy. Overall it was a great stay, excellent location, helpful staff, clean and large rooms.

This is a good location with many things to do nearby but the one draw back is that it is not on the beach... pretty good hike to the beach. Being right near the International Market Place is nice because of shops and restaurants really close! Several good restaurants here!

Stayed at this location as it offered a government rate. That said, I'd stay again as the staff and location were perfect. The property is across from the International Market, which offers shopping and dining options. The staff was warm and welcoming. They provided water upon arrival as well as Kona Coffee. Everyone was super friendly and helpful. They only offer vallet parking, but the convenience was worth it. With the government rate, breakfast was included. The service was slow but the staff was again really friendly. Would stay at this location again if ever back in Hawaii.

We stayed here for 5 weeks. Bottom line: it is reasonably priced based on comparable properties in the area. 99% of staff members were always extremely nice. All common areas were always really clean. The pool is meticulously cleaned every morning, which was important for us. We stayed in two different rooms. One was just a King and the other was King with couch. Both of which did not have any type of dresser. If you can find a way to book your reservation without the resort fee, do that because I really don't think that was justified. If we had to pay the resort fee we would have just spent a few dollars more on the room and paid a resort fee at one of the nice properties with more amenities in Waikiki. If you are a gold or diamond honors member, the breakfast is pretty good. I don't advise eating it for a month, but for a week its pretty good. Please also be advised that its $39 a day for parking. You can walk 5-10 minutes and find cheaper parking elsewhere or even park on Ala Wai for free if you can find a spot.

Aside from the room being a little on the small side our experience was perfect. Very clean hotel and rooms. Very accommodating and friendly staff. Valet service was great. Excellent breakfast buffet. Very central location. No complaints from me!

Our family of 4 had 2 rooms and stayed here for 8 nights. The rooms were very clean, comfortable beds and well appointed. There is a market shop on site which was very handy as well as a very pleasant restaurant selling normal US food. There is a small pool on the 3rd floor with a pool bar with pool table. The hotel is in a good location opposite Saks and 5 minutes walk from the beach, all of the shops and loads of bars and restaurants. We also had a complimentary breakfast buffet included which again was good and saved a bit of money. It was a great location for us and we would stay there again

We stayed here again after our shoebox experience in April 2017. This time we arrived as the year before about 2 pm but were warmly welcomed by a nice lady who checked us in and, per my request, gave us a late check-out as well. I noticed on-line that we had been upgraded to a partial oceanview suite, but when we arrived at our room, #1538, I was stunned. We had 2 balconies...one of which wrapped around the corner of the building. After the cramped room the year before with barely enough room to sneeze, we had a nice sized main room plus a small room with a sofa (not sure if it was a sofabed or not), and a huge bathroom with tub/shower combo. One balcony was accessed from the bedroom, and the wrap-around balcony was accessed from the smaller room. The bathroom was attached to the smaller room. In the main room was the kingsized bed, another TV, a ledge under the TV, a kettle station area with microwave, fridge, and Keurig coffee supplies and machine. There were some issues however: 1) no drawers anywhere except tiny ones in bedside tables, 2) no outlets under the TV but ample ones by the bed, and 3) a bed that needs harder pillows and a slightly firmer mattress. We received breakfast due to our Diamond status. It was as last year in the TR restaurant on the ground floor. There is a buffet with the usual plus fried rice, Hawaiian ham, and more but no scrambled eggs. All eggs had to be ordered via the pads on the table. I had egg white omelets both mornings. Waffles, pancakes, eggs Benedict, a breakfast sandwich, and Loco Moco are extra? I don't usually eat waffles and pancakes, but they are usually standard at HGI-sometimes make your own and sometimes made in the kitchen. The other 3 I can understand an upcharge. Since we receive breakfast complimentary, I am not sure if they would have given us any of these as well without paying more, but I was happy with my omelets and items from the buffet such as meats, fruits, and more. I also requested an extra large glass both mornings since I drink lots of water and was given one without any fuss. Overall, I am giving a 5 despite the few minor issues noted. I was much happier at the HGI this year versus last year. Breakfast was about the same, but the room and the front desk staff were above and beyond this time. This will be our first choice when we return to Hawaii. Mahalo!

Was very impressed with the room. Neat and clean. Staff was very helpful. Only downside is to go on tours you had to go to other hotels for pick up and drop off. Had an on site ABC store, a little pricey but then again everything in Hawaii is. Also had restaurant on site, again a little pricey. The location is amazing cross the street is a mall, food places everywhere. Great place for getting souvenirs there's an ABC on almost every corner. The people are very nice everyone greets you with an aloha. I would definitely come back again and highly recommend.

Travel agent recommend and was pretty good nice and close to cheap places to eat and the beach is 10 minutes walk! The assistance we got from the travel desk was pretty good but multitude of travel provider options nearby to check prices against! We didn't try the restaurant's as cheaper options just outside! Service and amenities at this hotel all good! I would recommend!

Very clean, lots of towels and amenities in the room, location is great, only 5min walk from the beach! The matress too soft though, a common problem in almost every hotel. Little bit overpriced, but I believe it was because of the vacation time. Also the parking is too expensive usd 39,00

Upside. The Hotel is nice. It is updated and has pretty rooms. The staff in the restaurant were amazing. RESORT FEE: I used points. I am a diamond member and I still had to pay a $25 resort fee per room per night. The resort fee is a complete waste of money. I have attached pictures of the card with details of what you get. Basically discounts on stuff I didn’t want, two non alcoholic drinks and some crummy sunscreen. Only time I got burned in 8 days was the day I used their sunscreen. NO HOSPITALITY SUITE. It’s the only hotel I have stayed in in Waikiki that does not offer a hospitality suite to shower/freshen up after check out. This was particularly annoying because the latest check out we could get was 2pm and our flight wasn’t until 730pm. I probably won’t stay here again. This is not a resort and the resort fee added no value to my stay. And lack of a hospitality suite was a huge inconvenience.

One street back from the main road I thought I had booked well. It’s right near Saks - the International Market place as well as Nordstrom Rack and Ross and has a food land right next door. Unfortunately for the same reasons it was noisy and not in a great location. All corners of this hotel are noisy, either from the road or the food land air conditioning system or the room air conditioning system - I literally had to go to Longs Drugs and buy ear plugs. A little far from the beach for my likeing. The staff were very accommodating and we moved 3 times, but I gave up in the end. In terms of distance, it’s a bit out of the way, probably better to stay on the main road as the noise levels are the same. Pool was below average. Didn’t try the restaurant. Can’t beat the price though, I suppose you get what you pay for!

Amenities at the Hotel were at a high standard and being on the pool level was a treat. Our rooms were always serviced and a 4 mums on holiday we appreciated the attention.We mostly enjoyed the evening strolls along the beach which was located 500m. Thank you for the lovely experience.

Breakfast could be better. Service was great. Don’t like that the gym isn’t 24/7. Overall stay was good. The grill restaurant connected to the hotel was not good so it would be nice to have more options connected

We spent 4 nights at this hotel last week. A family reunion of 17 people in 5 different rooms. Most of our rooms are on 3rd floor, with kids pool right outside the elevator it was convenient for kids to just ran out to enjoy without worrying about taking elevator to different floor. Our room was clean, with a huge balcony that faced the parking lot (not the most ideal but we only sleep there), but first time we opened the door we found cigarette butts, so I would suggest the hotel to check balcony to make sure it's also clean. Our room had 2 double bed, which was quite small for our family of 4, room was decent size and can certainly fit 2 queen beds, why not put 2 queen beds in so guests can sleep comfortably? We gave tips to the cleaning lady on the first 2 nights, and she provided enough towels, on the 3rd day, no towel was given even though we also tipped. My wife decided not to leave a tip the following day, and towels were provided....There was no parking lot at the hotel, with valet service, which was good for the most part except for the day when we checked out, they messed up and had us waiting there for good 20mins, with our luggage and kids!Overall, this hotel provides convenience of nearly by Waikiki Beach which was 5mins walk away, shopping mall across the street, and plenty of food choices nearby. A short drive from H1, and Diamond Head was only 10mins away. For the price we paid, the convenience was worth the cost. Minor things can be improved, but overall, this was a pleasant hotel, and we won't mind to stay here again.

This is a great hotel nice clean rooms and good service.it is in a very convenient location just across from the fantastic new international market place.Pool area small but adequate when we were here.Great shop and cafe a walk through the hotel with a good happy hour on drinks in the afternoon and some great take away bento boxes.

This is a good hotel for the price! The location is perfect and right in middle of Waikiki. Shops (high and low end), restaurants, food stalls, etc. surrounds the hotel. There's even a convenient store right inside the hotel. The beach is just a short walking distance. The only issue I had is with one receptionist in particular and some may also benefit from more training in customer service.

Stayed at this hotel in May 2018, rooms are clean and spacious although we didn't have a very good view or balcony unlike other rooms (cannot remember the room number). Hotel pool is quite small and there aren't many sunbeds.Hotel staff at reception and on the bar at the pool were helpful and friendly.Very close to shopping, restaurants and a 5 min walk to Waikiki Beach.Make sure you rent a car and drive around the beautiful island! Lanikai Beach was my favourite!

I spent two nights in a deluxe king, facing rear of building. Nice renovated room, close to amenities and 5-10min walk to beach. Staff were friendly, building secure and room was very clean. I was here during peak time so was a bit over priced for what you get with no mini bar, movies or room service. Would stay again but get a room with a view and if the price was a bit cheaper.

We spent 5 nights at the hotel a few weeks ago. We loved the location in Waikiki Beach. It is a few blocks from the beach but it only takes 5-10 min. to walk. It is right in the heart of the shopping and dining,however, which we loved. The only downside to this is the street noise you encounter if you keep your sliding door open. The rooms was ok but not very large. The first room we had was recently renovated but only had a tiny balcony and we had paid for a full one so we switched. The second room was fine but not newly renovated. We wanted the full lanai so we kept it. Beds were comfortable. We used the gym which was so so and very hot. The pool, on the other hand, was too cold so we didn't use it. We did use the breakfast buffet every morning. it was decent but often times the food was cold and my kids complained that the omelets were oily. They do charge $40 a night parking so we waited to rent a car until we were heading to the North Shore and Alamo is just a block away. There is a smallish grocery store right across the street which was handy. Overall I would recommend this place. it is not overly fancy but it certainly meet our needs.

Cheaper than at the beachfront but still very close. Many restaurants and great breakfast places within 2-3 blocks walk. International market place with plenty of shops across the street. Good rooms with small balconies. Daily resort fee of 25 USD is a joke though, the stuff included is not worth it (did not try the yoga though). Rather jack up the price than add this silly fee that only irritates people, draws down my rating from 5 to 4.

The staff were was excellent, including the morning breakfast staff (complimentary an the HoloHolo). The only complaint is the location, one block off the main Waikiki strip. If you can't see the beach from your room, or at least Diamond Head, it is not worth staying in Hawai'i! The hotel, though, is quiet, easily accessible to beaches and downtown. Highly recommended (if you don't mind the view).

Decent hotel with basic anenities I know that Wakiki is a very desirable vacation spot but as a business traveler I want value first. On Iahu there are many choices but my loyalty lead me to this property as well as my government per diem.My future travels to Hawaii may not include Hilton properties.

We were recommended this hotel as the location was excellent for public transport and it was a short walk to Waikiki Beach. the hotel was excellent, great service and very accessible. The room was good quality and very clean. Our room had a view of Diamond Head. We would stay here again.

We enjoyed a great 12 night stay in a Deluxe Two Double Bed room.. The room was very clean and modern... and we made great use of the in room microwave. The pool is of a nice size.. perfect for the kids.. We made use of the on site laundry facilities to wash our own clothes.. Being a Hilton Honours member.. I also used of the Digital Key service through the Hilton Honours app.. very easy and convenient... The hotel feels newly renovated... and the staff did a great job looking after our every need.. Will be back next year!

Hotel was OK, the best feature was having Noelani Gillis Hernandez on site to help plan out excursions around both Oahu and the Big Island. Every detail was covered and both the Snorkeling and Volcano tour in Hilo were great adventures. She stopped me after each tour if she saw me in Lobby to ask about trips which was a nice touch.
user_name:
lucavic745
New York City, New York

review_body: I stayed here for 10 nights this past May. I thought the location was great and was close to a lot of attractions that my wife and daughter found convenient to get to within a short amount of time. It's across the street from the newly renovated International Market Place and just close to everything in general, from Waikiki Beach, to restaurants like Cheesecake Factory, Marakume Udon, etc. I was able to get a crib for our room on short notice. I had forgot to reserve one far in advance so I was fortunate enough to get one on the night of. The overall cleanliness of the room was pretty good and room service always left the place looking new again. Would stay again :)

After checking in found our room was not what we booked through travel agent infact it was so small no pictures of this room exist on website, it was only suitable for 1 person. There was only one small desk with one wooden small chair no where to unpack bag except on bed no where to walk past each other and the bed was against balcony sliding door so couldn’t get in bed on that side and only 1 bed side cabinet as we booked for 2 weeks we complained and was told by girl at reception all our rooms are that size, which I knew was a lie I have been there before. I said don’t worry I will get travel agent to sort it. That worked they still said the room is the siame size but when we got to it the next day it was heaps better and it reflected the pictures and size we booked, bigger and comfortable plenty of room to sit and could put our bags out. Watch out for room1845 it’s tiny also that view was looking at dirty parking lot and grotty appartments at back of hotel that’s not a deluxe city view. Also someone in surrounding room was smoking had to put in with cigarette smoke drifting in room through vent on first night. After shifting to our proper room we enjoyed our stay air con a bit noisy but turned off at night as wasn’t too hot. But shouldn’t of been lied too, about room size.

Newly renovated hotel We checked in early (11am) and were given a nice room on a high floor- which we appreciated. Staff was nice. Rooms are a little tight, but clean and comfortable. Close walk to the beach via the Westin.

this is the view you get from your room at hilton garden inn , who saves to come to hawaii for this view and the hotel reponse is your travel agent ask for a city view. You come to hawaii for palm trees and beaches not this!!

The hotel was very good and the staff were very helpful and nice. As in the other hotels for the area remember there is a hotel resort fee of $25.00 USD a daily charge. It is centrally located in Waikiki - Honolulu, Oahu, HI. There were problems with the ash from the Volcano on the big island. Pearl Harbor is less than 10 miles away. The tour of Arizona was free and the Missouri was $29.00 USD>

We stayed 7 nights on the 10th floor. Walk out front & you are across the road from International Market Place, plenty of eating places around & also several ABC store close by. We swam down at the lagoons near Kapiolani Park, only & 5 min walk away. House keeping was very good, always happy to supply extra coffee, shampoo, soap etc. Staff on front desk very obliging & happy to assist. Only ate at the onsite restaurant for breakfast once, the usual buffet, nothing to rave about $13.95 + tax each, also a happy hour available if you want. For the money needed to pay for hotels closer to water, I'd rather save & stay here. Definitely would stay again if we came back to Waikiki.

The Hilton Garden Inn is a smaller hotel, but is big in accommodations. For the value in price to instill get a good deal of services. Free WiFi, in room microwave, refrigerator and keyring coffee maker, as Well as on site restaurant, store, and cafe.

We just got back from our 7 day family vacation in Oahu. I chose to stay in busy Waikiki and decided on this hotel. It’s a great location, close to the beach about 3 blocks, close to shopping and the options for food is abundant! And not to mention a grocery store, Food Pantry is across the street for all your needs, has a deli, and coffee shop! Our room was clean but very small, we barely fit our BOB stroller. It had a fridge and microwave which was nice for our little family when the little ones got hungry later. There is a pool but that too is small, we went there a few times and it was never too busy that it wouldn’t accommodate enough people. Weird towel policy, you must use your key card to get towels out, but there’s no count of how many is taken, yet you must return the towels (and don’t use key card to return) or be charged $20 per towel. None of the guests figured the logic but returned towels anyways - even when the bin was overflowing and couldn’t fit anymore! The staff was so so, I appreciate the valet, bell folks and house keeping more. The front desk people just weren’t as sincere. Some notes, valet is required and it’s spendy, should you choose to rent a car. The elevators are slow and their sensors may need some adjustments, I swear there were moments I wonder if someone was going to lose their hand! Thank you house keeping for keeping our room so clean, much appreciation to them.My biggest disappointment is how the hotel handled the smoking in the hotel. Apparently it is a non smoking hotel but I know there was a guest smoking in the room. Hey, not against it, but the smell got to our room, and y’all know it’s a pungent smell. I tolerated for barely a day but had enough when my 3 yo asked mommy why the room smells funky. And when I called to complain, the reaction at the front desk was completely inappropriate, hanging up on me! I called back, she tried to change her voice but I know I got the same girl, not sure if she gave me her real name, Christine, (call took place on 6/16/18 @ 8:57 PM). Her second response was better which I should have heard the first time, she said she would send house keeping to investigate. I don’t think they did, until the next day. Long story short, they eventually offered to move us although inconvenient, and gave us free breakfast buffet tickets. The breakfast buffet at TK Grill was nothing to brag about.Sorry Hilton, I’m terribly disappointed in how you handle and enforce your own hotel policies and won’t stay here again and won’t be recommending this to others. Nonsmoking hotel should be nonsmoking.

You’re not in your room all day, right? So, why do you need one of those. Stay here, it’s a Hilton which means service to die for and a relatively good price for Waikiki. Hey, there’s a swimming pool, sauna, gym, breakfast bar, store, laundry room (!!!), and lots of elevators.Okay, so the basic room faces the parking lot, pay a little more and you get a balcony (next time) with lounge chairs for that all important Hawaiian tan.Oh right, Hilton points too (I’ve used them). Really enjoyed my stay.

Our stay at the hotel was great. Staff were friendly and willing to help. The room was cleaned daily and our issues were sorted out immediately. The pool was cool but always clean and inviting. We were able to travel around the island easily using public and private transport. Felt safe through the entire vacation.

My mom and I stayed at this hotel at the end of Feb to first week of March. It was pretty centrally located within walking distance to the beach and shopping. The room was quiet large and quiet as well as the balcony was a nice size. The pool deck had plenty of space to relax and suntan and the gym was quite spacious with one room for cardio machines and other for weights. We had great service from the housekeeper Melody, Noelani and Brent at the Concierge and Nolan the bellhop. Melody was wonderful and very friendly always wanting to make our stay welcoming. In addition, Noelani and Brent at the Concierge were helpful answering all of our questions and booking tours for us. Nolan was helpful at getting our bags together and ensuring we didn't miss our shuttle. The only negative experience we had was with the front desk clerks who were unfriendly and rude especially when we checked in late at night after a long flight. In addition, the layout of the lobby was a bit confusing trying to find where to go.

This was a nice hotel but small. We travelled with our 2 teenage boys and there was nowhere to unpack anything except for the small closet with 5 hangers. There was a small balcony which was nice for 2. The hotel lacks a good restaurant, but the breakfast was good and fairly priced. It is a short and easy walk to the beach and surrounded by a ton of shopping and eateries. We were on the 16th floor and noted several times how efficient the elevators were. small pool, but we had fun using the pool table on the deck.

We were met with the most helpfull staff, they couldnt do enough for us, also the rooms had the cleanest and most extensive equipement to make our stay most excellent. We had a kettle for hot drinks and a coffee machine also a fridge which was amazing and the cleaners were like ants rushing round to make our stay the best

I was happy to see this Hilton Garden Inn show up in Waikiki. I travel on Gov't business often and I appreciate how well they value us as a customer. This hotel is a great stay, with a nice bar and restaurant on premises. Always clean and a super staff during check-in/check-out and the housekeeping staff is wonderful.

I’ve never been inclined to write a review until now. My husband is here on business and my daughter and I flew here so we can have our “first vacation”. We were given a room on the 10th floor and to our surprised when we opened the door we were already disappointed. There were pubic hair on the floor and blood/ketchup on the bathroom door. We entered the room and there were sand and the table was filthy. We eventually had our room changed...we booked a room here for 2 weeks and I can’t get that image out of my head.I second-guess the cleanliness of our current room as I went and bought a bottle of disinfectant to clean it myself. I’m quite disappointed in this hotel to say the least.

All I have to say is that Hilton Garden Inn was an amazing experience and awesome staff during our stay! We will always stay here the next time we are in Waikiki. The beautiful thing is that it is in a prime location and you can walk to almost most things. Otherwise you can get an Uber or Lyft. We enjoyed everyday we were there, only thing that could use a little improving is the Breakfast variety in the restaurant. The staff was awesome each day, but staying 10 days you do kind of get tired of the same thing. That would my only improvement critique. Other than date awesome stay!

Great location can easily walk to beach. Staff is friendly and courteous. Rooms are spacious and comfortable. We were able to check in early! To get a ride to and from airport ask them about the shuttle and taxi service the rates are better than walking out to get a taxi.

Very close to the beach. Across the road is the International Market. We had a one day/night layover and this hotel really suited our needs. The staff are wonderful and so friendly. We arrived before check in and they were so quick to get us settled in.

We had a wonderful stay here.close to ammenities Beach Room was lovely however we did miss out on a balcony table and chairs,as our room was at the end of the building did mean we had no human traffic passing the room.The restaurant down stairs had happy prices from 11:00 am until 10:00 pm with a selection of US$5 cocktails and beers etc They also had a bar at the outdoor pool on level three free biodegradable sunblock and Aftersun when you over do the sunbathing.Only other gripe I suppose was the shower pressure very poor.look Let’s put it this way We would have no problem staying at this hotel again.

Excellent location in Waikiki Beach. Convenient to many many restaurants and stores. The area is beautiful. The beach is only a short walk away. Would definitely stay again. Only downside is that there is only valet parking which costs $39 per night.

Well positioned to restaurants, and beach. Holoho store acess from lobby with great range of food and drinks etc.Comfortable beds in well appointed rooms.Reception staff and Tours desk staff very helpful.Only negatives were Swimming pool bit chilly and Laundry machines kept breaking down.

This hotel is in a great location close to shopping and convenient stores close by, not only ABC but a full supermarket. Only a few blocks from the beach. The rooms seem to be recently renovated. the only minor complaint was paper cups instead of glasses for drinks and coffee. small fitness center but adequate unfortunately the TVs on the cardio equipment didn't work but had my iPhone to use. would definitely recommend good value compared to similar hotels in Honolulu

No regrets; before booking hotel I read as many reviews as I could. My family enjoyed our stay at the Hilton Garden Inn Waikiki Beach. The hotel is at a great location for shopping, restaurants, and roughly 5mins walk to the beach. The staff was friendly and made you feel welcome upon check in and throughout our stay. The rooms were clean, beds comfortable and having a balcony was the icing on the cake. Overall they did a GREAT job with the renovation. Why stay at a overprice stuffy resort - when you can enjoy a friendly staff, clean accommodations and great location at the Hilton Garden Inn Waikiki Beach!

Nice rooms and a great location. Would have been helpful if reeption told us of events the day (or week) of arrival - no informaion provided so we missed Friday night fireworks. They did however accommodate us when we arrived early in the day. Nice pool area.

Overall I had a pretty good stay. It is in a great location for shopping, eating, transportation and the beach. My only complaint is that this hotel advertised a heated pool and there isn't one. I would recommend.

Very clean. Close to everything. Fun pool. Close to beach. The breakfast buffet was a total morning feast. Every morning I looked forward to the coffee. The rooms had every amenity that was needed for a wonderful stay.

The rooms were very neat and clean. The breakfast buffet was really good with lots of selections and made to order eggs and omelettes. The hotel is right across from the International Marketplace, which has lots of shops and restaurants!

Couldn’t fault this hotel in any way. Location is great and next to plenty of useful grocery stores and shops. Hotel was very clean whether it was through the lobbies/lifts or pool areas and the like and more importantly the rooms were very clean and housekeeping done an excellent job daily. Staff were always pleasant and if I’m ever lucky enough to come back to Hawaii Ill be straight back.

Quiet, peaceful, relaxing in a beautiful facility. A little big/spread out, but everything beyond the waiting for the shuttle/Long walks was excellent. The long walks allowed seeing the art collection.

This hotel had everything we needed. - The renovated rooms were new with a balcony for every room. - The 3rd level pool was really convenient and this floor also has floor to ceiling workout rooms with separate rooms, 1 has all cardio and the other free weights. - The lobby is well staffed and friendly. The dining place is a full restaurant and provides much more than the limited and over priced hotel menus. The other side has a large convenience store with a coffee bar that also sells sandwiches and other fruit and pastries. - The location is what wins out overall. It is in walking distance of everything. We took a couple of tours and the pick up locations where either at this hotel or within 2 blocks. - Dining at all levels can be all within 1 block (food trucks, Japanese/Korean/Chinese, grocery store, and semi fine dinning to fine dining across the street in the international marketplace).Highly recommend! There is no better quality hotel for the money in Waikiki.

We stayed at the HGI for a short family vacation. We loved the location! Customer service at the hotel was excellent. Desk staff, bell staff, pool staff, cleaning staff and valet staff were all helpful whenever we made a request. We had requested a high floor and were on 18 overlooking buildings but I still sat on the balcony and drank my morning coffee. We had no road/city noise being up high and with a building view, which I liked. The room was average size and fine for my husband and myself. My daughter and her husband were in the other room and they also felt like they had plenty of room. I had read that people had to wait a lot for the elevator. The hotel was full and we did not ever have to wait more than a minute or two. I had also read that folks had issues with the buffet breakfast. We loved it! It was well-stocked and really tasty. We usually ordered eggs and they were delivered promptly. We had free breakfast each day but the $13.95 price would have been reasonable for what we ate. We valet parked the car (39.00 per day) and never waited long for the car. There were 4 of us and we all thought the hotel was great and did not have any problems. Great customer service and we would definately stay here again.

RoomI loved my room. I had booked through Costco.ca as they offered a better price than Booking.com and complimentary pick-up / drop-off. Staff were attentive, we got in late as our flight landed at 11 pm. We arrived at the hotel past midnight where there were 2 staff to greet us at the front desk. We ordered two conjoined rooms for more ease but in all honestly, one room was enough space for us. I had to get my own room due to someone's loud snoring! The walls were thick enough that I did not hear his snoring.I loved the entrance of the room and washroom. The entrance were just like the pics advertised with a mirror, sink and lots of counter-space with storage underneath. Across was the washroom area where the toilet was separated with a sliding door and glass wall for shower. LocationA great location for a tourist who plans to take local transit and eat Asian cuisine. There were many ramen, udon and Japanese restaurants in the area along with Cheesecake Factory (Canada only has one as of this entry) so it was a novelty for us Canadians. Across the hotel was Saks Fifth Avenue where it was attached to the International Market Place (IMP). Local friends told me this market place underwent massive renovation which now hosts designers shoes and clothing brands. In the past, it was considered for local hangout I was more interested in the upstairs part for the Asian grocery sold Japanese makeup and skincare products. Inside, also had Moodo (moochi + donuts) in multiple flavours and really affordable! I wish we had one in Toronto, it would put Tim Horton's donuts out of business. We were on the lower floors and faced the grocery store's parking lot. The view wasn't great but the area was clean so didn't mind it. AmenitiesA swimming pool and laundry room are available for use. I did not know they had a laundry room, if I had known in advance, would have brought less clothes. The hotel also has an attached grocery / convenient store for you to pick up pre-made meals. Definitely more convenient and priced reasonable across other nearby groceries. However, the best prices I found to be at 7/11 across Hawaii Convention Centre. It's quite a long walk so taking the bus (purchase a $5 day pass for unlimited use) is recommended if you'd like more of an authentic Hawaii / Japanese cuisine vs tourist-target ABC stores.

We enjoyed our stay at this property quite a bit. The best part is the convenient location that does not require additional costs of uber or taxi’s. The pool is a bit on the small side but because of the position on the building you get sun later into the afternoon than some of the other properties. I am a bit disappointed to learn they started charging a resort fee as this isn’t really a resort.

A 7 night stay after an 18 day cruise from Sydney..Paid a few hundred dollars more after seeing on line photos that seemed to show a more up market decor etc compared to what was offered in our original package. Also got to see inside a room in the original offer and although it was more than acceptable we believe the extra monies paid was worth the experience.We were on the 11th floor looking back out over other buildings. Paying extra for specific views was of no interest to us. We had 2 large double beds . Huge shower. Very big TV. Free high speed WiFi. Ice machine in the corridor. 3rd floor rooftop pool but Waikiki beach is less than 10 minutes walk. Everything expected of a totally renovated hotel by the Hilton group..International market place with numerous eating choices inside was across the road.24/7 supermarket across the side street was ideal for buying items for us to make our own breakfasts. On the next corner of that block are 2 diners with covered outdoor seating that do excellent value evening meals of which we did on 4 of our 7 nights.Two ABC stores are within 100 metres. Buses run continually and are great at $5 for 24 hours. Overall a great location.It is not the cheapest but we had no complaints whatsoever.

This motel was in the perfect location. This end of is great. 10min walk from waikiki beach. A stone throw from an amazing affordable eatery. Shops all around. Motel service was very good.Coffee supplies in the lobby in the morning cold water in the afternoon.Room service ladies were so polite and helpful. service great. Location great.

We booked this hotel on the spur of the moment after the big island started to pop. We were staying on kilauea National Park but had to cancel. This property was twice what we were paying for similar accommodations earlier in the week. However it was very close to shopping. They can arrange tours through second parties. Busy part of town, but well kept property. Parking is very expensive on property, but concierges were spot on. Price point was a bit high for the smaller sized room we had.

Room was very good. The service for breakfast was excellent and a good selection of food. The hotel made sure our group was fed on time so that we could catch our transport fir the various functions we had to attend. Our evening drinks & pu pu'sWas wonderful a the Grill. Great service from the Management for our NZ Group of Navy Veterans.This hotel is close to everything, beach, transport.

We looked forward to taking this trip for 20 years; a Hilton brand hotel was the ONLY one we considered using. This hotel was an easy walk to the beach, close to shopping options, and surrounded by lots of dining choices. The room was clean, well maintained during our stay, and had an amazing shower!!

I started at this hotel on my recent trip to Honolulu. I wanted to be close to Waikiki beach which is about 3 blocks away. The hotel was clean and comfortable. Staff was excellent and knowable. The hotel offers a good breakfast buffet for $16.95. A good price for eating out. There are plenty of other dining options near by, convenience stores, markets and retail shopping. Location is ideal for beach and shopping. It is a distance from Pearl Harbor and some other attractions. Shuttle service will need to be arranged separately.
user_name:
Anthony I
Rio Rancho, New Mexico

review_body: When I first stayed with HGI Waikiki last year it was amazing! The location was EVERYTHING. The hotel is very central and the staff were so accommodating and the service from check in to check out was everything you would expect from a Hilton property. And... no resort fee!Because of that experience, I'm heading back to Waikiki again later this year, and wanted to book the same hotel! Imagine my surprise at now finding there to be a fee of $25 per day, added ontop of any booking you make! I'm floored. The worst part about it.. the rice cooker. That's part of what's bundled into the $25 per day cost. Not any rice though.. just the cooker, in case you happened to bring some from the mainland!I loved the hotel, truly it was perfect. However, maybe it's time to see what else Waikiki has to offer?

Located a short walk to Waikiki Beach, with plenty of shopping and restaurants nearby. It was very clean with plenty of friendly and helpful staff to help plan your stay. There is an outdoor pool and pool table with a Tiki bar on the roof.

I stayed here for a couple of days prior to my cruise. I arrived late but it wasn't an issue. My room was ready and check-in was quick and efficient. Room was spacious and clean. At the time of my stay, there was no resort fee at this hotel. This hotel is close to shopping and restaurants. It's only a couple of blocks to the beach and within walking distance of many attractions. Staff were super friendly and helpful. Would consider this hotel again if I'm lucky enough to make it back to Hawaii.

Stayed here for 2 nights and I gotta say the rooms are spectacular. Nice and clean, they even have the fancy toilet, and comes with small fridge, keurig and a microwave. Housekeeper that cleaned our room is super nice. The only downfall, the front desk that checked us in is super rude and no customer service. Overall, it's a nice hotel to stay in, right across from international market place, walking distance to kings village, a food pantry from a block away and food trucks nearby. There is also a lot of hole in the wall places to eat around the hotel.

The Hilton Garden Inn Waikiki Beach is a nice hotel with lots of restaurants and shopping very close. The HoloHolo Market next to the lobby was a great place to pick up snacks and other needed items without having to leave the hotel. Staff was very friendly and helpful.

Yep. Called the hotel directly...if your reservation was made prior to May 15 2018 there is no resort fee. My reservation was made May 10th and was told I would not be charged the resort fee. Have stayed here several times and enjoyed the hotel. Parking charge now $39 per day - valet only. Great location and friendly staff.

Very comfortable and modern hotel with friendly and helpful staff. Rooms were very well designed with nice balcony. Great location, close to everything. Lovely buffet breakfast. We would stay there again.

We had three rooms between the five of us and we all thought the hotel was very good. the linens and bedding were lovely and the other amenities were nice.The location is perfect and we even had a small view of the ocean. The staff are all super helpful and there is a large supermarket just across the street.The one odd thing about this hotel is the elevators. They close very quickly except when you want them to and they don't always obey commands. At other times they stop at all the floors even if nobody is there. Everybody talks about the elevators.

I stayed at the Hilton Garden Inn with a tour group in May of 2018.Normally would not stay at a hotel that's not on the beach but did not have a choice of hotel.Hotel had been completely renovated and was very clean.Staff is very friendly and accommodating.Bed is very comfortable!Had a restaurant on one end and a convenience store on the other end with a pastry and coffee bar. These make it super convenient for travelers. Breakfast buffet was $12.95 but then the price went up as I was staying there to $13 and change. It's about average in quality but certainly a very reasonable price for a buffet in the area. You do get made to order eggs or omelets with this deal. Also get a couple of different kinds of juices including guava and coffee.There's a pool on the 3rd floor with free towels.Overall was a very nice stay.

The hotel itself is about average. However, the staff are incredibly friendly and helpful. Brenda, one of the housekeeping professionals, was efficient but also friendly and helpful. She did a very nice job on cleaning my room. She should be commended for her good attitude and professionalism.

Hotel centrally located a block and a half back from the beach and central to the Waikiki area, with good access to all local amenities and local transport.Rooms were kept very clean and tidy.We took a long time to book this hotel as Waikiki is not cheap; based on experience, we made the right choice as it was excellent value for money, it would have been probably cheaper had we not gone during the Spring break, so first tip if your not from the US, find out when the Spring break is and avoid.Next doors food store, had everything you need, drinks prepared and unprepared meals.Be careful with on site concierge which is Expedia, and is not neutral, cheaper tours can be located locally; hired a car through the Expedia rep, when picking car found the costs did not include any insurance, which when booked on-line is normally included so became very expensive.

We had a great stay! All of the hotel staff we encountered were really friendly and helpful and made us feel welcome.It was a surprisingly quiet hotel considering the size. It was good to have a coffee machine in the room. The room was a good size and it was nice and clean. We stayed for 5 nights and our room was stocked and cleaned well each day. The location was excellent, it is within walking distance of many shops and places to eat. There is also a general store in the lobby which was handy. The pool and gym were both good. The wifi worked well.

We arrived in Honolulu at 7 am after all night flight and all day in New Zealand flying and airports only to find out we would have to wait till 3pm to get into our rooms. tears, exhaustion in our 70ties. I fell asleep on a couch so tired they worked as quick as they could an dead us all in by 10am. Very thankful for that, the room had two comfortable beds and also a little balcony. Everything was clean.
