A good sized room and a nice bathroom although the mirror was on the wall outside the bathroom also the jug for drinks and all your makeup etc. Cannot say it wasn't a relaxing Inn though as very comfortable beds and transport by shuttles etc were amazing. Yes would go back there any time.

Visited this hotel while on my honeymoon and it was quite underwhelming. The room itself was nice enough however the service was lacking. Firstly, there were a couple of days when our room was not even made up- we notified reception and nothing was done about it. Also we had an item of clothing go missing from our room - when we complained to reception again nothing was done about it. When we got our bill at the end we noticed we were charged for phone calls we never made! The hotel was in a great location however this does not make up for the poor service- definitely wouldn't stay here again!

Check in was a hassle. We were told to come back at 3pm but had to wait a further thirty minutes to check in. As a compensation, the reception guy kindly offered free breakfast which was also a pain to use every morning. Despite the restaurant having empty tables, we always had to wait outside to get a seat for breakfast. Staff were pretty inefficient and lack a sense of urgency. Rooms are not sound proof and can hear sounds of people walking even in the wee hours of the morning. On our first day, we were awaken by a false emergency announcement forcing guests to get out of the room at 3:30am in the morning. The next day housekeeping knocked at our door at 830am asking permission to clean the room! Maybe it was just a coincidence but we had a pretty horrible vacationioning experience with it. Location is the only great thing about this hotel but overall really not a great experience.

poor experience, I had used several other HIltons in Waikiki and wanted to compare this one, was very disappointed, had to change rooms due to water damage to carpet and bad smell, took forever to get me to another acceptable room, staff less than gracious about it, wasted a lot of time. Breakfast buffet pretty below standard, no easy check out process that I was aware of, things didn't work in room, just overall not a great experience

This hotel is clean and modern, freshly updated. Location is perfect close to international marketplace, beach is 5 minute walk, buses and trolleys stop right by the hotel. You can take the trolleys marked pink line or with pink flags $2 each way to ala Mona mall. Tr grill offers a great breakfast buffet for $12.95. The downside got room 950 beside the elevator sounded like a train passing every 5 minutes got no sleep after arriving from 10 hour flight, don't take rooms that end with 50. The view was no better a parking lot enclosed by 4 buildings, but hey not in Hawaii too look out my window, go out and see how beautiful Hawaii is, absolutely stunning place will be back and staying at this hotel again

Nice place great location in the city just a quick walk to any and everything! Clean hotel rooms and the breakfast buffet was sooooo good! I definitely recommend not too expensive and it is well worth the money.

We stayed in a 2 bed standard room looking out at the carparks at the back, the room was serviced every day the staff are very friendly, house keeping, bag handlers, Suzette at reception was fantastic and very helpful we were able to get into our room by 12 instead of 3pm as we were on the first flight in. we stayed 7 nights, the location is great close to everything there's supermarket on the corner which was handy, had a meal at fire grill on our last night it was delish. will be staying here next time we visit.
user_name:
Vicky N Alan M
Melbourne, Australia

review_body: My friends and I stayed in a One Bedroom Suite. The room was perfect! Our check-in experience was wonderful! We were welcomed by the Assistant Front Office Manger Jacob who couldn’t do enough to accommodate us. We arrived at 11am well before check-in. He checked to see if our room was ready, since it wasn’t he walked us over to the bellman to safely store our luggage so we could explore the area. He welcomed each guest with such hospitality! The housekeeping, front desk, pool bar, and breakfast staff were all so lovely!

We were in Waikiki because my husband had a business trip and I went for vacation. The location is great, the cost was average and the hotel was great. The service was great and the hotel was clean. The restaurant next store was convenient as was the smaller shop for coffee and other items.

We stayed here for 5 nights. It is an excellent location in Waikiki beach area only a couple of blocks from the beach. Lots of restaurants available. Pantry market right across the street. Bus stop on the corner. The International Market Place is across the street on Kuhio.We had a King room with a city view. The view was other buildings, that was OK because we didn't want to pay for the ocean view anyway. Room had a fridge, microwave, coffee maker and a safe. A desk area with a bench. No other chair in the room. The room was small but everything was in it except for another chair. Room was clean and housekeeping was good every day.Decent sized lanai with 2 chairs and a table.In the hotel there is a restaurand and small market store with coffee bar.I won't comment of price because its kind of if you can afford it then you an stay here. It was pricey for us but we were here for a special occasion and splurged. Rooms are pretty good value for money considering location and amenities.Would stay here again.

Located in a great spot, about a block from the beach, close to Food Pantry/ABC stores, restaurants, clubs. Very nice rooms, tidy, very comfortable beds. Could not fault anything - great staff, clean and tidy, best location. Will definitely recommend this to my clients and look forward to visiting again.

Stayed with my husband for weekend of the Lauryn hill concert. The room was clean, the staff was friendly and very helpful. The cold water, warm cookies, and fresh fruit in the lobby were a welcome sight. The restaurant is located across gromt he reception desk although we didn't get a chance to grab a bite the it smelled good. The DVD rental was also welcome for a lazy day of lounging in those comfortable beds. I will be staying here again

The Garden Inn is located in the Hilton Waikiki Village. Many shopping opportunities and restaurants. The room and view were both great! All amenities were top notch. Pool on the third floor with hospitality room, change facilities and showers was a real boon, because as you know, checkout is 10 AM and most flights don't leave before 8 PM. Only downside is that the beach and outside pools are a zoo. Beach chairs are problematic and poolside space limited.

Walking distance to the beach, shopping, and dining. Staff was great. Valet parking only (I paid $39.99/night). Pool and fitness center looked great, although I didn't use them. Holoholo convenience store attached was very useful.

[ ] Desk Chair - none. I had to stand in front of the mirror to do my hair. After extensive walking during the days, it hurts to stand even more. [ ] Full length mirror - none. If there was one, I could at least sit down on the floor to do my hair.[ ] Bananas - none. I couldn't find one in the hotel's restaurant or convenience store. HNL Airport of the Delta Sky Club didn't have them either. We're on a tropical island folks![ ] hotel restaurant for bfast - was closed for 3 consecutive mornings until 8:30am, for a private group function. If I were on a business trip, this would have been unacceptable. [ ] Fitness Center - had to kick out 3 different groups of high school teenagers (7 boys, 2 boys, 2 girls) each morning because they weren't accompanied by an adult. I'm on vacation. It would be nice to take a break from being a mom. [ ] Sliding Door - keep closed. Birds come to your balcony.[ ] Mini Refrig - no thermostat inside. It didn't chill any of the water bottles. [ ] Expedia - saved the day with finding a car rental, when Hertz and National were all sold out in Waikiki. Service was fast and effortless. We didn't have to go to HNL airport just to get a car rental. [ ] Customer Service - outstanding from Front Desk, to Cleaning Crew, to Bell Hop to TJ Fire Grill.

Amazing service. The room was clean and amazing. The shower was just awesome. The room it’s self was great. Will come back to this hotel :) the valet service was nice and the pool was small but great.

Great location only a short walk from the beach, restaurants and shopping all around, a food pantry right across the street. Stayed here as part of a large tour group and have no complaints. Pool is on the third floor which makes it more private, which is nice. All our rooms had balconies, although some of them looked out on to the buildings next door and had no real view. Beds were comfortable, rooms well accommodated with small refrig and microwave. Great breakfast buffet available in restaurant on premises. Also a small store on premises. Overall a great place to locate for a visit to the area.

Such a boutique style hotel, very new and trendy (Hilton waikiki is further away from Kuhio ave, and not right on beach kinda victorian style. Hilton village is not in central you need to uber in to waikiki or walk will take 25-30mins).HGI Location is best right smack bang in waikiki so convenience to all landmarks, literally across from International Market place and other shops on Kuhio Ave. The hotel’s room is clean and big toilet, bed so comfy, small fitness centre next to the pool on level 3, but why spend time in the pool when this hotel only 5mins walk to the waikiki beach.Check in was a pleasant my room was on 16th floor a cnr suite which you have both of city views. Staffs were friendly and very helpful, thanks to Suzette from reception helped me upgraded to a better room.The only downside of this hotel is the Breakfast, not continental, very plan and simple for USD $12 or $13, so don’t do breakfast at hotel, go across to International market place for lots more options and much cheaper. Overall i enjoyed my 7nights stay at HGI very much and will def be back for sure.

Located on Kuhio Avenue, it is a bit hard to get to the first time (you have to drive east a block past the hotel, then drive north to circle the block to get to the hotel pull-off). Once you are there, you will appreciate the location (across from the revitalized International Market Place and two blocks from the surf). The room that I had was not large and the balcony looked at a parking lot and a different hotel but the room was recently updated (new bathroom with large shower, large TV, and good bed). The lobby has lots of seating and has both a restaurant and a food pantry. The pool was very popular (on third level) and has a bar.

Great price, great room, great service. Folks were very accommodating about a late checkout, valet parking was reasonable ($40 for 24 hours). Onsite restaurant but we went across the street for more options and better prices.

This hotel is what you want and expect from a Hilton garden inn. Parking was a pain to see but clean, remodeled, and modern.Two blocks off the beach but no resort fee. Definitely an increased value due to that.

Spent an amazing week at the Hilton Garden Inn. We were checked in immediately upon arrival and so grateful that the staff could do that for us, as we had arrived earlier than expected.Conveniently located across the road from the international market place shopping centre and a few minutes walk from the beach.We loved the supermarket across the road because it had a much bigger selection than the copious amount of abc stores available around Waikiki.The pool facilities were very good and we used the gym rooms most mornings. They are two small rooms, but if you are strategic with your workout times then you can have the whole room to yourself. Staff were very kind and helpful during our stay. I particularly liked the Expedia staff that helped us to book day trips and gave incredibly helpful advice.We had a view of the busy road and entrance to the market place. This was pretty cool for us to spend time relaxing on the balcony and people watching. We weren’t interested in a view of the beach. The hotel itself has laundry service, but we are on an extended holiday and needed to do a whole suitcase of washing. I was very pleased to find a public laundromat across the road to assist with this task.Special mention to the housekeeping staff. They were just lovely! I would recommend this hotel for singles, couples and families. Thanks for having us and we’ll be sure to book again in the future

Location is great. It is right across from the International Market Place. You can walk to most places.We booked the cheapest room and it had zero views as we were facing another building. I guess if you pay more, you will be able to get some mountain or ocean view. However, being on the Kuhio Ave, I doubt you will be able to get that great of an ocean view.The room was very clean and staffs were very nice. The bed was a bit too soft for my husband’s liking who likes hard beds. The bathroom sink is right next to the entrance and the area is all open (you can see the sink from the bed). If you need to use the sink at night, better be quite as only the toilet and the shower can be closed with a door. We were here in late Feb/early March and some days were quite cool. The pool was really cold and on cloudy and windy days, it was super cold. This would be our one and only complaint.What we really appreciated was the free coffee in the lobby in the mornings and flavoured cold water during the day.They charge fee for parking, standard for Waikiki standard. We didn’t use their parking lot.If you have a car and need to park for a bit for checking in and out, you need to drive to Walina St from Ala Wai Blvd. At first, we missed this as we arrived at night and had to scramble for a parking on the street which is not an easy find at night.Overall, it was a great stay. We would stay here again.

We've just returned from a trip to Hawaii and on arrival stayed at the Hilton Gardens for two nights. After a long night flight it was excellent to arrive and be told that they had a room ready. We were given a corner, ocean view room which was great, if a little on the small side. The bed was comfortable and the room had everything we needed although some form of lighting over the work desk would have been good. The bathroom was good with a large shower. The sink is in the room but that is fairly normal these days.The pool was never crowded - the weather not really hot enough. We had breakfast on site and while it was nothing spectacular, for the money it was fine.The on site shop is good for anything you may need.The location is a few blocks from the beach, but perfect for the new International Market Place which has some great stores and good eating options. The Bus goes right past the door.All in all we had a great, if short, experience at the Hilton Gardens.

Lovely stay if you don’t mind a very hard bed. Parking is a whopping $40 a night, valley only. I am used to paying $25-$30 a night to park in Waikiki but never had to pay this much before. The bed is much to hard for me and so I didn’t sleep well. Also get the highest floor possible or you’ll have a view of the street. Can you tell I didn’t sleep and am grouchy this morning.

This is a great place to stay for the following reasons 1) There is no nightly room fees that most of the other Hotels charge, 2) A very professional and friendly working staff, 3) You can book all of your Hawaii activities here at a Great Price, and if you add transportation with your activities the buses are very nice and comfortable, 4) I will use them again, 5) You can pre-order and ship your pineapples at the hotel. NOTE: If you forget any items on the bus, please call the hotel or the bus company right away.

Booked last minute travel to O'ahu for Christmas Holiday. All the beach hotels were fully booked. We favor Hilton so took a look at the Hilton Garden Inn on Tripadvisor. Reviews were great and we were able to book a room...besides its Hawaii, how much time would we spend in the room? We were so surprised at the level of service & convenience of the hotel and the room. The entire location looked like it had recently been remodeled with a contemporary style. The room was small - even for 2 people - but very conveniently laid out. Loved the sinks/mirror outside the bathroom area as it was bright and open with light from the patio door. Had a nice balcony with view of the mountains and sneak view of the ocean. Bed was great and room was very clean. Attached restaurant had a great breakfast buffet and across the street is the Royal Hawaiian Center with a multitude of shopping and eating. The walk to the Beach was short and the area felt very safe even late at night. Would definitely recommend this hotel to avoid the crowds on Waikiki at a much better cost. Hope to stay here again - it was a wonderful Holiday!

Recently stayed here for 5 Nights - 04MAR18-09MAR18. Chose this hotel after lots of comparisons and was pleased that after much debate that our experience lived up to expectation. We arrived at about 7:00am off an international flight and a room was available for us to check into straight away which was the nicest way to start a holiday. Everyone we encountered in the hotel, from start to finish was friendly, helpful and accommodating. The room was a good size and the bathroom was nice a spacious. Loved having a coffee machine, fridge (and microwave - though we didn't use that) Room was cleaned well everyday and the rest of the hotel, the parts that we saw, were always well presented. Location wise you couldn't get much better than where we were (non beachfront comparison wise). Located across the road from the beautiful new International Marketplace we only had to walk across the road for numerous food options, day or night and then a brief walk through the Marketplace will take you to the main street and across from there the beach access between the Cheesecake Factory and the Outrigger Waikiki. I was impressed with the hotel and our stay there over this time. I am a Travel Agent and I will be including this hotel as a recommendation to any clients I am sending to Honolulu in the future. Bonus no Resort Fees as well!!

Hilton Garden Inn Waikiki is a great business hotel. Breakfast buffet is good during the early hours. Hotel has valet only for parking but it's very efficient. Also has clean laundry room, which helps when traveling. Rooms are efficiently designed and perfect for the business traveler with the typical microwave and frig. Nice to have this option for my future business in Honolulu.

Justin at the front desk greeted us with much aloha and made us feel welcomed in the islands. Isaac in the restaurant brought us our eggs just the way we like them. The rooms were smaller than we are used to, but then again, it is in Waikiki. Overall, it was a nice stay.

We stayed for 9 nights. We chose to stay here because of the good reviews, location, air conditioning and price (no resort fees which is a big deal for this area). We were not disappointed. It is wise to check reviews on several sites or you may be misled.We stayed in a partial view room on the 12th floor. Our room and bathroom had been recently upgraded and had a fridge and microwave. Both came in handy. Room was clean and kept clean during our stay. A nice pool was outdoors on the 3rd level with plenty of chairs to lay on. There was a bar in this area. Beach towels were dispensed from a machine that was linked to your room number and electronically kept track of towels. Towels could be taken to the beach as long as they were returned to the machine otherwise there would be a charge.Hotel had a great laundry with updated appliances.The beach itself was only 2 short blocks away. We would have liked to have beach chairs provided to take to the beach.Staff were friendly and tried to answer requests..The only grocery store in downtown Waikiki was very close as were many restaurants and stores. Food prices are high in Waikiki so great to have this grocery store.We would stay here again!

This hotel is in the center of prime Waikiki shopping and an easy walk to the ocean. The best you can get is partial ocean views because there are not full ocean views. I believe hotel was recently redone. No bathtub but a hot water machine. Hotel got us in early and out late. Buffet brunch downstairs a good deal.

We did the Pride of American cruise arriving in Honolulu on Saturday morning. Our flight home was not until Sunday evening. We stayed here for the night. They were very accommodating, letting us store our luggage from early in the morning until afternoon check-in. We then took the hop on/hop off trolley to visit sights. The room was lovely. We enjoyed our stay, left our luggage there after check out the next day while having a last meal in Honolulu at the Outrigger.

We stayed at the Hilton garden inn for 5 nights and had a view of the ocean from our 12th floor room. The hotel is clean and comfortable and convenient to many restaurants shopping and The Bus. As a Hilton diamond member we received free breakfast in the restaurant which was nicely presented with made to order omelets and a large variety of other food.

Accommodations are very good, clean rooms and helpful pleasant staff. The in-house restaurant/bar food and drinks however was disappointing. Would definitely stay here again fortunately there are plenty of other places nearby to eat and drink.

Clean rooms, easy access to beaches and shopping. The unfortunate part is that there is no way to park a car without paying a $40 per night valet fee for parking. The only other option is that you can risk parking your car from 6 PM to 7 AM on the street without it getting towed at 7:01 AM… And that’s if you can find a parking spot on the street. If you don’t Rent-A-Car this hotel Would be a great option

This hotel is ideally located two very short blocks from Waikiki Beach and is right on the bus route to virtually everywhere you want to explore in and around Honolulu and with one connection, the entire Island of Oahu. The breakfast is very reasonably priced and good tasting. The relatively inexpensive rooms are well kept and the front desk staff are very helpful. In particular, Zelda Moleta, is a classy, intelligent, very guest oriented representative of that hotel and of Hilton in general.

Book a room at the Hilton Garden Inn, from the time I walked in to the time I leftI was made to feel welcome. Check- in went smooth as well as check out. This hotel is locatedin a safe area. The International Market Place across the street. On the other side of the Market are upscale shoppingand many places to eat. I ate at the Cheesecake Factory and watched the people walk by. There are Starbucks within walking distant.I was on the 15th floor. My room was clean and comfortable with a refrigerator, microwave and coffee maker. And the biggest draw for me is there is no resort fee!!You can arrange for tours from the front desk lobby. The Pink tour bus runs right in front of the hotel as well as many trollies and city buses.I took a cab to the hotel at cost of close to $50. But on the way back got a shuttle to airport for 14.00 Shuttle was on time. I would stay here again,

Found the recent upgrades to be very impressive. The lobby is clean and modern. Check in was a breeze, and staff were very friendly. Room was city view, on the smaller side. The view wasn’t worth writing home about, but we knew that was probably going to be the case. Issues: toilet would not stop running. We were able to fix it ourselves but we had to do this multiple times throughout the trip. We did see a little bug scurry across the bench area once. (Ew). I realize this is a tropical environment and bugs happen. Also a couple light fixtures in the room never turned on. Overall, the location is perfect, quick walk to the beach and shops. It’s a good value for your money. We didn’t spend much time in the room so it was sufficient for us.

No desk, no chair, no drawers for clothes, no suitcase stand. Breakfast was the same everyday - heavily greasy and fatty content. As a Hilton loyalty member I will not stay here again. Housekeeping staff and front desk staff were excellent.

We loved this hotel. It has a great location, super nice staff, parking fees cover you to come and go, and it's close enough to the beach to walk. We had a really nice room with a balcony overlooking the street and night life, which was really pretty and not too loud. All the facilities were nice as well. At the breakfast buffet, no one mentioned the eggs were ordered separately, but we figured it out quickly. We would definitely stay at this hotel again and recommend it.
user_name:
Tamara A
Colorado Springs, United States

review_body: If I had booked and paid for the room I ended up with in this property, I’d probably be writing a rave review. But that wasn’t the case. Selected a top floor room. Got in and the room was huge, two exit doors to a balcony, lots of space to move around. Laid down and heard a very loud mechanical humming noise, so loud it affected our ability to sleep. So at 3am, we requested to move rooms. The night auditor staff went above and beyond to try to get us at least another room with a king bed, and the one they found for us was smaller but got the job done. (They offered to move us again the next day to what they said was an upgraded room, but it was absolutely tiny and we elected to stay in room #2.)All rooms we saw were clean and about as quiet as you can get in a city. No issues with elevators (other than they display eastern time for some reason). The included breakfast for higher HHonors members was the best I’ve had at any HGI in the country. Two options are offered, we tried both and loved both.My reason for the low review is the issue with the first room, and what I feel was an inappropriate remedy. While we were fine with the room we ended up in, it was labeled a “King Standard Low Floor” and we booked a “King Deluxe.” And I paid the deluxe rate for the standard room. That doesn’t seem reasonable to me, and I won’t return as a result.
user_name:
spade7
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: This is a newish and clean hotel that is 5 minutes from the beach. It’s a quick walk through the international marketplace and then through the Outrigger hotel. The prices is good and you get honors points, a balcony with chairs, microwave and fridge. We stayed here and walked to the luxury hotels for atmosphere, bars, and dining. The hotel has a pool. The lounge chairs were uncomfortable.

All staff encountered were welcoming and helpful, going out of there way to ensure needs were met. Rooms clean, nice size and quiet. Nice central location for walking around Waikiki, close to trolley/bus lines. Will definitely stay here next time in Honolulu.

We found this hotel to be a good base for our stay in Waikiki. It is a no frills hotel without the wow factor but is clean, comfortable and service was good.The hotel is in an excellent location. Just a short stroll to the beautiful Waikiki beach. It had a shopping mall directly opposite, with plenty of restaurants nearby.

Arrived at this hotel Feb 21. Check in was a breeze. Room was large and very clean. Not impressed with the sink and all towels being outside of shower room. Make sure you grab a towel before your shower. The beds a quite comfortable. Big flat screen TV. Breakfast is buffet style with a good selection of food. Lots of fruit, eggs, two types of rice. One white, one like a Hawaiian style fried rice which was very tasty. Hash browns, breads, etc. A decent selection of food, coffee, tea and juices. We never ate lunch or dinner there. Too busy exploring the Island.

The only reason this got three marks is because the people were so nice, two marks otherwise. Room was tiny, find out the square feet before you book it, also "city view" might also mean looking directly at another hotel. Housekeeping leaves a bit to be desired, l took pictures of the bathroom when we first arrived, I decided not to post them because of the graphic nature. I'm really not one to complain but we had housekeeping and maintenance up three times in one week. I chose this hotel because of the reviews, maybe I just had bad luck but you spend alot of money for a trip and I always had good luck with Hilton properties all over the country. I wouldn't stay here again. Disappointed.

We spent 4 days at the Hilton and had a great time. Check-in was smooth, in spite of the number of people milling about the lobby and coincidentally enough, we saw that the flight crew we were flying with was also staying at the same hotelThe facilities were great and looked new (or were recently renovated). Coffee was available in the lobby in the morning and during the afternoon, there was fruit-infused water (i think was strawberry and pineapple). Apparently the hotel was pretty booked, so the best the front desk could do was put us on the 3rd floor. Having Gold status, we opted for the breakfast and we received vouchers which could be either for a breakfast buffet or the cafe, where you could opt a combination of things. The food at the buffet is the same everyday (rice, potatoes, eggs, bacon/sausage, fruit, yogurt, bread/pastries), so if you get bored, you can switch to the cafe breakfast, which is more grab and go--any coffee beverage they make, plus a hot breakfast sandwich or a pastry and a fruit combo. They do have a variety of pastries you can choose from their display case and the coffees are made-to-order.Location is great-in the middle of Waikiki. While you're not on the beach you are a few blocks walk away. We weren't intending to spend more than a few hours at Waikiki beach (it's way too crowded for our taste), so that worked out ok. They do let you "check out" pool/beach towels. In the pool area, there's a towel container, where you use your key card to unlock the door and then take some towels. Then when you're done you return it in the bin next to it, which doesn't require any key card. The sign says you'll get charged for unreturned towels. We still haven't figured out how the return tracking system works, but appreciate the amenity. We didn't use the pool, but it seemed to be a pretty popular hangout for guests.Otherwise, you have shopping and some restaurants across the street at the International Market Place (IMP). If you're renting a car, Avis is right inside the IMP and you can rent a car for the day from them and return it before they close to avoid the $40+tax valet nightly parking fee at the hotel. Another cool thing about being across the street from IMP is that if it's raining, you can practically get all the way down to Lewers Street with minimal exposure to the rain via the IMP and then the Royal Hawaiian Center.Check-out was smooth and when we requested a late checkout we got an extra hour added.

Hilton Garden Inn is incredibly clean but unfortunately for us that’s where it stops. If not for the cleanliness our rating would have been 1-2. The pool area is not very inviting, service ok and other facilities ok. Overall just ok or a bit less than ok. We were advised we had a partial ocean view but we are facing away from the beach area and even on our tippy toes not even a glimpse of ocean. The restaurant in the Lobby was not great - we tried breakfast and dinner there. Both were really disappointing. Hilton Garden Inn is a couple of blocks from the beach and this would be ok if everything else was 4-5 star but next time we will pay a little extra and stay on the beach. Unfortunately won’t be recommending this place to family or friends.

Great location in Waikiki, very close to the beach an two major shopping and eating areas. You do not need a car here if you mainly want to go to the beach, eat and shop. You can take public bus airporter bus from and back to the airport. The staff at this location are very friendly and helpful.

A friendly stay with helpful staff. Room was large and clean. Serviced daily, linen change every 3 days unless you request more. Would have liked a shower cap provided and top sheet seemed short. Otherwise no other complaints. 5 mins walk to Waikīkī Beach and most popular eating places. Public bus service a few metres up the road. Well worth using for getting around. Buy a day ticket for $5.50 and you can see the whole island. I wish I was told about this earlier in my stay. An enjoyable place to stop.

One of the best locations in Waikiki area with short distance to the beach and various choices of the eatery. Staff in this hotel are super friendly and helpful. However the interior of this hotel is a little bit out of date, and there is lack of entertainment at the hotel property.

Stayed Feb 24-27, 16th floor. Before flying to Oahu and staying at the HGI Waikiki I read some reviews as anyone does these days. I was hesitant about a few things I.e. the customer service, renovations, parking, elevators, water pressure (seriously someone mentioned that specifically), and breakfast quality. In a nutshell, I would absolutely stay at this HGI when we come back and the only one of these things that ended up being any issue was the parking but let’s get real this is Waikiki and anyone that bashes a hotel for parking is nuts. We managed with street parking on Ala Wai and a few of the cross streets no more than 2 blocks from the property. Total parking paid was $3 over 3 days. The customer service was great from the front desk to the fire grill staff to the housekeeping. All of the receptionists were more than happy to assist with any of our requests. I’ve got the Hilton app and used the digital key which was convenient but we checked in anyway to get some waters (Hhoners). The breakfast buffet was great (inside fire grill in lobby), nicely set up and everything you’d want before starting your days of adventures around the island. Omelettes to order, bagels, fruits, coffee, and juices. The room we were in had one king bed and a balcony, with a view to the east which lets you see downtown and the mountains behind the ala wai golf course. Comfortable bed, clean, updated amenities with no issues. Air conditioning was perfect and easily adjustable. Shower was clean with an updated shower head that provided above average pressure. Elevators were not slow at all and the longest we waited was 30 seconds. Yeah they might get full if you’re staying on a top floor but they were by no means slow. 4 elevators total. I haven’t even mentioned location. Not even a 5 minute walk through the aloha marketplace to the beach. Didn’t use the pool on the 3rd floor but the towel “vending machine” was useful. Overall for the price and location this hotel will be difficult to beat. I highly recommend the Waikiki Hilton Garden Inn. Thanks to the staff for a great stay!

Stayed here five nights, modern hotel, two breakfast options which was included as being Hilton Gold, Strange layout of the room though, no desk, no chair, made for difficult laptop use. The refrigerator didn't have a freezer though. Asked if I could be moved to a room with a desk and was told I'd be contacted but never was. Location is ideal and a supermarket is across the street with more reasonable prices than the ubiquitous ABC stores. Despite the hotel's large capacity elevators were quick so long waits weren't an issue. Slept well, no concerns about external noise.

Stayed with family here at the hotel. Walking distance to the beach, I wouldn’t worry too much about finding a hotel right on the beach. The walk is short and there is a lot to see on the way! Hotel rooms feel a little small with 4 adults, but very clean with comfortable beds. Front desk staff very helpful.

The hotel was beautiful from top to bottom. The customer service was superior. From the front desk to housekeeping the staff was courteous, helpful and full of heart felt Hawaiian hospitality. Our room was immaculate, comfortable and quiet through out our amazing 8 night stay.The view from the balcony was stunning. We could see the ocean waves and a view of the gorgeous city lights. The location is simply perfect! It’s a shopper paradise across the street and a short walk to the famous Waikiki Beach. We enjoyed our second stay immensely and highly recommend the Hilton Garden Inn Waikiki.

Excellent service and staff. Hotel is clean and modern which makes it well worth the price in comparison to some of the other hotels in the area. Nice restaurant and store with all you need right on site. Pool was clean and on the 3rd floor. Right in the heart of Waikiki and just across the street from the International Market Place. We would stay here again in a heartbeat, highly recommended!

The hotel is in crowded Waikiki but must have good soundproofing, because we do not hear a thing from the street in our room on the 18th floor. We have a 2 bedroom unit, very spacious and clean. The breakfast buffet was good, but not great. Some essential things were missing, for example bananas, apples, berries. We thought here in Hawaii there might be fresh papaya or pineapple, but no such luck. There were the usual eggs (delicious), sausage, potatoes, cereals, yogurt, English muffins and toast. However, there were no muffins or pastries. The coffee was great! I think the BEST thing about this hotel is the staff. They are friendly, professional and helpful. For those who want it, there is a small pool and also 2 fitness areas with machines and weights.

This is a really nice hotel. Working in the industry I know what do expect and this hotel had good service, clean rooms, and centrally located within a block to the beach and shops. Lotta superlatives! I’ll be back!

Reached the Check-in at around 9.30 am after 16 hours flight.Friendly, helpful staff were able to help us with early check-in around noon.The complimentary morning coffee at lobby area was a surprising treat.Thanks!

The best aspect of this hotel has to be the location. Across the road from both The Street (great food outlet) & its adjoining shopping centre, and only a few minutes walk away from the beach. Staff were very friendly, though one member of the concierge gave us incorrect instructions for catching the bus which was annoying. The convenience store connecting to the foyer was very handy. Amenities were pretty decent, the gym being particularly well-stocked with dumbbells (max 50lbs). The pool was nice but nothing crazy. The elevators were definitely the low-point. They are very slow and can be waiting up to 10 minutes for a lift down, which on your way to dinner is a bit of a pain but never a tremendous drama for us personally. We had breakfast at the hotel on our final morning, which was reasonable but nothing special - probably a little expensive for what it was but if you're really hungry had a decent spread. Overall I would recommend this hotel and would happily stay again.

The location is fantastic, the view of the ocean was great, the room was nice......my rating is about experience.... When I was there they offered some great special rates that seemed to attract some unkind guests. I found many guests on my floor letting children run up and down the halls until late hours of the night. There were several families with their doors open, yelling across the hall to each other while I was trying to sleep. I had to ask them to stop twice. They then decided that the no smoking rules didn't apply to them and smoked with their hall door open and set off the fire alarm. The building was asked to evacuate at 10:30 at night. A large group of rude guests decided to take over the lobby with a loud gathering. I went down to ask to be moved only to find a large dark bug run across the front desk, I asked the manager to kill it. They were full so I could not move room. The staff was great, the view was great, the location was perfect. I felt like the low rate attracted poor quality, rude guests. Hilton as a brand is great. The staff was great at making things right.

The view out my “city view” room window was another building about 20 feet away. If I lean out the window/balcony far enough, I get a bit of a “down the alley” perspective and can somewhat see into town. This should not deter you from picking this hotel, as long as views don’t matter much. If they do, steer clear of the 1040-series rooms and corresponding floors below...Or your view will make you feel like you are on a vacation to practically any city with tall building - NOT Hawaii. Otherwise, prompt and courteous service and overall cleanliness are excellent.

We stayed at the Hilton Garden Inn Waikiki as it was through an Air Canada package. We had a city view room on the 15th floor, the room had a king sized bed, Keurig, kettle, microwave and mini fridge. The room was spacious enough for two adults. The pool area on the 3rd floor was great, there was always room on the loungers. There are 4 elevators and occasionally there was a bit of a wait for them but nothing to get upset by. Having a convenience shop, restaurant and a grocery store nearby were very handy. This hotel is close to everything so we did not have to rent a car to get around Waikiki. In fact we used the Biki service. The room was spacious, clean and the staff were friendly and helpful. There are blackout curtains and not a lot of noise to be heard. Our only suggestion would be to supply luggage stands in the rooms so you have a place to put your luggage. There is not a lot of storage space so we were living out of our suitcases for the week. It wasn't a big deal to us though. The bed is comfortable, there were a lot of towels and separate pool towels available. The hotel staff were very friendly and Susie at the front desk was awesome! We would happily stay here again.

Really friendly checkin staff who got us into room at 12 noon. Very slow elevators. Have had to ring housekeeping 2 days in a row to get the room serviced...with this happening on 2nd time occurring only after 2 phone calls made (1st at 4pm and 2nd at 6.30 when nobody turned up) finally got room serviced at 7pm which is poor....hotel has guest washing machines and dryers... small pool area which was often taken over by noisy children. Hotel is close to great food outlets and across from the new International Market Shopping Centre and food outlets. Budget car rental located across the road. Hotel about 400 metres from beach.

Beautiful newly remodeled hotel with a extremely helpful staff. Brad at the front desk was amazing. Pool area was modern and relaxing with a great bar. Room was spacious with comfortable bedding and a fresh design. The hotel is conveniently located across the street from the brand-new international market place and less than a five minute walk to the beach.

Found a good deal on this and it was so worth it. The hotel is fairly new so everything is still good. Location was prime. Doesnt charge resort fees so it's more affordable than hotels a block away. I would stay here again especially if u plan to hang out on Waikiki Beach anyway. If you use the pool, it's basic. No frills. But good enough for kids. I would stay here if I plan to just go to the room to sleep at the end of the day.

The hotel is very well located. Our welcoming was awful, we are a family of 5, we’re coming from a long trip from Tokyo and arrived before check in time. The woman in the front desk just told us: come at 3:00 pm. Not offering a bathroom, glass of water or place to leave our luggage. We had to ask for it.When we came back at 3 pm rooms were not ready yet.Breakfast is not expensive (13 dols) bit quality of food is very low. Room doors clse vey loudly so you wake up several times during the night because of the slam of your neighbors. The first room we got had no window to open, we were trapped, with no choice of feeling Hawaiian air, so we asked for a change that took 2 days but then was ok.Parking at the hotel is expensive, 40 dols per day so we parked in the street which is not an easy thing to do. You can spend an hour looking for a place and have to came every two hours to feed the parkimeter.
user_name:
julia241178
San Miguel de Tucuman, Argentina

review_body: For the price it was well worth it. Minus the slow elevators, everything else was nice. Room was big, clean, updated, modern.Gym was nice and big, pool was nice, pool bar was nice, everything about this was excellent. Would definetly stay here again.

Nice and well operated hotel. The staff is well trained and responsive, the rooms are a bit small though. The location is close to Waikiki beach, and yet away from the crowd. Right across the road from the International Market Place and one block from the popular Marukame Udon!. Will stay here again

So many hotels to choose from. Do not select this one. Room very small. Almost could reach everything from the bed. They did not make up the room even though we were out all day. Just one uncomfortable chair and sink area very small The room needs better lighting.

My stay at Hilton Garden Inn Waikiki Beach was great, the room is very spacious and had all amenities. I love the location of the hotel, just across the street from International Market Place where there are a ton of shops and a food street, and another 3 mins of walk away from Waikiki Beach. Very convenient.

My wife and I stayed one night as a stop over and we must say that we were pleased with our stay. The room was excellent, we had a city view but that was alright but we were on the 19th floor and from the front of the hotel the view of the sun setting on the ocean was awesome. The room was clean and in excellent shape. The staff was superb, and our short stay was without incident.

I think this property offers a great option for the mid range clientele, an old property with an AMAZING Refurbishment. Modern with a convienience store on site along with a bar/restuarant. Pool is smallish but enough for a cool down dip. Great location in central Waikiki a block back from the Beach

We just stayed a week in this property, and we were very happy with our room and location. No resort fee. Easy walk to everywhere in Waikiki. Bus stop at the corner. Room was spacious, clean, and modern. Restaurant food/service was good quality and reasonably priced.

So happy I booked at Hilton garden inn Waikiki. Valet guys and girls greeted us as we arrived. They were all so friendly. Check in was a breeze. Got to our room and it was very nice. Rooms were renovated a few years ago I believe. Room was a fairly decent size, liked that the sink was separate from the toilet & shower. Had a refrigerator, microwave & coffee maker (Keurig) bed was comfy. No complaints here. We were greeted by every staff member each time we passed by them. Will definitely stay here again. Wish we booked here when we came last July.

With so much choice we feel we picked the right hotel for its great location to beach, shops and right on the bus route!!! Rooms are of good size we had two double beds, very clean and well appointed. Pool area is on 3rd floor with pool bar limited time in the sun but that's what the beach is for!! Convince shop attached to lobby very handy for drinks and snacks. Overall good hotel with helpfull friendly staff.

We stayed in this nice upscale Hilton garden in for one night. We had a room on the fourth floor on the back of the hotel. We did have the fire alarm to off because someone attempted to smoke in this non smoking hotel. The toilet is also equipped with a washing mechanical so to wash the posterior. Interesting. Other than the fire drill it was quiet and we had a good night's rest.

Hotel staff are genuine and friendly and make you feel welcome. Great location in middle of Waikiki. Rooms are clean and comfortable, lighting for work space could use some rethinking. Cardio area of the fitness center is great, while the fitness side is adequate. I had a cancelled flight and had already checked out early in the morning, when I called (directly to the hotel from the airport) to try to re-book not only was I re-booked, I was provided the same AAA rate that I had booked with for my previous reservation. Fantastic for them to do that for me. Next day on my early morning checkout, the front desk staff were helpful in assisting with bringing my luggage down to the lobby. Overall a great stay at this property

Advised Hilton of our early arrival and asked if we could possible have an early check in, as it was a big hotel I imagined that to be a possibility, unfortunately it wasn't, we couldn't even check in at their Guaranteed Check in time of 3.00pm it wasn't until 4.40pm when we could go up to our room which ended up being extremely noisey (7th Floor) so the next day we got moved to the 16th Floor, right next door to a toddler who screamed everynight (11). The air conditioning had a horrible smell coming out of it so couldn't use that and we couldn't have the ranch sliders open as there were cigarette smokers on the balcony next to us and didn't want to smell that so we sweltered in our room. Housekeeping was hit and miss, sometimes our room was clean and other times it was not. I think the shock factor was the morning of the Ballistic Missile message, it took the hotel 12 minutes from the time we got the message to alert us, they told us to stay in our rooms which no one took notice of and then found out that there is no procedure for them to follow in case of something like this, hence the panic that hit. Being from NZ we didn't panic as that sort of stuff doesn't happen here. I feel like this particular Hilton was the forgotten one.

Easy check in process with very friendly and helpful staff. The room is nice and well appointed with all modern features you expect in a Hilton property. The attached market/cafe is great for all your needs and the prices aren’t as bad as I’d expected. There were only two negatives I can post but nothing that would keep me from staying here again. The elevators are ALWAYS full. Many times we’d have to wait for the third elevator before being able to squeeze in. The valet is also very busy and at one point I had to wait 30 mins to get my car. Call ahead very early to get your car. Overall this is a great location in the heart of Waikiki and I would recommend it as an affordable option.

This is the first time we stayed here. It’s a newly renovated hotel. The room was spacious, clean and nicely decorated. The shower was really good! The bedding, pillows, soft and comfy. It was very moderately priced, but be careful—parking is $35! Probably average for a hotel in Waikiki, but still leaves you feeling like it’s so expensive! One night stay including taxes $201. Very nice though and worth it. Will probably stay here again if we need to be in town.

We stayed for four nights. Overall, our stay had a lot of nice touches: - the staff were helpful and friendly. - the room was clean and comfortable, and reasonably spacious. We had a king deluxe (king bed plus sofa). The room also has a coffee table that extends to a desk height. - our room (on the west end of a higher floor) had a decent partial ocean, partial city, and partial mountain view.- the balcony, though not large, was more than enough room for two people to read and relax.- the breakfast worked well for us. We liked the choice between a full buffet + cooked to order omelettes and grab-and-go from the market, and appreciated the long hours (6a-11pm).Unfortunately, there are a couple of hotel characteristics that interfered with the quality of our stay, and that were outside of the control of the great staff. The elevators seemed to have serious maintenance issues (at one time, 3 out of 5 were out of service), which made for long waits and long and crowded elevator rides.Additionally, the hotel seems to have been built with doors with large gaps between them and the doorframe. This meant that we'd be awakened by the slamming of doors starting around 5am and could not get back to sleep -- some better sound isolation would go a long way here.If the hotel could fix these two issues, this would be a five star review --- good value, good location, comfortable rooms. But the elevators kept us from using our time well, and the noise issue kept the vacation from being as relaxing as it should have been.

We paid $322 per night for 6 nights stay.I just did the biggest review of this hotel and our experiences and lost the lot as website froze! I simply can't do my review again so will summarise.Hotel acceptable. Comfy beds and superb and generous pillows, towels and amenities. Great flat screen Tv, fridge and tea and coffee. Efficient and friendly house keeping.Good Location.Pool was good.Warning! Don't get blind sided by a free money gift in exchange for Hilton grand vacations presentation. You will be asked to part with $40,000 USD on the day and they were very pushy! Big regret and very unpleasant experience. Not worth a $150 free tour. No longer a fan of the Hilton chain and won't stay in Hilton world wide as a result.

Been to Hawaii many times and was stationed there while in the military. This property used to be pretty run down, but they've upgraded it a bit when Hilton brands took over. It's right across the street from the "new" International Marketplace, with high-end shops and restaurants. I miss the "old" International Marketplace with its vendors and local deals.The hotel is well maintained and the room was very clean. The balcony gave us a peek at the ocean a few blocks away, and it was nice to be wakened by the sunrise each morning. A/C does a great job of keeping cool, which is a necessary touch in the middle of the city surrounded by buildings that block the ocean breezes.We were initially assigned a room behind the elevator, tucked in a corner with barely room for a bed and a view facing the parking lot and a wall. After inquiring whether this was the best they could do (as I'm a long-time Hilton loyalist and Diamond member), they upgraded us to a suite on the top floor. It was a very nice move on their part, and afforded us expansive views across the Ala Wai golf course and across to the park (as well as the previously mentioned peek at the ocean).Front living area was very nice, with a large TV and coffee setup, together with a small fridge and a cabinet. The couch was comfy and firm, but the area was sparsely furnished because it was an ADA room and needed space for wheelchair accommodation. While we appreciated the large front room area, we really weren't planning to spend much time in the hotel so it wasn't a draw for us. However, there could have been a much better use of space by inserting places to store clothes (dressers, drawer sets, or shelves would have been nice).Speaking of wheelchair accommodation, the bathroom was very large and set up for ADA compliance. There was a roll-in shower with both a shower head and a hand-held shower nozzle. The fold-down bench was very helpful (knees don't work like they used to). However ... this is a horrible layout for a roll-in shower. The drain doesn't work fast enough to release the water, so it pools on the bathroom floor. The tiles became slipper water holes, and there was really no way to take a shower without making a lake across the bathroom floor. We tried extra towels, rolled up and placed like a dam to block the encroaching water, to no avail. Every time my hubs or I took a shower, we'd have to spend the next 15 minutes cleaning up the water and pushing it toward the drain. And BTW, there is not enough downward slant to pull the water toward the drain ... instead, it puddles up just in front of the entry door. We must have used 8 towels every day, for the water dam, for drying ourselves off, and for placing on the floor to avoid mishaps. It was annoying to say the least, but there's not much the hotel folks can do with this horrible bathroom design.There is absolutely no dresser or drawers for your clothes. The small clothes rack, placed at waist height to accommodate ADA, was fairly small and only had five hangars. A call to housekeeping rectified this quite quickly. But there are no places to stick your clothes, and we ended up living out of our suitcases for a week.The employees are lovely and try their best to remain polite and professional, despite a constant stream of guests checking in and out and asking questions. There's also an adjoining time-share desk to the front check-in desk. We stopped by to pick up a "free" Hilton tote bag so that we could use it carrying assorted things throughout the week. But we didn't succumb to any time share pitches. There are ample restaurants and stores and shopping within walking distance, and you certainly don't need a car if you plan to stay in Waikiki and/or play on the local beach. However, we did rent a car for part of our visit so that we could drive up to the North Shore and hit the more adventurous waves. A word of advice: plan your drives well before or well after rush hour, as traffic continues to get worse. There's a local food truck next to the hotel, but I wouldn't recommend it. ABC stores abound, and there's a nice grocery store across the street. We grabbed beverages and some fruit to stick in the fridge. The restaurant downstairs has a nice breakfast buffet that was included with our room, and they make pretty good omelettes. If you don't want to sit down to eat, there's also a small convenience store adjoining the hotel lobby and you can pick up all the necessities. I used their coffee bar frequently, and it rivalled Starbucks plus had some tasty smoothie concoctions.

The Hotel is in the heart of Waikiki with interrupted views to the beach and diamond head if you are lucky to be located on the higher floors. The rooms are relatively small, however the beds are clean and comfortable. The balconies are tiny and overlook the pool. The gym is adequate. The laundry room has plenty of equipment but will cost you about $6 for for a wash and dry.

This was our second stay at the Hilton Garden Inn Waikiki for the year. My review for our first time is just as good as this one. Service was great. Hotel staff were all friendly, kind & courteous. The bedrooms were very comfortable. Bathroom amenities were good with Neutrogena products. Housekeeping did a great job cleaning our rooms. The coffee machine in our room worked alright but I didn’t really like the coffee pods very much. The room had a fridge and microwave which was quite convenient. Across the hotel was the International Market with lots of restaurant / food choices. On the side of the hotel is a big supermarket where you can buy all your supplies. The beach is an easy 5 minute walk from the hotel. Fixed rate transfers to and from the airport was $30.00 each way. Just make sure to let them know a day before. The restaurant of the hotel was nothing great. Food quality was not good, so best for you to eat elsewhere. They served happy hour everyday though. And the convenience store in the hotel did too, but the service was not good.Thank you Hilton Garden Inn for another memorable and pleasant stay!

We had to stay here to rest because our flight changed and we just need to have a place to stay instead of waiting in the airport. I believe this hotel is newly renovated, our room is nice , bed are comfortable, shower is convenient. They have microwave and refrigerator. We don’t have view witch is just fine but we have balcony. Free Wi-Fi and location is very convenient to everything. They have 2 restaurants inside the hotel and buffet breakfast as well in witch very affordable. Across the street there is a place to do laundry and international market is just across the street. They have pool and 5 mins or more to walk in the beach . I will consider to stay here the next time we visit Honolulu again.

We spent the New Year vacation there in a family mini-reunion setting, and I don't think I could have picked a better hotel. Who we are: Travelers from NYC that have been to Hawaii several times--and love the weather, the people, the food, etc. etc. there--but we don't really LOVE spending too much time on the beach or by the pool all that much.LOCATION: *The beach was 5 minutes walk away for us and maybe 8 minutes with my 80-year-old mother (and the pool was also spacious enough with the bar, etc.).* In front of the International Marketplace (w/ boutiques, restaurants in all price ranges, Saks and a Japanese supermarket) and next to a big supermarket w/ various takeout options.* Centrally located, so it is within walking distance of most destinations within Waikiki, including the Zoo, etc.* The trolley stop is on the next block--which gives easy access to the Ala Moana Mher destinations.* Even w/ Uber, a ride to Ala Moana was less than $10, the Museum of Art, $14, etc.THE PROPERTY:* Unlike other area hotels, it is not chaotic. We've stayed at "better" hotels such as Hilton Hawaiian Village, The Royal Hawaiian, Outrigger, the Marriott, etc., but we didn't enjoy the chaos everywhere--from the entrance, lobby, the restaurants to the elevators. Hilton Garden Inn, by contrast, felt peaceful in the lobby, the restaurant, the shop, etc.* The gym and the pool were never crowded, even during the New Year period when the hotel was presumably full.* The room was nicely renovated, and it all felt fresh.* Still, there were two resort desks/concierge that took care of our requests/questions.CONS:* I'm an Honors Diamond, but there was no noticeable benefit beyond free breakfast (which Gold would get anyhow) at all. There was no lounge, and there was no room upgrade at all. The premium WiFi was not noticeably faster than the regular free WiFi, and it didn't seem very stable (and it kept on asking for my login info several times daily).* There were only 4 elevators, and there was a long wait several times daily (in the morning and around the check-in time).* The floor plan provided during the digital check-in was grossly inaccurate, so we ended up having to switch rooms.* The breakfast items were identical throughout my 7-day stay, and the selection was quite small (very few hot items, two proteins--bacon and sliced sausages, and limited bread selections, etc.) in comparison to any of the hotels I've stayed in Hawaii--or other Hilton-affiliated hotels. More importantly, the food quality was...memorable but not in a good way. [If you don't get free breakfast, I'd definitely recommend that you NOT pay to get their breakfast.]* The cleaning crew's performance was inconsistent. Our suite would be spotless with all of the supplies replenished one day, then it is barely cleaned the next day...with one of the trash can not even emptied.OVERALL VERDICT:This hotel is perhaps not for everyone. If you are looking for a beach resort--or you would like to be in a resort environment w/ Pina Coladas with umprellas, you may be disappointed. This is a "city" hotel w/ little resort feel. But, if you are like us and enjoy the urban environment without spending too much time on the beach, you'd probably be happy. I will definitely stay again.
user_name:
NYC212USA
New York City, New York

review_body: Want to go down to Waikiki beach for a swim, just walk across Kuhio, walk through the International Market place and down an alleyway full of surf boards and you are ready for the warm water. Just a 5-7 min walk from your hotel and you are on a part of Waikiki beach facing the famous Royal Hawaiian hotel. Your hotel is on Kuhio and not on the very busy Kalakaua which is good and Kuhio is the street where you pick up the local "The bus". On the bus they stopped giving out transfers and you have to buy a 5 dollar day ticket to return to your hotel. A short trip is expensive but on the other hand you can travel all around Oahu on the same ticket. It would take you 5-7 hours ! Bring a pillow, bus seats are hard and not comfortable. Your hotel room is excellent, well appointed and with comfortable beds. If your room is facing east you can have your morning coffee on the lanai. The coffee machines are fine, producing good coffee and new capsules are added each day. Room service should be agreed upon with the service dept. Book a time which is convenient for you. A local paper is available for free in the lobby and most of the days they don't run out. I guess many of the japanees guest rely on the japanees TV channels for news. There are 4 computers in the lobby if you want to surf or print your check-in papers for your return flight. Just across the street there is a large grocery store. Buy some fresh papayas and some lime. What a great breakfast fruit !Location, quality rooms and acceptable rates want you to come back to this Garden Inn.

I did a last minute booking for this hotel for 12/25- 12/28. The room was clean and very quiet. We did not hear any outside noise even though we had a room on the street side of the hotel. I have previously stayed at this location under another name and the changes are a great improvement. There is a convenience store right in the lobby, the coffee shop's cappuccino machine was out of order, but otherwise everything was perfect for our short visit to Waikiki. 2 blocks off the beach. Would recommend this to anyone.

We stayed at this Hotel leading up to and over Christmas 2017. What frustrated me with this hotel was the booking was made some 8 months in advance and on booking I requested a high floor, city view per my booking. On arrival, I was greeted by a male concierge and immediately he confirmed my booking being the two rooms. He then threw in, "oh we give you an upgrade to high floor and city view for an extra $20 per room per night". Sorry, but I found this like some kind of pre ambush, as the hotel knowingly knew what my requests were and this was obvious just a ploy and attempt to gain more money from the customer. Not impressed, and I did not argue considering it was a family holiday and it was Xmas. It turned out I was given two rooms on the 8th floor down the far end of the building which overlooked a carpark and was very close to another undesirable and rough looking residential building. No views whatsoever, not even sun. The 9 nights, that we experienced was noisy from this building, their occupants, every night someone was dumping bottles in a dumpster in the middle of the night and people screaming throughout the night could be heard. Very disappointing and not what you want on an overseas holiday at Xmas. I found the staff operating at the Garden Inn somewhat distant with no soul and never a greet, most of the time they were just standing behind the desk and looked like they were someplace else. Not a personality amongst them. Rooms were accommodating and newly renovated, cleaning of the rooms we found average. The pool area was nice as was the bar but nothing to write home about. The location of the hotel itself is well situated and close to everything, definitely this what it does have in its favour. Would I stay at this hotel again? As a return visitor to Hawaii, 3 times, I would not stay here again for the issues mentioned. There are a lot things management at this hotel need to get right before this would return stay hotel.

Great location opposite international market place.I was pleasantly surprised with how spacious our room was.Had a room with a king bed and then a sofa bed in the living area. Bathroom was a little small but was not a major. The fridge and microwave came in handy. House keeping were great and the place was always restocked. I was happy there was no resort fees like many other hotels charge. If you are on a higher floor like we were lifts can take a while. Overall though very happy with our stay.

This is a gem of a hotel. I heard from a friend that it has been recently remodeled. The remodeled rooms where very nice! The employees were very friendly and helpful and the restaurant food was superb!

The room was very, very small and I could hear my neighbor snoring. The $12 breakfast buffet was on par with what you see at the free breakfast hotels around the mainland.. one giant "scrambled egg" in a warmer, cereal, etc. with no focus on the fresh fruits of Hawaii as I'd hoped. The staff were pleasant enough but far from welcoming. Good location but little in the options of shuttle/taxi. The on-site convenience store was appreciated, especially since the room didn't have bottled water. HGI quality varies from 2-5 star hotels in my experience, this being a solid 3.

I’m a Hilton honor diamond. Dont expect any special treatment or even on a request. Their attitude was why you even asked? No, no, no and no. Terrible breakfast. Small room, remodeled from old hotel. Will never come back.

This hotel is recently upgraded. Our room was spacious with a small balcony. Coffee machine and kettle and a quiet fridge ! Lots if cupboard space to put things away. Good iron/ ironing board.Lovely bathroom with good products and good hairdryer

This Hotel was renovated and renamed 2 years ago. The rooms are large and clean.Have stayed there 3 times in the past and the most recent was this past Xmas.Waikiki was extremely busy during this time and so was this hotel. However during the previous 2 times the hotel was a lot quieter. There is usually not an issue with the elevators. However, for our last night we had to go to the Outrigger Hotel on Kalakaua Ave. and I have to say that their elevators were slower and just as crowded. The hotel is only 2 small blocks from the beach and on Kuhio Ave. There are buses running on Kuhio repeatedly so if you don't have a car you can still easily get to the Ala Moana Center.There are towels that you can take out at no charge and as I have mentioned before no Resort fees, which usually adds $30 to $35 per night at other hotels.Once again...Great location.We will go back to this hotel again.

No accessible wheelchair ramp at front of hotel--tried on two different occasions to use chair lift in lobby that would take wheelchair to street level but it was not operational. Staff member told me the lift frequently is out of order. The ramp on the Walina Street side of the building gets VERY slick when wet but concierge staff was willing to help push my wife after I slipped on slick surface and WC and wife nearly hit a wall.

Hilton garden inn Waikiki beach. WHERE do I even start. This place was the best hotel I have EVER stayed at. Lets start with our arrival. We didn’t get into HNL until I think 11PM or so because we we’re on the flight in from Vancouver. We didn’t get to HGI hotel until 12 or so and we were exhasusted and relieved to be there. Check in went smoothly and our check in dude was amazing and told us stories and gave us recommendations on great places to eat (heavenly island lifestyle has the best açai bowls on the island by the way) and he even upgraded us to ocean view. Overall amazing staff member and a great example of Hawaiian hospitality. Next we got up to our ocean view room and fell in love. We decided we wanted a quick bite so we went down to the market in the lobby(delicious and convenient) the room and bathroom were beautiful, the lanai and view took my breath away and the pool was also a great option when the beach was inconvenient (the day we flew out but didn’t leave until late evening) we also had birds that loyally visited us every morning and became our friends during our vacation. Overall I absolutely LOVE this hotel, location, staff and will, without a doubt in my mind be back as soon as I can. Mahalo and much love

It is renovated a few years ago and was clean and felt new when I went there last April. If you want to avoid all the crowd in the main street, I think it is a good option for you. Also it is right next to International Market Place.

Arrived Christmas Day with the family and stayed through the New Year's Eve celebration. So we stayed long enough to experience the hotel staff and amenities. Bellhop Timothy was friendly and helpful and the front desk staff on numerous interactions were also friendly and helpful, so that was key. Although not a beachfront property, the location is conveniently walkable from everything for your touristy needs including restaurants, grocery stores, shopping centers and of course the beach. TR Grill by the lobby has good food, both their dinner menu and $12 breakfast buffet ($8 for kids >3). It was convenient to use your room key to borrow towels from a machine by the 3rd floor pool, and bring to the beach. Just be sure to return it or they charge $20 per towel. Ramps were available for strollers which was a necessity in our case. Housekeeping did a good job with cleaning and providing us additional supplies upon request. Outsourced Expedia concierge desk conveniently booked for my family the Pearl Harbor Tour with pickup/dropoff from our hotel. The only negative was elevator traffic at peak times and walls thin enough to hear your neighbors on some nights, which means my neighbors may have heard my kids cry from time to time. Overall, I give the hotel and the staff 8 and 9s.
user_name:
Kuyakid
New York City, New York

review_body: This hotel is clean though dated. Price reasonable. Breakfast bar good and reasonably priced. Services are excellent. Location excellent, located in the hub of the city. Within four blocks of the beach and shopping right outside the door of the hotel. City bus runs at the corner. Taxi is within minutes of calling. There are so many things to do right around the hotel.

We are mid-way through our visit and have stayed 3 out of 6 nights in a one bedroom suite with large balcony/lanai.Positives: Spacious suite size, balcony size, decent bathroom, good location, clean and comfortableNegatives: Noise - the room is next to the fitness room. The sound of weights dropping reverberate throughout the hotel room from 0600-2200. The sound is enough to make you jump and really takes away from relaxing in the lounge while our young children sleep. We asked if there was another room available and while the staff member did look for alternatives, she said there was nothing available unless we wanted a standard room without the lounge area. It was an underwhelming response considering the price of the suite. If you are considering booking this type of room, check it is not the one next to the fitness centre!! Management should consider different flooring in the fitness area to absorb some of the sound, or at the very least warn guests. Our room allocation was not provided until arrival, when though I checked in through the Hilton app.Cigarettes are dropped from rooms above onto the balcony. The balcony is directly next to the pool area - with very little privacy secondary to a see-through screen.The kitchenette has no equipment/utensils e.g glassware, dinnerware, cutlery, cloth though does have a kettle, coffee machine and microwave. Paper cups are provided.

We visited over the Christmas holiday. The hotel staff and concierge team were very helpful and made our trip smooth sailing. The room was comfortable and clean. The area is in walking distance to the beach and shops and the bus is easily accessible.

Hotel was recently remodeled so has updated lobby and reasonable updated rooms. We needed a 2 bedroom place for six people so that is main reason we selected here. Their set up for that is a 2 bed (1K, 2D) with one bath (shower no tub) and micro size living area (with pull out). Our room was on 20th floor -- happened to have a small outside walled in sun patio with a few outdoor chairs that were handy to have for more seating. Pool is small at this place -- both in area and only 4 ft depth. Initially we thought it was a bit far from beach but kids did not seem to mind the 2 block walk. The closest beach access is by the Moana so it is a bit crowded area but nice sand if you can find a spot. Ask for a rate with breakfast thrown in -- $12 ala carte buffet but good options and value so worth eating here. Very few dining areas near by that are in the Value category. But only Waikiki supermarket is right across the street.
user_name:
BradR269
San Francisco, California, United States

review_body: Came here on business in July 2017. Had such a good experience that I came back with the family in December 2017. Spent over 2 weeks total on this property. Excellent location across the street from the International Marketplace and just one more block to Waikiki Beach. The staff everywhere is excellent: valet parking, front desk, Fire Grill and housekeeping. All very welcoming and helpful. The breakfast buffet is plentiful and very reasonably priced. Rooms are nice. Slightly on the small side. Good value, excellent location and great staff.

I’m finding this hotel difficult to review. It was totally fine but I think I expected more after viewing other Hilton hotels. Location was great. Off the main strip but only a block to the main shops and 2 blocks to the beach.Supermarket across the road to get cheaper supplies such as water. ABC shops in every direction. And good coffee straight across the road. So for conveniences, everything is at the door step, including the bus stop and the trolley stop to get to Ala Moana shopping centre.As for the rooms. They were small, but we expected that and it was fine. We didn’t come to Hawaii to sit in our room. The downside was that we found the beds far to soft and the pillows weren’t great either. So we didn’t have the best sleeps.And we were surprised that we didn’t get the complimentary cookie or mini milk for tea etc. it’s those little things you look forward to on arrival.The other 2 issues we found were that the lifts were really slow. Often it was quicker to take the stairs.And the although the pool was fine and quite a good Space and outlook and plenty of morning sun, it was far too strong with chlorine. My bathers stank for days. And pool bar drinks were expensive and pool towels weren’t great.The gym was good though - used that heaps of times.Overall our stay was fine and for the lower end of the budget it was good, it just those small things that can make the difference between a good stay and a stay fantastic.

Arrived on an overnight flight at 7am, expecting to have to wait for hours before we could get into our room, but we were met with smiles and a room that was ready right away! So impressed, just what we needed after a long flight. Room was great, plenty of space for three adults, and had everything we needed. The pool was lovely, if a little cold, but we swam anyway. Great location, close to everything, would definitely return here on my next stay in Waikiki.
user_name:
Wendy S
Auckland Central, New Zealand

review_body: The hotel is in an excellent location inside the city. Many places to eat, shop around it and the streets seemed busy but safe. It’s a few blocks from the Waikiki beach. The rooms were clean and comfortable.

This is our 2nd trip to a Hilton property in Waikiki and we really enjoyed the location and modern decor of the hotel. One staff in particular went out of his way to look after us and his name was Justin. He was personable, knowledgeable, caring and genuine in his service to us. We were there celebrating my granddaughters 10th birthday and were given an upgrade to an ocean view room at no extra charge and had cookies sent to our room due to our "Aura" which we found extremely delightful! The kind gestures really helped to take away our tiredness from a long trip. I hope you are lucky enough to get Justin at the Front Desk, please give him a raise.

I was pleasantly surprised by our stay here. location is OK BUT the rooms were better than expected. Quite new/modern and clean.
