[Maybe a tad small for a family of 4 but good]Would stay here again!The main issue we had was the Fire/Smoke Alarm that went off after midnight [due to someone smoking in room] I honestly think the staff did NOT do enough to control this situation. Obviously a young and minimum staffed night crew need to address the possibility of a Fire seriously. ADVISE and ASSIST hotel patrons. INFORM and UPDATE with information. This limits panic and confidence. As a Safety Manager I must say that the situation was handled totally incorrectly and inappropriately sadly

Good value for money hotel with all the amenities and a short walk to Waikiki beach. Easy access the public transport, restaurants, groceries and the luxury Waikiki shopping strip. Rooms are large, modern and well maintained.Staff friendly and helpful.

When I booked this hotel, I had no idea where it was located on Kuhio, but a Hilton is normally a good hotel. The front desk staff was very friendly and helpful. We got there early, so we were going to store our luggage, but our room was available, so we skipped that step. Our room was on the 16th floor, so the city and slight partial view was beautiful. The room was a little smaller than the other Hilton down the street, but for the price, it was perfect. We had a microwave, refrigerator and safe which all come in handy for our stay. Three of the best the best things about this hotel is the location, convenience store attached to the lobby and the buffet breakfast/all day restaurant. We didn't have to leave last night because we had everything. The location is right across from the old International Marketplace which is now high end restaurants and shops and Macy's, so it's very convenient. The beach is a short stroll with many things to see along the way.

Great place to stay when you are looking for a reasonably priced hotel that is within walking distance to shops restaurants and the beach! The rooms were clean, the beds were very comfortable and the staff were helpful. I would definitely stay here again.

It was a great holiday and the staff was fantastic. The rooms were great and they cleaned it daily. Anna from the shop was always willing to assist even if we had to get rid of our coin. Staff was always available to direct us on our next excursion and always with a smile. It is a short walk to everything and very centralised so great value for money.

Main Reasons we booked this hotel1. "No Resort Fee!"2. Location Location Location3. Newly Refurbished4. Reasonably PricedWhat more will you look for in a hotels in Waikiki? We were even lucky to have an early check in ....11 a.m. The Reception saw that our group were with a baby and kids so she kindly looked for an available rooms for us. So nice of the staff.Will definitely stay in this hotel again when we go back to Waikiki.

Hotel is nice, good rooms. Doesn’t appear to have ocean view. Less than 10 Minute walk to The Waikiki sand. Close by shopping to satisfy most desires. Breakfast buffet was just OK. There is a small market within hotel.

Hotel room was clean. Short walk to the beach. Hotel restaurant/ bar was nice. Location downtown across the street from International Market so close proximity/ walking distance to shopping. My friends and I enjoyed ourselves!

We stayed here for two weeks recently. A business trip for me and a vacation for my family. Our room was on the 12 floor so noise from the outside did not reach us. Unfortunately for us and our neighbor, our room had one of those locked doors to the next room and sound travels through it pretty easily. This meant that we could hear their kids and TV. I'm pretty sure they heard our baby crying at night too.Our room was pretty nice in appearance. Everything was like new and the beds were comfortable. There's even a Keurig machine with cups that gets refilled by the housekeeper. The bathroom corner has a sliding door that separates the glass enclosed shower and toilet from the rest of the room. The sink is outside of that corner. A drawback of this is that there are only 2 knobs to act as hooks in the shower/toilet area. Something of note is that there are no screens on the window doors and we had a few pigeon visitors who calmly toured our room.Customer service was nice but the front desk personnel could use some more training on their computer system. Fortunately, they were happy to learn something new that was usually handled by a different shift. Maintenance was prompt and issues were handled promptly.The location of this hotel is pretty convenient. The International Marketplace is across the street for those interested in shopping. The Food Pantry market is across another street for relatively inexpensive food. Getting to the valet parking area was confusing at first as it was not on Kuhio Avenue but instead on Walina Street. The person I called at the hotel was helpful in guiding us there.The valet service was good overall. It's better to call down to ask them to get your car instead of waiting to reach their stand to do it. I've had one instance where the person forgot to get my car after scanning my card.

Noisy room. We were placed on level 9 seaside, we requested to be moved up or carpark facing but was turned down.We have stayed at Hilton Garden Inn Waikiki beach and absolutely loved it but this time around whole experience was different.Even staff were very friendly!!

The hotel is in one of the main street. The location is excellent, near the shops, 10 minutes walk to the beach. Service is very good as well, service staff i.e Natividad Adnza, are very helpful accommodating. Gave good tips where to go, eat and shop. The room we had was comfortable enough for 4 adults.

The hotel is located in a very centralized area and very convenient to the main areas in Waikiki. The customer service was very unsatisfactory and unprofessional. We had a problem with a bed and the front desk did not offer any solutions and said there was nothing they could do. They did send up engineers to look at the bed without letting us know and they eventually solved the bed problem. The front desk personnel did not seem like they were concerned about the guests needs and were in their own world behind the desk. Very dissatisfied with the hotel and disappointed.

Great trip with family and friends. Weather was up and down, Sun and Rain. Didn't stop us keeping busy. Plenty to do, Pearl Harbour, Black Friday Shopping, site seeing, Luau, Restaurants, Pipeline Comp was on, Trekking up Diamond Head. Not a restful holiday but too expensive to go there and just lay on the beach, we can do that at home for free :)

Limited wheelchair accessibility--device that is suppose to provide it to front area was broken and from what staff told me is not the first time. Side WC ramp gets VERY slick when it's wet making WC use difficult.

this hotel is only 5 mins from Waikiki beach. yes not on the beach but if you want a nice comfortable hotel with no resort fee this is the one. we stayed for 8 nights late October and it was great... fresh new rooms comfortable beds and nice clean bathroom. the service is great too hotel staff always saying aloha and helpful.For a 3.5 star this is really worth it the best I have stayed in. Across the road from international market place walk through that and your on the main road to the beach... your in the middle of everything.going back next October 2018 and will be staying there again. cant fault this hotel.

Overall, didn't experience a service that would want me to come back to this location. Unfortunately this is a first in my HH Membership for the past 15 years! Just hope they can correct their offerings.

We booked our trip to Hawaii using Air Canada Vacations and chose a package with the Hilton Garden Inn, because of the location and because they have no resort fees. We were late checking in due to the late flight but it went smoothly and the staff were lovely. We had notified them that we were celebrating our honeymoon and a milestone birthday so they upgraded us to a one bedroom suite. With two double beds instead of a king (which we had originally booked). Someone might not have been thinking there! They were full up and offered to change us the next day but we wanted to get unpacked and settled so we ended up staying in the room and improvised! The suite was large and comfortable, bed comfy, with microwave, fridge, Keurig machine and a good sized safe. The balcony afforded great views towards Diamond Head and we could see the ocean as well. The staff kept it very clean. Toilet and shower are in a separate "room" from the sink. Shower is huge, walk in and with great water pressure. Wifi worked very well in the rooms and the television was large and clear. Downside? Although there's a wardrobe for hanging up clothes, there really isn't anywhere to put other clothes. No dresser and only one shelf in the wardrobe, and the floor that you can use. We stayed for 5 nights and definitely didn't want to live out of a suitcase. Location of the hotel was excellent, close to everything with the beach only a block and a half away. The hotel has a restaurant which we used for breakfast one morning and a meal one evening and were happy with the service and food. Mostly we ate breakfast in the attached cafe as our rate didn't come with free breakfast. The pool area was all right but we only sat out there once, preferring to be off doing other things. Staff was very nice, very helpful any time we needed anything. We used the business computers in the lobby to check in to our flight and look up some information and there is a desk in the lobby with an Expedia representative that can book you on activities or get a car rented for you. The other desk is someone pushing a Hilton time share though so just keep that in mind. Over all, very good marks, I'd stay here again.

My room on the sixth floor faced Diamond Head, though that iconic landmark was barely visible between buildings. The charm of this Hilton location is it is central to shopping and dining in Waikiki. The newly (one year old) revamped International Marketplace is right across the street. Our group spent many hours there looking at a Tesla car and solar roof, shopping for cookies, and dining at a top notch steak house with plenty of delicious choices on the menu for every palate.With Waikiki's one-way streets, finding the valet parking area was a bit of a challenge to find (go past the hotel entrance, left around the block to Ala Wai then left again to the side entrance of the hotel to the valet parking area).The lobby is well-staffed and very comfortable. Business stations are readily available as are complimentary coffee and daily newspapers.The room was very suitable and the bed was most comfortable. The bathroom splits toilet and shower from sink and closet. The glass shower stall with its slightly sloping floor, adjustable height shower head, and grab bars is one I would want in my own home with the addition of a bathing chair or bench for an ailing family member.

We were a party of five and arrived at the hotel around 7.30am and was met at the front desk by Michael. We had booked two rooms. Although the check in time is 3pm, Michael who was pleasant and friendly did his best to get us two rooms early and as close as possible to each other. The rooms were not ready and Michael advised to check back with him in a couple of hours. We left our luggage at the hotel and went across the road for breakfast. When we returned, one King size room was ready and two double bed room soon after. Both rooms were well presented and very clean. Christy from housekeeping 14th floor did a great job of keeping the room very clean for the next nine nights. One room had a partial ocean view and the other of the hills behind the hotel. Wardrobe storage was adequate, the safe was big enough to secure most things and we appreciated an empty bar fridge for our use (not a fan of expensive mini bars) A short walk (around 4 Mins) through the International Market Place shopping centre across the road and we were on Kalakaua Avenue which runs along Waikiki Beach. There are numerous ABC stores in the area as well as a Food Pantry supermarket to the left of the hotel. The pool area was ok, although the pool is small and no sun after 3pm but why need a pool when Waikiki, Kuhio and Queens beaches are just a short walk away.

Loved this hotel! It was clean and comfy. We had the breakfast buffet every day while we were there. More than enough to eat and a good variety of food including cook to order eggs and omelets. The hotel is in a great location just across the street from the International Marketplace. Most nights we got in after 10:00 p.m. The area is well lit and safe.

Great value. Stayed 5 nights over thanksgiving holiday before heading to the north shore for the rest of our vacation. Nice layout of the room, neutrogena soap products were a nice surprise. Beds are comfy. We had 2 double beds in the room. There was 4 adults in the room, we had 4 carryon suitcases and one large suitcase. There was enough storage underneath the bench for all luggages. Small table in room was a great asset. Safe is huge. Coffee in lobby in the morning with to go cups, fruit infused water in the afternoon. Pool is nice and not crowded. Restaurant is decently priced. Shopping is right across the road at the international market. Abc store as well. Beach is no more than a 10 minute walk. The room is nice, staff is friendly and helpful. Was nice having a balcony but our view was a back parking lot and other buildings.Bus stop near by. Diamond head is 25 min bus drive. Pearl harbour Arizona memorial is an 1 hr 15 min bus drive. We got a taxi from airport for 39 dollars. On the way back to the airport most cabs do a 29 dollar flat rate. If you are expecting to walk out on the beach straight from the hotel this is not the hotel for you. If you want to be close to everything, this is your spot.

Excellent location and short walk to Beach. International Market Place and other shopping and businesses are conveniently across the street. There's also a supermarket across the street from the valet station. No dresser in the room but there was closet space. 19th Storage team kept my room cleaned and were very friendly.

I am a worldwide Hilton brand customer because I can always count on an excellent stay at a Hilton hotel, however this was NOT the case at the Hilton Garden Inn - Waikiki. We arrived late (about 11:30 PM) and there were no carts available at the valet parking area. We asked for a cart at the front desk and we were told all the carts were locked up and "oh well". Richard, the front desk person, did not seem to care at all about us needing to move a large amount of luggage up to our room - he was completely indifferent and unwilling to help. I was very disappointed!I finally "pushed" the front desk person to go find a cart. About 30 minutes later he finally came back with a cart. I was extremely disappointed with the customer service demonstrated by the front desk at Hilton Garden Inn.

We had a very good experience at the Hilton Garden Inn. The room was very clean and the view was stunning. Very good location and the staff was friendly and helpful. The pool was very refreshing and we enjoyed the outdoor pool table.

I cancelled a reservation here and was still charged for 1st nights stay. I booked through an airline. The airline says I need to call the hotel. The hotel says I need to call the airline. The Hilton rep that I spoke to on the phone was less than helpful.

We really enjoyed our stay. The check-in process was quick and easy. The lobby has seating near big windows that overlook Kuhio Ave. There is a nice gift shop/coffee stand right off the lobby...but also a full grocery store (Foodland) right across the street (that has a Coffee Bean shop and a Hi Steaks food place). It's Waikiki so really everything is RIGHT nearby someplace. This hotel is right across street from the International Market Place. So many food options all around. Our room was on the 9th floor. It was very clean and everything worked fine. A nice balcony with 2 chairs. The room had a king bed and a couch/sofa bed...plus some additional bench style seating on opposite wall. I hate when there is not a few places to sit in a room...I don't want to watch tv from bed...unless it's time to sleep. Even though views from previous rooms at Hilton Waikiki Beach were better...We liked this location and room layout (couch) better...So we would for sure stay here again. Aloha and Mahalo until next time Hilton Garden Inn.

Awesome location to everything great staff and very clean rooms this is our 3rd stay here and won’t b our last highly recommend pool area great bar staff nice and restaurant had a great choice and well priced Mahalo

Very modern and Its so clean. All the staff are very helpful and nice. Overall it was an excellent service. Love this hotel and I will surely stay here againnext time I come to Honolulu. I highly recommend this hotel

Loved our stay at the Hilton Garden! We like to explore, so were not necessarily looking for a beachfront hotel. This location is perfect - right in the thick of downtown shops & restaurants and a VERY short walk to the beach. Short trip to get to the highway & over to the East beaches or North Shore. Only downside is that you have to Valet Park ($35/day), but the valet staff is very efficient and quick! Would definitely stay here again.

This hotel is well-located only two streets back from the beach. Comfortable bed, good-sized room and nice shower. Quality shampoo, conditioner, etc but (surprisingly) paper cups are the only crockery in the room. Noise from other guests' doors was a bit of an issue, as was the noise from our inconsiderate nocturnal neighbours heard through the interconnecting door. We had no hot water on the second day due to some weird city-provided issue but the staff were not interested in any sort of compensation for a day of cold showers. Two fire alarms (one just after we'd woken for the day and another after midnight) caused by people smoking in the room were poorly handled and we saw no staff at all while we all gathered outside wondering what was going on. Several rooms clearly had people in them long after the fire department had arrived but no attempt to get these people out was made. If this had been a real fire, people would have died! No compensation was considered again. The coffee shop and restaurant are both reasonably-priced and had quality food and drink.Notwithstanding the above, we'd stay here again, mainly due to the convenient location.

We are here for 8 nights. It is a completely renovated, modern hotel. The rooms are very nice. Location is excellent. Staff are friendly, helpful and accommodating. There is a restaurant onsite. Coffee in the lobby in the morning. It is very quiet..we are facing a busy street and when you close the door you can't hear the traffic. Pool is really nice..no hot tub. NO resort fees!!!! The room is very nice with a fridge, safe, microwave, coffee maker. There is a grocery store right new door. Very satisfied with this hotel and would stay here again.

This is a very clean and comfortable hotel with a warm and friendly staff. Conveniently located - within walking distance of the beach, shopping, and dining. Love this place and have made future reservations. Am looking forward to my next stay.

Booked this hotel 3 days before coming on my trip and after reviewing lots of other hotels in the area. I am happy to say it was totally perfect for what I needed on my week long getaway.I was traveling on my own so needed something close to everything and not too expensive. This hotel ticketed all the boxes for me.Room is on the smaller side but has a great balcony and one of the most comfortable beds I’ve slept on.I didn’t use the pool as I spent most of my time at the beach but it’s an ok size and has plenty of sun beds if you want to tan.The restaurant attached to the hotel is great and I had the buffet on my first day which was reasonably priced for Honolulu and also had lunch where the burger was exceptional. There is also a supermarket attached to the hotel and many more shops and restaurants only a stones throw away.Overall it definitely has everything I needed for my first trip to Hawaii and would stay here again in a heartbeat!

Comfortable, clean but small rooms in an excellent location in Waikiki. We would definitely stay here again. Short walk to shops, beach, restaurants. Excellent on site breakfast spot. There is a small amenities shop in the building and a small grocery store next door.

My husband and I stayed here recently for a short visit to Hawaii. Everyone at this hotel was accommodating and very helpful with our questions. I get very anxious whenever we have to travel because I like the places I stay to be very clean and this hotel certainly lived up to this standard. The one thing I also want to comment on is the aircon temperature. Every time I changed the temperature this was not touched by the staff when our room was made up which was awesome. Small details matter to me. View wise, not much of a view from our room but I’m sure if you pay you could get a good view. Bonus was the space in the shower! Overall a great stay :)

Amazing views from the higher floors. This HGI is walking distance from Waikiki beach. It has a nice private pool but you might as well just walk to the beach. It's central to everything and I walked everywhere that was local. The room was clean and the staff was friendly. I would stay here again.

Employee service was really terrible. -. Ask us wait for check in until 15:00, but we were waited until 16:00 by asking them the update. -. They said there was room avalable at the higher floor, but they refused to change and checked it because I told them I wanted to stay at 14's floor. They never want to change and hear from me again. There were cockroach every night. -. We called the room clean service, but they just came and tried to catch it. -. They suggested us to change the room, but the front desk guy ask us to come down and talk and discuss. It was 1:00AM. I asked them to come to my room if there was something to talk with me, but they refused. -. We were scared and itchied every night. My mother's room had water drop from upper floor. -. Room maintnance come and clean them. It was because of upper people took the shower. It was really disgusting experience. The service is really terrible hear. I took cockroach and plan to post it in the internet to inform people to know the real situation in this hotel. KOO DAE HYUN

Great location - close to beach, opposite a supermarket & International Marketplace. The pillow selection isn't good- there needs to be a firmer/ higher pillow provided. Noise from slamming doors in other rooms is disturbing. Hotel fit out & presentation is very good.

good luck finding the front drive - I know Honolulu well and this was challenging with all the one way streets. Valet was fast and friendly once we found them.Hotel is set up really strange, it's hard to explain... but some hallways are inside and some are outside. Our room was small and expensive. I normally stay at the Hilton Waikiki but it was booked up and as a Hilton loyalist I wanted to try this new HGI - but next trip I'm back at the Hilton Waikiki.

The 1st thing we noticed was how clean the hotel and room were. Definitely a plus and hotel is centrel in waikiki. The staff were very friendly and polite. Would recommend to anybody and would definitely go back again.

Hawaii was amazing and the hotel accommodations were great. I will definitely go back & stay at same hotel easy access to everything. The hotel desk was very helpful with directions & transportation requests & they also gave great things to suggestions

Great hotel, great location. The only complaint I had was insufficient sun shade umbrellas. The hotel has at least 50 sunbeds but only two umbrellas at one end of the pool area. Other than this the stay was very enjoyable.

A modern updated hotel in a great location with all the modern conveniences a traveler may need. I really cannot fault the hotel with it's price range and in comparison to other retro 1970's hotels along the strip, you're getting much more value for your money.I find the room sufficient with a stand up shower, the internet was complimentary and fast, the air conditioning working great, the bed is very comfortable and the room is clean. Coffee machine, a microwave, a mini fridge, iron and ironing board in room are great addition which offers the modern traveler flexibility and independence.There is a gym, but I did not get a chance to use it, the small pool is a welcome addition to cool down after a long, wonderful day sight seeing etc.Plenty of food options around the hotel to suit all budget. Beach is literally a block away.Very pleased with my one week stay here and would sure to be back.

Pros: The hotel was centrally located in Waikiki, across from the International Market Place and walking distance to the beaches. There were plenty of restaurants and shopping options in the area.The hotel room was nice. It was clean and updated. I liked the stand up shower in the bathroom. The bed was comfortable.The Holoholo Café & Market was nice. They had decent breakfast offerings, and had any supplies you might need while you are there.Cons:The elevators were ridiculously slow. Even though there were four of them, it seemed as if only one of them would be operating at any given time. Plan ahead if you plan on using any of them.Ice machines were not on every floor. The closest one to ours was the floor below ours.The internet service was slow.The breakfast buffet at the TR Fire Grill was absolutely appalling. The food was overcooked, and in some cases dry and burnt. We chose to eat breakfast elsewhere as a result.Finally, my wife had arranged for a shuttle with one of the hotel employees. He assured her that he had put her name down on the list. When it came time to leave, her name was not on the list and the shuttle left her behind. She was very upset because she could not be late for the airport. A different employee arranged for a taxi to the airport at the same rate. When I questioned the hotel manager about this, she stated that the employee told her that my wife had not requested to reserve a spot on the shuttle. I assured her that my wife did. I had a string of text messages confirming everything my wife said. The hotel manager chose to believe her employee and not me or my wife.I am a Diamond member with the Hilton hotel chains and I have never been more upset in my life. We visit the islands from time to time because our son is stationed at Schofield. I can assure you that I will never stay at this hotel ever again after the treatment we received.

I generally stay at the Hilton Garden Inn sites when I travel, and was pleasantly surprised to discover this one was up to par in spite of being in the midst of the Waikiki jungle. There is a store adjacent to the lobby that sells a variety of items you may need for your stay, including food. There is also a small grocery store with take-out food across the street. Although not that close to Waikiki Beach, it is not to far to walk there. The lobby is nice and modest and the male staff were friendly upon check-in. The hotel room was small but clean with usual amenities. The halls to the hotel rooms are outdoors and overlook the street, but inside the room, I did not hear street noise.

Had a great holiday, lovely place to stay, very handy to everything, good size room and comfy beds, clean, nice very reasonably priced buffet breakfast, helpful, friendly staff, would stay again, only regret holiday wasn’t long enough.

Very central hotel to Waikiki beach and main drag. Opposite International Marketplace which is great. Hotel recently renovated so nicely done. No issues with lifts as some people have mentioned. Excellent happy hour at the Fire Grill e.g much more than 1 hour. Buffet breakfast was ok - cooked to order eggs were good but the pastries were stale and I even got a slice of mouldy bread. Staff were very nice particularly the hotel porters who were wonderful and informative (Thanks Timmy). Pool reasonable size if the beach is too busy for you. We had a bug problem in our room which other guests did not seem to have. Cockroaches and some bugs that come in on beach towels according to the maintenance people. We complained 4 times about the bugs and they did spray but to no effect. Think our room needs fumigating. Hilton did handle the issue well after I complained though. I am awarding 4 stars for the location and the porters! I would stay there again and hopefully next time no crawlies!

Outstanding as always! The staff always recognizes me and treats me like a king! The hotel is extremely convenient for dining and shopping. The restaurant serves great food for dinner. And I've used the free breakfast the last few times I've stayed and it was always really well done!

Nicely updated and close to beach.Friendly people and great atmosphere. The room and service was awesome at a reasonable price, had a great conversation with the bell hop who was well informed of the surrounding area.

We arrived for 5 days from Australia, and the hotel was so near to everything, bars, restaurants, supermarkets, and the International market place. Pool had a bar which was staffed by lovely people. Small pool but great, plenty of sun lounges, and towels on hand. Room smallish but everything you needed including a microwave!!! Walk in shower, hairdryer, iron.Beds really comfy and plenty of pillows.

We experienced some bugs infestations in the first room on the 5th floor. The hotel was accommodating and relocated us to another floor, but that didn’t resolve the issue at hand. Not sure the last time the hotel has been maintained sprayed.

Love the location for the price, very good conciergeFree coffee & water in afternoon. Our air conditioning is too cold, cannot bend the grill. Our room is not available for early check in as requested so we have to spend 2.5 hours across at Matsuya Market which has great Japanese lunch & misc grocery that I’m looking for.Manangrose2014@SFO

Just a block from the beach. Conveniently located across from the International Marketplace. Doesn't have all the bells and whistles that the pricier, beachfront properties have. But it is a third of the price. If you are going to be out and about enjoying the city rather than lounging at the pool, this may be the place for you. The Fire Grill restaurant inside the hotel is horrible. Staff is rude. Food is disgusting--stale, greasy, flavorless.

Very handy position, one block from the beach. Easy walk to pick up locations for organised day trips, and public transport Our room was very clean and as normal, comfy pillows and bed.Tea/coffee facilities. Everything we needed for our 9 day stayAll staff were very friendly. Hopefully we can bring big family here later next year.

Don't expect this hotel to honor any of the 'Surpass' benefits if you have their card. None of the advertised benefits are honored here. They DO NOT provide bottled water to GOLD status card members. They do NOT offer upgrades to GOLD status card members. There was no free continental breakfast. Their power goes out. They didn't know enough to reset water heaters, so there was no hot water for hours following this.

the only problems we had was the parking is 35 dollars a night and our toilet wouldn't stop running water. Location is good if you like busy streets. Lots of shops. Close to beach. We prefer less busy so it wasn't a perfect match for us. The restaurant was yummy. The people were all very nice. Comfortable beds.

It was our anniversary trip and the reservation agent made sure to note that when booking, and promised a room upgrade. We arrived to find a standard room without a view and with a weird smell. Nothing special with the hotel itself but the location is great. We probably won’t be back considering the nicer hotels right on the beach have comparable rates, maybe 40 more per night.

A very accommodating Hilton Garden Inn Hotel. The hotel staff are friendly and stand ready to assist at any point throughout your stay. One of the best fitness centers I have had the experience of using and the outdoor pool was small but easily accessible. The only issue I had, which is rather minor, are the size of the pillows. Too many small pillows. Would prefer two large pillows vice the pillows that compress all the way down once you lay your head on them.

Stunning new hotel in Waikiki, very close to the beach, just walk thru the International Market place. Room was gorgeous, the only thing that bugged me was the doors slam shut, making it a not so peaceful time. I recommend they have quiet doors like they do in the Outrigger on the Beach. Otherwise its not relaxing and probably wouldn't stay there again.

We were very happy with our stay here for 13 nights. Great location, close to shopping malls and restaurants. 5 minutes walk to the beach - just across the road from International Market Place .Food Pantry supermarket right across the street! Fresh modern clean Hotel. Would definitely stay here again.

Stayed here for 10 nights we had an enjoyable stay. Staff were courteous and polite and amenities are good. Breakfast needs more added to the menu as it was limited. Apart from that the hotel is situated in a great position and very close to the international market place and a short walk to Waikiki beach. Also has a great pool with a bar which was a bonus. Highly recommended this hotel.

I booked the Hilton Garden Inn on Kuhio from October 7 to the 17th and it was a great experience. The location is superb with a food pantry across the street. The location is the best. Waikiki beach is a 5 minute walk. International market place is across the street. Many restaurants around including onsite. There is onsite laundry and one across the street if onsite is busy. My birthday occurred during my stay and the staff gifted me a card and a tin of cookies from Honolulu cookie company. What a great touch!The rooms are very spacious for 2 and have everything you need including mini fridge, Microwave and kettle.All transit is outside the door.Beds are most comfortable and the premises are very clean. I will stay here again my next visit.

I booked this hotel as a birthday present for a friend. When we arrived we were checked in right away and our digital key was activated but we were not greeted as Hilton Honors Members and not given the customary water or cookie. When we arrived to our room it was extremely small and hard to move around. We were tripping over our suitcases. (We only had two in total.) Also I booked a king size bed and was given a queen and was told it was a king. When we went to the front desk to inform of our issues we were told all rooms were the same and nothing they could do. The hotel is in a great location and since we were there to celebrate and not stay in the room 24/7 we made the most of it.

Very good location, price good and no resort fees, 3 blocks to Waikiki Beach! Staff was helpful and friendly offering advice. The rooms were clean and comfortable. It is not the high end but for location the price pint was fabulous. Would definitely recommend it.

This was probably the best hotel we stayed at on our recent trip to the USA. The room was large and in good condition. There was a fridge in the room. The bellman were helpful and there was a guest laundry. The pool and outdoor bar area were also good.There is a full supermarket right next door as well as local convenience/ABC stores. There is a bit of a wait for the breakfast buffet, if you go at peak time, but the buffet was good value. The hotel is right at the back of the international marketplace, so is very conveniently located. While not quite at the same level as some of the posh resorts right on the beach, this was a really good hotel and good value. We would return without hesitation.

Great location, close to both the beach and shops. Wonderful staff who were very attentive. Lovely pool for a cool off dip after a busy day sightseeing & shopping. Clean and modern lobby.Great room, good size! Very clean.Only negative was the laundry, two of the three dryers were broken... had to hang laundry around the room to dry. Otherwise a wonderful stay

A friend and I met here for breakfast. We both decided on the buffet. First, it was reasonably priced. They take your egg order at your table and they are very prompt with their service. The eggs were excellent. The buffet line wasn't that large. However, everything on it was well prepared. They had an assortment of juices and the coffee was really good. The server was very prompt and the price was $25 for the two of us. Reasonable in Waikiki.

When we arrived at Hilton Garden Inn at night around 9:30pm. We unloaded our luggage off the shuttle and I was expecting that some staff would help us as I was holding my kid in my arms, leaving my husband to the luggage. However, no one helped. There were about four or five bell staff just sitting there talking to each other. No one even acknowledged us or told us where the front desk was. The entrance where cars could stop is actually the side/back entrance so my husband had to lug two suitcases and two backpacks to the front desk and then up to our room by himself.When we asked for our luggage that we stored with them on the day we checked out, they didn't acknowledge us either. Our shuttle was already waiting for us in the driveway. There were 4 bell staff just standing around until I finally got one of the guys' attention and asked if they could get our luggage out of the storage room. He told me that someone will help us shortly. This annoyed me because they were all just doing nothing and finally two of them decided to go get our luggage a few minutes later.Other than the bell staff, the hotel is quite good. Room was clean. We had a suite and there was good amount of space for my toddler to run around. The AC is slightly loud. The elevator doors close quite fast on you and the wait can be long at times. The front desk staff were friendly. The pool is good but there's not much shade. Free coffee in the lobby in the morning; free juice in the afternoon. Great location and central to everything as it's right across from International Marketplace.

These hotel was everything we needed. Nice, clean and very welcoming but more important, the location is perfect. The Waikiki beach is 5 min walk, buses, convenient stores, dinning.... All within minutes of walk.

Hilton did an awesome job renovating this property. It is in a prime location for shopping in Waikiki. Right across from the new International Marketplace shopping mall and a bus stop right in front. Gold HH members can get breakfast buffet or pay $11.95 for registered hotel guest (otherwise $19) can’t beat the price for Waikiki! Pool is small as are the rooms so I wouldn’t recommend for extended stays or family with kids that want space and a pool. But there is a mini fridge and microwave in the room.

We stayed here on a Thursday and Friday night and have no complaints. Check in was a breeze. There is a souvenir shop on one end of the lobby and restaurant on the other end. We were on the fourth floor overlooking Saks and the street below. Although we didn't use the pool, it is on the third floor, overlooking Saks as well. We ate at the buffet ( ~$13), which was great. They offered made to order omelets, rice, potatoes, French toast sticks, waffles, bacon, sausage, pastries, cereal, oatmeal and a variety of fruit and fruit drinks. The valet staff was very friendly and helpful. I suggest calling down about 10-15 minutes before you need to leave so you don't have to wait for your vehicle. The hotel is conveniently located in the heart of Waikiki with several fun shopping and eating selections. Large flat screen television in the room and glass showers with an adjustable showerhead. I would certainly stay here again.

Had a wonderful island getaway at the Hilton Garden Inn in Waikiki with my family. Service and hospitality was exceptional. Would definitely recommend this property to friends and would definitely return to this property in any future trips to Waikiki.

We were very pleased with our 2 night stay here on our first visit to Hawaii. We wanted to spend a day seeing Pearl Harbor with a small group tour and then move on to a week on the Big Island, so we had not focused much on Honolulu except as a stopover. We had actually considered staying near the airport to avoid hassles with traffic. But the friendly, helpful staff and nice room at the Hilton Garden convinced us that when we return to Hawaii in the future, with the inevitable connection through Honolulu, we will probably stay here again. Waikiki is a fun place and the staff showed a genuine interest in making sure we enjoyed our brief time there. Our flight from Los Angeles was delayed by nearly 2 hours and we arrived tired and well into the dinner hour, but one of the concierges magically got us a virtually "no wait" reservation at the very popular Roy's. At the other end of the pricing scale, we were encouraged to try breakfast at the nearby Marukame Udon - another hit! One of the concierges, Kenia, who had already drawn routes on a map and helped us with a dinner reservation on our second night, saw us in the morning to ask how we had enjoyed it. When she heard we were headed for the Big Island, she told us she was from Kona and wrote out a list of restaurants to try there! Even the staff at the taxi entrance were also exceptionally friendly and helpful with suggestions as we waited for our group tour van.Impressions about staff attitude last longer than impressions about views and furnishings, and six weeks later I still have very positive memories of our stay here.

We stayed here one night pre-cruise and two night post cruise. On our first night we had a lower level room without any views. Our second stay we were on a higher floor and had great views and a much nicer view. Employees were nice but couldn't give you much info on things around town. We booked tickets through the concierge and got wrong information through him too. Hotel was nice enough and we loved the location.

I had stayed in this hotel before the renovation and becoming Hilton Garden Inn. I was impressed with the changes. The room was nice and clean. All staff was very professional. My only complaint would be with the buffet breakfast. It was not very good.

The hotel is in a great location and the front desk and tour staff were very helpful. The downside was the maintenance anything that had broken down never seems to get repaired, coin operated clothes dryers and washing machines were near,y all out of order and had been for weeks. Couldn't get coffee in the cafe as the machine was broken All of this was trivial, but sad to say you need to watch your possessions in your room. Only little things, nothing we noticed at first and to small to make a complaint about as it sounded so silly, but a box of Hawaiian Cookies, then some new socks that were in a bag with sneakers we purchased. When I got home I realised that I didn't have the earrings I bought from Pandora and had put on the TV stand.Didn't spoil our trip, but I couldn't stay here again. I've travelled all around the world and this is the first time this has ever happened to me

Stayed for 8 nights recently and the room was very comfortable and clean. The entire staff ( especially Alana) was always very helpful. Having the restaurant and market in the lobby was also convenient. Pool was small but we spent time mostly on the beach. The location was also close to everything. We would highly recommend!

Got this reservation on short notice. I was welcomed by Justin at the front desk for check in. I mentioned it was my birthday next day and he made sure to recognize my birthday by upgrading me to a partial ocean view room and also to give me a few complimentary items from the restaurant. This really sealed the deal for me and I ended up staying at the hotel for 2 additional nights. The breakfast is amazing, so much variety, fresh fruit and lots of options. Great staff in the restaurant for breakfast.The hotel is only a couple of blocks from the beach, easy walk and shopping everywhere. Big secret the hotel is close to 1 of the best kept secret in Waikiki for food items at the Food Pantry. We visited everyday to stock up on wine and beer plus snacks of all kinds. The staff overall is very friendly and accommodating. I asked the bell hop to reserve a taxi for me to the airport the morning of our departure but it was done. I had to scramble at the last minute to get someone else to take us to the airport. My husband loved the balcony and the pool on the 3rd floor. You don't need a bigger pool, people are on vacation for lounging around not exercising for the ones who complain about the size. The beach is near by for swimming. This hotel is worth every dollar you spend. Rooms are small but ideal for couples plus in Waikiki nobody is spending time in the room, you are at the beach or shopping! Thanks once again Hilton Garden Inn Waikiki for making my visit memorable.

My family and I went last month for a family vacation. My dad is a Hilton honors member and most Hilton hotels we have stayed at are good. When we booked the hotel there was a promotion going on for members, but even without the membership prices seemed really good for a Hilton hotel. The hotel's location was probably the best thing about the hotel. It it's a couple blocks away from the beach, and across the street from the International market place. Overall location was great. So close to everything you can just walk. Overall is a clean hotel when you walk in and what not. The rooms were a lot smaller than we thought, especially for what normal rates are. Also even after we left the hotel room all day we can back around midday/evening/dinner time and housekeeping still hadn't made it to our room. Some days we saw them a couple rooms down, we left thinking they'd get to ours soon, come back and they had left the floor without getting to our room yet. They didn't come back until late. Very inconvenient. Sometimes we'd have to call for them to come clean. Pool is small for how big the hotel is. Oh on the plus side the valet guys were great! Car was there by the time we got downstairs and they had great recommendations and help with directions. Probably won't stay here again next time in Waikiki. Even on sale.

The check-in and check-out was fast, easy and with a smile. The rooms were very large with all the things you need for a relaxing time. I love the shower, it had a folding bench and I actually feel asleep while showering. Great location a block from the beach, shopping and eateries all around.

We emailed the hotel with our room preferences for our wedding anniversary trip to Hawaii. On arrival we were given a room next to the lift which rings loudly each time it arrives & an ice making machine, we were also in a corner next to a wall and directly overlooked other rooms! It appears they ignored our request ! When we complained they moved us to another room which was better, but nothing special for the price we paid, but having said this our room was kept clean and tidy for the duration of our stay, with plenty of soft white towels for our use. When we asked where our room was the receptionist pointed to the lift but there was no one around to assist us with our luggage.The swimming pool here is small and above a main road which can be noisy, but there's always lots of sun loungers available any time of day.On checkout we had no offer of assistance with our luggage, and found the reception staff very disinterested in our stay.As Hilton Honour members we expected a much better service than we received.
user_name:
RonandMo61
Isle of Man, United Kingdom

review_body: The hotel itself is nice and clean. However, I experienced so many problems during my stay for 6 days. 1. the valet people takes a long time to get the car - sometimes, I had to wait for 20+ minutes. I ended up parking my car in a different garage a few times because I didn't want to deal with this hotel's parking 2. the front desk staff and guest service staff were untrained. They took my luggage tag saying that they were going to get my luggage delivered to my room. However, 40 minutes later, no luggage. I called the guest service several times - first few times, she didn't react...then after 3rd call, she finally reacted and told me that she found my luggage tag still sitting at the front desk. Then she tells me that it will take some time for the bell staff to deliver my luggage as they are understaffed and they have a long queue...so I ended up going downstairs to get my own luggage, as I was late to go to my cousin's wedding. It took literally 1.5 hours from the time I gave my luggage tag to when I was able to get my luggage (and I had to get it myself!). And on top of that, no apology from any of the staff. 3. I had the breakfast tickets due to my HHonor status, where I had the option to go to the restaurant or get some espresso drinks + food at the store. But, the espresso machine was broken the entire time I was there. I had to go buy espresso drinks somewhere else outside the hotel.

Great location one street back from the beach front and right opposite the International Market. The hotel was modern, clean and tidy. Our room was great - very comfortable bed and had a small balcony with 2 chairs and a table. Could've done with more drawer space. There were just 2 small ones one either side of the bed. For stays longer than a couple of days it's nice to get your clothes out of the cases and stored away. Bathroom was well appointed and had everything you needed. My needs are few but a decent shower, hairdryer and an iron are a must and the he's were all available. Staff were friendly and helpful

We only spent one night on Oahu before going to Kauai. The hotel was nice and in a great location. It was a good one night hotel after a long travel day. If you are spending more time there, make sure to get an ocean view. If you don't, you're overlooking other hotels/parking lot. It didn't matter for us, but I could see how that would be a negative.

This is a beautiful hotel in a very convenient location. Staff could not be nicer and they make you feel special and appreciated. They know you have choices of where to stay and they truly want to make your stay special.
user_name:
Mary A W
Pulaski, TN, United States

review_body: Very clean walking distance to all activity And just across the street from international market. Down side if renting a car the parking in hotel is 35 a night + tips each time they fetch the car. But a very clean nice place.

Nice newer hotel in Waikiki, convenient location, NOT on the beach, but right in the heart of everything. Offers nice amenities, friendly staff, one restaurant on property and breakfast/store with good choices. Clean and comfortable
user_name:
Debra K
VIRGINIA BEACH, United States

review_body: Excellent location, value and cleanliness. Located near everything, near shopping, restaurants and transportation. Just a few block away from beach. Help desk was extremely helpful with transportation and tours choices.

Nice new hotel, great bar and happy hour. But....the elevators were in an out of service over our 2 week stay - LONG wait times, the water was shut off for repairs and our request for early room cleaning service was missed. Parking is pricey at $35 daily and I believe off site - it can take a while for your car to arrive. Once they get the mechanics fixed should be fine but honestly, you can do better at this price point if you look.

My third stay. Very comfortable rooms. Some room layouts are better than others so don't be afraid to change rooms. The location is great: two blocks to the beach, market across the street, bus stop next door, and near many good restaurants. The help at this hotel is very good and accommodating. Looking forward to my next stay.

We stayed here for 2 nights, the hotel is an old hotel that has been newly renovated, we found the room a disappointment, our balcony was overlooking a high rise building and car park, after specifically telling the hotel we were there for a special occasion. We found the standard of cleaning, as I had read previously from other TA reviews was an issue, to be true...marks on the floor, toilet roll nearly empty on arrival, marks on the doona cover and an overall slight smell of smoke. We found concierge staff helpful and the location of the hotel great for shopping and restaurants, however did not feel we were staying at a Hilton and would not spend the money we did to return. Every time we went to use the lifts we would stand there for at least 5-10 minutes waiting and often had to climb the stairs to get to our room. They need more lifts or more efficient lifts for a hotel of that size!

My husband, myself and my best friend had the pleasure of visiting the this hotel. After reading some of the recent reviews, I was concerned that I may have made the wrong choice. Much to liking, this place was wonderful! The hotel was extremely clean and the benifit from Diamond status of complimentary breakfast was plus. All of the workers were extremely pleasant and polite. We were created immediately and bell hop took our luggage. I checked-in and was given a slight upgrade. Typically being Diamond status, I am upgraded more, however I understand this is busy property in a tourist area. The room was adequate and I enjoyed having the vanity and sink in the room in the room rather than in the bathroom. We were able to get showered and dressed more timely. The hotel is a short 6 minutes from the beach. There were many restaurants nearby. The pool was very clean, but is a bit small. There were some unruly children splashing everyone which was a bit annoying. The bar serves awesome drinks which are reasonably priced along with complimentary fruit infused water. I was a bit disappointed there was no snacks or tapas available at the pool bar. Unfortunately, the safe didn't work in the room. I informed the front desk, but chose to not have maintenance come to repair it. There was not an ice machine on my floor. I originally asked to be close to an ice machine, but I assume the "upgraded" room was not near an ice machine. The balcony was small, but clean and did provide an indirect view of the sea. I would not recommend anyone to utilize the Expedia desk. The woman seemed disoriented and overcharged us for excursions. The vendor at the helicopter ride informed us of the error and assisted in having it refunded. By the way, the excursions were awesome. I asked for late checkout which was accommodated for a late afternoon flight. I would definitely stay here in the future! Justin was extremely friendly during check out. My stay was pretty close to be perfect!

Could not have been more pleased. Excellent rooms. Outstanding accommodations. Close to beach, shopping, dining, nitelife. Staff were extremely friendly and accommodating. I will be returning and hopefully soon.

Overall this hotel was nice great location and very clean, the laundry facilities were not all working should be on more than one floor and the lifts were a bit slow. Was suppose to be non smoking but people were smoking on their balconies need cameras to catch the ones that spoil it for others.

I stayed at this hotel for 4 nights during work travel. The hotel is situated in a great place in Waikiki beach. The hotel service at the front desk are very friendly, I arrived early so my room was not ready. They held my luggage for me and I had time to explore the town. The hotel is walking distance to a lot of restaurants, shops and the beach. I came back later in the afternoon and my room was ready. The room was a great size for me and it was clean. It does not have beach views but that is ok since the beach is so close. If I was to travel for work or pleasure I would definitely stay at this hotel again

Stayed here for 6 nights, couldn't fault it. Very comfortable bed, clean and tidy room with coffee machine, microwave, balcony. Great location right across the road from International Marketplace. Food Pantry across the road for groceries and bus stops right there as well. Would def stay here again :)

First let me say that this was our honeymoon booked at the last minute due to hurricane Irma we couldn't go to PR. I say that because it was already a stressful time with a wedding and then having to cancel and book another honeymoon. Upon arrival we were excited, both of our first times in Hawaii. Upon checking in the woman at the desk didn't even greet me! NO aloha or anything...just a "name?" WOW!! I still smiled and told her our name. Explained this was our honeymoon etc. "Oh, ok" is all I got. The gentleman next to her working looked over at her screen while helping the couple who rode the shuttle from the airport with us and said "shoot" and then proceeds to tell that couple that they were upgraded to a King with an ocean view! So I asked about being upgraded and was told no. We finished and went to our room. Our king with a city view was clean but the view was horrendous! It looked like project/ghetto buildings all around! I started to cry just overwhelmed from everything. My husband went down to try and speak with someone but was told there was nothing they could do and that the other couple was upgraded because they were some kind of members. LIES..if that was true why did he even look at the woman who was helping us screen and say "shoot" because they probably had a double or something and he was going to give them the upgrade to king but with a city view NOT ocean. Listen, I know they're NOT obligated to upgrade us, BUT the woman not properly greeting us set the negative tone that I didn't appreciate. It would have been a great gesture to upgrade the newlyweds. The interaction from the woman at the desk was just unacceptable! I emailed Hilton while there and they said there was nothing they could do since I was still staying there. Whatever. Greeting guests in a positive, nice manner is customer service/hospitality 101. I guess not here. The rooftop was a nice area, pool was small. The last night we wanted to wash some clothes and there was only a few machines maybe a total of 4-5 and 1 washer and dryer that were broken. People were waiting and complaining. Ridiculous for a hotel this large to have such few machines and then some broken. We went across the street to a Laundromat and washed there with no wait. No good sleep in that bed, mattress probably should be turned.

Couldn't fault our stay. Hotel had all that we needed - clean comfortable room, fridge, microwave, balcony, laundry, towels for the beach etc. Short walk to the beach, less than 5 mins. Supermarket across the street or convenience store on ground floor. Would definitely stay again. Bus stops to all the major sites and airport on next block 1 min walk away.

Housekeeping staff was awful. Valet and bellmen were wonderful. At least 1 of 4 elevators was not functioning. Room was very damp. We couldn't get hung up towels, clothes, swimwear to day. All beefed up getting sick.

I really enjoyed my stay at this hotel! The location is very convenient to shopping, restaurants, and the beach. It is clean inside and out. The staff is professional and friendly, eager to make one's stay pleasing. Our bed was comfortable, making for a good night's sleep after hiking Diamond Head and long exploratory walks!
user_name:
Sheree B
San Francisco, California, United States

review_body: This hotel is in an excellent location close to shops and restaurants, service was generally pretty good. Facilities and breakfast service was good most of the time. My room was bit tired though, carpet fell a bit worn out and bathtub did not work properly hence the very good rather than excellent

The hilton garden in just been refurbished. The wife and i spent 10 days there as part of our island hopping honeymoon. Rooms are clean and tidy. Facilities are very well maintained. Staff are very friendly and helpful. They learnt our routine and when we left in morning even if we were pack an hour later room was done. Well worth the money. Restaurant attached so you don't have to go out if you dont want.Highly recommend

Clean modern hotel lobby/rooms. Close to international market place, restaurants, abc stores on the main strip of waikiki. Couple blocks from the beach, complimentary beach towels offered on 3rd floor by the pool. Rooms were very clean with modern interior and decoration along with keurig and electric water kettle. Complimentary coffee/tea in the morning and fruit infused water in the lobby (day time only). Valet parking on the side of hotel not the front - no issue great experience. Great hotel for the price and quality in comparison to Hilton Hawaiian village, I prefer the new modern style of this hotel and would recommend for those who do not mind walking a couple blocks to the beach (easy to access by walking through international market place). Would highly recommend and no resort fees.

Super nice and the staff was very helpful. The location was super convenient, and great cafe in the hotel. Rooms were nice and modern. I loved the fact that you couldn't hear any noise from your room.

We were very pleased with this hotel. It is centrally situated and not far from the beach and shopping. There is a guest laundry and a lovely pool area. We took advantage of the free wifi too. The staff were very accommodating and helpful

Hotel staff very pleasant, facility clean, housekeeping personnel was awesome. Hotel in the heart of Waikiki in walking distances to awesome Restaurants and shopping(some very high end), only 1 block to Waikiki beach.

i visit honolulu often and i have been staying at the hilton garden inn waikiki since its opening.this hotel is in a great location ,a small but nice pool and deck area and the lobby is a comfortable place to cool your jets while waiting for your room or using the hotels wifi.however the big hiccup started at check in this time when the rather robotic agent,while acknowledging my gold member status with free bottles of water and breakfast coupons ,could not show enough independent thinking in honoring a request that i had in a previous visit asked for and received with gracious generosity .i did not pursue it further but instead left a message with the general manager melinda who immediately apologized for my disappointment and offered to make it right.very much to my satisfaction.my faith and good humor was restored . thank you again melinda ! you and your hotel rock !
user_name:
Cynthia L
los angeles, United States

review_body: I am a Hilton Honors Member. Recently we were forced to extend our Hawaii vacation since our airport in Houston was closed. I immediately checked Hilton Hotels in Waikiki. I found the Hilton Garden Inn. The staff there was wonderful. Finding the entrance to park our car was difficult, but we managed. When we checked in the staff member asked why we were staying at their hotel. We told them we were from Houston Texas and because of Hurricane Harvey our Houston airport was closed.As soon as they heard this and saw that my daughter had a one year old , she upgraded them to a suite so the baby could take a nap without being disturbed. Amazing and so thoughtful of them. Also they put our room , the grandparents, on the same floor. Then after we get settled we receive a card and gift of the famous Hawaiian cookies. The note was from Kerry and her staff. What a nice gesture. I loved this hotel. Every morning we enjoyed a great buffet breakfast using hotel vouchers to reduce the costs.Thank You Hilton Garden Inn in Waikiki.

I spent 8 nights at the Hilton Garden Inn in Waikiki and it was very enjoyable and comfortable. My room was upgrated to the 15th floor and I enjoyed the city view. The staff was friendly and very kind to meet all my needs. I had no problems at all.

We booked this hotel last minute after deciding to change hotels. They put us into a one bedroom suite on the 18th floor, with two queen size beds, a sitting area and a large bathroom. We required an accessible room as my mother is in a wheelchair and this was perfect for her. There was plenty of room for her to manoeuvre around with the wheelchair. The room was clean and tidy, the beds were comfy and there was plenty of space for us to put our luggage. The room had a kettle and a microwave, which came in very handy. The hotel itself is situated a block back from the beach, and there is a small shopping centre on the corner. It's very quiet but still in a fantastic location - you just need to walk through the International Marketplace and you are at the main drag of Waikiki Beach. The service was great; we didn't have a problem. There is also a $12 breakfast buffet.My only complaint would be that there is no room service available, but other than that I couldn't fault this hotel. There are also laundry facilities available which were a real lifesaver.If I was returning to Waikiki I would definitely stay here again.

The room was not cleaned properly. I also marked towels for two people. I only have one, and I clean the basin with water, Coffee refill is not available. I took it off. I tried to check in. I did not hear any guarantees about Hilton Honors or anything else.
user_name:
Hyun Duk S
inchoen, South Korea

review_body: We stay here recently to celebrate our 30 th wedding anniversary, after checking inn we went to our room to find we had two king singles in there so I rang the front desk to ask if we could move to a room with a queen size bed and were told we had to ring our travel agent in Australia and see if they could change the booking. I explained we were there for our 30th wedding anniversary but it fell on deaf ears so I wasn't very impressed.The next day I found out via my credit card company who was checking on fraudulent activity that the hotel had taken a deposit on my card BUT I was not informed, I don't mind them doing that but you should tell the customer who then approves it.Overall the hotel is a very nice place located one block back from the main drag so you get less traffic and pedestrian noise. It is located near all the main places you need to go and has a great supermarket across the road. The rooms are a good size with great TV, free wifi, kettle and microwave oven. The hotel also has a great little restaurant downstairs that offer great breakfast and dinner. The lifts can a little slow at peak times but other than that we would stay here again. aloha!

The Ocean view room, high floor, is terrific. Very good location. Spacious. Nice and modern furniture. Bath and shower very clean. A small problem with smell from the drain, could be solved with a better training. Elevators always full.

I did a one night stay at the Hilton Garden Inn in Waikiki Hawaii. This hotel opened around 1 year ago under the Hilton Garden Inn brand. I was shocked how dirty this hotel was. I booked a suite with what they list as a large private lānai (patio). This is one of the most expensive rooms in this hotel. The issues started with this hotel at check in. I used the app to check in and was sent a message that my room was ready and my app was a digital key, the instructions told me to go directly to my suite. Well there was an error on the app and the door would not open.. So off to the desk. The check in process was cold and argumentative. The agent told me I was checking in early and that is why the digital key did not work. I showed him the message the app sent me “Your Room is Ready”. He looked at me and just said I have to check. He gave me real keys and off the room 335. When I walked into the room I started to notice it was not very clean, the floor had shoe marks all over the tile floor. Then I looked at to the large private patio that was listed as the highlight of the room. I was shocked to find cigarette buts all over the chairs and ground. The tables were full of black dirt, along with bird crap all over the outdoor sofa. The patio was also in need of a power wash. How long was it like this? Trust me it was not something that happened overnight. It was a disgrace. I then started to look around the room to find food stuck to the back splash of the kitchenette, sticky soda like stains all over the sliding doors that separated the living spaces. Holes in the walls, urine stains around the toilet just and just a lack of basic cleaning for a hotel with the Hilton Garden Inn name on it. I took some photos and went back to the desk.. This time a nice young lady asked what she could do. I started to show her the photos and she took charge of the situation and asked if I would send the photos so she could show her management, I did text them to a number she provided. She was upset by the state of the room and started to look for a suite to move to into. She moved me to a suite on the 20th floor, this was a clear downgrade as the sitting room was tiny and you had to step over furniture to walk thru it. I know the room I booked was one of the largest suites and there was only 2 with the large patio. The balcony in the new suite was tiny and to get out the door you had to roll over the bed as it was so close to the sliding door. Now this room was cleaner but still I could find issues and there is a clear lack of care when cleaning a room. There was a nickel coin in plan sight under the bathroom vanity.. I guess they do not clean the floor between guest. I did get a voice mail on the hotel room phone from a front desk manager, and I later meet up with him to chat about the room. He was very apologetic and said it was not normal. Yet the amount of dirt on the table on the patio of the first suite was like that for a long time. I did bring up the fact that my new suite also had issues with cleanliness yet that was passed over by him. The manager told me I would be the topic of the next days staff stand up meeting. I found the wording odd, that “I” would be the topic not the state of the suite. I was never offered any type of compensation for my experience. To make matters worse they still charged me for the suite I booked after they had to downgrade me to a smaller suite. Nothing! Just a lot of talk and apologies. I was not going to make a big deal of my experience but my experience at check out put me over the edge. The same guy who gave me a hard time at check in asked me at check out “how was everything?”.. I replied “could have been a lot better and I wish I got the room I booked” he looked at me and said “sorry you did not like your first room” and then went on with the check out process. So this tells me I was not the topic of the meeting or I was the topic of the meeting and it was that I complained about the room. When heading out I stoped in the lobby bathroom (key access) and it was so very dirty. I have been a Hilton Diamond for over 12 years and have been in Hilton brands for thousands of nights all around the world. This hotel could be nice (yet more like a Hampton Inn) if they had a staff the cared. The simple things. Every issue was because of careless staff and a management team that do not walk the hotel and check it. Sad really. I did contact corp Hilton and they made things right and refunded the cost of my stay because Hilton Garden Inn has a "Our Promise""We promise to do whatever it takes to ensure you’re satisfied, or you don’t pay. You can count on us. GUARANTEED™. The Hilton Garden Inn Promise reflects our focus on hospitality and integrity. We are committed to providing an excellent hotel experience for every guest, every time." Again sad the local hotel did not offer this and I had to go to the corp office.

The service is excellent, very clean hotel and the staff are friendly. We are going to go back someday. Thank you all, Mahalo for your friendly service and accommodation. A great and memorable experience.

After reading so many negative reviews about this property, I was very happy with my stay. I even thought that those other people must have stayed at a different hotel. Yes the elevators can be busy at peak times, what the hurry. Took the stairs most of the time. The only thing I found odd was that the ice machines were on different floors, better than none. The A/C water pressure, pool, restaurant were all fine. Didn't have a car so no complaints with the price of valet parking, pretty much the same at any hotel in Waikiki.

Great location for the price, quiet and very clean. But the staff were not overall welcoming nor helpful when they gave us the wrong room. Pool is ok, but the bar prices are dear with no Happy Hour. Satyed at many Honolulu hotels and this is one of the better ones. A positive is that it does not have a hotel surcharge for the bus etc.

My family and I stayed here for five nights during our vacation.The rooms are not that big so comfort will depend on your family size.The hotel is located in close proximity to many restaurants,the beach,mall,and more.It was nice just walking out of the hotel and being in the midst of Waikiki.The customer service meets standards.The pool area is nice as it is a rooftop pool area on about the third floor.The only downfall was housekeeping as one day housekeeping was not up to par thus rating of a four.Overall,I would recommend this hotel.

Excellent location in Waikiki, not beachfront but near to shops and restaurants. Excellent value for money as the standard of service and amenities is very high. I recommend this hotel for short stays in Honolulu.

We spent two nights here. The hotel (about 10 minutes walk from the beach) looks to have been recently renovated. The room that we had on the ninth floor was fine for two adults and two teenage kids. No breakfast was included. There is a grocery shop linked to the hotel which proved useful as it is open late. We made the mistake, however, of looking around for breakfast outside the hotel and ended up paying about $65 for four. We should have taken the buffet breakfast in the hotel ($12 pp). It would have been cheaper.

After having rough experience with other hotels. This hotel was a sight for sore eyes. Has a nice place to eat right next to it. Conveniently next to international shopping center. Would defiantly book again.

Great location, great place to stay, prices is reasonable! Staff is very helpful and are Friendly, perfect place to stay while in Waikiki, close to everything. Beach is a quick walk away and some rooms have great ocean view. Perfect place to stay whether alone or with family.

All the hotel staff was excellent, from the desk, the concierge, the parking and house keeping. We ate breakfast a few times, very good. Also the store connected (something like ABC stores) was very convient.

Hotel is beautiful and has a great staff. The restaurant's breakfast is well worth the discounted price for hotel guests. The internet was good, speedy, and reliable. The only hiccup was that we had to wait passed the regular check-in time to get a room and even then, we had to be moved to a low-floor room which wasn't nearly as nice just to get into something without waiting into the evening. Housekeeping wasn't done in the room until well after 3p each day. Otherwise, location, too, was really good and short walk to beach, bars, and shops. I would recommend to others.

This property is beautiful and centrally located. Once you step out of the hotel, you can cross the street and find yourself at the International Market Place which has stores and restaurants. The strip on Kuhio Ave has tons of stores and restaurants as well. The hotel is literally 2 blocks from the beach. Valet parking only at $35 a night with in and out privileges. The staff is very nice and friendly. There's also a little convenience store attached to the hotel which has everything!

This hotel is about 2 blocks from the Waikiki beach. The room was clean but the Two Double Bed Deluxe Room was smaller than I expected. Staff is courteous and friendly. The Fire Grill restaurant downstairs is excellent. Try the Avocado Chicken Flat Bread from the take out menu, it is amazing.This hotel has valet parking; no self parking available. Valet parking uses more than a gallon of gas. On the day before my return flight I filled my rental car with full tank of gas because I didn't want to stop for gas on the way to my early morning flight. However, when I got the car from valet parking more than a gallon of gas was gone, so I had to stop for gas. I am guessing the offsite-parking used by valet parking is more than 10 miles away, for them to use that much gas. Either that or the valet parking took my car for a nice ride (my rental car was a BMW X5, got a great deal on that at Alamo).

This is a decent place to stay for business while in Hawaii. The room was comfortable and quiet. The price was decent for the hotel. If you are on vacation, the pool is nice with a bar right at the pool and it is two blocks from the beach. There is room for improvement. I prefer a room on the highest floor furthest from the elevator, I was put on the third floor of what must be at least 20 floors. This just happens to be the same floor as the pool which if I was on vacation would be nice but I was on business and had to walk by this noisy place every day and get on the elevator with wet people. The valet parking is weird and no matter how long ahead I called down my car was never ready. The neighborhood this hotel is in is not very nice. My room looked out over the valet parking on to a grocery store. The room has the sink in the entry way with the shower and toilet separate. There is not a desk but a table and a couch so working in my room was difficult.

This hotel was a great place to stay in Waikiki. It is very close to Cheesecake Factory, Dukes and tons of shopping. The only issue we had was the fire alarm kept going off but I am sure it was just do to a temporary maintenance problem. We would definitely stay here again!

This was my first time staying at this property which appears to have been recently redone. The hotel staff was very friendly on arrival, and the lobby was beautiful. Lots of things to do around the hotel and it is right across the street from a grocery store which made it easy to get snacks and food for the room which is equipped with both a microwave and refrigerator. The pool is quite small but there is a large area with chairs and also some chairs on multiple floors throughout the hotel, lots of space to get some sun! Will for sure stay here again.

We were only booked to stay here for 1 night before we checked into the Hawaiian Villages a few blocks away. We arrived before check in, was upgraded to the top floor (20th) with a spectacular view of the mountainside, and had a spacious room with a huge walkout balcony. Being a diamond member we received free breakfast vouchers, premium internet, and water bottles daily. The staff was friendly, the rooms were clean, and the Property is centrally located to everything. Best of all- no resort fees. To be honest, I wish I had booked here the entire time. For those of you on the fence about where to stay and don't mind a blockOr two Walk to the beach, this is your place!

Slow, ineffective with responding to customers complaints. Only thing good about this experience was the quickness in getting our car from the parking garage.
