The embarrassing moment was when my wife went to restaurant and had our Gift Card denied. The card was issued by Hilton Corp Office. Reason given for denial was computers were not up to date to accept payment via gift card. Inexcusable.

As A family with 1 kid and 1 baby I was looking to be outside the Main Street but still close to be able to walk. Found the Hilton garden inn and it was the best decision to have booked there. Just a block away to Waikiki beach and in front of the international market. We arrived very early around 6am and when you have a 6 months old baby the only thing you want is to be in your room, they were happy for us to check in as our room was ready. We had a 1 bedroom suite, it was very spacious. The bathroom was huge, the bedroom was good and the living room too. A plus they had a fridge and a microwave, definitely need that when you have kids. Everything was clean as it is a new hotel you also get free coffee at the lobby every morning and also free refreshing water in the afternoon. The pool is great, there is a bar and free refreshing water as well. I have always like the Hilton, this one was very good and affordable. Will definitely recommend and come back.

Excellent hotel close to good food, shopping and the beach. Renting a car was just across the street. Highly recommend since it was recently renovated and has a microwave and mini-refrigerator which is very convenient.

I stayed here on a layover as I had an early flight in the morning and arrived late (and there aren't a lot of great choices near the airport).The hotel is pretty centrally located near the Marketplace. It was a few blocks from the beach (but it was dark when I arrived and when I departed in the morning so didn't see it this trip!). The hotel did have decent city views from the room I had and I was high enough not to hear any city noise (as this part of Waikiki tends to be pretty loud at night). The rooms were relatively spacious (I've had much smaller in this area) and felt very clean and new. The bathroom was a little disjointed with the sink and everything in the main part of the room and the toilet/shower in a separate room (which was totally fine just a little odd). Staff was super friendly and talkative.

We stayed as a guest of Hilton Honors (on loyalty points) so the three nights there were essentially free. The rooms were comfortable, the hotel is located beautifully about two blocks from the beach and right across the street from a swank shopping mall. There was plenty of shopping and restaurants nearby so we did not rent a car (another cost savings). We made use of the concierge to book two trips (a tour of the Arizona memorial at Pearl Harbor and a day trip to the Polynesian Cultural Center). Handled perfectly.Free breakfast included in the hotel restaurant which I enjoyed (my wife was wishing for bagels and lox, which they did not have).All in all, for us, it was a lovely hotel.

This hotel works just fine for those visiting Honolulu on business. I stayed for six nights. The hotel is directly across the street from the International Marketplace and two "blocks" from Waikiki Beach. There are many restaurants at your door step, and lots of "excitement" in the streets with the many tourists walking about.The room (Deluxe City View with Sofa) was a bit cramp, but work just fine for a single person. Storage space is a premium, though. There were not drawers, just a space for hanging clothes. (The wardrobe also houses the safe.) Modern toilet/shower "closet" with pocket door. Sink is outside the toilet/shower "closet." Adequate TV with cable options. Overall, clean room.Refrigerator, microwave, and coffee pot included in the room.The views from the City View room is what you would expect. However, the hotel advertises partial ocean view rooms. Given the hotel's location, I would not recommend spending the additional money for a partial ocean view room.There is a supermarket right across the street from the hotel, which is convenient if you wish to pick up some items for your stay. The hotel does have a rather large store attached to it, which offers breakfast pastries and bagels. (The bagels were fine, even for this New Yorker.) It also has a restaurant but it was not something I visited.Overall, I would consider this hotel again when visiting Honolulu for business. I would opt for someone else when traveling with family or for a romantic getaway.

We loved that the hotel was central and near to the beach and other resort amenities.The Hotel staff are all welcoming and friendly and the room is serviced everyday.We ate in the restaurant on two occasions and found this to be appropriately priced .The breakfast was especially good.There is a coffee shop / supermarket attached to the hotel and the plain toasted bagels and coffee are especially good value there. We loved every minute of our 10 night stay.The pool is rather small though however, on the upside ,the pool area is spotlessly clean and well kept. The pool bar is staffed by pleasant and friendly staff .

This is the second time we have stayed at this hotel. When transfered to Kwajalein Atoll Jan 2017 we stayed two nights. On return Jul 19-22 2017 family vacation we stayed there for 3 days. This is a great hotel in a wonderful location. You can walk to any place in Waikiki within about 10 minutes. Directly across the street from The International Shopping Mall. The customer service is out of this world. The conserige went out of his way to accomendate our needs.

Used to stay here years ago when it was Ohana West so was interested to see what Hilton had done with the refurbPositives1) the location is still great - whilst not being on the main street the renovation work that has been done to Kuhio has bought back a great buzz and eating options2) great to have clean, fresh newer hotel in Waikiki...was noticeable when you went through other hotels3) the expansion of the pool, plus adding in much better access with wide steps was fantasticNegatives 1) there were no drawers in the room - i dont like to live out of my suitcase when im staying for ten days so like to put often used items in drawers for easy access - i was totally out of luck! the only two drawers in the room were in the bedside cabinet2) the pool bar - whilst it was the West it had a great vibe, was a busy little place with great drink options and some easy bar snacks - to say its now the saddest hotel bar ive visited is being polite - a very poor attempt from the Hilton and would take very few changes to get this humming and to help pick up the atmosphere around the pool areaWould I stay again? Yes if my preferred hotel wasn't available as was the case this time. But it didn't wow me enough to become my new fav in Waikiki.

Newly renovated and decorated. Rooms are nicely done but especially appreciated the larger bathrooms even though they needed more clothes hooks in the bathroom and the shower. Beds were very comfortable with lovely white linen. Had a room overlooking the street which got the sun on the balcony in the morning. Had little wait time for the lifts which was a nice change. Spent many hours by the pool which has been upgraded. It badly needs a handle bar along and around the inside pool wall to have something to hold on to. Was nice to be able to get a drink at the pool bar. Plenty of beach towels available and very clean. Location is great, a short walk to the main street and the beach. Kuhio Street has been redesigned and now has good footpaths, eating places and shops. A modern, clean hotel in a good location
user_name:
Sally S
Auckland Region, New Zealand

review_body: I really liked how close the hotel was to everything. Just a few blocks from Waikiki Beach. The hotel pool is pretty small, and the website states it has a poolside bar/grill, but this is not true. I think it would have made the stay so much more enjoyable. Also, the rooms are pretty small. If you plan to stay for longer than a week, you will feel extremely cramped. I will say that all the staff that we had contact with were very friendly. Overall, the hotel was pretty average. When we go back, we will probably stay at another hotel. Not that there was anything particularly terrible about the hotel, there are just more in the area for the same price point with more amenities. Also next time, I want to be closer to the beach.

hotel in good location. needs to address layout of bathroom. You have to navigate aroubd toilet to get in and out of shower. Breakfast great. Beds were not made, doona was just pulled up, sheet not straightened Staff were great

This was our very first time staying at the Hilton Garden Inn Waikiki. Great location, wonderful staff! Everyone was always very cordial and accommodating. The location is right in the middle of where it all happens. Walking distance to a lot of great eateries, right across from the International Market place. Would definitely stay here again!

I came for a few days to check out a work opportunity. The hotel was a pleasant surprise. Great location and excellent service! I loved that there was a convenient store attached, very handy! Would definitely come back!

Arrived at 11 AM noon by the time we got to hotel they let us in Early due to Diamond Status trade off was 4th floor of 20. Room was decent high ceilings small deck king bed comfortable and fridge with microwave. Worked out great moderatly priced would stay again for short term stay

Room was dirty, no desk for working at. Sink did not drain. Housekeeping was substandard. Staff was rude. Would not stay again given the price and accommodations. This is not a typical Hilton property.

Booked this hotel as a package deal. We were on our way home from New Zealand and stopped here for 3 days to break up the long flights. This is just an average Hilton (a little dated) however the staff was warm and welcoming from the get go. Every question, any assistance no matter big or small they were happy to help. Even after getting in our room early and realizing this room wasn't going to work for us, I went to the front desk, explained and the gentleman behind the desk upgraded us to a suite with a view for a very reasonable upcharge and had us in the suite in less than 30 minutes. This hotel staff is all about customer service. Thank you!This was all during a holiday weekend .

We stayed for five nights and enjoyed our stay. Room was large and spacious, with partial ocean view. Beautifully decorated. Bed was very comfortable. Convenient to have refrigerator and microwave and Keurig coffee in room. Shower pressure is like a spa deluge. All staff was really friendly and welcoming. Restaurant on site is good, and Brunch was yummy and a good deal. Pool area and showers were great. Location is excellent- two blocks away from beach, and very close to good array of restaurants and shops. Great value for a great hotel. We'll definitely be back!

We just stayed here 2 nights before going to another island. It was a great place to stay to see Waikiki. The decor was modern, the rooms were all clean and the staff was friendly and helpful. The location is great, close walking distance to so much shopping and restaurants and the beach. (The International marketplace across the street is amazing! It is a beautiful open-air mall with tons of shops and high-end stores and lots of good restaurants up on the top level. We loved walking through it to the beach.) The pool area was clean but small and nothing fancy. There were many kids and all the lounge chairs were packed together. We didn't do any more than look around, I would not have spent much time there. The rooms weren't big, but big enough. Overall good place for the price range.

Good location for value. Rooms are small, recently remodeled but not cleaned well in the room we stayed in. Mildew in shower, towels/sheets with yellow stains. Pubic hair on counter top. Very small pool. Should have paid more to stay somewhere else.

We ended @ Hilton Garden Inn after CANCELLATION of three bedroom home eight days prior to trip. On arrival, I assumed it would be nice as it was across from Saks 5th Ave and Market Place. All the staff that I came in touch with were excellent and very professional. Superior

This hotel was chosen because it was not on the beach but surrounded by places to shop and eat within walking distance.. and because the beach was just a short walk away..I would recommend this hotel not only because of the above but the staff was often and the staff at the breakfast every morning were very upbeat and took care of you when there..We had a great time with the perfect location..very comfortable..quiet and awesome folksPhotos a short walk away..We spent a week here and a week on ship visiting the other islands ..(see next review)

This hotel is in an excellent location; the rooms are nice if you can get past the fact that the door opens into the bathroom. It's quiet even though it's on very busy Kuhio. I've been staying here monthly while working on the island and have always enjoyed the amenities. However, I am taking my hotel business elsewhere after the hotel refused to remove a nightly charge for a night I couldn't make due to airline issues. Even though I called as soon as the airline issue surfaced, could provide copies of both boarding passes to show the attempts to arrive, they charged me for the night. I have since cancelled all my future reservations and staying at another hotel.

We went for an family holiday to Hawaii, Awesome hotel, with all amenities on site. Very centrally located and amazing rooms, nice staff and very nice.We could book all the activities on the site inside the hotel, staff was very helpful,very nice food and restaurants on site and around area. Very central location to shop. A must visit.

I really enjoyed my stay at this hotel. It is right in the center of all of the action offered. The beach is only a few steps away as is a few top notch restaurants and shops. The concierge and housekeeping staff made the hotel seem like a home away from home.

I stayed here once before for a short business trip, not long after the redevelopment was completed, and was impressed enough that I planned to stay here on my next vacation to the islands. We did just that for five days and everything went smoothly. Hotel is a nice mid-range hotel for business travel or vacationers who want to be close to Waikiki but don’t want to pay beach prices. Contemporary modern design and furnishings with hi-tech amenities. Located two blocks from the beach, you couldn't ask for a better location. A few minutes’ walk in any direction for nightlife, shopping, restaurants, sightseeing, exploring and public transportation. The International Market (high end shopping and restaurants) is just down the street. My favorite place for Loco Moco is just across the street. What could be better?Service by the front desk and other hotel staff was excellent, friendly and efficient. Many of the staff speak multiple languages. 100% smoke free. No Resort Fee. No pets. Free WiFi is a nice amenity. I wish more hotel/motel chains would adopt this policy. Nice workout facility, plenty of cardio and strength training equipment. Complementary breakfast buffet for Hilton Gold/Diamond members. Very helpful concierge desk. Coin operated laundry on-site as well as Valet service. Outdoor rooftop pool on the fourth floor. As a Hilton Diamond member, we got upgraded to a corner suite on the top floor. Room was clean and linens crisp. Room was very spacious. Amenities in room and bathroom were of good selection and quality. Walk-out balcony with enough room for several people. Microwave, mini-refrigerator, coffee/tea maker and small safe in room. Valet only parking is pretty pricy at $35 per day but that's typical of most downtown locations anywhere. We took taxi from airport for $36.Overall a great place to stay in order to be close to the tourist/nightlife excitement but far enough away not to be subjected to it when it's time to sleep. We are looking forward to returning in a couple months.

The Hotel has recently been renovated and met all our expectations. It's conveniently located in the middle of Waikiki - two blocks back from the beach. Access to the beach is just a 10min stroll through connecting shopping arcades - "Sacks Fifth Ave" & "Dukes" The suites in the "30 Series" are the best to stay in, as they face directly toward Waikiki Beach and the Pacific Ocean. The rooms were very clean and comfortable, the beds were soft and supportive with a mix of pillow types - both polyester and feather. The staff were friendly and accommodating...typical of American customer service - no complaints

We came here recently for a staycation and absolutely loved it. Desiree checked us in at the front desk and was super friendly and welcoming. We've stayed in many hotels in Waikiki, but was one of the best equipped for longer stays-- a microwave, Keurig, hot water kettle, and fridge. We also really enjoyed the restaurant downstairs! They have a breakfast buffet and fantastic happy hour! Conveniently located behind the new International Marketplace, this hotel is great whether you're a local looking for a little R&R or a tourist enjoying Waikiki for the first time.

We had a great experience in this Hotel. Staff was friendly and very supportive to meet our needs. Location is excellent as well, close to many shopping and dining options. Two blocks away from the beach, this was a short walk which was very nice. Did have a poor experience with the onsite restaurant, food quality was poor at best. Breakfast over priced for the quality of food that you are getting as well.

I write this review just so that I can recognized my family housekeeping staff, Paulina/Pauline? (18th floor) she made my parents feel very welcome and she took good care of my family. She is wonderful. Thank you!

I liked the hotel, the buffet breakfast is ok ($11 when you are a client of the hotel). The only thing that was not so good is the parking. You have to use the valet and it is super expensive. Around $35 a day. Otherwise, it is well located (next to a lot of shops, restaurant and the beach), the room was big and clean. Overall, good hotel for the price.

Had a great stay this past weekend at the hotel. Room was clean and comfortable. Booking and checking in was easy via websites. Front Desk and Valets were friendly and welcoming. We like that this hotel has rooms that will accommodate a family of three. A rare feature for hotels these days. This hotel has a great location. It is across from the International Market Place with lots of shops and eateries. There is also a convenience market and coffee shop on the first floor that also has hot and cold food for purchase, plus other gift items. The hotel is only blocks from the beach, many other shops and restaurants, and a supermarket across the street. Great Location. Like most hotels in Waikiki, there is only valet parking.

This hotel has a nice 3-star look to it upon initial arrival. The rooms are much nicer appearing now that it has been renovated and taken over by Hilton (we stayed when it was Ohana as well). However, right off the bat they were very unaccommodating. I called the day prior to my arrival to request a room with a king bed. The gentleman on the phone ensured me that he would put the request in for me. However, upon arrival, my wife and I were given a room with 2 double beds. When we returned to the counter, they were "sold out" and were unable to offer us any other room. The next morning and the day after they also ensured us that they were "sold out" and could not change our room (and they were not very nice about it; so much for the perks of being an Hhonors gold elite member...). Our room was OK in regards to furnishings, but the decor was cheap (on par with other 3-star hotels). However, the walls are paper thin. We constantly heard the loud children and drunk folks roaming the hallway outside the door at all hours. You could also hear talking, phone conversations, and even cell phone alarm clock of the neighbors next-door -- paper thin walls! Furthermore, we constantly heard walking and a "scratching" noise above our room. Not a peaceful experience in the least bit. Also the elevators are TERRIBLE. One or more was/were broken the ENTIRE time and it was regularly a 5+ minute wait to catch one. On the way down, they are almost always full by the time they stop at your floor so its better just to take the stairs. If waiting in the lobby for a ride up, get ready to run to beat the other 20 or so folks waiting to get in as well. Not relaxing. The room was also not cleaned one day at all, and was cleaned around 6 pm another day. This was fine, just a heads up for those trying to plan around it. Overall, I would not recommend, although the renovations look nice and it is in Waikiki. I found the thin walls and the fact that they could not accommodate a request for a king bed which was made more than a day before arrival (especially because I was staying >1 week) to be big turn-offs. Would choose a different Hilton property or possibly one of the Hyatt properties that are in a similar price-range rather than choosing this crap hole. Oh yeah, the breakfast is OK since we took that instead of points at check-in.

Stayed at Hilton Garden Inn for 4 nights earlier this year. It is not on the beach front but it is in easy access to all amenities. Across the road is the market place which takes you through to the beach front. It has a restaurant which we found excellent. There is also a shop at ground level where you can buy anything from hot food to toiletries This we found very convenient. There is also a supermarket across the road if need be. The room was very well decked out, comfortable and clean. We were on a lower floor at my request but I believe if you stay up higher you can request a sea view room. The reception staff were very helpful to any of our requests.

Fabulous location and pretty quiet being back from the main street. I did think my booking entitled me to a free mini bus to Ala Moana and breakfast each day however this was clarified upon check in as not an option. Free bottled water each day would have been nice. Great pool area. Only 1 umbrella for shade to cover 2 people so another 30 or so day beds are in the sun.

This was a wonderful stay! The service was very friendly and even the restaurant downstairs in the lobby was great! Very clean, Hilton always holds true to its standards! Spent 2 nights here at an affordable rate not far from Waikiki beach and all the shops and restaurants!

Wonderful place, close to the beach, (one block away), near many places, nice, quiet, rooms are very good good staff. Only thing I was not crazy about was their breakfast. The room i stayed in was one bed. Just the right size. Great shower, nice balcony. You could see part of diamond head. Staff very helpful and cordial. I was not crazy about their buffet breakfast. I did not feel like it had enough choices, or variety. Easy access to everything on Waikiki. good location. One block from the beach. It was near the New international market.

This hotel was amazing in every aspect. From the delightful staff to the cleanliness of the guest room, it far surpassed my expectations. The location was fantastic, just across the street from the new International Market Place, and just a few steps further to beautiful Waikiki Beach! I look forward to my next stay at this remarkable hotel.

I reached out to the concierge prior to our vacation because we were struggling with getting tickets to Pearl Harbor. Ross Asato, not only got us a wonderful excursion, that picked us up right at the hotel, but every adventure he booked for us was 100 times better than the excursion we did through the cruise we were on the following week. He was able to book us 2 different snorkeling trips, a scuba diving trip, a rental car, and a luau on the beach, all including transportation. I loved being able to tell him what we were interested in and he had all the connections. The best part, it didn't cost me anything for his services!!! Don't go to Hawaii without having Ross Asato arrange it for you!!

The hilton Garden Inn is walking distance to the beach. The rooms are clean, the bed is comfortable, the air conditioner works great and the stafff is very helpful. The valet service is exceptional. They are curteous, fast and very helpful. We had a very nice stay here.

Stayed here for 6 nights. The location is great for an "off-beach" hotel. Very clean, wonderful staff and surrounded by everything you need. A grocery store next door, shopping across the street and a couple blocks to Waikiki Beach.

While it's in a convenient location near shopping and not too far from the beach, I'm not wowed by the hotel. It's fine and at a decent price but small rooms and nothing special. Would not recommend for any kind of romantic trip. I used my (many!) reward points for a week and as a thank you for being such a valued customer I was given a 3rd floor room above the valet. Usually Hiltons have reserved floors for Hilton members so I was expecting more. It's fine with a family however so I wouldn't tell you to avoid this hotel.

I take one point from the rating, as the have paper cups sealed in plastic which is possibly the worst environmental sin I have seen in the past years. - At the second street from the beach, bus stop 2 minutes, clean rooms. I had balcony and could therefor chose to open the window, AC can be set individually. No desk but small table that can be used for laptop work. Big hotel with no personality but I did not mind.

We visited Waikiki for the third time celebrating my brothers graduation from high school. And this place is the best stay we've had in Hawaii. Central and modern to other places. Laundry/Shopping/International Market was across the street. We will definitely be back. Mahalo ❤️

Perfect location close to beach & shops. Excellent hotel with clean, modern rooms. Located in a central location to everything. Nice amenities, quiet. Great value! I definitely would stay there again. You won't be disappointed!

A few inconveniences with valet service, but otherwise a solid stay for business trip. If traveling with my family, I would choose a resort with beachfront access and nicer pool. It's a short walk to the beach and shopping. The pool is ok, but overlooks the street.

The rooms were great except for not having a dresser to put clothes in, but we made it work. I had 2 kids with me so it's a little tough to arrange things for everyone. Beng able to get fresh air is amazing!!! The room was very nice, included a bathtub and the location was perfect! You were close enough to walk to the beach in about 5 mintues and close to many resturants and shops. Would definitely stay here again!

This hotel was a great hub to walk to many things around Waikiki. Excellent choices of food places around, and close walk beaches. Comfortable, clean and good customer service. Great amenities including pool and gym.

My Husband and I went on our Honeymoon and at the Hilton Garden Inn, This is a classy hotel with all the amenities. Its located right in the center of shops,markets and meeting places for excursions..

The location is excellent and staff at the Hilton Garden Inn are fantastic. My room was cleaned expertly each day and on most days was completed before I returned to the room. The staff at the front desk were courteous and helpful.

Great location for food and night life. Staff is very friendly and the breakfast is decent for both business and family travelers. All of the rooms have been updated including soft close drawers. The fact that a fridge and microwave is included is a bonus and usually not a standard feature in the Waikiki area.

The room is much smaller than I was expecting and livingroom area is super narrower. I disappointed to pay additional to get this room. Stay away this room if you look for more space. Valet parking service is very slow too. Although I mentioned I need a car tomorrow at certain time but I had to wait more than 20 minutes to get my car. Paying USD 35 per day, service is not near to worth it.

Staff at the lobby were okay.Very slow check-in. We got in at 12:45 PM from a six hour flight. We were told to return at 2 PM, but returned at 3:15 to allocate for standard check-in time. We were told to wait for half an hour more and then another. Eventually the attendant gave us free breakfast to appeace our inconvenience. We finally got in our room at a quarter 'til six.Housekeepers are dilligent in keeping the room clean daily. Although this hotel is not a green hotel. Recycling bins are not available in the lobby area and hotel rooms. Those who collect the garbage and recycling placed just by the elevator entrance of our floor just mixed them together. Also, they sprayed pesticides around he pool and bar area when there are people using it.Amenitties are okay. The restaurant were we had our buffet breakfast is decent. They have a small pool, gym and laundry room. It's a five minute walk to Waikiki Beach, and just across the street from International Market Place.

For a central location this is a great option. Good size rooms and right in the heart of Waikiki. Good service and friendly staff. Really enjoyed it. The Nordstrom discount store is across the road and lots of good food options in the block across the road too.

I found the rooms, staff and general experience of the hotel completely fine for the price you pay. The hotel has a small supermarket down stairs, a tour desk and a restaurant in the lobby. The lifts were my biggest annoyance, the lifts take ages to travel up and down and you had to wait for a long period of time to be able to get in a lift as they were very often full. Location was ok with a bus stop out the front and a big mall opposite (we found the quickest way to the Main Street was walking though the mall)

Too expensive for the quality of service you get. Looks like they are trying but not a good leadership. Long lines and staff are just chatting instead of helping. Valet area is a nightmare for the $35 per night charge ridiculous.

We stayed for 2 nights while visiting friends on our way to Seattle. We arrived around 9 am and get dropped off at the side of the hotel. The front was a busy road. Anyway front desk told us that our room will be available at 12noon. Front desk does'nt accept cash and required $100 deposit from a creditcard. I used my mastercard/travelcard. It has been three weeks since we check out and its still pending transaction in my account.It does'nt happened with any other hotels we stayed. The room was clean but a little bit on a small side. Not enough room for big suitcases. Tried the coffee machine in the room but end up throwing it, instead went downstairs and got one from the lobby. Wifi connection was fast and checking out was easy. We will stay again in the future.

The valet team lost my key tag and could not find my vehicle. The front desk flagged my vehicle and never contacted me, so valet refused to release my vehicle and I was late to an appointment which cost me $120.00. The front desk allowed a 13 year-old-child to make changes to my account without my approval. Upon arrival, my room was dirty and the sink was full of hair. After my room was changed, I had to ask for my HHonors benefits, which the front desk required me to retrieve instead of conducting a room delivery; the bedding on the pull-bed in the new room was dirty and smelled of musky body odor. The digital key would not allow me to register the key for the new room after my room was changed due to being assigned to a dirty room upon arrival. Although the 3:00 PM late checkout was confirmed on three separate occasions, it was not honored and additional charges were imposed. Children threw candy and toys from an upper level of the hotel hitting me in the head when I was standing beside the the pool, which hotel management said was unable to be resolved due to not having video surveillance throughout the property, despite the photos and video from my cell phone of one of the three culprits. I had to request $500.00 irroneous charges be removed from my bill. Upon arrival my room was dirty and the sink was littered with multiple strands of long hairs; the bedding on the pull-out sleeper in the replacement room was dirty and smelled of musky body odor. The second room was not changed and although new bedding was promised, it never provided. The food and drinks at the hotel restaurant are grossly over priced; a 3 ounce drink cost $15.

We had to stay here as our hotel Hilton Hawaiian Village was not available for a day. It was a decent back up option. Breakfast was decent, nothing great about it.Rooms were ok. The day we were there, all of their elevators stopped working because of a water leak. We were on 15th floor and we had no option to bring the stroller and infant down. We waited for an hour and no one came to help out with the stroller after calling them repeatedly. At last, we ended up carrying 1 y.o and 2y.o 15 floors down.Bad service!!

We enjoyed our stay, but felt almost like cattle at times when waiting for breakfast and check-in. This place is in the heart of Waikiki and budget priced for the area so they get a lot of business. There is a mall across the street and a farmer's market around the corner. The beach is only a couple blocks away. there is a pool on the 3rd floor for kids (not large enough for a bunch of adults). The room was very nice. We only got a studio since we were staying for a short stint, but it was well furnished and comfortable. The hotel is clean and the staff, although busy, were very friendly.
user_name:
road_tripping9110
New York City, New York

review_body: The hotel is nice however the staff can be quite slow due to its thoroughness with each customer. Hallways are extremely noisy. The doors shutting can be quite bothersome at night. Since it's how the rooms were built, I didn't complain to the front desk. The hotel has a great location but valet parking is extremely expensive (most in city at $35/day - no self parking). If you're okay with slamming doors throughout the night, this hotel may be for you. However, we will probably be looking elsewhere next visit.

we were pleasantly surprised with this hotel. although it is not right on the beach, it is in a very convenient location and you can walk to lots of places. we had 2 rooms that connected (king bed & 2 doubles). very clean, staff very friendly. we enjoyed our stay and our rooms had all the amenities needed - microwave, keurig, fridge. the pool is a bit small and only 3-4ft deep, so good for small children. we had a deluxe city view, right above the main street. however, once you close the lanai door, it is VERY quiet.

Stayed for a night with family. A really nice hotel. Staff was fantastic. Walking distance from the beach, restaurants, international marketplace mall. Rooftop pool. Only wished that pool bar was open. would stay there again

We stayed in May and got a deal that included breakfast. Gave us vouchers for the buffet restaurant which included the tip. Glad it was for free as not worth $20 for buffet but was a good breakfast. Only one main block back from beach which was quiet and along bus routes. Quiet rooms and well maintained as we were back from road. No view though

Had a great stay at this hotel. We arrived from Australia at 7.30am and proceeded to check in. We were surprised that our room was ready and we were upgraded as hilton honours members. The hotel itself has had a renovation and its very nice. The price we paid for what you get is great value. The pool area is nice and tbe hotel is very central to everything.Front office staff were very helpful and one of my kids need to see a doctor. The staff sorted it out for us.. I will be back was a great stay.

Very nice room with king sized bed. There was a spot in the first few floors where we could visit with friends which was a nice feature. Room was clean and well cared for. Elevators were a bit slow but pretty minor.

Stayed for 6 nights in a king room with a city view? Ummm should rename it king room with a internal parking lot view. Or king room with other views of balcony. There is no real view! Another problem was in the shower, the drain got blocked so was like showering in a puddle of water. I had to clean it myself as blocked first thing after cleaner had been! Also fridge wasn't working, it wasn't cool at all. So had to call for maintenance which took 3 phone calls as no one answered the call! Maintenance came and "fixed" the fridge. It cooled down alright, a few hours later the drinks and fruit was frozen! Need to replace the fridge I think. You can't even adjust the temperature of fridge by yourself you have to call for maintenance to come! How silly! Which brings me to next point each day the housekeeper "forgot"To refill something in the room. One day forgot to re stock shampoo and body lotion or they would not restock cups in room so couldn't even enjoy the coffee. Balcony had bird poo on it also which wasn't cleaned at all during the stay. Had to ask for slippers as they aren't provided in the room. Why not? most other hotels provide slippers in the room. Would expect Hilton hotel to have slippers in the room considering its rate is around 300 dollars a night. We were lucky we used qantas frequent flyer points to pay for the trip. Only good thing was they let us check in early around 8:30am on first day. The hotel is in a good location also but is it worth the price to stay there? I don't think so. Would I stay again the answer is no. The price needs to be lowered quite a bit for me to consider. I would only recommend this hotel if u aren't expecting much. Maybe just ideal for business traveller.

I said overall is good, I just can't get over that dirty bath towels. I have requested some towels in two different days and I have received dirty sticky liked pleghm sticking in the towels. Check your towels before using them !

Hotel resembles a poorly remodeled Holiday Inn from the 70's. Check-In staff could use a more customer service oriented approach. Being a diamond member you stay with the brand enough to know the brand standard. Worst Hilton brand hotel I've found on any of the islands.

Only stayed one night just to get a feel for Waikiki area. It was a nice hotel if you are on a budget and want to be somewhat close to the beach and walking distance of shops,etc. But the parking is super expensive at $35/day. Not sure if they had a public parking lot nearby.

I was pleasantly surprised at this hotel it is set perfectly between all of the wonderful shopping in restaurants as well as walking distance to the beach. It is a very reasonable price for the area. My room was 1551 and the view is not a good view it's called City View but it was more of the parking lot. But does come with a balcony and I did sit on the balcony a couple of times but for the most part we were gone either shopping or out to eat or to the beach. I highly recommend the Hilton Garden Inn Waikiki. The room keys are the swipe entry as well as for the elevators.

Will definitely be back!! As a Hiton Honors Gold Member I was very satisfied!! Luved the breakfast the rooms and the staff !! Only 1 block from the main shopping center and all the excitement. 10 all around!!!

Desiree at the front desk is very nice and accommodating. I only stayed 1 night so didn't have the time to take full advantage but they have a pool on 3rd floor. Very convenient to have ABC store in the lobby as well. Great location, a block off the strip.

We enjoyed a great stay with wonderful service from the staff! We'll be back for sure!!! I was issued an upgrade to a beautiful suite! The views and the pool were great. The hotel is walking distance to many great places!

This hotel is such a breath of fresh air the staff couldn't help enough so polite and friendly. We arrived at the hotel not knowing what to expect we initially had a room facing the car park which was a bit dark however when we said we were on our honeymoon the hotel staff moved us as soon as possible to a much brighter room with a distant sea view which was fantastic. The rooms where very modern and clean and really comfortable beds .The hotel is 2 blocks back from the beach which is perfect and not far at all. Also there is a fantastic restaurant attached to the hotel the meals are the best we had on the island and we ate out at a lot . Also the breakfast in this restaurant is also great value for money.Over all I would highly recommend this accommodation and will return in the future

Great hotel conveniently located near Waikiki beach. Room rates are great and the staff is phenomenal. Had problems finding the check-in entrance via Google Maps, but otherwise, valet parking responsiveness was outstanding.

Big rooms and very modern bathrooms in this big holiday village. Pretty much everything is here, shops and restaurants. In a fantastic location right by the sea and on Waikiki Beach. Loads of information points were you are able to book tours around Hawaii.

This hotel worked well for us. It's not luxury, and there are many extras missing which you would expect to see in a higher class hotel (such as room service, bigger rooms, better quality fixtures, better pool, pool bar, better range of toiletries, small kitchenette etc)...But if you want a well located, mid range hotel then it's perfect. The location is great, just a few blocks back from the beach, close to all the shopping and with a well stocked food shop / cafe next door and the International Market Place over the street with lots of cheap and quick eateries. The service was good and attentive, and the rooms were kept well serviced over our stay. Wifi worked well. The only real disappointment was the pool area which is dated and neglected. The pool bar looks to have closed down a while ago and it's a shame. Otherwise, a great choice for a stay in Waikiki. Good hotel!

Stayed in this hotel for a week with husband and two adult children in two separate double rooms.As Hilton Club members it was our 25th wedding anniversary and we let the hotel know thinking we may receive a nice room or a small complimentary gift(doesn't hurt to try) No such luck we got two rooms overlooking the carport.On the positive side check inn was quick and easy, rooms were clean and reasonably spacious and the pool area was small but lovely.The hotel is in a pretty good position close to everything and at the end of the day we had a pretty good time and enjoyable stay .

Stayed for 3 nights. Originally was only for 2 nights but couldn't pass up the opportunity. We stay in waikiki all the time but to be honest this hotel has a great location. Being across the street from the international marketplace. Newly renovated and very clean. Service was quick and very good. Friendly staff. Only thing that bothered me was only 2 of 4 elevators working when we were there. Aside from that, not stopping me from staying here again. Parking is $35 a day.

We found the Hilton Garden Inn great value for money No Resort Fees close to everything close to all the great things in Waikiki, international market place just across the road, beach, bus stop, hotel was clean beds super comfy rooms clean staff are great, would definitely stay again.

Arrival and check in was quick and staff was pleasant and very helpful. The room was clean. We were there for our 43rd Aniversary. We enjoyed the morning coffee and afternoon flavored water in the afternoon. The hotel is in a convenient location.

This hotel was renovated this past year. Very clean, updated and the service was great. The location was perfect if you don't need a place right on the beach. This hotel is centrally located, walking distance to all the action. We didn't rent a car so this worked out well for us.

We chose this hotel because it was a Hilton and we have stayed in Hilton managed resorts and hotels before and they have been excellent. This was a good hotel, with excellent staff and in a fantastic location. There are loads of restaurants, food outlets and shopping all around the hotel.... how ever we were disappointed as it did not live up to what we have experienced before. The lobby area and cafe/convenience store were great, our room was a real disappointment. There were two double beds for two of us... we were under the impression we had booked a queen bed and with two double beds (a double bed is pretty small for two people!!! ) in the room there wasn't much room for anything else. I asked at reception if they had bigger beds and they said as it was peak time there were no other rooms available.There was a microwave and coffee pod machine and small fridge but no utensils of any kind or plates, cups bowls etc. I would have thought if there was a microwave here would have been some forks and knives and plates at least also. Not even any drinking glasses or cups just 4 paper cups for the coffee machine that weren't even replenished until we asked. We went out and bought cups and bowls etc as we're staying for 8 nights.It was a small room and not ideal to stay in for this long when on holiday.Another thing, was there were 3 fire alarms that went off while we were there... the first two were false alarms and there was no fire on last one but a lot of water was pouring out through the side of the building. I know people around us were getting to the point where they weren't even coming out of their rooms by the third one as they were so used to them going off. The restaurant at on the ground floor was not a great experience either..... my partner got what the server recommended and for $29 received one piece of over cooked fish and 3 pieces of broccoli. I ordered the tortilla soup and this arrived Luke warm. We only went there once as it just wasn't worth it. Lucky there are plenty of other great food places around.Over all if your looking for a hotel in a great location hen stay here but don't expect a 'Hilton' or 5 star experience it is definitely a 3-3.5 star hotel

Just an average hotel but really close to Waikiki Beach and near the strip. The good thing about this hotel is everything is walking distance mall, restaurants and the beach. I can recommend this hotel.

Stayed at this place 4 years ago when it was Ohana west. Has been ungraded and name change since. Staff and location excellent, central to everything and also felt safe when out at night. Will definitely will be back.

From the moment we checked in to the Hilton Garden Inn to the check out, we had an amazing stay. The staff members were so helpful & friendly! The room was beautiful, clean & modern. We were staying with our little baby girl & we really fell welcome.The situation of the hotel is great! I would highly recommend it!

Great location on wakiki beach and close to huge number of restaurants. The hotel is clean. Parking is valet only ($35), so beware of the extra expense. We travelled with two small kids and one thing we really hated was the bathroom where the door does not lock. What were the designers thinking

1F market has 1 gallon of water and beer,next door is Foodpantry, oposit is international market place.It is convenient for a shopping . We cut just fruit,so it is OK for us in a simple kitchen of this level. I want to use it next year.

Just several blocks away from the beach. It is right across International Market and from other shops. If renting a car, Avis will be recommended by International Market and you can pick up the car in the morning then park it here for a while. Alamo rental is also nearby. Staff is very friendly and food is good. Awesome location.

This hotel is not newly built, it is fully renovated and re-opened in mid 2016. Almost all hotels in Waikiki are very old and very tired. I booked this just based on it being shut down and fully renovated, as I remember seeing it boarded up last time in Hawaii. I will never stay at another hotel in Waikiki again. Brand new everything. Very polite checkin staff and convenient grocery store on ground level. The valet service was excellent and will be hiring a car again based on how good this service was.

Intiaiall related to a bisuness travel, I and my wife stayed 9 days at Hilton Garden Inn Waikiki. Bith of us liked the hotel for its good service, friendly personal and very convinient location. I had a problem to store my luggage for a couple of days and the hotel helped me resolved the problem. My overall impression on HGI is well above average.

My stay at the Hilton Garden Inn in Waikiki was fantastic! This was my first visit to Hawaii, the hotel was centrally located in the heart of Waikiki which consisted on various restaurants, shopping and the beach was steps away. I really enjoyed the Pan American parade it was AWESOME! I would recommend the Hilton Garden Inn because the beds are soooo comfortable and the staff make you feel like family. In Hawaii, everyone is referred to as "cousin". I LOVE IT!

This was our second stay at the Hilton Garden Inn Waikiki Beach, and we were very disappointed. The room was fine, and the location is great, but when we reported to the front desk - twice - that the people in the room adjacent to us were very noisy, nothing was done about it, for three days. This was completely unacceptable to us, and caused us to cancel an upcoming reservation there in August. Too bad.

The hotel is at a very central location right next to the International market place so we found that very convenient. I don't think the brand promise of making sure the customer is completely satisfied or we don't pay really works though since our requests for a firmer pillow and some glasses rather than paper cups were not able to be fulfilled!

We have just spent 5 days in Waikiki here and it was a very pleasant hotel to stay in we had an inside room on the 3rd floor which had no view except for a car park bit disappointed.The room was very comfortable and clean, super comfortable beds. Modern fit out and new bathrooms, just note that the shower floors are very slippery and dangerous I recommend that you put a towel on the floor before you step in, I slipped 2 times and it was not pleasant or without consequences to my back.The swimming pool is a joke 4 foot deep great for children but not adults and that leads to to the fact that if your room is near the pool all you can hear is kids screaming all day.The staff are very friendly and helpful.DON'T waste your money on the restaurant for breakfast buffet ($19usd) per personWe had 1 meal there and it was not busy and there was no hot food in the serving dishes and what was there was old and had been stewing for a while. In this day and age there is no excuse for a restaurant in an international hotel not to be able to cook a good full breakfast.

First time Hilton Garden Inn experience was well worth the 3-day Staycation. Enjoyed the Kamehameha Day and Pan-Pacific Festival parades, Hoolauleas, and related activities throughout Waikiki.Also great venue for walking exercise while you take in the sights, sounds, and scents all around Waikiki along Kalakaua, Kuhio, and Ala Wai, from Ala Moana to Kapahulu.A memorable experience for visitors and locals to enjoy...

I booked this hotel as part of a convention package where this was one of the selections of the housing bureau. I had stayed in Hilton Garden Inns in other locations, and always enjoyed the experience. This hotel is in a good location in Waikiki, close to the beach, shopping and restaurants. If I ever need to return to this area I would gladly stay at this hotel again.

We just returned from a week stay at the Hilton Garden Inn and had a great stay. The hotel is close to shopping, Waikiki beach, and tons of places to eat. Across the street there is a super market (The Food Pantry) to do your shopping to fill your fridge. The international market place is also across the street. The rooms are modern and spacious with balcony's. The rooms have a fridge and safe its a nice touch. I would definitely stay here again when visiting Waikiki.

The hotel is in a great position so easy to get around. Rooms are comfortable and fresh. Ask for a room on a high floor. The pink line to Alomoana stops just one stop over. Recommend going to Nordstrom rack across the road. We booked one night and paid in advance and the other nights used our Hilton points. When it came to checking out they wanted to charge us for the whole stay it took quite a while to sort this out and spoilt our stay. When we returned home we have been charged for the stay on our credit even though we were assured that it had been rectified.

We stayed in room 1451 with our 18 and 20 year old sons. It was classified as a double room with city view. The room had two small (full size) beds and a padded bench along one wall. It was very compact but was just enough room for us to move around and sleep. The furnishings and fixtures were upscale and relatively new and we had no issues with noise. Very comfortable and close to the beach, shopping and restaurants. The little general store/bar off the lobby was very convenient. There is a 24 hour drug store (Longs- associated with CVS) within walking distance which came in handy when my youngest got sick!

A fantastic location, very clean room and modern. Bus stop one side and the Waikiki Trolley stop on the other. A 5 min walk to beach. Very helpful staff, great tour desk. Every tour I booked picked up from the hotel. There was no onsite restaurant operating whilst I was there as it was under construction and opened the week after I left. There is however a well stocked shop/gift shop attached to the foyer that has meals and a great place for breakfast. Plenty of great places to eat all within short walking distance. Have recommended this hotel to many family and friends. Returning again this year.

Central location. Close to many eateries & takeout stores. Buses on the door step. Food Pantry opposite for supplies. Pleasant & helpful staff. Modern clean room. Only issue was with paper cups & no basic cutlery.

Internet signal is ~50% and requires login on each device every 24hr - a real bother/annoyance.Shampoo, conditioner, lotion bottles identical except for small print identifying contents. Had to put my readers on to see the difference.Decor is '60s modern, not up to date.Water pressure in our 10th floor room almost non-existent in "shower".Room was well maintained and clean and staff were excellent!

Hotel was nice and modern. Room was spacious and clean. Loved the mini keurig and kcups in the room. The pool is not that big and it awkwardly faces the mall and puts you eye level with the store. That was the only drawback for me. Its a few blocks from the beach but its in a good location. They only have a buffet for breakfast so we went to the coffee shop/bakery across the street several days for a quick bite we could take with us. The restaurant chicken/avacado flatbread was delicious. Friendly staff and very helpful for making tour arrangements for you.

This hotel is fairly updated but does have modified open air hallways in part. The room was clean and new but small. Rooms have a small balcony which is lovely in Waikiki. There's not really a great view as buildings are all around but the fresh air is nice.There's not a free breakfast but tons of nearby spots just a short walk and a pricey restaurant in the hotel.If you have a car the hotel only has valet parking for $35/day. There are other cheaper lots nearby as well.This hotel is in a great central location and shops, restaurants and the beach are just a short walk away.

We stayed at the Hilton Garden Inn at Waikiki in May 2017 it was the best. It was clean and the staff were friendly and helpful. Its only a block away from the beach the trolley was 300 metres from the hotel and shopping all around you at walking distance. The hotel has been fully redeveloped with microwave in the room and free wifi in the room. We had the room with the balcony facing the main street on the 10th floor and it was perfect with no noise from the street. The pool isn't very big, but it never got crowded. Great restaurants all around (Cheap and expensive ones). You can dine at TR Fire Grill next to the hotel unique American bistro offering fresh artisanal dishes, or you can go to th Café & Market for a large selection of grab ‘n’ go food items, plus gifts and souvenirs.

Very good experience. Nice hotel for sure. Kone coffee across the street is awesome for coffee and pastries. Outdoor pool is nice but can be cool due to sun hitting it only after noon each day. The only bad thing is if there is police activity at night you here the sirens but that would be true anywhere in Waikiki.
user_name:
Steve M
Birmingham, Alabama, United States

review_body: My review may be a little unfair as this was the fourth time my wife and I have traveled to Hawaii, each trip to a different island. Since we've visited three of the other islands beforehand, our expectations were high. Our room was clean and stayed clean but it was a little cramped. There wasn't a lot of room to store our luggage and we had to squeeze a crib in because we were traveling with a toddler. We had a balcony but it was hard to sit out there since the view from our room was of the back of another hotel and some parking lot. The staff for the most part were very friendly and helpful. The pool was small and there was no pool bar. I found that disappointing because who doesn't want to be served a drink while you're sitting at a pool in Hawaii? Other than that, the location was pretty good. We walked to a lot of places nearby, took an Uber to the zoo and Diamond Head and rented a car for Hanauma Bay and the North Shore. We can't really imagine staying here again but then again we don't really know if we'd want to visit Waikiki again.

We stayed here for 4 nights and had a partial ocean view. If you want to see some ocean from your room you will need to get a partial ocean view and that will be upper floors. Our room had a nice balcony, bedroom and a table for a snack. There is a room safe that is free as well as microwave and refrigerator. My husband preferred decaf coffee and once the housekeeper found that out, she made sure to leave him a few extra decaf pods for the machine. The fitness center had 2 treadmills that weren't working but as soon as I let the front desk know, they were going to send an engineer up to take a look. The hotel was within easy walking distance of Waikiki Beach, the International Marketplace and Royal Hawaiian Center.

If your goal is to stay in a nice, clean hotel, you can't go wrong with this one. The rooms and facilities were all clean and in good repair. If you have need for extravagant fixings, look elsewhere. I traveled here on business, and the room was quite comfortable and easily met all of my needs. The restaurant was also excellent. If I have to find a negative, it would be the parking. I may have misread the website, but I thought the valet parking for $35/day was an option. I did not realize that was the only parking available for the hotel. I prefer to park my own car, but then again I may just have trust issues.

The Hotel is very centrally located right in the heart of Waikiki and directly behind the International Market Place - close to the beach, shops, restaurants, free wi fi and very family friendly. The staff are helpful, knowledgeable and willing to assist.

Had an amazing stay at this property. The accommadations were sufficient for my group to feel accessible to everything, not crammed and the staff was awesome. Literally 2 blocks from the beach. All the restaurants were amazing. About 2 miles from Diamond head.

Hotel very conveniently located in Waikiki near shopping, restaurants and beach. Modern updates and very clean and comfortable. Did not use pool but looked nice and well maintained. Has a gift shop and convenience store onsite with cafe. Also a restaurant open for breakfast(buffet), lunch, and dinner. Free wifi throughout hotel. Very satisfied with our stay!

This hotel was perfectly located and had the BEST customer experience!!!! Within walking distance of Waikiki and the shops. Directly across the street from shopping and tons of restaurants. You can't go wrong staying here!!

The hotel itself is pretty nice, rooms were pretty clean. The lobby was amazing. However there were a few things that did bother me. One was the shower water pressure. It was super weak. It was hard to rinse out your hair, and if you had to turn the hand held shower head upside down you were lucky to get 2-3 inches spraying up.The second thing which really bothered me, because it was one of the reasons why I was looking forward to staying at this hotel, was because they said they had a poolside bar. This was not the case. Any bar that had been there had been taken out and sealed up. This was pretty disappointing considering their website still to this day is advertizing a poolside bar. I hate false advertisement. Other than that they had a store on the premises and gave out free coffee and tea in the morning, in the lobby.

This property was beautifully clean in a prime location, beach and restaurants in five minutes walking distance. The staff were incredibly helpful at all times. It was fabulous having a money machine in the hotel and a supermarket over the road

Great Location, on one of the main streets in Waikiki. This is a no frills hotel but very clean and updated. Just a street away from the beach. Walking distance to shops and restaurants. We noticed a launderette across the street which was very convenient for anyone staying longer then week. They had all the basic necessities. Within the hotel was a small restaurant and a convenient store open until 12AM. They have 4 elevators we never had to wait more then a few minutes to go up or down but they do require your room key to operate the elevator. They offered cold water in the lobby area and free coffee in the mornings. If you are a Starbucks addict it is just down the street (less then 10 minute walk). You also have a Keurig machine in your room. They provided local coffee or tea cups. The rooms in this hotel are very oddly shaped. As you walk in the door the first thing you see is the bathroom vanity and this is true for ALL rooms. We requested a 2 bed with a sofa room. Unfortunately the room we were given was so small that if the sofa bed was out no one could go to the bathroom because the bed blocked the path. Also if you sat on the sofa you had no way of watching TV because of the way the couch sat. If you wanted to watch the TV you had to place the chair from the patio on the door track half in and half out to be able to watch TV. We paid for the upgrade at the front desk so we quested a different room. We were shown 4 different rooms until we found one that worked for our needs. 1541 is a great room for anyone with a family 1 bedroom suite. Lots of storage space however no tub shower only. The room also has a microwave and small fridge. No view but we were willing to give that up for the space we needed.The pool area had lots of seating and had a cap of 24 people in the pool. No life guard so I'm sure they don't closely monitor the cap. They offered pool towels and cold water at the pool. Nothing fancy but nothing to complain about. The hotel provided floating rings and tubes. Although the pool is small we never felt it was too crowded.Self parking is not available. There is a parking lot you can pay by the hour or day across the street. There is free metered parking after 10PM. Valet parking is available. When you get your bill don't be surprised by the taxing. You will pay RM Transient Tax and Accommodations Tax and General Excise tax. This hotel does not charge a resort fee.

I rarely write reviews and I always stay at Hiltons but I will not stay here again. Unfriendly staff when I checked in. I had been traveling for 12 hours and was exhausted I asked if they had room service since it was 9pm and she stated "no". I said really? There is no place to get some food close by, and she pointed me to the direction of the gift store. So today I go and buy groceries and come back to my uncleaned room at 3pm to find out the hotel has a restaurant next to the lobby where I could have gotten dinner last night and tonight. So needless to say I had to clean my own room after a long day at work and will be eating poke tonight instead of enjoying a nice dinner. Room is average, but I will not be staying here again. I work for a large corporation and have had colleagues stay at this hotel and they had warned me not to stay here as well.

We arrived in Honolulu at 11pm, checked in the hotel we originally booked, unfortunately the quality of the hotel was unacceptable, especially travelling with two young children (this experience will be another review), so we decided to check out. Long story short, our travel agent eventually arranged accommodation with Hilton Garden Inn. By the time we arrived, it was already 4am, the front desk staff Gary and Richard were empathic of our experience with the previous hotel . Although we didn’t have reservation, they quickly had a room ready for us. We also found a handwritten welcome card and breakfast vouchers in the welcome pack. My husband and I are very grateful to Gary and Richard for their help. Now, the hotel in general, staff are friendly and welcoming. The room was spacious, clean and quiet. It’s at a fantastic location, right across the International Market Place, my kids had great time playing there and it’s also a nice place to relax for my husband and myself. Overall with my experience, it is good value, I would definitely recommend Hilton Garden Inn to my friends.

Great location, right in the heart of Waikiki, across from International Market Place & walking distance to all the shops. Close to the airport and the amenities that are offered are great. Fantastic restaurant in the lobby also a store with an attached mini bar area that serves drinks, and breakfast foods. The pool lounge area is large and very comfortable, plenty of lounge chairs, located on the third floor. Service here is fantastic, all employees go out of their way to greet you and ensure your stay is comfortable. Downfall is $30.00 a day for valet parking.

Hilton Garden Inn Waikiki is in a great location. Just a couple blocks from the beach and steps from restaurants, cafes, grocery stores and malls. The hotel itself is no frills and pretty much what you'd expect from a 3-star Hilton. Economical for the destination/location, clean, great customer service, fairly modern and well-maintained. Not much of a lobby and rooms are small. Didn't use the pool so can't say anything about that.Overall, it was a comfy place to crash for our family of three (3yr old toddler included). It was perfect for us as we spent every waking moment out and about. Maybe not the best choice for all those wanting to actually hangout at the hotel. Not that it's bad, it's just that there's not much to it compared to more expensive hotels in the Waikiki resort town.

Overall, my experience at this property was very positive. The staff was friendly and welcoming. The hotel seemed to be remodeled recently, so it is modern and clean. It has a great location for proximity to all of the major Waikiki shopping and restaurants. My only complaint is that my room was very small.

Brilliant hotel in a hard to beat location. Comfortable, clean, quiet, spacious, convenient.... Everything you want in a good value hotel and nothing you don't. Fantastic staff, quiet and efficient air-conditioning and super comfortable rooms and beds, cannot recommend highly enough!

We are diamond Hilton Honors members from Australia. We come to Honolulu at least once a year. We booked 8 nights at the new garden inn although staying only 7. We do this because our flight arrives at 6 am & want to get into our room straight away. On arrival we were declared a no show so our room wasn't ready. No upgrade was offered. We were told we should have called to say we'd be late. Customer service!! They gave us a ready room. It's tiny & near the lift which we can hear. Our Hilton profile states we want to be away from the elevator The water pressure is very bad. Can hardly wash or rinse my hair. This is a newly renovated building. Today we were out by 9.15 and back at 1.30 but our room isn't serviced. At 2pm we were told we should advise what time we want service. Customer service!!!! The garden inn is well located but we won't stay again. We are still waiting for our room to be cleaned on a Sunday afternoon when we'd rather be in our room relaxing. Hilton needs to address this lousy attitude but they won't. Thy don't get it. What customer service??

Okay, let's cover off on the good. Nice central location, close to just about everything. Comfortable clean rooms with excellent if somewhat "filtered" ocean views on the higher floors and helpful friendly staff.Now to the bad. 3.00pm check in, especially after a long flight, is a major bummer. The rooms, whilst quite nice, are also pretty small - spent 8 nights tripping over our luggage!! The breakfast buffet is quite possibly the worst I have encountered, it was very ordinary. Consequently never did dinner at the same venue as had no confidence in their ability to do other meals If they couldn't get a simple brekkie buffet rightBut for all of that, the thing that did my head in the most was no glassware or crockery in the room. Paper cups for both water and coffee!!! Really? What is THAT all about?

Wonderful Hotel located in the Heart of Waikiki lots off shopping bars and Restaurants very near the hotel Hotel rooms was great small and neat enough for a couple lovely new rooms and cozy beds love itNot for Getting the wonderful House keeping Staff Mrs Xorda and Maria UrobioAnd Mr Ben For taking good care of us during our stay at the Hilton Garden InnKeep up the good work and we will see you again soon.The Digital key work great you don't have to go to the front desk or wait in line to check In do it all on your mobile phone good job HiltonAloha see you againMr gonsalves

This Hotel is quite nice and we had a great stay. The room was upgraded for us as it was my birthday and our anniversary. Room was weirdly configured but that was ok. It was always clean. There was no milk in our fridge, you only got two capsules of coffee for the coffee machine, there were no spoons, glasses, plates or even a bottle opener!!! There were no draws to put clothes just a shelf in the wardrobe. We were particularly looking forward to having a swim in the pool and a drink. The bar was all boarded up even tho there are pictures of it on their website. The staff at the front reception for professional but lacked any personality. The day we left we checked out and the guy just took our keys, settled our account and that was it. No "hope you had a great stay". Maybe a bit of training might be needed here. The hotel is in a great location, very close to everything which was great. The tour desk were very helpful and I highly recommend booking any tours with them. DON"T book with the guys on the street!!! I probably would stay here again if I had too but after walking round Waikiki there are definitely better places with nicer outdoor areas.

Great location beautiful hotel very helpful staff all good! Would recommend this hotel. Very close to Waikiki Beach ,shops, great restuarants and sightseeing .Easy access from Airport and to the ship.

Want something 'nice', i mean "nice?" This boutique-size hotel offers plenty. The decor is modern, clean and well-cared for. Good polite service and attention. It is one street back from the main street and a short walk to everything and off course on the bus route. We found it to be quieter than the Holiday Inn Waikiki Beachcomber we stayed at and this place never charged any additional daily fees/ charges either. Nice rooms, even with a jug to make a cuppa but no tea bags! Coffee machine wouldn't work either but not a deal breaker for us

Central location in Waikiki an easy walk to everything. Super clean, great service. No problems with our stay whatsoever. Enjoyed having my morning coffee on the balcony every morning. Pool area was great with a couple of cozy shady spots.

Perfect location! Short walk to the beach but away from the noise from the street. Right across the road from International Market Place. Yes, the room might be a bit small like some reviewer mentioned, but we don't stay in the room long enough to worry about it. Very friendly check-in staff. The three of us sharing a room was not a problem at all.

As a business traveler who stays a couple weeks at one place and has to work from his hotel room, this property was substandard. It was much smaller than pretty much any room I've stayed at for work. It did not have a chest of drawers - I had to put my clothing on shelves. There was not adequate work space. Instead of a desk, it was a table with a bench instead of an office chair and the TV was above the desk. I had to move the wicker chair over to the table so I could have a chair with a back on it. I have stayed at many Hilton properties, including other Hilton Garden Inns, and I'm used to the Hilton Garden Inn being being much better than average, but after this experience, I will not be coming back to the Hilton Garden Inn Waikiki.

Hotel staff were very friendly and accommodating. My reservation was done via Hilton worldwide but was not available upon checked in, the front desk clerk quickly found an available room for me and my husband. Everyone was helpful and friendly from the front desk, housekeeping, maintenance and concierge; they made sure our stay was comfortable and enjoyable. Hotel is located right across from the International Market, minutes away from the beach and all other major hotels and shopping areas in Waikiki are within walking distance like the Kings Village, Ala Moana Shopping Center and several ABC Stores.

Stayed during the past week. Nicely done remodel and still had that new feel and smell. While the valet was $35 it was an easy drop off and they were very quick in getting my car back to me. Had the city view room which is mainly a view of the other hotels. I for one when in Hawaii does not spend a lot of time in the room. With that said the hotel is in walking distance of so much. I used the electronic check in and key so minimal engagement with staff except valet who were all excellent. I will definitely check out availability for this hotel my next trip to Honolulu.

My wife and I stayed at the Garden Inn Waikiki for a quick get away. The hotel is Centrally located however to get to the Valet parking(there is no self park) you have to drive past the hotel and down a few side streets. Make sure you read a map and know where your going. We had a king bedded room with a partial ocean view. The bed was comfy, room comes equipped with a microwave, refrigerator, and a Keurig coffee maker. However the shower is amazing the pressure is amazing. I used the Hilton app to reserve, check-in, and as the room key. I wonder if I could have gone the entire stay without interacting with a hotel employee?My only adverse experience with this hotel was with reservations. I made the reservation 2 days before my stay with the Hilton App. The App doesn't display special rates such as the Kama'aina rate for local residents. I found they had a local rate the day after I reserved and contacted the hotel. I asked if I could change the rate but was told I could not as I was within 3 days of my reservation so I could not. I could understand this policy if I were cancelling my stay but I was only changing the rate. I would suggest a thorough search for rates before booking. All in all it was a great stay at a great hotel!!

Stayed multiple nights to visit Oahu. Hotel is very well situated in Waikiki. It is in front of the in terminational market which give you straight access to the main street and the beach by crossing the mall. The beach is no more than 4-5 minutes walking, restaurant are nearby. There is an Avis rental car right in the market. Many busses are driving right by the hotel, leading to the main attractions.Hotel was clean, well taken care of. Staff was excellent and very courteous. Amenities are OK for this class of hotel. Our room was facing the inner court so it was quiet. Excellent bed and WiFi.

Is this technically a 5 Star hotel, not really but by the service and amenities you might think they are trying as hard as Hilton staff deliver. I stayed March 9-13th and again April 2-4th 2017. Both stays had a few hiccups but the Hilton Staff worked to take care of my needs. In March spent a long 4 nights w/room long wall couch, small couch with desk and big King Bed. I checked in via the App and never used the front desk because i used the virtual key cause i arrived at about 1145PM . I got to the elevators and to the room. No problems the room was hot though. After 30 minutes i realized the air conditioner wasn't working and caalled down stairs. An engineer showed and took apart the conditioner and said they couldn't do anything more till the next day and they would send someone up with new keys and a room assignment for me. Later when the front desk guy showed up with keys and a luggage cart to assist me i learned the engineers go home at 12:30 am. and would not have the parts needed to fix. I understood and the room i got was smaller but i was exhausted and took the smaller room. The next am i called downstairs to change rooms again and without hesitation Sharon or Raquel immediately apologized and found me a nice room with a the same amenities as the first room and upgraded me to a main KOHIO street view. I'm not easy and i'm demanding so Hiliton Garden Inn Waikiki staff take this as my genuine thank you for you service when things go right or go wrong. You do a great job of helping me every step of the way from printing downstairs, changing rooms, changing my rooms cause i don't like the sun waking me up to finding some unique hole in the wall restaurant that locals love. I wish i got your name but i had to have laundry service on same day return and the tall young man called back the laundry service to return to pick up my laundry for same day service since i was just 5 minutes late. He knew they weren't far away and asked them to return for me. You all do a stellar job and if you can tell i've been coming back every few months and its cause of you all so dont change unless its improving cause i love telling people about your property and service.

Very pleased with my 7 night stay! It takes me forever to settle on a hotel and I am constantly reading reviews. This hotel did not disappoint. I booked a deluxe city room view- the view was not the best i.e. Construction..The hotel was in a prime location for shopping, restaurants and the beach was not far. We rented a car for the week and the valet staff was great. The staff here was on point and kudos to housekeeping staff! I would definitely return in a heartbeat.

Great hotel within easy walking distance to shopping, restaurants, and a little longer walk to the beach. My room was clean and the A/C was set perfectly. Also, the balcony was a great place to enjoy a cup of coffee in the morning and get some work done on my laptop before starting the day. I interacted with roughly 6-8 staff members during my stay and each one was courteous and attentive to my needs.
