The only reason I gave four stars instead of five stars is that the fitness center did not open until 6am, and I had hoped for early-morning workouts on two of the mornings during my stay. Had the fitness center opened at 4am or 4:30am, this would have been a 5-star review!

It's very difficult to get to this hotel by car, but if that's not an issue or you're able to figure it out easily, then this is a great hotel. My fiance and I stayed here with the intention of being outdoors and in Waikiki as much as possible, so we mostly used the room as a hang-out area when we wanted to escape the 90-degree weather. We definitely enjoyed our stay. Also the valet team here is phenomenal; by our second day they had memorized who we were and which car was ours. I felt they truly enjoyed seeing us, but maybe that's because we had a red Mustang convertible for our rental ;)

We spent five days here with our 22 month old son, who inconveniently got sick half way through. And while the location is great, and the whole hotel is nice, I really have to commend the staff for their help with my sick son, and making the second half of our trip as comfortable as it could be. Thank you, we will be back!!

Great location at great price will have everything you need. The location of the hotel is perfect, close to the beach, across from a shopping center. Service and security are a top priority as well. The rooms are very modern, loved the bathrooms.

I thought the motel was in a handy spot. Rooms were very clean and well appointed, the bed was very comfortable. Service was excellent, friendly and couldn't be more helpful. No hesitation to recommend this motel

Husband and I visited for three nights for our anniversary. The location is fantastic!!!! The staff is wonderful as well. The rooms are fairly sized. They actually have bidets here....can we say AWESOME!!!! There's nothing like sitting on a warm toilet seat...ahh....take me back.I workout six days a week so I was highly disappointed when we went to the "gym" only to find three treadmills and a two bikes...this is NOT a gym..more like a cardio center. Please invest in weights and other weight machines. The restaurant "Fire Grill"...eh. The breakfast buffet was horrible. Would I stay here again....YES.

We stayed here for 11 nights, the rooms are a little on the small side but we got used to it. There isn't a lot of room to put your luggage. The toilet/shower is separate from the basin which is nice -- lets multiple people get ready at once. Wifi is free. Breakfast isn't included, however there is a cafe where you can buy restaurant as well as a restaurant where you can do a breakfast buffet for $20 as well as brunch on weekends. We walked down to the local McDonalds for a cheap breakfast. Valet is $35 a night. The hotel is a quick walk to Waikiki Beach, only 5-8 minutes -- we cut through the international market place. The hotel has laundry facilities, only three of each machine and it gets busy. $3 a wash. The pool area is nice, but the pool is a little on the small side and really cold. Beds were comfy. Enjoyable stay.

I stayed at this Hilton Garden Inn Hotel in September 2016 on a business trip, shortly after it opened. I recently stayed at this hotel again in April 2017 on a return business trip. The hotel has relatively small rooms, equipped with a closet with hangers, a refrigerator, and two bench seats on each side of the room, between the bed and the balcony. I'd prefer a chest of drawers for clothes storage, instead of one of the benches, but it's not a major inconvenience. The only change since my last stay was the opening of the restaurant. I received coupons for breakfast with my rate, so I ate breakfast in the restaurant each morning -- omelets made to order and the usual fare. It was good. The HoloHolo Café and Market also adjoins the lobby, also a plus. The staff members, maids, waitresses, and valet service were all very service oriented. Parking was valet only, and it cost $35 per day -- somewhat expensive. This hotel is located behind the new International Market Place -- a good location. For business travel to Honolulu, I think it's a very good Hilton Hotel option.

I needed a place for one night and didn't want to spend a lot of money. This Hilton fit the bill. Nice room albeit smaller than a normal room. Quiet. Clean. Good bedding and pillows. Free WiFi. No hidden charges. Good location.

Hawaii annual trip leaving the desert behind.Like Arizona a beautiful place to be, great places to hike, shopping world class, great places to eat.Lei Day celebration May 1st, Spam Jam also during visit

Great location, right in front of the international shopping center. Walking distance to almost everything - beach, restaurants, bars, shops, bus stop, other hotels. The marketplace attached to the hotel is a big plus.

I stayed here for 2 nights and I really want to go back and stay there again. They had a cozy bed and nice views from the balcony. It was very convenient how it had a mall across the street from the hotel and the beach was on the other side of the mall. It was also convenient that the had lots of stores and food places a couple blocks away from the hotel. This is a good place for a couple to stay at if you're looking for a cheap hotel to stay at.

As a regular Hotel Goer (2 -4 nights every week) the Hilton Garden Inn is good value for Money based on the location.... It does lack things like a good bar area, and the restaurant is good but not outstanding, but for the price you are paying it all makes a good package... staff are courtious and helpful, and my only bad experience was when I called down to housekeeping because my room had not been serviced and I went out for another couple of hours and returned about 7PM, and it still wasn't done, so I called the front desk and they got someone up to the room within 15 minutes... might have just been an accent problem!! All in all I would stay there again if I was on a budget.

HONOLULU in general was a very nice place to visit, with people throughout that were very kind and considerate. This hotel, nestled among other tall buildings in Honolulu, was delightfully clean, and efficient. Breakfast was available in the Fire Grille, and before you could blink your eye, housekeeping had taken care of our room, and made it look like no one had ever been there. The front desk staff was very polite and courteous, and answered any questions we had about the surrounding areas. The pool area was clean, monitored, plenty of towels provided. The electronic room card also served as an electronic key in the elevator to be able to go to upper floors from the ground… Thus keeping out anyone wandering in from the street being able to visit the pool area, our room floors, etc. The room itself had everything in it that we needed, was not overly spacious, but sufficient in size. The king size bed was an absolute dream to sleep on. We would definitely stay here again.

Hilton garden inn was fine but some insects in the room and bath room. Breakfast was great. Staff was friendly. 2 blocks from the beach. Accessible to a variety of shops. Food can be pricey but too be expected in this area.
user_name:
Robert L
San Francisco, United States

review_body: I stayed in the hotel and left a quite expensive headset Headphones in the room. I am pretty sure it was in the room because I was using it on the night before I checked out. However, when I called back after checking out, the hotel frontdesk and housekeeping department said nothing was found. That was impossible and someone must be lying!

Very excellent stay! Very quiet hotel. I was impressed being it was not on the beach. We were able to walk to restaurants and the Honolulu zoo. I'd stay again. Good use of my hilton points. Wish the parking wasn't so high.

This a great location in Waikiki. You are a block off the main drag but you don't have the crowds and noise being in closer. It's only a couple blocks to the Duke statue and the beach. Room was nicely appointed. I had a king bed which makes the entry a little tight. There was plenty of room and the love seat area was a nice spot to relax by the sliding door. There were nice views of the International Market across the street, with the beach off in the distance through the buildings. You are also close to the canal which is a great place to go for a jog. If you are hungry grab something from Surf and Turf Tacos. Also there is a grocery store across the street. Only drawbacks are the $35 a day cost for parking and no breakfast included. There are several spots close by with inexpensive food.

Stayed here for six nights in an partial ocean view room with sofa. The room was immaculate, and the bed was extremely comfortable. Coffee machine is supplied, which is great. The room is large, and the balcony is great. You don't get the morning sun from the ocean view room, so lovely to sit out there to start the day. Air conditioning works really well, so room is nice and cool. Neutrogena toiletries are really nice, but would prefer a shower gel rather than the soap.Valet and parking service is great - I didn't use valet, but they organise the taxis and tour buses, and do a great job, very helpful.Front desk is pretty slow, and did have an issue with my room key.Pool is quite nice, but no spa.Laundry is good - need 9 x quarters ($3 for washing machine and $3 for drier, but drier is super efficient and does your drying in 45 minutes).The shop attached to the hotel is really great - you can buy drinks and snacks etc. The restaurant for breakfast is good, had dinner there too.Great location of this hotel, directly opposite International Market, which you can walk through, then down a side street and directly onto beach.Forget the digital room key!! Just get the normal key.I would stay here again.

We stayed here our first 3 nights in Hawaii so we could enjoy this end of Waikiki. We moved to the Doubletree for our final 2 nights to enjoy the Ala Moana end for our remaining time. We arrived early, maybe 90 minutes before official check-in time, and were told that we were receiving an upgrade. (Note: I am not a huge fan of a “view” upgrade since I would rather have a nicer room). When I checked in on-line the day before, I had chosen a room in the same location but on the other side so our view would have been towards the city but we received one towards Diamond Head instead. It really didn’t matter since there were so many buildings in between that we mainly just saw buildings! The best view was on the walk from the elevator to the room and would have been the same for the original room? The room, #1866, was one of the smallest I’ve ever had in the USA; it was more like a European compact room. The bed took up most of the main part of the room. The sink was on the right when entering the room with the bathroom, which included a toilet and shower beyond a sliding door to the left. The ice bucket, Kleenex, and amenities were next to the sink with ample towels below on shelving. There was an area to hang clothes with a ledge on top and a safe below. There were no drawers, except in the bedside table, anywhere in the room. To summarize the right side of the room, walking from the entrance to the sliding glass door for the balcony, there was the sink area, then the closet, and then a small desk with the only chair in the room. The desk did have a small fridge below with a microwave as well. A Keurig coffee pot was also there. The balcony had 2 chairs and was about 10 by 3 feet with a view of the buildings and the adjacent vacant lot near the hotel. One could see the golf course to the left past the canal and a patch or two of water to the right between the buildings, but again, the best views and pictures were from the walkway near the elevator bank. On the left side of the narrow 2 foot path in the room was the bathroom and then a small space to access one side of the bed, then the bed, followed by another small space to access the other side of the bed and then the sliding glass door. There was very little room for any real movement. It was cramped to say the least! The bed was comfortable, but HGI no longer has its once trademark adjustable beds. The wifi worked fine but required signing back on several times a day. We supposedly received a higher speed as HiltonHonors members. We also receive complimentary breakfast which I would not have enjoyed for the regular $18.95 price per person. They were out of wheat bread 2 out of the 3 days we were there. For the price, there were very few choices: packaged sausage patties, bacon, frozen waffles, French toast sticks, scrambled eggs, potatoes, rice, and maybe one other thing. There were some bagels, English muffins, and white bread all 3 days. Juices and a coffee station were around the corner. There was also a large bowl of fresh fruit. To receive eggs made to order, there was a form to fill out. Choices for eggs (sunny side up, over easy, medium, or hard) and omelets (choice of onion, tomato, mushroom, bell pepper, jalapeno, spinach, bacon, ham, or mild cheddar cheese). Friendly service was the highlight for breakfast! The front desk was more robotic. The guy at check-in was great, friendly, and welcoming. We had AARP rate, which promotes 2 pm late checkout, but it is based on hotel’s discretion so really a misleading perk. I asked and was told 12:30 was best they could do and only because of our Diamond status! Not tip top customer service as a Diamond level guest would expect and DESERVE!Check-out was painless, bill was correct, and we checked out just after 11 am as we had changed our plans because of their attitude about late check-out. It all turned out for the best as we found a great place for lunch nearer the Doubletree, our next Waikiki destination.The air worked fine, sometimes too well and really cooled room off; it would shut off if balcony door was left open too long-good feature.Housekeeping was fantastic and cleaned room on both days we weren’t checking out within an hour or less after I requested while we took walks for lunch and sightseeing. Top notch here!In conclusion, we stayed here 3 nights and then 2 nights at the Doubletree about a mile away toward the Ala Moana Mall. The room at the Doubletree was a much better value for the money. It was almost 3 times the size and had a much larger balcony. The housekeeping staff and the cleanliness were the best aspects here. The cramped room, the robotic front-desk team, and the minimal, (overpriced for those who had to pay) breakfast were the shortcomings here. When we return, we will probably stay elsewhere for our nights on this end of Waikiki, but the Doubletree on the other end of Waikiki won us over

I had the most wonderful time staying at this Hilton. The room albeit quite small was very well designed and functional. I love the newly renovated feel - lanai with fresh ocean breeze got me to sleep very well, too. Bathroom was great. I like it the breakfast coupons get you something from the store which actually has very good breakfasts. You can also use the coupons in the restaurant (which served terrible breakfasts with equally terrible service.) There was a lady at the front desk who gets an A+ for top notch customer service and she made up for a weird chip-on-his-shoulder colleague of hers. She deserves a promotion any day. Service would have been a five-star if not for the passive aggressive attitude of this male front desk clerk. ah well.
user_name:
DebraL_12
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: Everything was wonderful Clean updated rooms - 3rd floor rooms have patios with patio table and umbrella along with 2 chaise ( sunbathe ). Also the fitness center has all new treadmills with own tv , pool on 3rd floor with a view. Location - grocery store across the street , beach 1 block away, shopping is all around the hotel along with plenty of restaurants.

Had a two night layover on our way to Kauai. The hotel was very nice, clean and modern. Staff was very helpful at providing information on local sights, including Pearl Harbor and Polynesian Cultural Center. The hotel restaurant breakfast was great and the hotel is close to shopping, restaurants (go to Duke's) and the beach. Valet parking is convenient, but a little pricey.

I am a Hilton Diamond member who travels frequently so please take into consideration that Hilton upgrades me when I travel. That being said I booked a single room pretty cheaply and they upgraded me to a suite on the top floor with a view of the ocean. I highly recommend if you are a Hilton Honors Member with status to book your stay here. As usual with status they give you coupons for free breakfast. There is only one restaurant, Bonfire. You can also use your coupon at the attached store which has a small food counter. i did not try the food counter. As far as Bonfire for breakfast you have choices at the breakfast buffet. scrambled eggs, bacon, sausage, pancakes, waffles, fruit, cereal (from a container) - many choices including fruit loops for the kids. You can also ask your server for the kitchen to make you eggs or an omelet. They give you a paper to fill out and select choices which is nice. As far as the actual food i mentioned, everything was pretty tasty. I stayed for two weeks so I pretty much tried every combination of omelet and fried eggs possible. The pancakes were excellent, and they have a big container of macadamia nuts so I improvided and made myself macadamia covered pancakes every day with strawberries and blueberries. It was good. You never can go wrong with bacon. Since I ordered omelets or eggs custom, I never tried the scrambled eggs. I stayed for two weeks, so I did use the on-site laundry room. They sell detergent at the store downstairs and next door. $3 a wash and $3 to dry if I remember correctly. A bargain compared to taking it to get dry cleaned or have the hotel pick up your laundry and pay per piece. No problems with the laundry room. In and out.quick.As far as the suite, it was big and comfortable. It had a mini fridge which I used and it was very cold. As I mentioned there is a min store attached to the hotel that has food, wine and beer so I used the fridge for some of my purchases there. Also there is a big market next door in case you need things. All the rooms in the hotel are recently remodeled so the room itself was really clean and comfortable. the living room had a sofa, closets and a big balcony. There was an ocean view. The bathroom was big. No tub, just a rainshower. Water was hot. The sink was big. They give you lots of clean towels. The nice fluffy ones. The bed was a king and was very comfortable with big pillows and has a curtain that blocks out sunlight well in case you want to sleep in late. The bedroom also had a balcony with charis. Very nice. Overall the value for what I paid (no resort fees either) was well worth it. I wish my family came with me as the hotel is very nice. One block away from the Royal Hawaiian, the Outrigger Hotel. One block away from the Royal Hawaiin Center and all the popular Waikiki beaches.

We booked this hotel for our remaining last 2 days in Oahu before our departure. It was walking distance from our car rental point which was at Hyatt Regency Waikiki. Budget and Hertz are both located here.Avis is located at International Market Place.Great hotel location and it's located along the more relaxing Kuhio Avenue, which is just a street away from the swanky, over-crowdy, touristy Kalakaua Avenue.Food Pantry supermarket is just across of the hotel. So convenient. The bus stop heading towards Ala Moana, Honolulu downtown, Chinatown and Bishop Museum is just outside of Food Pantry. It does not charge the resort fee unlike the other hotels.Rooms are clean and very tastefully furnished. Everything was good.There is a gym which was good.The pool is more like a circular dipping pool and probably quite small if there were a few more people. Plenty of deck chairs.Staff was friendly and very helpful!! Their smiles made our stay more pleasant.We like this hotel. Will come back!

This is my second time staying at this Hilton and I will return again. For business travel, it's the only Hilton Waikiki I'm aware of that doesn't have a resort fee. Very comfortable rooms well appointed. There's not much of a view from the rooms I've stayed in, but I'm not here for the view anyway. My only complaint is that the fitness room doesn't open until 6 AM. Highly recommended.

The hotel has been recently renovated. The public facilities and the rooms were in great shape. Very good value. Location was excellent and access to the beach was VERY easy. Plenty of great places to eat, shop, etc. nearby. The hotel restaurant is B+ type of food / selection and bar menu. Pool was good for kids after a long day on the beach. Front desk staff was EXCELLENT. Special shout out to one of them in particular, Michael. Excellent help with trips, meals, and helping us with any small issue/request.

Enjoyed the hotel and its staff. Most rooms are 2 beds, would like to see more king beds. Good location, plenty restaurants and shopping near buy. Off the main drag, so the evening noise level was low. Will visit again.

From the time we checked in until check out 7 days later, my family and I had a wonderful experience at this hotel The staff was attentive on every level and guest room was spacious. One thing I would ask for is a dresser of some type for storage of clothes. We made do with the shelf in the closet and on the bed bench.

This hotel is a brand new property and hence has a nice modern touch with washlets in the bathrooms. It is a short walk to the Waikiki Beach and has a lot of shopping / dining options across the street. Also there is a bus stop across the street for easy access to downtown Honolulu and the Ala Moana mall. The rooms are a little compact but that is a compromise for its location. The pool isn't great but then most people here are enjoying the beach.

If you enjoy Waikiki this is a good place to stay because it is reasonably priced and centrally located. The staff is friendly and helpful and they have all the amenities that you'd expect. The valet is a pain in the butt and really expensive but other than that it's a good choice.

I really enjoyed my stay. The room was clean and spacious. The staff was very courteous and helpful with any questions that I asked. The location was great, right in the heart of Waikiki! I would definitely stay at this hotel again!

Loud, tiny rooms and get ready to pay $35 per NIGHT to park your car. Then, be prepared for the Valet service to do everything except reach into your pocket for a tip on top of the $35 per day, every time you park and every time you leave. We have been here 2 days and have 2 dings in our passenger side so far. We will see if we end up with 5 by the time we check out. I am totally ok with expected charges. I am NOT ok with these enormous charges upon arrival.
user_name:
Steve B
Salt Lake City, Utah

review_body: We stayed 4 nights and the suite was just the right size for our family of 3. I love my boys but I don't think we would have made it out alive if we had stayed in the original "boutique size" room I had originally booked. The pool is no frills and there is no hot tub which was kind of a bummer because a good soak would have been nice after walking 6 miles around town and the mall. However, the location is perfect!!! You're right in the middle of everything without the masses of being on Kalakaua. Any where you would want to go is within walking distance and you're directly across from the new International Marketplace. All of the staff from the valets to the front desk to housekeeping were super friendly and accommodating. We will definitely stay at this hotel again :)

We were originally booked in a different Honolulu hotel, but needed to change the dates a bit. Honolulu was 95% booked out for our new dates, so renovated Hilton started looked like a good option.We booked the 'city view room' and mentioned that we were coming to Hawaii to celebrate my child's birthday. After 15 hours of combined flights, there we were - checked into a dark room with a view of a parking lot and not even a greeting card to acknowledge our occasion. After a few hours in the room, it became obvious, that we could not keep the curtains open, as there was also a motel adjacent to that parking lot, so no privacy. The receptionist was downright not interested in the fact the room was not fitting the description it had been sold under, so I had to ask for the manager. She did apologise for the mishap, and moved us to the room where you could actually see the city. There are pluses and minuses in terms of location. The hotel is not really close to the beach, but is right opposite the international marketplace mall. The staff was hit and miss too. One of the bellmen gave us great tips on where to go for lunch, while another one barely let our uber driver to pick us up. It is an okay place, I guess, but definitely not for a memorable vacation.

This was my wife and I's first time to Hawaii and our 10th Anniversary. It was perfect. The Hotel staff was very friendly. The Hotel was very clean and exactly what you would expect from the Hilton name. We are already talking about our return.

For the price and excellent service, always willing to help. Breakfast was amazing fresh and very tasty. The rooms were very comfy and clean, had a problem with the coffee machine came up and replace it right away. Very attentive to my needs

Great from check in to check out easy access to shopping and transport very clean comfortable room quiet non intrusive staff helpful when needed.Great coffee shops across the road a must to go to easy access for pick up by transport

My husband and I stayed here for a week for our honeymoon. We were not disappointed! The moment we arrived, the staff were very friendly and made us feel welcome. Our room was a great size, ac, mini fridge, keurig, beautiful shower. It suited our needs wonderfully. The location was central and easy to navigate to different activities, etc. On our day of departure, our flight wasn't leaving until after check-out time and they let us continue to use the facilities until we left. All the staff were wonderful! A perfect place to stay for an "average" couple.

Great location, great staff! We stayed there for one night on our way from NY to the big island. Friendly staff, very clean and perfect location. We highly recomend this hotel if you are traveling to wikikii.

This hotel has recently been completely renovated, and is located across the street from the new International Marketplace mall, and two blocks from Waikiki Beach. My room on the 16th floor had an ocean view, but through two blocks of hotels! I found the room well appointed fora resort stay, it is not conducive to work, so don't work!The bed was extremely comfortable, the air conditioning ran well and quietly, and the balcony was very nice to sit on in the afternoon and evenings!There is a grab and go market in the hotel, and a good restaurant too for those that are not adventurous.I found the staff great, helpful, and friendly!

Convenient location on Waikiki, next to shopping and walking to beach. Especially convenient to local transportation to anywhere on the island (very good price for seniors). Very pleasant staff and service. Relatively expensive for average building. Restaurant/bar was average for the prices. Bar closed too early.
user_name:
Knut L
Novato, California, United States

review_body: Newly remodeled. Directly across from the "New" International Market Place. Staff were very friendly & helpful. Nice room ( a little small but adequate) Could use some food & drink amenities in the pool area.

A great newly renovated hotel that is a block from the beach and main shopping strip of Kalakaua Ave. Rooms contained everything you would need for the stay - hanging space, safe, hairdryer etc. Air Conditioner was excellent and much needed and a big comfy clean bed. We were lucky enough to be able to check in at 8:30am although we had prepared ourselves for the normal check in time. The front desk also went to the extra effort of making sure the two rooms I had booked were on the same floor and as close as possible to each other which was great and rarely happens. Reasonable prices for location and brand and I was able to get a deal and save some money which is always handy and they don't charge resort fees like many others do. A bus stop is close by if you want to visit the Alaa Moana shopping centre. Will stay here again if I get back to Hawaii.

To far from Main Street and beach. Area can be a bit sleazy after dark, especially after midnight!!! No restaurant if you like the convenience of a buffet breakfast occasionally. There is a private restaurant but not worth the cost nor did the food look great. Nice pool but quite small, pool bar is convenient as well. Rooms nicely renovated. I think you could do better price wise and be closer to beach.

Excellent just fantastic from the room to the serviced the viewed was beautiful just everything was to our standard this hotel we will be staying again in our next hawaii vacation i would recommend this hotel anyone

My husband and I stayed here on a Friday night to Sunday afternoon. For being one block over from the Waikiki strip, it definitely gets the job done. They're testing out digital check in and digital key options, so I tried that out. Digital check in ran smoothly: I was able to choose my room about 24 hours in advance, with the help of a property map. We ended up going with a corner room on the 18th floor, so even though we primarily faced the city, we could see the beach on the far end. The digital key would have been nice, but it didn't work upon check in. We ended up having to go downstairs to the lobby to request two keys, anyway.The room itself was spacious and well equipped. Even though we didn't use it, I loved having a mini refrigerator, microwave, and Keurig. The bathroom had excellent Neutrogena products, and it was nice and clean.If you don't need to be on the actual strip, this hotel is great! It's also across the street from the newly created International Market Mall, which is a prime location! Walking to the beach is quick and easy, too!

I don't have not a bad word to say. A great vacation thanx to Hilton Garden Inn. Can't wait to go back !!!!! Early check in and we requested a late check out and with no problem they gave us a 4pm check out, they were extremely accommodating!!

We spent a week in Waikiki and stayed at the Hilton Garden Inn Waikiki Beach, This was the best stay we every had . The location was great. The staff was friendly and very accommodating. The room was very clean and quite. Highly recommend this hotel and will be definitely staying here next time we come to Hawaii.

Having a refrig, microwave and coffee maker as part of your room is the best thing for families travelling with infants. All of the hotel staff were all so pleasant and friendly. Rooms are very clean and modern, restaurant food was delicious. General store available and right across the street from the new International Market Place Shopping mall.

Keep up the great work in Hospitality!! The staff shows what is needed in this industry a very good welcome knack. The service provided here was SUPER!! At the Hilton on Kuhio- Bradley at the front desk was so professional and knowledgable of the hotel and the surroundings of various vendors to go to. The houskeeping staff stayed on point on keeping us with clean towels our room stayed up to par with their friendliness. The pool was great.

Great location, very good value, friendly staffLocated just opposite the renewed international market placeWith the price we pay, the quality and service of the hotel is really great. The hotel seemed newl renovated.The staff is all friendly too.

Hotel was very clean and modern appointments throughout. King size bed guest room was very clean and well equipped with refrigerator, microwave, Keurig coffee maker, & Hot water pot(quick heating). Would definitely stay here again on my next visit based on price and quality of the accommodations. Also a short walk(2 blocks) to Starbucks and other restaurants.

Stayed here with my family for a few days to enjoy what Hawaii has to offer.Quite a large and busy hotel, valet parking and check in were quite easy. The room offered two double beds, but faced over a car park and into residential units. Nice TV, beds were comfortable and Hilton pillows amazing as always.Bathroom was nice, water pressure was mediocre. The room was serviced daily which was a nice surprise. I called down to get my car from Valet a few times during my visit and found them rude and ignorant. They didn't pay attention and became rude when you called them out on it. I didn't tip them once because of this. They also had a rather annoying way of locating vehicles in the parking lot half the hotel looks over - continuously pressing the key so the horn sounds until they find it. Given the sound reverberates from the surrounding buildings - I just wanted to throw something off the balcony at them. Crazy.Otherwise I had a nice stay here. Location is ok, a few blocks from the beach so its a bit of a walk. The on site restaurant has different prices online to in the restaurant (more expensive when you get there) so we didn't bother going.Towels at the pool were a nice to have, we took them to the beach and also by the pool the one time we frequented it. A lot of asian tourists at this hotel that preferred the beach over the pool, so it was generally busy in the water there. It mentioned there was a bar, but I never saw one?There is a nice convenience store in the lobby also, they even sell musubi.I found it expensive for what you got, not sure I would stay here again given the inconsistent service and poor view for the price paid. Perhaps if we had an ocean view for what we paid it would have made us feel less rorted.Still closer to the action than the other Hilton's.

The Hilton Garden Inn Waikiki was wonderful. The staff was helpful and cheerful. They did a nice job in the restaurant, valet, housekeeping and front desk. The hotel was bright and clean. They did a nice job all around. Thank you for a wonderful and relaxing stay.

Great hotel in a Central location to everything! We stayed as a family of 4 in x2 double bed room. Room not massive but big enough. Very modern room. Bathroom small only downside is that there is only a shower and both shower and toilet in one room.Overall hotel is great, staff friendly rooms are clean and comfortable. Plus we are staying again in 3 weeks on our way home!!

Enjoyed the hotel. 2 blocks from the beach. One block from everything else. Very clean. Stayed on the 20th floor. Nice partial view of the ocean. The rooms were smaller than I expected, but I guess they figure that you're in Hawaii...who's in their room.

If you like the Hilton brand and are in Waikiki, this is a pretty reasonable option. It is not ocean front, but anywhere in Waikiki is a an easy walk to the water. It is a repurposed hotel, and the rooms had kind of an odd layout, but it was a good night's sleep, and it had a nice bathroom. There was an odd little sitting area as well, which had a second TV, microwave and mini-fridge.

Just completed our 4th trip to Waikiki as a family of 4. Each time, we stayed on beach properties as we wanted to have the ease to stroll down in the morning without any obstacle in our way! This time, we stayed at the Hilton Garden Inn which is a few steps away from the beach AND surprisingly we adored it! Not only is it actually a very close to the beach, it is also IDEAL located for ALL activities in Waikiki and Oahu! The new shops and restaurants around the hotel are great, the local transportation is easy and the renewed hotel rooms are a great value! Please check this out. It's worth while. Joris

Location, location, location!!! The hilton garden inn is nice. Most of all the staff are awesome and do the best they can to make your stay wonderful! Kona coffee shop is my fav and international market place is fantastic and convenient!

I have stayed 14 days here in the past month. My first room had NO desk and NO desk chair. For nearly a week, I had to use the patio furniture as a makeshift work station. My second stay had a room with a "desk top" but a bench. Again, I had to use a wicker chair in the room for any sort of back support. Not conducive for business travel; however, location and staff are GREAT.
user_name:
John G
Fairway, KS, United States

review_body: Nice to have small balcony with two chairs and a table, no other room noise but you do hear traffic at night. Hilton Gold breakfast is option of buffet or drink + fruit or breakfast sandwich in lobby market. Free coffee & tea at breakfast and flavored water during checkin at the lobby. Good location with easy walk to beach. If you plan to drive to the hotel make sure you look at the map closely, there are a lot of one-way streets around the hotel and the only car entry + valet is on the side street. Across the street is a Food Pantry grocery store and there are ethnic restaurants very close.

This is a moderately priced hotel for Wakiki that is relatively new. Parking is expensive at $37/night and valet the only option. Fitness center has only treadmills and 3xrecumbent bikes with no elliptical machines and equipment is Star Trac (not the best), Precor is better. Internet is not always fast or reliable. Staff is friendly, nice, and helpful.

A tower hotel in the middle of the action. Clean and up to date. Nice rooms with a balcony but short on storage. Easy walk to most areas. Valet parking if needed, friendly and fast. Very quick coffee service in lobby which I thought was a poor reflection on their part. Has computers in lobby but can be a hassle using them as they are busy. Has a market in the lobby and across the street. Has salespeople in lobby trying to sell you overpriced excursions, stay away. Overall, not bad.

If I can summarize what happened with us in few words will be, dishonesty, unethical, bad customer services and among all they don't do what they promise they would do.We found a lower price from Zenhotels and as per the Hilton Best Price Guarantee we have submitted the claim with the screen shot and guess what they came back and they can't honor it, claiming they can't find the deal. We have done that twice and both times we get the same response, so what you call this??I am an Hilton HH member but for sure that would one thing i won't mind letting go of it because i am not going to stay in any Hilton hotel again.Just as they have lost our group booking of 20 rooms in one go. Very disappointed

This hotel has been renovated and a very nice job. Rooms are nice, but a little small. No drawers in room to put your cloths. Has pool and suntanning area. Smoke free. Everything you need is very close.

This hotel was great. Hotel was just freshly renovated (formerly Ohana Waikiki West). From the Lobby to the rooms, everything was fresh. Front desk was very accommodating and friendly. Rooms were new and clean. I don't ask much for a hotel other than clean & comfortable. The pool area was very nice. Most complained about the pool being small. To those people I say there is an ocean a block away. What the heck are you doing staying by the pool! Most of the rooms have a decent size balcony. I had a corner room with only one smaller balcony and a window on the other corner. This room felt smaller than the others. We had relatives in another room so we could compare. In the end I will absolutely stay here again.

I recently spent three nights at this newly refurbished hotel. On the map it looks like it is a few blocks from the beach but the distance is actually short. The blocks are small. The international mall is right across the street and you can walk through to the street that runs along the beach. The hotel is clean, comfortable and has a fabulous shower. There is a nice pool on the third floor, outside. With plenty of loungers and towels. On the 2nd floor is a laundry room with three dryers and three washers. There is a grocery store at the side entrance and a convenience store right in the hotel with a fairly good selection. Just a few dozen feet from the front door is the very convenient pink line bus stop that does a loop to the Ala Moana Mall. There is a restaurant in the hotel, but plenty of restaurants easily accessible in the immediate area. At night this section of town comes alive with bars and restaurants and lots of nightlife. The hotel is really well run, clean and everyone was absolutely helpful. I would absolutely recommend this hotel, close enough to the beach and everything you might need in the Waikiki area.

Hotel is in great location. All amenities, shopping, food, etc. are close by and is a safe area. Unfortunately, housekeeping does not pay as much detail to the small areas that could have made this property as top tier Hilton property as we have stayed at before. The front end staff are very friendly and have excellent recommendations and are very helpful in ensuring that you get the most out of your stay in Oahu. Also, this particular property does not have a resort fee, yet has great amenities. Unfortunately, the parking of $35USD plus tax is high, however, is consistent throughout Waikiki.

When we first arrived at the hotel, we found the hotel fine, but we rented a car and trying to figure out how to check in and dropping bags off. There is no place in the front of the hotel to do this. You will have to drive to Walina St. Due to all the one-way streets, we had to turn into Kanekapolei St. and turn left onto Ala Wai Blvd and then take a left onto Walina St. and the Valet is on your right. There are no self-parking for this hotel. When we first checked in, we had some issues trying to combine our reservations since we booked our reservation with Hilton Honor points and on 3 different reservations. The lady at check-in seems to be confused on how to combine the reservations. It took about an hour before we were in our room. The room was very nice and clean with a balcony. The room has a microwave, a mini refrigerator and a keurig. The location was great and in the heart of Waikiki. There are a lot of places to eat and shop. One of our favorite places to eat and cheap is Marukame Udon and it is a short walk from the hotel, but it gets real busy at peak times. The beach is an easy walk from the hotel. Walking through the international market and then crossing the street on Kalakaua Ave and going through the Galleria. When we needed the car from the valet, they always had our car ready if you call ahead. So, I am please with the service, but I would prefer self-parking for convenience. Also, I think the cost of parking is a little excessive. In the morning, there are coffee and tea in the lobby area near the elevator and flavored water in the afternoon.At checkout, we had more issues with the reservation. Somehow, our last night reservation was changed from all points to points and cash and we had to go back and forth with the Hilton honor customer service representative and the manager of the hotel to resolve the balance on our bill. This took about 1.5 hours to resolve. Lucky we had a copy of our reservation for proof.I would have given it 5 stars if it weren’t for the check-in and checkout process and the valet fees.

This hotel whilst not on the beach is just five minutes walk away. It is central to everything in Waikiki. It is friendly, great staff and if you get a high room the views are great! I spent 10 days here and will certainly stay again!!

Hotel is very conveniently located - just opposite the international market place, near ABC stores and eateries. It's about a 5-10 minute walk to the Waikiki beach. What I liked as well is that the hotel is newly built. Rooms are of a decent size. Hotel staff are helpful. Pool is small but did not try it. Will not hesitate to stay there again if I return to Honolulu.

pretty decent hotel, not like a top of the line 10+ oh my gosh amazing, but it was decent... a bit pricey for the value, I wish they did continental breakfast too, but again, not bad, I would stay again

This hotel is really well located to Waikiki Beach, restaurants, cafes & transport. It is opposite the International Market which houses shops & restaurants but missing a good food court, however this is being built now and is planned to be completed by May 2017.The pool is small and the lounges need cushioning as they are quite uncomfortable. I expected a bar at the pool but there isn't one, although looks like there was at some point. The hotel is clean, good check in service, tourist information desk with bookings, great shop where you can buy almost anything you need including food, cold drinks, suntan cream & trinkets.

The staff did a great job. Very friendly, especially the morning restaurant staff. My room was a little small but it was an upgrade to Ocean view that they gave me free of charge. Central location on block off beach. Breakfast buffet was outstanding.

I spend 4 nights at the Hilton Garden Inn and thoroughly enjoyed the stay. Excellent staff, great location for shopping, going to the beach and exploring. The staff was very helpful and courteous. When heading out to drive to the many great sites on the island, my car was always ready and waiting. I just made a quick call to the valet. the Fire Grill has great offerings and the food was great. Rooms were clean and spacious.

waikiki hilton gardens is a very conveniently located oasis near the Waikiki strip across(north of) the renovated International Marketplace. the white sandy beaches are a few blocks away but one can get on da bus easily. no need to go to Haunama bay for snorkeling as the fish are bac! by the jettys just east of the Honolulu Zoo. bring your Medicare card for $1.00 bus fare.

It's not on the beach, but that's okay because it's centrally located and you have access to loads of food and things to do nearby.The poolside bar is a treat and they make really lovely cocktails while you enjoy the lovely weather and the water.Our toilet clogged and despite requesting a king bed we had 2 singles (not fantastic for a newly engaged couple) but we explained the situation and our room was upgraded.

This hotel was very accommodating to us as we arrived very early in the morning and they went out of their way to get us into a room early. The room was very comfortable and the bed was great. All the staff was very friendly and helpful. We would stay here again.

The room is clean and all the furniture is new. Great shower! The bed is comfy, there is an automatic coffee machine and a kettle, in the hall during the day you can drink hot and cold beverage. The guy at the reception is very cheerful and kind.

Just a couple of blocks from the beach and next to the International Market Place. Nice large clean rooms. Room rates are moderate for Waikiki. Breakfast buffet had a wider selection than most Garden Inns on the mainland. Bar, coffee stand and convenience store on sight. Staff was very helpful and polite. I would recommend this hotel to friends and family.

This hotel has just been renovated and is quite modern. The fridge contained NOTHING, not even water.So we went to the ABC shop and stocked up and put it in the fridge ,no problem. The bed was beautiful and comfortable. The room was cleaned every day to perfection, thank you Girls I do not know your names.but thanks. We stayed 10 days and it was great.

Upon arrival we were given our room eventhough we were early. We were met with a very friendly aloha and the staff attitude was always the same from day one.Of all the countrys that i have stayed in i would have to rate this one as the friendliest.Room cleanliness was always good and staff were once again most hospitable.Concierge was great helped us with our tours and any other things we neede to know.Best thing was the warm and sincere smiles.

Let's face it, you are going to pay money for any hotel you stay at in Waikiki. The reason we chose this Hilton was that we refused to pay a resort fee ($20 a day) and it was an easy walk to the Honolulu Marathon start. It also had a microwave (but no cutlery!) so you could make yourself a porridge for the EARLY start. Everyone was very nice at the front desk. The app to open the door malfunctioned more often than not, so we just stuck to the good old fashioned key card! Right across from the Aloha Marketplace, it was smack dab in the middle of it all. We had breakfast at the restaurant one day and that was pretty tasty, was included in our room price, else I would just stick to the grocery store or something local. The room included a mini fridge, so you could buy some cold ones and enjoy them on your lanai (bring your own bottle opener though!)

If you want to know where to go and what to see speak to Terry Farrar at Hilton Garden Inn. We didnt pre book any trips and met Terry who took our suggestuons and available days and suggested what might work. All the time checking we were ok and wanted the activities we chose and the days selected. Its not just pucking the outing and booking it in but also considering the day and availability. Terry also looked at what we had suggested and made othet suggestions for us to consider. Definatly worth using Terry if you want to do any bookings.

This hotel is clean and reasonably nice. It appears that the hotel was renovated recently but is an old building. The lobby has a nice little market with coffee and pastries that was very convenient. Be warned that parking is very expensive and the on-street parking is metered.

We stayed at the Hilton Garden Inn at Waikiki Beach. This hotel is centrally located and has just recently been redeveloped. It is two blocks from Waikiki Beach and is an easy walk everywhere.The rooms & suites have free WiFi, refrigerator, microwave and coffeemaker and ours had two balconies. We used the electronic key and it worked great. Our plane was late so we valet parked and didn't get to the room till after midnight. The electronic key worked in elevator and room. Next morning we walked the beach and then ate at TR Fire Grill and bought some things at the Holoholo Café & Market next door. Very convenient!!We didn't get to check out the roof top pool. Overall great stay would highly recommend. Good value.

I stayed in this hotel in July 2016 for 4 nights. The staffs at front desk were super very friendly and helpful. There were several computers that the guests could use near the front desk. The location was excellent near some bus stops, many restaurants, and only a few blocks away from beach. Only one thing I didn't like was that when I visited there, they were doing some constructions and it was a bit noisy at the floor I was staying (I think it was at the 2nd floor I stayed if I remember correctly). They have a big pool, too. Overall I enjoyed the stay though. Thanks for reading my review and you have a great day!

This is my the second time that my family and I stayed at this hotel. Just like the first time, it was a great stay. This is actually even better now that they're done with the construction of the International Market Place. This hotel is close to everything that you need. I would definitely stay at this hotel again the next time I'm in Oahu.

Staff is very kind and cleanliness of room is also very good and I think that it was hotel which was really good for price in Hawaii because it was just renovated. Overall, the staff was very kind and impressive. If you have a chance, I would like to visit you again next time.

It's right behind the new international market place. It's not "on" the beach but very close. It was clean. We arrived early but they were able to give us a room. (It was my 4th trip to Waikiki and this is the first time the hotel has nicely offered it to us.) I would come back here again. It's not a 5 star hotel but I loved it.

This is a new Hilton hotel located close to Waikiki Beach and across the street from the new International Market. The staff was outstanding, the location is central to access Waikiki Beach attractions and the restaurant for morning breakfast was great. I was alone for business. The rooms are smaller than your average Hilton Garden Inn and there are no drawers in the rooms for folding clothes. Be prepared to hang everything or live out of your suitcase. The valet parking is slow so be sure to call ahead for your car or you will be waiting.

We will definitely be back - exceptional customer service, very friendly and welcoming staff. Room was comfortable and modern and the location is perfect - 5 minute walk to the beach. Could not fault the hotel at all - exceptional

Started out on 5th Floor and moved up to 15th floor. More room, better scenery, less traffic noise, less air conditioning noise and less construction noise. Upon arriving, we received wonderful service, and the young people at the desk were delightful. The rooms were clean and the maid service adapted to our schedule, as wewere doing business related correspondence in the morning. (5 hours later in Florida and Ohio). Very rude restaurant service, and concierge service lacked knowledge. The location of the hotel really made up for the minor inconveniences. Lots of restaurants, shops, pick ups for tours, and a short walk to the ocean.
user_name:
Elaine O
MT. VERNON, United States

review_body: To the location was very good. Could have done away with the street noise, but it wasn't that bad. Being in this sort of central location (only two blocks from the beach) very close (across the street) to stores galore and can't forget to mention that Starbucks is about half a block for those Starbucks fans. Staff is friendly and helpful. I think the double bed rooms could have the bathroom sink behind a door or at least a way to shield the sleeping area from the light, but this was a business trip and my companion was my wife. Other than the street sounds (which can't be helped) this hotel would have received 5 stars from me. Maybe next time I will try a room higher than the 9th floor or try to get a breakfast voucher for the street sounds.

When we arrived, the towel bar was on the ground, it was broken. The staff member that helped us with our bags, reported it right away to maintenance. We were told that they will come as soon as possible. We have to leave the room, that was 2pm, we didn't came back to our room until past 10pm, and the towel bar is still broken and on the floor. We have to call the front desk again about this issue. When we arrived that afternoon, the room got a lot of footprints (like muddy prints) and the bathroom floor got lots of hair. We did try to use the coffee maker, it was disappointing that there's still a k-pod inside the Keurig. We don't know how long it was there. How often does housekeeping cleans the room after the guests leaves? Who checks the work of the housekeepers to make sure that the rooms are really ready for guests? This Hotel is located in the heart of Waikiki, with the rate of the room, it is not worth what we paid for plus the added mandatory fees makes it worst. We understand that Hawaii is expensive, as a customer we're expecting that our money is worth what we paid for.

Although it was a one night stay. It was a great one night stay. Great location. We walked everywhere. The store in the hotel had very reasonable pricing for the location. Food all around with a few great hole in the wall places with great value. I would love to come back. The pool is cold at night. No jacuzzi. No hot shower there. I wish the pool was heated. The towels were! I had a great time with my kids and husband. The lobby, so modern and nice. Low sealing near elevators. But opened up in lobby. Restaurant looks fabulous. But no chance to dine there.

It was great time in hilton garden inn except to accomodities. I have to ask razer, comb, bath gel, toothbrush and so on it was little bit to bother me. Good location and kind service satisfied me and my hudsband.

There was a lot of confusion with the hotel reception when we were checking out regarding our rate. We had the later half of our reservation rate lowered due to a rate drop on the Hilton website. Despite confirming this with the hotel clerk (Kia) and going through an extended phone conversation with the Hilton Honours toll free telephone number about their Rate Guarantee Policy, we didn't get the lower rate when we were checking out. The rate differential wasn't as much an issue as the principle of what the discussion went down with the hotel clerk Kia. Kia indicated that they cannot honour the lower rate minus 25% as per the Hilton Rate Guarantee Policy (which was understandable) but he can adjust to the lower rate. Kia distinctly mentioned that at the lower rate, there will be 2 holds on the credit card (which was fine) as an indication of the details of the discussion we had.At check out, the desk clerk didn't have this information. They indicated that they telephoned Kia and the discussion with me was denied. I guess I was accused of lying!!! Fortunately, I had a screen photo of the lower rate reservation (AAA rate). I requested the manager review this and he (Jacob) was even more unhelpful. Jacob checked my CAA (Canadian Automobile Association) membership card and questioned the validity and the reciprocal AAA policy. I went on to call my CAA/AAA toll free number and put them on the speakerphone before Jacob grudgingly gave me the lower rate. Jacob then asked me to re wait for the next available clerk to finish the check out process-I would imagine that any hotel manager can complete the checking out process. In total, between Kia and Jacob, I wasted at least an hour of valuable holiday time.I'm a Marriott Reward program member and uses their service frequently.The difference between my Marriott and Hilton experience is like night and day.I will think twice before doing any reservations with the Hilton chain in the future and would advise all my friends and colleagues against using the Hilton brand.

For the most part it's a lovely hotel. Convenient store in the lobby, nice pool area. However, the walls between the rooms are paper thin. I could hear the other end of a phone conversation from my room crystal clear. I bought ear plugs the next night but my neighbor decided to get busy and our headboards shared walls so I feel like I was part of the action.

Great value for money. This hotel honestly exceeded my expectations and during this trip I had actually stayed in 3 hotels- Hilton Garden Inn was definitely a favourite. It is conveniently located and many restaurants around to choose from. A lot of the staff are really sweet and helpful. The hotel room is beautiful, clean and the layout was well thought out. When you enter the room you immediately feel as if you know it'll definitely be a good stay with good accomodation. We did however encounter a problem with incorrect charges for restaurant dining but that was resolved in no time. For the price you pay and the service/accomodation you're provided with, I would definitely recommend the Hilton Garden Inn.

We both enjoyed our stay for a week in February. Shame we couldn't afford to stay longer but did come home both relaxed and refreshed. We will definitely be recommending to our friends and family that the Hilton Garden Inn is a perfect place to stay. Thankypi

We stayed at the Hilton Hawaiian Village for 4 nights then moved here because HHV was sold out. Of course, it paled in comparison. It is very nicely located right behind the beautiful and new International Market Place and is a 10 minute walk from the beach. The pool was ok, but cold and no hot tub. The room was very clean (brand new) and modern. TV was small but adequate for a smaller room. The staff, especially the bell staff, was excellent. I love Hawaii, but apparently so does everyone else, so it is hard to find a good value hotel. I prefer Hilton properties, and this was up to the brand. Maybe there are 'deals' but $250 per night was a lot.

I've stayed here twice and it is a very nice hotel close to everything and walking distance. Make sure to get an upper floor outside wall. The workout center is good. Nice to have the pool on 3rd floor. If you're a Starbucks fan they've just opened a new one a block away.

Hawaii was without doubt our best holiday ever & the Hilton Garden Inn played a major role with its lovely decor, great staff who provided an efficient & friendly service every time & the excellent location close to all Waikiki had to offer with everything within walking distance, including Diamond Head ! Mahalo, Con & Maria # 1647 Feb 2017

Great Hotel, great location, awesome staff and service. The Hilton Garden Inn is an awesome hotel to stay at. It's staff were very helpful and the rooms were clean and stylish. The highlight was the comfy beds! I had an amazing time at the Garden Inn and can't wait to come back soon.

Stayed here for 10 nights in February 2017. Excellent room (337) had a one bedroom and huge outdoor lanai. This hotel is close to everything you need in Waikiki. Bus and tours right out the front door. Staff were very friendly and professional. Had one small glitch with the room but it was taken care of right away. Will definitely stay here again.

The staff at this hotel were amazing nothing was too much trouble !!! The cleanliness was excellent a sparkling bathroom everyday ! The one thing which is not a biggie but worth a mention ,shower pressure was quite low When we arrived the room allocated was a little small for three people, we asked if there was another at the same price and we were allocated a room with a comfortable pull out couch this room was larger & very well suited for 3/4 people thank you so much for ensuring our stay at this hotel was a time to remember for all of us

The room was in excellent condition with new carpets and repainted walls. Bathroom facilities were great with a large friendly shower. Beds were OK but a little small and the air conditioner was quite noisey. Location was very good with a short walk to Waikiki beach and buses out front of the hotel. Supermarket next door with everything you could possibly need or want. Staff were very friendly and extremely helpful. Room security was excellent and a large safe came in handy. Highly recommend the place.

Our stay at the Hilton Garden Inn was great. The updated rooms were so clean and comfortable. We especially appreciated the extra large shower, the large sink area, the big television, and the in-room Keurig machine. The service was friendly and prompt. The pool area was large with plenty of chairs, tables, and lounges. The pool itself is quite small, but for a quick dip, it was great. I chose to go in the late morning and it was usually quiet at the pool. My husband used the workout rooms a few times and they are well-equipped and overlook the pool lounge area. The only problem we had was that the wifi was not working a few times, which was inconvenient because my husband had some work he needed to do, but it came back online within an hour or so. We did not get an ocean view, but our lanai facing the city was very quiet and I think we sat out on it more because it was in the shade most of the day. The hotel is connected to a coffee shop and store and also has a restaurant in it. The location is really good: it is only a 5-minute walk to the beach (and those gorgeous sunsets), right across from great shopping at the International Marketplace, across the street from the Food Pantry grocery store, and just a block away from the canal which is great for a leisurely stroll. We walked everywhere! I would recommend the Hilton Garden Inn as a good value in Waikiki Beach.

Newly renovated & very good hotel across from the newly built International market. Good location, friendly staff, restaurant OK for breakfast & a grocery store across the street. Rooms are small but fine for a short stay.Excellent service provided by Christine at the front desk. I highly commend her.

Very clean and very welcoming as a Hilton member. Was greated with pleasure but only to find out it was $35 a day for parking and mandatory valet. Multiple times called to reserve my car in the morning but show up down stairs and it was ready. Minus the parking the Garden inn is very nice and location is key.

The hotel looks brand new and the room is very comfortable. Love that the room has lots of plugs for electronic devices. Lots of counter space around the sink. Great price for the room too. This is one of the few hotels where they have 1 King bed and a sleeper sofa. Good accommodation for families. The hotel also provides FREE coffee in the mornings by the elevators. Wifi is decent. The hotel is very conveniently located. The Holoholo mini-mart is just downstairs with coffee and baked items. There is also a restaurant on the first floor - we did not try it. The Food Pantry market is just across the street. The new International Market Place is just across Kuhio street with restaurants, eateries and lots of shops. Aside from these, the hotel is in Waikiki with many other restaurants and shops all within walking distance. And off course the famous beach too. My only nit-pick is that the room lack dresser drawers; otherwise we couldn't complain. Parking is by valet only which is typical in Waikiki. We really did enjoy our stay at this hotel.

This trip was planned for my birthday. I chose the Hilton because I love staying in Hilton's hotels when I travel. The location wa great a few blocks from the beach, beside a grocery store, across from the international market place, down the street from a shopping area. There were bars, nail salons and such in walking distance. When I return I will go back to this hotel

The room smelled like urine. The location is great if you don't need to be on the beach. The bed is comfortable. The smell is appalling. Had to keep the balcony door open to abate the odor to make the room tolerable for resting. Sleep quality would have been excellent if not for the odor and having the outside door open to street noises all night to abate the odor. Need to improve housekeeping quality assurance before assigning rooms.

We really lucked out with this hotel, as we booked it the week prior and cancelled our previous reservation at a different hotel (due to lack of pool at the previous hotel). All I saw was that it had a pool at the Hilton and looked "nice" when I booked. The hotel is in a nice area, and near the new fancy international mall. The hotel itself is lovely, and has a little shop in the base of it that has all sorts of stuff should you have forgotten anything. Super convenient when you've forgotten something and don't want to hike out to the local ABC when you've first arrived and don't know where anything is. We didn't eat in the restaurant so can't comment about that, except we did check if they had a happy hour and they didn't. But there is a little bar in the front which does (odd location) - but it did have a happy hour!Staff at the hotel were amazing, and I mean everyone. Front staff were super knowledgable and every cleaning staff member always smiled. It seemed that everyone was happy to work at the hotel, which you don't often get! It was actually a really lovely surprise. The concierge was fabulous and booked a car for us super quickly. Heads up. I think one of the concierges also does represent a time-share with the Hilton, so if you don't want to sucked into that 7th circle of hell, don't sign up for a timeshare presentation. (I didn't go to one of the presentations, it's just my experience with other timeshare presentations!)Pool. It's small-ish but that's pretty much the norm for hotels in Waikiki. That being said, unless you're planning on doing laps, it's perfect! There are plenty of chairs, towel access is super easy, and there's a bar down there and a sitting area. The bartender was friendly, but just FYI, no happy hour.Our room was great… The shower was huge, and had killer water pressure! We had a little balcony that had two chairs on it which we used…we had an excellent view of the busy downtown area which was wonderful from the 11th floor in the evening. There's a fridge and even a microwave, and a coffee machine… But we never used the coffee machine as there was hot coffee in the lobby in the mornings. There are little paper cups for it, so if you wanted a larger caffeine hit, I would suggest getting a big mug from ABC. They also did serve decaf and had tea as well. Oh, and our room as also decorated in a cute modern style. Security. The elevator will only take you up to your floor if you use your room card to activate the elevator. This is true as well for the bathrooms by the pool area, and I don't think you can get access to the pool unless you have your card either to let you out on the third floor. Initially it's a pain in the butt, however it's a brilliant idea, as there are so many tourists in Waikiki, anyone could really just wander in. So the additional security measures were appreciated!So we would go back in a heart-beat. Hotel was in a perfect location, grocery store next door, the people lovely and room beautiful! Happy!

Great hotel; not on the beach but it the middle of everything. Hilton assistants are great, especially Lauren. Great restaurant and bar and good stores on either side of it. International market has been ruined by high-end stores but the Duke's Market next door keeps some of the traditional aloha. Study the maps, as it is tricky driving in and out. On the other hand, you won't be driving a lot since the HGI is in the middle of everything. Great hotel.

Stayed at the Hilton Garden Inn Hawaii for 7 days with the family. Hotel staff was always very helpful and friendly, specially Nolan... Always a smile and an Aloha... Arrived in Hawaii at 6am and were able to get a room even though check in is later in the afternoon. The hotel is close to everything and the restaurant downstairs is great too. Booked all our tours downstairs through the concierge in the lobby. Ross and Micah were always very helpful and friendly and helped us organise our whole week there. Had a great time there... Good value..

Staff was excellent --bell boys (Wade & Kazu) to waitresses (Hazel) , room attendants, etc. Very exceptional, quality, friendly service. Property was well maintained, breakfast was profound with a great selection and variety of items

Amazing hotel, the staff were so friendly and helpful and the hotel is equipped with many features like a gym, pool and a cafe. The restaurant downstairs is lovely with great service too! Our room was cleaned daily and the hotel is also in a great location; I would definitely return and recommend to my family and friends!!

What can I say, I am extremely happy with my stay here. I stayed for 10 nights and everything was just right. The beds are comfy, rooms have generous balconies, large tv, modern living space, etc. The whole hotel looks very modern and inviting. The Fire Grill bar/restaurant downstairs in also great; we had many a meal there! The hotel is just across the street from an ABC Store (groceries and general items) and it's also surrounded by other shops and general eateries (Jamba Juice, Mc Donalds, Coffee Bean, etc.) The walk to the beach is very short, 5 minutes generally; and if not for the constant traffic lights it would be even shorter. Very good and central location, close to everything you could need. My one minor complaint about the room (we had a double City View room) was the shower pressure. I liked that it was a detachable head but the pressure was not very strong, but as I said, a very minor issue. I also didn't like that the rooms didn't come with a kettle as I was expecting to at least make myself a tea/coffee that didn't come from a capsule. Again, a minor issue.Everything else was absolutely great. Staff are very friendly, especially those at the travel desk. They will be able to help you with shuttles, airport transfers, tours, etc. All in all a great hotel and if I ever came back to Waikiki I would definitely be staying here!

This hotel is in a great location, on the main strip close to shops, 5 minutes from the beach and 30 seconds from the supermarket. They happily moved our room after we were put in a room with two separate beds. Hotel is clean and very friendly. Staff have been wonderful. The only thing that I would change is that they don't provide you with cuttlery or crockery. Found that a bit odd as we had to go buy our own to have cereal in the morning. Otherwise would absolutely recommend this hotel

we started with a partial view room was small and compact, then we changed to an ocean view... room was larger.the rooms were clean and tidy...recently renovated.staff were very friendly and helpful.complimentary coffee in the lobby from 7-9am and citrus water in the afternoon(pinapple,orange,lemon).very close to bus stops,international market place,and malls.15 mins walk to the zoo and aquarium.ala moana mall is about a 25 min walk.we really enjoyed staying at this hotel and would like to stay here if we return to Honolulu

While the hotel is very clean and offered amenities like other nicer hotels, the rooms were small and no space for unpacking luggage. The hotel is in the heart of many restaurants and shopping areas. It is right across the street from The International Marketplace and a block away from Waikiki Beach.

Really clean and staffs are nice. Near Waikiki beach, Pink trolley stops, ABC mart, Nordstrom rack, marukeme udon.... you can go by walk. Pool is also nice, you can use beach towel free. Free coffee service in Lobby. I really satisfied with service and convenience.

This place has nice clean rooms and is just about 2 blocks from the beach. The lobby is cute and inviting. Our room was nice it just would have been nice to have more drawer space. My husband likes to completely unpack when we get someplace. The pool got sun most of the day until about 3. We were on the 5h floor and there were lounge chairs that got sun for another hour or so after the pool. Parking is valet only and $35 a day but, that seems pretty standard for the area. The valet people were great, they had our car right away when we needed it and were always friendly. This is a great place to stay and not spend a fortune but you are still in the heart of everything.

Overall the hotel and location is great, close to the beach (about 5 minute walk), shopping, eateries and local bus stops are just out the front.Pillows were crap for a Hilton Hotel and the powdered milk for coffee a big let down.Would stay there again.Minor improvements would make this a 5 star.

This is a very nice hotel if you're traveling for leisure with your family or loved ones. If you're traveling on business, this is not the hotel for you. There was no desk or chair in my room so it was very difficult to do any work from the room. I can't speak for all the other rooms, but none of my work companions had desks or chairs in their rooms either.

I spent about 2 weeks here after a stay at another Hilton property as my husband didn't want to spend all 4 weeks at the same hotel. This was our first stay here and chances are, it will be the last. The hotel was refurbished and the only thing it has going for it is newness and that will wear off soon. We originally had a 2 bed room. there is minimal closet space - 7 hangers. why so important - because there are no dressers. there is a cushioned bench that you apparently put your suitcase on and live out of a suitcase for your stay. at the foot of each bed was another cushioned bench (without a back rest) and that was the only other place to sit aside from the bed. No desk, no table. We, like most others, brought in the small table from the balcony. the bathroom - not good. Granted, new but that is the highlight. Water pressure is low, no place to hang towels (so much for environmentally friendly). The towels are kept outside of the toilet and shower area - across the entranceway is the sink - basically open to the room. We were "upgraded" to a king room. No cushioned bench at the end of the bed because the room was too narrow. Again, no place to put your clothes. Disfunctional and uncomfortable design. Water pressure was still low. Fast internet was a plus. Our room included breakfast and the staff at the restaurant was wonderful! The only meal we ate there was breakfast. Location was good because the bus stop and trolley is at next corner. Pool is very small and faces Saks Fifth Avenue. NO HOT TUB! NO HAPPY HOUR! However, there seems to be a constant smell of smoke - as in BBQ. At the pool and in the hotel hall. About the valet - each time we got the car, the valet adjusted the seats, arm rest and would change the radio station. At one point, I thought I had left it with more gas than when I picked up the car. One morning, when headed back to a destination, the valet had programmed into MY gps a golf course. WHY? It was bad enough that these guys adjust your seats, arm rests and radio stations but now use MY personal GPS? Makes me wonder why every night on returning was asked, when I was coming to get the car? If doing laundry, easier and cheaper to go across the street to Ido. there are only 2 washers and 2 dryers at the hotel. too bad you can only use valet parking - that was the first time I didn't trust the valet guys.

To be fair this hotel had not been open for very long when I stayed, and teething problems were very evident. I am sure things will improve with time, however the hotel, which is an old building that has been renovated, has the feel of a cheap renovation. The rooms are clean, nice, but nothing special. Parking is valet only with a very small off street space to drop off and pickup. It is a good location in the center of Waikiki and an easy walk to the beach and shops.

We loved this Waikiki location and found the accommodations clean, comfortable, and pretty. The staff went out of their way to be helpful. The shop in the lobby has convenient items like beer and food that are not too pricey.

If you don't mind walking to the beach this hoyel is the best in town. It's new rooms are excellent ans spacious. Staff amazing very helpful we stated with Zelda or Selda then Diseree front representatives and Mimie our room attendant. All in all was a great layover for two nights. Hotel located across from the new mall and accessible to all.

We had a suite on a high floor and it was new and lovely. The location of this hotel is very good, since you are only two blocks from the beach. It really is an ideal spot for walking around town and the beach.

Waikiki and Honolulu never gets old, you could practically live there if you could afford it. The Hilton Garden Inn was a pleasant surprise and overall a great stay. I just stayed there last week and I was given a corner room at the end and it was VERY SPACIOUS! 50" Plasma Screen TV on the wall, 2 double beds, microwave and mini-refrigerator, with 2 long benches inside along with 2 nice size ottoman and a full Lani balcony. You might want to ask for a corner room! Very nice size for me. Another tip, if staying 5 days or less I personally wouldn't pay the $35 a day parking, we just parked in Waikiki, like a block or too over, read and follow the signs and you should be good! I think parking should be reduced or COMP for Diamond members, if we are business travelers and staying in Hilton Properties over 120 stays per year giving us free parking for 5-7 days will not make the hotel and property go broke!
