It's probably only 25% of guest who stay on a given week are Diamond or Lifetime Diamond members! Also Gold and Diamond members do get the free buffet and cook to order breakfast, but do realize after 3 or 4 days the menu doesn't change and it's the same crap! I wish the Food and Beverage manage could get more creative in that department. Even smaller hotels change up their breakfast menu! SMH! It's $19.00 per person and totally not worth that price, walk 2 blocks over to Duke's for an amazing breakfast for $1.00 less! Yes it's that great!Even though we had free breakfast on the 3rd day we asked was it the same crap and they said yes, so we just went over to Dukes. Overall it was a great stay and I would stay again! Please address the parking and the breakfast!

Central to almost everything Walking distance to the world famous beach. The Hilton Garden Inn is relatively inexpensive comfortable clean and the staff are efficient and friendlyMy only criticism is that the pool is really small I know the reason for being in Waikiki is the beach but a larger pool would make the aground experience more pleasurable

We stayed for 7 nights at the Hilton Garden Inn Waikiki. We found this hotel to be a great value and fantastic location. The rooms were what you expect from a Hilton Garden Inn: clean and comfortable. What we really enjoyed was how quiet the room was. The hotel was at full capacity and we didn't hear anything outside of our room other than the occasional noisy guest walking down the hallway. Big plus. Maid service was excellent.We paid to eat the breakfast buffet at the restaurant located on property and it was good. There is a convenience store also attached to the Hilton, and we found this very handy. This store also had a coffee/smoothie bar which also served hot items (turkey sausage burrito was very good), pastries, and in the evening had beer on tap and wine. The store had everything from packaged meals to drinks to food to toiletries to souvenirs. Waikiki is a bustling place with every store you can imagine, and this hotel is located directly across the street from the newly-built mall International Market Place. Beautiful open air facility with shopping, restaurants, and almost daily musical entertainment. A quick stroll through this mall takes you right to the resorts located on the beach (Duke's, etc.). The pool on the roof of the third floor gets great sun. The beauty of this pool was you didn't have to fight for a chair like you do at some other resorts. There were always plenty available. The bar opens at 10 a.m., or so I was told. It was different nearly every day. It seemed anywhere from 10:10 to 10:30 a worker strolled in and spent the next 1/2 hour putting the bar together before it ever opened. Some bar staff were friendly, some barely seemed to have a pulse. And the drink prices seemed very high compared to most anywhere else I bought a drink in Waikiki. So we enjoyed our sun, usually bought one Coors Light (not bad for that one at $7 for a can) and then usually headed elsewhere to drink. Would I come back to this hotel? Definitely. We saved a lot of money staying one block away from the beach, and it was nice to have a comfortable, quiet room at night. I do hope they figure out that they can sell twice the alcohol at the pool bar if they'd just come down a bit on their mixed drink prices.

Booked online through bookit. We were upgraded to an ocean view room floor 19 which was great size with separate King room from living area which had sofa bed, tv and fridge and microwave. Lovely view from balcony. Hotel is close to Waikiki Beach. Just a short walk through international marketplace across street and down.AC could have worked slightly better can at night but was manageable. Many pillows to choose from and the bed was pretty comfy. Great coffee in morning and fruit infused water in afternoon.Manager Melinda was phenomenal!!!! Kudos to you.ConsHousekeeping walked right into our room the one morning while hubby and son lying in bed AND the parking fees are ridiculous.

Nice hotel with excellent staff and location to Waikiki, restaurants and shopping. Room was a little small but comfortable. Required valet parking too expensive and a little slow but OK. Would come back again.

We stayed a week at the Garden Inn and thoroughly enjoyed our stay. There was one glitch upon arrival in that our deluxe king room was very, very, small. We asked about this at the desk and we were moved to a much nicer and larger room. The hotel is spotless and the staff is very friendly and service oriented. Suzy, at the front desk, helped to make our especially nice. The location is fabulous! A short walk through the International Market takes you right to beach access and lots of the best beachfront restaurants. For the price, this is exceptional value. There were only 2 small things that kept me from rating this as 5 star. There is a need for umbrellas in the pool areas, and the water pressure was rather low.

No compensation for double charging my room, received email saying that I would receive upgraded room which did not occur and the rooms were extremely small, nor did I receive compensation i.e. Free breakfast,

The check-in was fast as no one else was checking in (we arrived late at night) but it took a long time for the bags to get to the room. Not sure why as they had lots of staff and no other guests wondering around. The room was nice, it's rare you get the room as advertised in pictures but it is exactly that. Brand new (must have just finished renovating) shower was nice and the beds were great too. We were floor above the pool and were facing the international market place. It was nice to sit on the balcony and relax at the end of the day. The room had a microwave, mini fridge and tv. The free wifi worked good too.Parking is expensive but that goes for all hotels in Waikiki, we had a car and walked from another hotel that had cheaper parking. It was nice the hotel didn't have a resort fee, that was one of the reasons we picked this hotel.They are still renovating the restaurant on the corner of the hotel so it might have more options when you stay there, but it could also add to the noise. Food pantry was right across the street which was nice.We did have an incident where a bellman didn't knock and just opened the door with his key then saw us and said wrong room and left. That was kind of odd he didn't knock to make sure no one was there.

Diamond member, stayed for a couple of paid nights to enjoy some R&R.Pros:- Newer hotel; e.g. relatively clean, shower door did not leak water all over the place, etc.- Good location, next to Int'l Marketplace and Marukame Udon (must go for cheap and filling food), 5 minute walk to beach- Holoholo food pantry/gift shop attached to hotel- No 'resort fee' extra charge bsCons - deal breakers for extra rating:- As a Diamond I was subjected to room XX48, which is 2 doors away from the elevator. Noise level unacceptable at night when people come & go ... along with the constant bell dings when elevator reaches floor. - As a Diamond I was not offered any upgrade to a better room or view.- The one day I wanted to try out breakfast at Fire Grill - the restaurant was closed due to fire inspection. I was not notified of such closing at check-in, else I would have planned for breakfast another morning.- In lieu of breakfast at Fire Grill, I used a coupon at the pantry/gift shop. Though convenient, the amount of food was severely lacking. They were out of 'hot breakfast sandwich', so I had a 'breakfast turkey bacon burrito' that was about 4 inches long.

Modern hotel right opposite the new International Market Place which takes you out to the streets of Waikiki Beach. Walking distance to shops, restaurants and the beach. Coffee machine available daily until 10am.Only complaint is that for a redeveloped modern hotel they need to provide more comfortable beds.

My 13 year old daughter and I stayed here for eight nights. The hotel's location was perfect for us for food and transport. The staff were super friendly, rooms clean, housekeeping perfect. We will be back.

This was a great hotel it had recently transitioned to a HGI the rooms are on the smaller side but were clean and decorated nicely. When I went there restaurant was not open yet so we had breakfast at Dukes which was amazing. The hotel was in a great location and I was able to walk to the zoo, aquarium and lots of shopping places. Would definitely stay again.

Clean, spacious, quiet room, comfortable bed and also a fold out queen sofa bed, lanai. Great location in Waikiki. There is nothing special here, although we really did appreciate the mini fridge and microwave. On-site restaurant is ok, but wouldn't go out of my way to eat there again. Ordinary pool. In short, if you just want a nice place to lay your head this fits the bill.

I was traveling with my children aged 16 and 13. We booked a partial ocean view room with 2 double beds. The room was very clean and quite modern, the partial ocean view was what you would expect. We were on the 20th floor and the view as you got out of the elevator was fabulous. The free wi-fi was a hit with the kids-unusual in some of the bigger hotels.The location was excellent, especially if you are wanting to save money by using the city buses. We caught one to Diamond Head from across the street and one to Ala Moana shopping Centre slightly up the road.The staff were really helpful and we ate twice at the Fire&Grill restaurant downstairs. The food was so good and the staff were great! It was also a bonus you can pick up bits and pieces from the store downstairs. Ultra convenient.Even though we weren't on the beach, it was just a quick walk through the International Market Place across the road. The view from the pool was the Saks 5th Avenue store window.I've already told friends about this gem. I would definitely stay again.

We stayed at the Hilton Gardens after our cruise and were greeted with happy people that were eager to help any way they could. With directions. Places to eat things to do. The location was excellent. Close to the beach. Across the street from the newest shopping mall. It was great all in walking distance

Was here 2 nights. Easy walk to the beach, no more than 10-15 minutes. Right in the middle of shopping and restaurants. If this is what you want, this is a great choice. Obviously downtown Honolulu is not a quiet secluded spot. Facility is fairly new or has been remodeled, interior is modern, room fixtures new. Nice balcony for fresh air. Price seems about right for this moderate level of luxury. Hilton Garden fans will not be disappointed. Breakfast good. Staff helpful, car valet was quick.

Good value without sacrificing access to Waikiki top spots. A fun walk through the International Market Place landed you on beach front restaurants and beach. View from 20th floor was very nice. Staff was very helpful. Didn't bother with a rental car but cabs were quickly arranged. Bell hops knowledgable on bests ways to get to airport, Pearl Harbor and make meal recommendations.

Really terrible welcomeWe arrived early to be told our room was not ready. We found out we had not been given a view room or king bed as requested. Staff was really indifferent, especially manager. They gave us a room above valet parking so we could not open door for fresh air due to all the talk. We were told they would mov e us day 2 but were initially assigned 2 double beds and no view. After complaining the manager said she would move things around which she did and we were placed in a king bed room. Why the manager would not move anything around as the manager did on the second day, despite our early arrival is very upsetting. They knew I was an honors member and the visit arranged by travel agent. In fact they said that there were a lot of honors folks staying there and that did not mean anything as they were full. For the start of a 40th anniversary trip to Hawaii , which they were aware of, it was awful. The day 2 and 3 experiences were better but the palpable lack of caring day one is what will stay in our minds.

I've stayed at the other HHonors family properties in/around Waikiki but wanted to try out this new property this visit. I booked a standard room but was upgraded to a suite as an HHonors Diamond member.The suite had an unusual layout; you actually walk into and through the bathroom to get to the room. Once you step through, you're in a small living room that had a sliding glass door onto a balcony. Through an interior sliding door, you have access to the bedroom and a large open closet space; the bedroom also has a sliding door that opens out to the same narrow balcony the other door opens onto.The room was comfortable and quiet; internet was fast and always on; air conditioning was easy to control and water temperature/pressure were fine. The shower was especially roomy and I appreciated the nice adjustable/modern head/controls in the new shower. Otherwise, furnishings and bedding were comparable to other Hilton Garden Inns.The front desk staff was very friendly and accommodating. They have a new full-service restaurant on-site; the decor was really cool there and atypical of standard food offerings at other Hilton Garden Inns. The breakfast spread was great with made-to-order items available from the kitchen too. Best bacon I've ever had at a Hilton Garden Inn :)The drinks at the restaurant were also good. Priced high like peer eateries on the street, but mixed well with special recipes and special infused liquors.Food at lunch/dinner was just OK. They try to be a bit upscale and eclectic, but they weren't able to completely pull it off with the dishes I tried. It was just average quality/taste wise. And a bit pricey.But for a large Hilton Garden Inn property in the heart of Waikiki, this was a nice hotel with nice options ...and footsteps away from anything you want to see/do in town.I would definitely consider it my mix of properties to stay at the next time I'm in Oahu.

My wife and I had a stop over (23 hours) in Honolulu so we were looking to not break the bank on the hotel. The location was great (for not being on the beach). The staff was friendly. The rooms were great (for a garden inn). The pool was a great place to kill time!
user_name:
dereksL3797XA
New York City, New York

review_body: It was a great place, close to everything so we could walk, Staff is great, room was great. Wonderful view of the ocean from our room with a partial view, Valet parking is the pits if you forget something in your car. GREAT GROCERY STORE ACROSS THE STREET.

As others have said - rooms are small. I am a Diamond member and even though I requested upgrade in comments section, when I arrived I was put into a really really small room. Bed with no room and most of all no table/desk & no balcony (even though I booked balcony room). I guess none of the rooms have what we would call a desk. Just a narrow, under the TV table with bench seat. I called down & they upgraded me to a 1 bedroom unit. Rooms are still small, especially if you are used to the older hotels that have decent sized rooms. Good feature is that they let you call down for the car (most hotels now require you to come down first) so the wait isn't too long if at all. The best about the hotel is if you are Honors member that gets the free breakfast, the buffet breakfast is excellent at the Fire Grill restaurant in lobby area. The service getting in is a problem but I'd expect the restaurant management to get their act together and make it better. Understaffing problems ( Not owned by Hilton).

There are a few things going for this hotel. Its new and the beds are very comfortable. The beds are double beds so very spacious. Additionally, the location is right infront of the International Marketplace which is a newly opened shopping area with a lot of eateries with a Kona Coffeeshop right across the street. It is also not far from the Waikiki beach and all the action along the main area. There is also a grocery within the hotel with a casual bar and dining area. I don't think it's part of Hilton but it is within the grounds. The staff are great and friendly. My only bad experience was with a lady who checked us in. I felt she was just doing her job (similar to a robot). She checked me into a regular room even if I am a HHonors Gold member. I had to call the desk after checking in and Zach immediately transferred me to a better and slightly bigger room. Except for that lady, everyone in the reception was awesome and super helpful. The rooms are a bit small though and there are no special views (atleast where we stayed). We had a special time here and would not hesitate returning.

This hotel has undergone a total refurbishment under the Hilton banner. Very well done, nice clean modern lines, the pod coffee maker a nice extra. Shower good size, room size average. Pool area lovely with nice size pool and plenty of banana lounges. Good size supermarket across the street and bus stop nearby. Very convenient to lots of restaurants. The only negative, is that not everyone wants to drink out of paper cups, so real glasses please. All staff helpful and friendly. I would definitely stay at this hotel again.

After being a honors member and grand vacations owner for many years we were assigned to a room that was loud due to location. Open to outdoors and more importantly to elevator noise. It was awful, no sleep and room was so small could barely walk around the bed. Thankfully we spent minimal time in the room but what we did was terrible and not hilton quality!

This is a new hotel, and I have stayed here twice since they opened. They are definitely working on fixing things, and the staff has been wonderful each time, but little things are still WIP, like missing laundry bags in the room, no luggage stand, minor issue with the check-in process, etc.As I said, it takes time for a new hotel to get up to speed, and its only been six months since they opened their doors, so all of these are understandable. They now have a functioning restaurant that serves all meals, and have a breakfast buffet which includes made to order omelettes. I did have my table cleaned while I was getting more food, and the seating arrangement can be a little award (some of the tables make seating very close to strangers), but again, all things that I'm sure will be worked out, and the food was good, overall, with great service (if somewhat overenthusiastic...). Even the lobby can be tricky to reach from the car drop off circle, which is to the side of the hotel and not the front.Overall, the hotel features a great location, right across from the new International Market in Waikiki, and good views. It has a small market connected to the lobby, and I expect it to be even better as time goes on.

Hotel centrally located on Waikiki strip very clean and close to all activities and shopping . This was a very good experience. I would recommend the Hilton Garden Inn for a comfortable stay in Waikiki.

The best part of this hotel is the location!! Walking distance to eveything including the beach!! Hotel is clean. Staff is friendly. This is not a 4 or 5 star restort. But for the money and location its worth it!

Perfect location in Waikiki, close to everything.we were 3 generations travelling, so our needs were met very well. Lovely pool area, nice clean rooms, bar and restaurant. would definitely stay again.

My friend and I booked this place last minute after an airbnb disaster for our last two nights in honolulu. After our stay, we regretted not booking it earlier!On arrival, thee staff were gracious and welcoming. After we told them about our previous airbnb, they were nice enough to give us complimentary drink vouchers for their pool bar, which was unnecessary but appreciated! As the beach was so close we didn't use the pool, but it looked nice and clean and not overly crowded.The room is simply decorated but clean and comfortable. It had everything we needed - the beds were comfortable, and there was heaps of luggage/closet space. The only annoying thing is the layout of the shower/toilet and open sink area made getting ready/dressed slightly difficult but not impossible.This hotel is in an amazing location. It's conveniently located near the main beach/street, lots of food/restaurant options, a supermarket and heaps of shopping. Our tour to Pearl Harbour left from just outside the hotel which was great for the early morning start. There were homeless people around which was unavoidable, but the area is well-lit and busy enough that I never felt unsafe even at night.This hotel is an excellent choice for a nice, reasonably priced hotel in the heart of Waikiki.

The Hilton Garden Inn ticks all the boxes! Its new, clean, modern, situated right in the middle of Waikiki and very reasonably priced! I would definitely stay here again and would highly recommend. Did not disappoint.

We had an excellent stay at the Hilton Garden Inn Waikiki. The staff was very friendly and helpful during our stay. The room, while on the small side, were very clean, but we didn't spend a lot time there anyway! The bartenders and wait staff at the hotel restaurant and bar were very nice as well. The location is perfect for walking over to the beach or to the International Market and all the shopping areas of Waikiki. We would definitely stay here again.

Great new and clean mid-range hotel in Waikiki. Regular room is small,like a business hotel in Japan but clean. Comfortable bed. Very quiet. Nice restaurant with fresh local foods, hand-mixed cocktails. Awesome staff throughout. Highly recommend.

Staff were very accommodating, we arrived before the check-in time but they still checked to see if any rooms were available, unfortunately none were but we appreciate the assistance. Bag storage was easy and pain free.We wondered around Waikiki for couple hours until we were really exhausted and decided to sit in the lobby until check-in time. We checked for the room availability on occasion and we were met with smiles and unhindered assistance on every occasion. When a room became available we were given an upgrade, unfortunately though as it turned out the upgrade was for the view on a higher floor but a smaller room. We had booked a King with Sleeper and now only had a King. We thought we could make do with the space, but unfortunately we realised that it would become too small for us as we were staying for 14 nights and needed some breathing room.The staff were only too accommodating and changed our room to our original option which we were much happier with.The facilities (pool/gym) were great and well kept.The hotel is ideally located with it been a major stop point for most tours, especially Robert's Hawaii. All the good shopping locations are a short walk from the hotel.International Market Place is right across the road.Royal Hawaiian Center and beach are a short walk through the International Market Place.Overall our experience was top notch, the staff were superb and always happy and friendly, right from reception to housekeeping. We will definitely recommend the hotel to anyone who asks.Thank you to Hilton Garden Inn in helping us enjoy our holiday that much more.

The hotel is located in fron of the International Market Mall, walking distance from waikiki Beach, nearby to several restaurants and shops. The value for money is reasonable good. They have an Expedia inhouse office, very convenient to plan and book tours.

This hotel was great, nice view, close to shopping and restaurants, there was as a store and restaurant on sight. Very friendly and helpful staff. Busses and trolleys pick up regularly nearby the hotel. Rooms were quite comfortable with quite a few amenities.Coffee was served in the lobby daily and there was a full business centre for patrons use.A couple of PROBLEMS though. Ice machines were not on every floor so it was necessary sometimes to wait a long time to get an elevator to go up one floor to the ice machine. Just a real nuisance since we had to go through this routine daily.Also, the unit doors close SO loudly that you couldn't quietly exit, and could hear people all the way down the hallway closing theirs all hours of the day and night.

This newly renovated hotel has everything you need for your stay at Waikiki. Centrally located opposite the new International Marketplace, it is easy to get to everything with bus stops right outside. The rooms were large and spacious, with comfortable beds and pillows, all the amenities you need (coffee maker, fridge, microwave) and thoughtful little touches like USB outlets everywhere. Breakfast buffet (included for HHonors Elites) was fine, has all the expected food and generous span of time (6-11). No, this isn't a fancy resort with poolside dining and entertainment every night, but you also don't have to pay exxy resort fees. A great addition to the Hilton chain, and highly recommended for people who would rather experience Waikiki/Oahu rather than stay in a resort hotel 24/7!

I absolutely love this hotel. The former Ohana West has been totally redone and is now the awesome Hilton Garden. Everything has been redone from top to bottom. Love the modern decor and the pool area is great! The staff is very friendly and Lauren N at the front desk is awesome!! Great food at the TR Fire Grill located at the hotel. Fantastic location across the street from the new International Market and a couple of blocks to the beach.

I was in Hawaii for work so I stayed at this property for 22 nights, which included the Christmas and New Year holidays. This is a fantastic hotel. Close enough to walk to the beach, but yet far enough away from the hustle/bustle of Kalakaua Ave, which is the main drag through Waikiki.I'm very picky when it comes to room cleanliness, as I'm a borderline clean-freak LOL. I have to say that my room was always spotless after housekeeping did their thing. The hotel was refurbished within the past year, and it definitely shows! The room A/C worked great, which is very important when you're in Hawaii. Wi-fi was good. The Keurig machine, microwave and refrigerator worked great as well. The 47 inch wall mounted Samsung TV (with LOTS of TV channels) was the icing on the cake.My room was on the 16th floor facing Diamond Head. I couldn't see too much of the mountain, and just a small sliver of water, but I did have a great view of Kuhio Avenue. The International Marketplace is across the street, which has many dining and shopping options. There is also a small market just off of the lobby and a great full blown restaurant is on site, along with a self service laundry room that has 2 washers and 2 dryers. $3.00 to wash and $3.00 to dry per load. Parking is the standard "valet only, $35 a night" variety that is common throughout Waikiki. This is a fact of life over there - I've seen many reviews where folks complain about this, but good luck trying to find a place to park on your own if you want to save the money. The only down side was there was no desk or Ethernet ports in my room. This was not a big deal for me as I was able to work at the table and use my AirPort Express which utilized the hot-spot on my phone for Ethernet connectivity, as my work laptop does not allow Wi-Fi connectivity. Just thought I'd throw that out there if you absolutely needed the desk or Ethernet connection.The pool area was nice. There was a bar at the pool as well. Drink prices seemed to be average.I really enjoyed my stay at this Hilton property. I have stayed at quite a few Hiltons over the years (current Diamond member) and this one is definitely at the top of my list.I know where I'll be staying if/when I return to Honolulu for work or vacation :-)

Would recommend for sure, can be pricey in peak seasons but staff are amazing and would be back in a heart beat, valet was very expensive if you hire a car for more than 3 nights find alternative parking

Happy we stayed here, all rooms were recently updated and very clean hotel. Staff were helpful and would stay here again. Although it was Christmas and New Years when we stayed here, it never looked over crowded and was alway comfortable at the hotel.

This hotel is in the heart of the shopping area of the Waikiki Beach neighborhood. It is a few blocks from any beach access. The hotel isn't new but the rooms have been redone. The rooms are clean and well appointed with lots of outlets and USB sockets. There is a small lanai. There is a microwave and a fridge in each room. The bathroom shower is excellent and glass encased. No tub. The rooms are smallish but very well planned. No chest of drawers so the only drawers are the two in the night stands. The parking is valet only and we'll staffed with a very courteous bunch of young folks. The lobby staff is ultra helpful and there are many. Service must be a high priority because it shows at all levels. The restaurant attached serves good breakfasts and the staff there is also excellent. There is a full service convenient store connected to thr lobby. It opens very late. It also offers deli food and some hot food and liquor. Can't beat it for convenience. There is a high end mall with shops and restaurants across the street. The entire neighborhood is a commercial busy hub with restaurants all over. Many choices inside a block or two at every price point. This isn't a resort hotel at all but more of a downtown business and tourists hotel. It is quite workable for most purposes. Recommended.

We were pleasantly surprised with the friendliness and good service in this refurbished garden inn.The rooms are very comfortable and the front desk staff are helpful and very friendly. Excellent location.

I stayed for a little over a week at the Hilton Garden Inn in Waikiki and really loved the location. You can easily walk to the beach and there are a ton of restaurants and stores in the surrounding areas. I'm not a fan of the valet only parking but understand since it's quite cramped in the area! Valet was generally tolerable as long as you called valet earlier (they provide you a ticket with the extension number and an ID number). The rooms- I was able to see two since I switched once due to the lack of view (more on that later)- appeared nice but may differ in terms of large desk or standalone table. Walls can be a bit thin- one night I heard some sort of drilling and hammering past midnight, which stopped after I called the front desk to complain. On another night, I heard a couple have enthusiastic relations. Thankfully, did not last beyond that night!The lack of view was truly, truly terrible- there is another building nestled in the inner "L" of the building and my first room faced a blank building wall. After talking to the very friendly front staff, they relocated me to the 7th floor facing Walina St, so I had a view of some trees, a bit of the cityscape and the roof of food pantry. If you get a room facing Kuhio St, you will have a view of the International Market. Overall, definitely a good location and I would consider this hotel if I were to stay in the area again.

The hotel is in a good location near everything beach about a 10 min walk. The rooms are clean but very small. I don't think I would ever rebook again. To charge what they change we paid less at the Sheraton Waikiki and it's a dream hotel impaired to this place. Staff very nice and friendly

Old hotel refurbished. Good location, opposite shops. But the rooms are just too small. We had two double beds, which took up most of the space. The bathroom has a shower and toilet so close together that you feel like you may fall into the toilet when you exit the shower.

This hotel has an Excellent location, very clean and quiet room, close to the nice International market shopping mall, and Waikiki beach, I wish I could book a suite. Does this hotel have a suite?We stayed during new year eve, it was very full and crowded, didn't try the TR grill, wish we could stay longer.
user_name:
C C
San Ramon, California, Usa

review_body: HGI was a great place to stay while in Waikiki beach. They provide beach towels everyday and also have a good market in the lobby. Con - no drawer space. We had to get a lot of extra hangers and become inventive with storage space. For a family of four we made it work but it made for a tight fit in the room. Excellent customer service and a mini fridge with the food pantry right across the street. Bring your own bottle opener

Great hotel,great staff, room was spotless the misses love the fact that there was a microwave fantastic location to walk to the beach & shops,restaurants transportation is at the door we have booked another stay in September

The only reason I haven't given them a 5 star is due to the mattress being very hard. I like firm mattresses but this was actually hard, the kind where you can feel there isn't enough padding between the springs and the top.... 5 days into our 12 night stay I got used to it and stopped waking up with a sore back. Onto the all the positives: we arrived on a 6am flight and were prepared to hit the streets until our 3pm check in but a room was available and they checked us in early without any extra fees, like Las Vegas charge - we were very happy; not sure what the hotel was before Hilton refurbished it and opened up in June 2016, but they have done a great job; my husband and I stayed in a 2 x double beds room which had ample space to move around in, a bench to place suit cases on, a wardrobe, large TV, heaps of electrical sockets including a USB charging point, a small round table for food/drinks/laptop, Neutrogena toiletries, very large shower and toilet behind a sliding door, large vanity area, in room safe, microwave, fridge, coffee maker with coffee sachets/pods, ice bucket (ice in the foyer) hairdryer, iron and ironing board. I could often smell a pleasant perfumed fragrance in the foyers, which I later discovered was one of the disinfectants the cleaners used - nice and fresh. Our room was on the 3rd floor which is where the pool is, I asked for a quiet room which it was, but the only downfall to that is the balcony faced the car park and another building so we didn't use it... no big deal as we were out for most of the day and enjoyed the cable TV when we got back. The pool area was a little larger than what the photos do justice and they had a bar, billiard/pool table, couches as well as sunbeds. The hotel also had a guest laundry (washer/dryer) which we used at a cost of $3 USD per load. Every morning the lobby was setup with free tea and coffee and late afternoon they would provide free chilled water which was infused with fruit - 3 options like lemon, lime and pineapple which was our favorite. The hotel had both a front and side entry point - the side offering a ramp for those with wheelchairs and prams, the front of the hotel which faced the International Market Place has stairs only. The hotel's restaurant 'TR Fire Grill' still wasn't ready when we left 2nd Dec, though appeared to be very close to finally opening. The hotel did however have a convenience store attached to its lobby with snacks/drinks/alcohol, souvenirs as well as a cafe that served various sweet and savory items, coffee etc. Across from the hotel was a Food Pantry which boasted a large grocery store, alcohol, fresh fruit/veg and meats as well as some ready made cooked hot items - upon entry there was also a Coffee Bean and Tea Leaf cafe, an Asian sushi shop and one that prepared various hot meals which people often queued at . As mentioned the hotel's front, sits across from the newly built International Market Place (last time we were in Honolulu it was actually more like an open air market place, but now its an upscale semi enclosed building with Saks on 5th; Honolulu Cookies and other boutique stores, as well as a cafe at the front entrance called 'Kona Coffee Purveyors' which makes excellent coffee, has an onsite bakery with lots of yummy things and even sell glasses of wine); from here you can walk through to Kalakaua Ave which is considered the main shopping/restaurant strip. If you need to jump on a bus, there is a stop located on the corner opposite to the hotel and for example a $2 bus fare took us to Ala Moana Shopping Centre about 15 minutes away. Despite the hard mattress I would consider this hotel again if the price is right (the price was creeping up after it opened, so I may have been lucky booking it pre opening in June 16).

I don't like if there no toothbrush and toothpaste, even there is no slipper, I asked guest service, leter they bring it to me. and one more big problem is washstand located in open space, it is not comportable that your bedroom partner washing her mouth and nose and tooth in front of you.

The lobby was modern with a coffee/bar/shop attached on the 1st floor. Nice pool area with plenty of lounge chairs and a small bar (not the best pool view though-faces a shopping area). Convenient location-across from a shopping area, short walk to the beach and Royal Hawaiian area. Definitely recommend. Staff was very friendly.

Stay was enjoyable easy access to WaKiki area for beach and shopping. Check in was hectic busy, would be good to have a information only desk to take some of the burden off the service desk. Service desk rushed.

This hotel is the perfect combination. It does not offer all the amenities of a full-blown Hawaiian resort, but offers just enough to make a an economical compromise. Totally re-modeled in a modern look. Great pool/patio/bar. Good restaurant. Excellent, friendly, and helpful staff! Truly a perfect economy compromise location. Directly across the street from the entrance to the new amazing "International Market Mall". Only one block walk (through the mall) to the main retail street. 2 Blocks to the beach. Connected to quite possibly the best little store in Waikiki, HoloHolo (see my other review). No self-parking, but the valet was always great. Good Wi-Fi. Great selection of computers (including a mac) to use in the lobby. Rooms are a little on the small side. Double beds in rooms can be tough for two people in the same bed. Bathroom/Shower is beautiful, but shower lacks much pressure. View can be from limited, to not much. Overall, if you need a resort on the beach, this isn't your place. If you need a very modern, clean, convenient location, with more than just all the basics, this is an excellent choice. i would stay here again in a heartbeat. In fact, I would pick this place above many other bigger, more expensive hotels, solely based on its superb location. You will not be disappointed!

This was a great find, very good location, good eating spots nearby, hotel restaurant great, pool was fine for quick dip not too crowded, overall service was fantastic with very friendly staff who were happy to help with solving any problems we had

1. The hotel locates directly across International Market. 2. In order to get their complimentary breakfast, you need to be a Gold or Diamond Hilton member AND you NEED to book directly through Hilton. 3. The hotel is very stingy, when I asked for brand aid, front desk said ONLY one brand aid per guest.

My fiancé and I spent a few nights at the Hilton Garden and had an amazing stay! The staff members are so welcoming and attentive! The rooms are spacious and we had our own balcony too. It's right in the heart of Waikiki and you can literally walk to anything- the mall, the beach, little gift shops, or restaurants for breakfast/lunch/dinner. Also the hotel conveniently has a store attached where we got fresh bagels and coffee. I certainly would recommend this hotel to anyone-

Everything about this hotel was amazing! One of my favorite details about the room was the shower and the bathroom. It was perfect and the room was just beautiful. There is a huge counter and mirror with wonderful lighting (for the ladies when we need to do our make-up). The sheets were clean and the bed was extremely comfortable. Other hotels in the area don't compare to the professionalism and comfort of this one. Easily the best hotel I have ever stayed in. They have a little fresh market downstairs that is everything. I went their literally every morning to grab a Kona coffee and pastry. They have everything you need and more. If you call ahead for vale I guarantee that they will have your car waiting for you when you go down and if you don't call ahead, you only have to wait maybe 5 minutes. Before you get to the front desk there are a few different varieties of fruit infused water that are delicious and refreshing. The staff was extremely polite and helpful and room and maid service were spot on. I would give this hotel 10 stars if I could. Management has done a great job. I was very surprised how smooth and easy everything ran especially with this hotel just opening. I will most definitely stay again.

New hotel with nice decor. Our corner room was a good size, and had a coffeemaker, microwave, fridge and safe. Bed and pillows were very comfortable, the shower worked well and there was always hot water. The location is great, very close to stores and the beach, but we weren't bothered by noise at all. All the staff were very helpful. There's a great bakery / coffee shop / bar / general store located off the lobby.I would have given this 5/5 except for the following:- the towels were a little on the small side- the vanity unit was not flush to the wall, so toiletries could fall down the gap- the wardrobe rail was only half-heightAnd - most troubling of all - about a week after we checked out, they emailed another bill to us. We had palpitations initially as it was around $3000, and we had already paid for our 2 night stay. Then we realised that someone else's name and address was on the bill, and they had sent it to us in error. We were back in Honolulu the following week, so we called in and showed it to them (we were unable to get through on the phone). They confirmed it was their error and apologised, though they didn't understand how it had happened ... but it was disconcerting, and made us wonder if our bill (and personal information) had been emailed to someone else too.

Negatives include valet only parking (which was not smooth), suites located under a loud and probably inefficient chiller, a lack of room service and such amenities, and limited access as it has one entrance located on a one-way street.

My husband and I stayed at the Hilton Garden Inn Waikiki Beach the week of Dec 11. This was our first time visiting beautiful Hawaii and this hotel was a perfect fit for our vacation. We chose this hotel because of the very reasonable room rate (there are no daily service charges like the other hotels) and it's central location. The hotel is new, clean, modern and never seemed busy or over crowded. Also, the hotel staff were very friendly and helpful, no issues here whatsoever. We stayed in a guest room with one king bed and a lanai on the 17th floor. We had lovely views of the mountains. The bed was very comfortable with lots of pillows options to choose from. Couldn't hear a sound from our neighbours or traffic in the hallway. A Keurig coffee machine with an assortment of k-cups, a microwave and fridge were included in the room. Kona coffee is available in the lobby for hotel guests from 6 a.m. each morning and cold pineapple water is available in the afternoon. A self-serve laundry is located on the 3rd floor and a 24 hour laundry mat is across the street. HoloHolo Market (closes at midnight) and TR Fire grill are connected to the hotel. There is valet parking only for $35 per day. We found most guests hiring a car at the hotel for a day to avoid the fee.The beautiful International Market Place is directly across the street. It's brand new with high street shops and restaurants. You can walk to Waikiki beach by walking through the mall which is about a 5-7 min walk. Marukame Udon is a block away from the hotel. We visited this popular noodle house in the morning for breakfast to avoid waiting in long lines. The Food Pantry is across the street which is uber convenient. The number 8 bus to Ala Moana Mall is right outside the door (it's a 15-20 min drive). The bus fair is $2.50 pp. I highly recommend booking Charlie's Taxi service airport transfers in advance for a flat rate of $29 each way. it's about a 25 - 45 min drive to the hotel. You will say about $15-20. Overall, the hotel was very nice and in a very good location. We highly recommend staying here.

I don't think we will be returning to this hotel. Had issues at the valet, the patio was dirty and filthy. Having the bed right next to the dirty curtain by the sliding door was ridiculous, our faces was right on it while sleeping. Internet was very slow, couldn't get any work done.

Was thinking this hotel would have a high price being only 6 months new and in Waikiki. The hotel is in a great location right across from international market and near all types of food and beverage places for every size wallet. Loved the room and entire hotel and it was priced reasonably being just two blocks from beach. The restaurant and cafe are also great in the hotel if you just feel like chillaxing! Not too far from park and other site seeing places. Definitely staying here again for work trips as so easy to get in & out of Waikiki as well.Surf & Turf Tacos, Kona Purveyors, Udon were highlights of the food around there.

A newly opened, fully upgraded hotel with all the amenities. Across the street from International Marketplace and many local shops. A few hundred yards from popular downtown Waikiki restaurants, bars, and beaches. This hotel is a perfect place to stay if you are in town for a vacation or if you are in town for business travel as I was. The rooms are very modern and well appointed. All rooms have a TV, microwave, coffee maker, comfortable beds, a desk, couch, and a very nice shower and modern toilet. Parking is a bit difficult and valet only, but the staff are exceptional and it is perfect for work. Getting your car back is quick and you can call ahead. The in hotel bar and shop are very nice and have everything you will need to compliment your stay. The hotel pool and outdoor lounge area are very nice. Rooms are relatively quiet and of a medium size. Internet is fast and reliable. I would stay here again and I would recommend this hotel to others. This hotel does offer Hilton Honors App Check In and Electronic Keys so you can completely bypass the front desk for your entire stay if you wish.

Nice hotel; handy to everything, but away from the main hype. Just walk across the road, through an emporium filled with beautiful shops, gardens and trees and you are in the hype. The pool isn't heated, but the pool area is pleasant. We arrived early and they were unable to have our room ready until 3 pm, even though it was a request. It wasn't too bad, we dosed around the pool lounge, had lunch in their restaurant; yawned our way through and finally it was 3 pm. Staff are helpful, considerate and obliging. Room staff are hard working, so worth tipping. A nice hotel

Loved this hotel. Not a resort like some others and still expensive but worth it. The central location was perfect. The restaurant was brand new and the food was delicious. The staff in guest services were super helpful suggesting activities and tours.

Great brand new hotel, located right across the street from an international market. Rooms are decent size , same for bathroom. I didn't like the roll out shower design , it floods the entire bathroom. It's an excellent value for location and brand new hotel , restaurant just opened . It's very nice and modern as the rest of the hotel . I would stay again and would recommend it to everyone heading to Honolulu.

Love this hotel it's really nice only bout 6 months old. Beds are super comfortable, pillows are great. Room is quite spacious for 2 people queen size beds. Checked in & the lady changed us to a room with a bigger balcony just to be nice. Great location opposite the International Market, Food Pantry right across the road & the beach is just a few minutes walk. Hotel has a guest laundry $3 each for washer & dryers. Hotel also has 2 fitness rooms. Been to Hawaii a few times & when I return to Waikiki this is where I'll stay. Attached to the Hotel is TR Fire Grill really nice food in here & 5 star service.

Just one block away from Waikiki Beach along the busy thoroughfare, the room blackened out city lights and we could not hear street noise, nor our neighbors. The compact, well furnished room offered a pleasant balcony for morning coffee. I like staying at Hilton Garden Inns when I can, but this is one of my all time favorites for modern comfort with style.The only downside of the hotel was that although there are plenty of restaurants nearby and there is a convenience store/sandwich type shop, the usual restaurant was missing - so no room service. The only other downside is if you are staying as an overnight spot to break up long distance travel, make sure you have plenty of time to get from the airport to Waikiki. The shuttle took FOREVER - and not because the driver didn't know what he was doing. Once there, you are all set because everything you could need is within walking distance.

We couldn't fault our stay at the Hilton Garden Inn Waikiki. The location was excellent, a few minutes walk to the beach, restaurants and shopping. Our room was spotlessly clean, modern and great layout and facilities as depicted on the hotel website. Front desk staff were friendly, helpful and service oriented. We appreciated immediate room availability when we arrived early morning, which is always subject to availability but we were offered our rooms without the need to ask if it was possible. We had two separate rooms close by each other as a family group. I would definitely recommend this hotel as value for money in the heart of Waikiki.

New hotel in great location, only a few minutes to the beach. Close to good places to eat. There is a little shop attached to the hotel, good for coffee and snacks.Great staff, very friendly and always happy to help. Rooms are modern and clean, little on the small size but who spends lots of time in your room anyway.Would stay here again.

Great location and room. We especially enjoyed the fabulous view and lots of balconies. Only complaint are the pillows. Too soft and no support. I think they were down pillows and would have been nice to have options on different firmness of pillow type.

Room was small. No chair with back, so no working here. Just a bed, bathroom. Lanai very small--didn't see anyone using them, though was okay for a stretch and a very cute and tiny lizard. New and clean, so okay for a f w hours of sleep, but not the kind of room you hang out in looking at the view. Hotel staff competent. Valet parking was $36/day. Close to touristy things, national ripoff chains like Sacs. Boring. But a short walk to the beach and nice run along the beach down to Diamond Head.

This was an amazing hotel; very impressed. Right across from the new international market mall, looking straight at Saks, which is open til10-11 pm. Lovely modern hotel, rooms and pool super clean. I have already recommended this place to a few people.

I went here with 2 friends for a shopping holiday and it was great!Our flight arrived at 7am and even though check in wasn't until 2pm they had a room ready for us when we arrived! This was amazing as we'd been flying all night and it was so nice to be able to have a bed straight away! We stayed here for 6 nights and it was great for the price! Very close to everything and was more than what we expected!Would highly recommend

Ask for beach view or the Diamond head view or else you are facing the parking lot & other buildings & you cannot keep Your shade open unless you want to be seen by others. Asked to be moved but had to be moved twice since the second one was not any better. Housekeeper lady was nice kind enough to help me move my luggage to my new location. She was a life saver. Disappointed that I was not given the same information as my colleague when I checked in. Was not even aware of the restaurant in our hotel of the grocery market across the hotel. $36 tax included for valet. No self parking.

We stayed at the Hilton Garden Inn, Waikiki for 6 nights. The location of this hotel is brilliant and is right at the heart of all the shopping areas. The newly opened international marketplace is just across the street and the main beachside road is just a short walk away. The lobby of the hotel is new and comfortable with nice couches and tables, next to the lobby is a handy convenience store open from 6am all the way to midnight. The store also serves breakfast which is handy.The rooms of the hotel are top quality with decent amenties and room service. The service was great throughtout our stay and our room was always in a clean fresh state when we came back to the hotel after going out for the dayOverall I would recommened this hotel and commened Hilton on making our stay as enjoybale as possible

Stayed with my 22 year old daughter.Check in and out was good.Proximity to beach excellent and shopping.The room was good but big disappointment only paper cups and no bottle opener.I had to go downstairs each night to have beer bottles opened.The reason given for no proper glasses was they us no proper sanitation station( ridiculous) and because it was 3 to 4 Star this is normal.Pool area and fitness rooms good.Would stay again but definitely take my own glass ware.
user_name:
Fran M
Auckland Central, New Zealand

review_body: Hilton Garden Inn was in a great location for the family. Great places to eat in the area from low budget to five star dinning. Short walk to the beach. Hotel is a like hard to find the first time on a one way street. Rooms are good size for the family

Terrible service.... low water pressure on our floor which they knew about. The shower wouldn't work. The button that you push on the faucet to activate the shower wouldn't stay down so the shower wouldn't work. Someone came to our room and used electrical tape to keep the button down! There are many other hotels way better than this one! Don't waste your money.

My boyfriend and I were in Waikiki for 8 days and stayed at two different hotels. This was our first stop, location was great because it was close to the beach. The pool was ok but could use some upgrades like their bar. Wasn't too busy when we went in February. The lobby was absolutely beautiful and no complaints about the room. We had an ocean view and it was hard to start your day off bad when your views were of beautiful Waikiki Beach.

Our recent stayed for 7 nights, we booked thru Hawaiian Airlines vacation which saved almost $700 for 3 pax, if possible, avoid HA vacation, the worst services ever. We arrived at the hotel around 2pm and checked in was so smooth. The staffs were friendly too. Our room was on the fifth floor close to elevator, face the busy street (Saks Fifth Ave), to our surprise, we couldn't hear any noise from the busy street or the room next door.This was a clean room, plenty of USB charges around the room. We were here for vacation, so we no need any desk. Room has a small table with long bench which were nice. Balcony has a small table and 2 chairs. Hotel is located at the middle of Waikiki, everything within walking distance. Waikiki Trolley stop location on the left in front of Waikiki marketplace which has nice Japanese udon and Korean food. International marketplace opposite the hotel has more upscale restaurant. T Galleria about 10 minutes leisure walk. Waikiki Beach just 2 blocks from the hotel. There was an Expedia tour agent ready to help at the lobby, keep in mind, we won't able to get our Expedia point from our booking. The restaurant has soft opening on the second last day of our stay, it was closed when we back to hotel, the front desk has no idea about the opening time and anything about it, so we never get to enjoy the new cafe at the end. Overall, we enjoyed our holiday, and happy to stay in this cozy room for 7 nights.

I stayed 5 nights in this fabulous hotel, the rooms were nicely decorated and housekeeping was prompt as well as valet services. The lobby was fully functional with nice furnishings and computers for your use. The views from my side were city but there is an excellent city/ oceanview. The pool was well kept. Loved this place.

I chose this hotel because I was coming to Hawaii on business and did not need all of the resort amenities, but desired a convenient location. The hotel has recently been renovated and the staff is generally professional and very helpful. I was upgraded to a city-view king on the 20th floor and it was a good-sized room with nice amenities. The only drawbacks were that the desk chair was not very comfortable for sitting at the desk and working on the computer and the lighting in the bathroom could use to be brighter. However, the hotel was clean and the bed was comfortable, so I was pleased with my choice of this property.The hotel has only recently opened its restaurant and as an HHonors Gold Member, they gave me coupons for free breakfast each day. The buffet had all of the items you might expect to find and they also would make omelets to order. They had only been open a few days, so there were some growing pains, but the food was good and the servers were all very nice.My only complaint revolves around the fact that I arranged for a 6:00 PM checkout on my last day since my flight home did not depart until 10:00 PM. The late checkout costs $105 plus tax, and I had arranged it the day prior at the front desk when they asked for my ID and reset my key. Imagine my surprise then when I returned to the room at 4:00 PM and first received a call from my wife at home who said that the hotel was looking for me. A moment later the hotel called me and asked where I was. I told them I had just arrived back in my room and I was asked if I knew that checkout was at noon. I told the person on the phone how I had arranged for late checkout and the hotel staff person then started quizzing me on who had made the arrangements, telling me that it had not been done properly. The person I was speaking with made it seem like it was my fault. I did not appreciate that. I was then assured that everything was "ok", but 20 minutes later housekeeping arrived to clean the "vacant, dirty" room. Then I discovered that my wireless internet no longer worked. It was very frustrating and seemed to me that I was being rushed out, despite having paid the additional charge. It was an unfortunate end to an otherwise good stay.

Our 6 day stay here was the best. Newly renovated with style, very helpful staff, servicing...the best with plentiful supply of towels. Close to shopping, restaurants and Waikiki Beach. Can thoroughly recommend.

Review many hotels, finally choose this one, arrived very late and check in very fast. Hotel gave us upgrade suits room, high floor, inside super big and super clean. Room inside looks brand new, very moderm decoration. Hotel locate in very convenience location, cross road to international market, supermarket next to hotel, many restaurants close by, few min walking to Waikiki beach. Highly recommend this hotel!!

It is always a concern when you have to stay at a new hotel, especially when it is an extended one, 23 nights, and you stayed under the previous ownership, and were not overly impressed! This however was a revelation, the rooms were super and the staff friendly and courteous, we had a small issue, which was not actually easily resolved, so I was slightly dissapointed not to receive a couple of complimentary nights, especially with their slogan about not paying if you're not satisfied. However all in all a very enjoyable three weeks in an excellent location, andI would not hesiate to return in the future.

Everything was great. The room was nice and the staff was top notch. Everyone was super friendly and helpful. I traveled with my sister and we each had our own deluxe room. I would definitely stay here again.

The hotel is in a perfect location in Waikiki just across from the new International Market. The hotel the old Ohana West has been completely redone and is awesome! The new rooms have a modern feel and are bright and cheery. Staff is very friendly.

Very nice property with a great location. I would stay again with no reservations. All the staff I encountered were pleasant and helpful. I only wish the HGI had a breakfast included with the room, but this is HAWAII so that's expected.

Newly refurbished with awesome room threads - stay away if you do not plan to sleep in for you'll have to be dragged out of the comfy bed. A hop and skip away from awesome shopping joints and good food, you'll be spoilt for choice. I love coming back here after a long day out in town - I get to wind down with a relaxing hot shower, the pressure is superb to soothe those tired leg muscles and then jump into bed to recoup for another exhilarating day back at town.

Stayed for a week in the recently remodeled former Ohana East and they did a nice decorative job. HOWEVER, could not change the tiny rooms which had VERY limited storage space and space to move around and only one chair for two double beds. Balcony unfortunately looked away from ocean at beat up old apartments that looked like slums. Great location, nice having free coffee in lobby in morning are positives. Paid with tax $200 a night and would not go back.

Great hotel just accross the International Market Place and and good restaurants. 5 minutes walk to Waikiki beach and groceries stores are just around the corner. Rooms are quite small but would suit perfectly for couples. I would recommend this hotel to everyone who would like to stay in the middle of Waikiki.

Staff were helpful, room was great. The early checkin was really appreciated. Would highly recommend.Vallet service was great at organising shuttles and giving general information and tipsThank you for a great stay.

This hotel was a great choice for our seminar at The Royal Hawaiian. Great beds, friendly staff, a coffee shop across the road that made great cafe latte and delicious pastries. A pleasant 10 minute walk through landscaped 'arcades' to the beach and in the afternoon delightful live Hawaiian music at every turn. The trolley bus to the Ala Moana shopping centre - if you really want to shop!

Hotel is a recently updated property and new Hilton. Good location for tourist stuff without paying the premium to be near the beach - beach is an easy 10 minute walk. Good restaurants within walking distance.This was my second stay here. Both rooms were nice and reasonably quiet. I am stuck with a business rate and a double room, so I am not sure how the Queens and Kings are laid out.Onsite restaurant is open. I am unsure how long they have been open and they still experience some hiccups and inconsistent service.Parking is a typical Waikiki goat rope. They offer valet parking and the entrance is around the side of the hotel on a one way street. My experience so far has been that patience is needed. There just isn't much room near the street.Overall, worth the stop and I will stay here again.

The hotel is truly beautiful. Well done, well maintained and close to everything. There is a small shop in the lobby that sells food, snacks, and all kinds of merchandise and there is complimentary coffee in the lobby in the am. The concierge service was great! She recommended great excursion options based on our schedule and budget. The convenience of having our choices booked and paid for at one location with all of the instructions and maps provided was a great time saver. There are really no views at this hotel unfortunately because it is not on the beach, but rather two blocks away. However the two blocks you walk are well worth it. There is a beautiful mall right across the street that we cut through to walk to the beach. We were able to see 2 free shows in the mall while we were there on the history and culture of the area and various dancers performing in traditional dress. Really great time!

Gave this Hotel 4 Stars mainly for the great location and friendly staff. Location is great, across the street from a grocery store (Food Pantry) and there is a very nice cafe/shop in the lobby. They were opening up a restaurant as well in the hotel the day I checked out. Also across the street from the new International Marketplace, which has a number of restaurants. Plenty of restaurants, both cheap and pricey easily within walking distance. Beach is a couple of blocks away. Valet Parking only, so at $35/day, it is expensive to have a car. Rooms seem to be newly updated with comfy beds. As to the only negatives, this hotel is not ideally suited to guests coming for business, or for long stays. The fridge in the room barely keeps things cool with no freezer compartment. There is a microwave, which is nice. The biggest downside, though is that not all rooms have a desk. When coming for work, this is pretty much game stopper. There is only a bench and small table to work at with no nearby outlets (see photo). However, when I called and asked for a change, the front desk personnel promptly moved me to a room with a desk (maybe diamond status helped?). If heading here for business, make sure you request a room with a desk, but there is no guarantee according the staff. Still, as most people coming to the islands are looking for vacation and not report writing (I hope!), this might not be an issue and hence 4 stars.

I recently spent 7 nights at this hotel and I'd definitely recommend it. It's in a good location, easy walking distance to the beach, across from the international market place, food pantry, restaurants and the trolley bus stop and the bus stop heading to Ala Moana mall and other parts of the city are right outside the hotel.Front desk were helpful and friendly, I was able to check in early which was great and appreciated after a long 8 hour flight. My room was a good size, didn't feel small and the bed was comfortable and huge! The water pressure in the shower wasn't the greatest but not a big deal. The room had a huge TV, safe, wardrobe and air conditioning. My room was on the higher floors overlooking the pool area, it wasn't too noisy. I'm guessing the higher you are the quieter it gets.The coffee in the morning and water in the afternoon in the lobby was a nice touch and it was so convenient having the shop attached to the hotel for snacks etc.... The restaurant wasn't yet opened when I was there but it looks like it may be opening soon. Overall it was a good stay and I'd definitely recommend this hotel and I will be staying here again the next time I'm in Waikiki.

We spent seven nights at the Hilton Garden Inn Waikiki, and found it to be everything one expects in quality accommodations. The Hotel is situated a short five minute walk from Waikiki Beach. it is central for shopping and transport. We found this to be a perfect location, close to everything we required. There is a good supermarket right across the side road. The Staff were all friendly and efficient, and made our stay memorable. We were able to check-in immediately, which was so much appreciated, after a long flight from New Zealand. Our room had a beautiful view of the ocean at Waikiki, and the city buildings. The Hotel was always spotlessly clean, and our room cleaned, and re-stocked daily. We found our room had plenty of room for our suitcases, and room for hanging our clothes. The was a long bench seat, and a multi-purpose table suitable for my business and computer use. The air-conditioning was efficient, and the private lanai a pleasant place to admire the view, and enjoy a meal. There was coffee/tea supplied in the mornings in the public area, and cold infused drinks in the afternoons. We bed and pillow comfort was superb. We both slept extremely well.

Make sure you don't get a room with adjoining door to the room next door. You will not have a good night rest from noise. Lack of noise proofing on adjoining door. Hotel was decent. Great location. Clean. Great staff. Updated.

Good location. Newly renovated. Great front desk staff with only one or two exceptions.Nice outdoor pool and fitness room. Have to go off site for breakfast. Quiet on upper floors. Comp. WiFi in rooms. Premium WiFi free only for Diamond members. Microwave minifridge and safe in room. Wide flat screen TV with multiple channel selection including some oriental and Spanish channels. Comfy beds. Hand held shower with piping hot water. Comp. coffee and tea maker. Easy walking distance to beach and shops. Great house keeping with very clean rooms and baths. Comp printing from lobby computers. Rates are on a par with other accommodations in Waikiki.

This is the former Outrigger West. The recent complete makeover is great. Just be sure to avoid the suites with a tiny living room. When you open the couch it is almost impossible to reach the bathroom.

This is a new Hilton, and the full refurbishment from its previous life as an Outrigger is very close to completion. I'd say it needs another 6 months to be great, but it's on the way. I just wish the restaurant was open as advertised when I booked.

Very satisfied with all the service and facilities during my stay. Prefer this actual location to those that are often more highly regarded. Excellent staff and very comfortable room with efficent lift service.

I spent one night at this hotel. At check in the clerk was very helpful giving us a list of her favorite restaurants of various types (Hawaiian, Italian, etc) and advising us as to what was in walking distance. The room was quite nice and the area seemed safe. There did seem to be shops in walking distance and you could walk to the water although it wasn't exactly close. The clerk at checkout was also very helpful suggesting places for breakfast. The concierge, Terry, however was completely useless. He gave us one suggestion for dinner and told us that there was nothing to do within walking distance of the hotel. All he wanted to do was sell us a helicopter tour and if we weren't interested in that he wasn't interested in us. He also told my mom and I it was safe to walk by the beach at night which went against everything every WOMAN we talked to had told us. REALLY unhappy with him.

This is a great hotel about 20 stories tall with exceptional staff and in a handy location to Waikiki beach and nearby restaurants. Unfortunately the hotels own restaurant is not yet completed and seems to be behind schedule. So breakfast is not an option except at the Holoholo cafe next to the lobby (limited options). But hey, you're on vacation right! There are plenty of choices to make a short walk nearby. The rooms are very comfortable and with plenty of space but lack seating unless you use the bench seat in the room with no back, lie on the bet or bring in the metal balcony seats. There are no glasses or plates in the rooms and no mini bar but you can purchase beer and wine by the can or bottle respectively from the Holholo cafe below. Thoroughly enjoying the stay here (still here as I write this). Waikiki Beach is about 400 metres away through the the nearby shopping and dining complex across the road. Free wifi too.

I enjoyed this hotel as I'm into boogie boarding and watching surf. The large screen in the hall was all surfing wow. While you wait for transport you were entertained by the big screen. Big Hawaii waves awesome thumbs up. The pool bar fantastic and staff were absolutely friendly and very cheerful. The whole hotel was very clean and nice I will be coming back here again...

This Hilton Garden Inn was a different brand before the renovation. It is the great location for this one near all the shopping and restaurants. The rooms were in great condition. The staff welcoming. The convenience store on site was perfect to grab something to go and there is a small cafe take out in store as well. A restaurant was under construction when I was there that will fill that full service gap. Oh and across the street in that food pantry grocery store are a couple of take out places . Overall one of my better HGI experiences and I would stay there again.

stayed here nov 6-10 2016. just myself and my boyfriendthis is our second time in hawaii this year. first time was with the kids. - GOOD LOCATION if you don't care to be beachfront. but there aren't many hotels that are actually beachfront! this is about a 3 minute walk to the main beach area. close to food and shops! not on the main waikiki strip but on the more quieter road parallel to it. right across the street from the new international marketplace- VALET PARKING was always fast. you can call down 15 mins before you want your car but even when we didn't, we didn't wait long.- ROOM was clean and had microwave and fridge. our fridge didn't work the first day but we called and someone came right away and fixed it. - SERVICE was all around pleasant. would definitely come back here!

This property has been recently renovated and it looks great. It is really clean and the location is excellent for walking to and from shops and restaurants. The room is cozy and perfect for a couple. It is an odd setup, you walk right inside to the bathroom vanity on the left and the water closet/shower on the right. But we got used to it quickly and it was fine (just don't walk around naked if someone is entering and exiting the front door!)The bed was a little firm, with nice big pillows, great big TV, and having a Keurig, mini fridge and microwave are added benefits. The toiletries are Neutrogena, which I liked. My only complaint is that we left the room for 8+ hours and housekeeping never came. Other than that, our stay was perfect. From the front desk, to the valet, and market, everyone was pleasant and helpful.I recommend this place as a great value if you don't care about being a few blocks from the beach. My husband said the pool area looked nice, but I didn't see it.All in all, we liked everything about this place and we have stayed at a handful of hotels in downtown Waikiki the past few years.We will be back next year. The room is already booked!

Couple blocks from the water but still good location for the price. Hotel was nicely updated and very clean. There's a shopping mall with very high end stores directly across the street which you can cut through to reach the beach access. Here for 2 nights and it was good start to a 9 day vacation with my wife!

I stayed in a very comfortable room for one night after a brutal series of fights from the East coast. The Hotel location was perfect! It was within walking distance of many restaurants and the local grocery store, and about a 6 minute stroll off Waikiki Beach! The staff was awesome, making me feel welcome, and explaining everything clearly.The room was spotless and well-appointed. The bathroom was very modern, with a cool shower. Just be advised that this building is mere feet away from an adjacent building - my balcony view was a wall. I didn't use the pool but it looked refreshing, and unique in that it overlooked Kuhio Avenue and Sax Fifth Avenue!
user_name:
Lynn D
Purcellville, Virginia, United States

review_body: Far away to be a standard Hilton hotel. Recently renovated but very small rooms, offering no privacy at all. There is no place for your luggages. Breakfast 12 minutes walking distance away from the hotel (the staff is not disclosing this at checking in).

First time at this hotel in Hawaii.....Stayed for a 2 night business trip. Staff was great! Room was very nice, clean and comfortable. Bed was dreamy! Staff accommodated us with a room with a better view! THANKS!

On my way to Sydney, I had about 24 hours in Honolulu. With limited time I wanted a clean, comfortable hotel at a reasonable price that would still allow me to see Honolulu. Originally I looked for hotels that had shuttles to and from airport but realized they were just a place to sleep with nothing around. I did have a little time and wanted a nice meal and to see some of the town. The Hilton Garden Inn filled all of those for me. I took Speedy Shuttle from the airport for $15 that dropped me off at hotel. The central location allows for shopping and dining all within walking distance. Aloha

I looked around a lot to find affordable accommodations in Waikiki Beach and the Hilton Garden Inn came up as one of the more affordable (once you add on cleaning, deposit and other fees w/VRBO, hotel was comparable in price). This is a clean, fresh, contemporary, looks like recently renovated hotel with a short walk to the beach. Shopping and restaurants everywhere. Friendly, helpful staff, free wifi for HHonors. Valet parking is $35/night which remarkably is market rate for the area. I could find no self park options in the area. Room was not noisy and had a balcony, 2 double beds, safe in closet, fridge, mw, iron and board.

While the location is great, as a Honors member there is no lounge. The lobby is the only office meeting area. While they are advertising on their website a newly opened restaurant, in fact it is far from complete. Judging by what I saw, it will be lucky to be open by the end of the year. So you choose either points for vouchers at a restaurant several blocks away, or points with no food. The room size is a little small.The swimming pool is nothing more than an oversized kiddy pool. And everytime the elevator stopped on the pool level, all one heard was screaming children. So much for a little quiet down time at the pool. The plus side, the staff are great. The valet staff are great! Overall I would recommend one of the other Hilton properties.

While all have said nice newly renovated hotel which it is and there is no resort fee here are pro and cons. Pro: good central location. Across street from new International Market which is nice with entertainment that is free and some decent restaurants. Although not the international market of old. Hotel is clean.Got free breakfast coupons at Dukes sine hotel restaurant not open yet (expect that to be January from what I saw) and while a bit of a walk way worth it, just go straight through the international market. Nice buffet and coupon from hotel included 15% tip. Bathroom was very nice in room with large shower. Good size balcony on room. Hotel employees friendly and helpful. Lobby very nice & corner store handy and well stocked. Next store is grocery store with food court. Transportation with the Bus and trolley right out on street. CONS: As others have said the room is small. Didn't think could be that's,all but it is. Think our stateroom on a cruise ship was bigger! Had city view trying to save$$$ not a great view. Balcony chairs hard. No resort fee because this ain't no resort. Overall: OK. it's 3 stars not 4. More like a glorified Hampton Inn. I've spent near 60 nights in a Hilton this year alone and near Diamond level but can't get one room upgrade. I was a bit disappointed. If return will stay at the Hilton Waikiki as we have stayed before just down the road..

Newly renovated rooms very clean, small fridge and microwave in room. Pool area nit huge but nice. Good value for money. Location right opposite the back location of newly opened international market which is lovely with great shopping and restaurants. Waikiki trolley stop 50 metres from hotel.
