Stayed for 11 nights with the family.Pros:- Fantastic location, close to shopping malls, restaurants, Waikiki Beach (a few blocks away), grocery shop (opposite corner), bus stop to other locations- Reasonably priced- Room was of adequate size but not overly large- Rooms were clean and our room was relatively quiet at night (faced away from Kuhio Ave)- Room had a microwave- Staff were friendly (but not too interactive)- Coffee and water were available in the lobby in the mornings and during the day respectivelyCons- Pool was small and not 'resort-like'. Did not use it at all and went to the beach instead- Gym had treadmills and cycles but did not have any weight machines, only free weights- Laundry machines were not very clean and were out of service at times. The washing machines were replaced and became coin operated during our stay- Water pressure in sinks and shower was very poor- had difficulty washing hand soap off- Sink is located next to the door in the entryway, not in the bathroom

I was traveling on business and arrived Saturday night, after 11 pm. The room was clean and I was happy with the room. The next morning, the cleaning staff was already knocking on the door at 9 am. I asked them to come back later, but they never did. At about 3 pm I complained to one of the cleaning staff in the hall (they were just putting their things away) that my room was never cleaned. Someone was sent a few minutes later, but I shouldn't have to do that. During the week there wasn't a problem, but on the next Saturday morning, the day I was checking out, the cleaning staff was already knocking on my door at 8 AM!The counter staff was friendly and everyone was very courteous. However, there was no restaurant at the hotel. They would provide recommendations, but the closest restaurant was about 2 blocks away.

Great staff and very clean hotel. Location is also great. Also microwave in the room who's is great to have and coffee maker. Stayed there for 8 nights. Booking a hilton brand is a Guaranteed clean, and super comfortable beds.

A maintenance request to remedy the shower head button (held as a shower by water pressure) that had to be wrapped in a towel to hold wasn't fixed or even addressed. Tile floors weren't mopped every day which with sand and sweat is a problem.

The staff were extremely friendly and very helpful, always willing to answer questions and provide directions. The hotel has been recently renovated & they did a fantastic job. The pool deck was a great way to spend an afternoon, complete with a poolside bar. The hotel location was a short walk to restaurants, shopping and the beach. I would definitely recommend staying here!

did not have room cleaned waited until 4pm then stopped housekeeping to get towels. housekeeping did not even have a reason why our room was not cleaned. how sad that a hilton is more like a motel 6. too bad.

The hotel is in a very convenient location in downtown Honolulu. It is very close to the shops and attractions. The room is very clean and the staff are very helpful. We got a room with city view which is fantastic. We were with two kids and the kids loved this place. Bathroom is little bit slippery but that's not a big problem. We loved this hotel and will definitely recommend to anyone traveling to Honolulu.

This Hilton Garden Inn is more of a business traveler hotel than a resort destination. As someone who stays in Waikiki for business quite a bit I appreciate the low key setting and quite atmosphere of this new property. I found the open air hallways odd for a Hilton property, but it fits with the tropical resort location of this older building. The room renovations were very modern and even though water pressure was low, the fixtures were nice and clean. I’d definitely stay here again.

My fiance and I stayed at the Hilton Garden Inn for 6 nights and it was amazing. Perfect room, great location and even better service.We met Josie Castillo in the lobby and she went out of her way to ensure that our stay was the best possible. Her and the rest of the staff were extremely friendly and accommodating.We would love to stay there again the next time we are in the Honolulu.

Hilton Garden Inn Waikiki Beach is very reasonably priced. They do not charge resort fees like most Honolulu hotels now have implemented. The parking is valet only and is $35.00 a day. Hilton members receive free breakfast vouchers for Duke's restaurant in the outrigger hotel, buffet breakfasts, and views of Diamond Head and Waikiki Beach. The rooms are very nice and spacious.

I love this hotel, very modern and new hotel. Location was wonderful and Ashley and Richard provided excellent customer service! They were very welcoming and gave me lots of information about the area. Thank you!

We spent 3 nights early October at the Garden Inn in Waikiki. I found the room to have an absolutely adequate size. There was no desk though but we did not need one. The beds were very comfortable. The bathroom was on the small size but absolutely fine except maybe for the fact that there is no sink so you have to wash your hands outside in the section close to the door. A bit annoying at night if you need to frequently go to the bathroom. The bathroom door in our room was a sliding door.The swimming pool is not huge but has an adequate size. The area has a lot of deckchairs and a bar ;-)The location of the hotel is very convenient as it is close to the beach (but not facing it), next to convenient stores, not far from shopping areas and next to bus stops that can take you pretty much everywhere (airport, downtown or even to the nice beaches of Kailua).There are plenty of hotels in Waikiki but I found the Hilton Garden Inn to offer a solid value for the price we paid. A weak point was the overall attitude of the front desk. Not rude but not very friendly and customer oriented. At least for the 2 staff we talked to.

Just wanted to write a great review for Bradley at check-in. It was my girlfriend's birthday and he helped make it her best birthday ever. Thanks for all your help and speedy check in! Views were great, pool was fun, free breakfast at Duke's was perfect. Thanks again, definitely staying here again

great location, a block away from the beach which should make it quiet, but for some reason, the streets below are very noisy through dawn. Nice pool, would be nicer with a hot tub. Excellent in-room Keurig coffee and tea, and optional lobby Kona coffee and tea in the morning. Free daily newspaper. Great views from balcony. Lots of staff to greet you when you get out of the car (valet parking).
user_name:
Wayne L
San Francisco, United States

review_body: We were a couple heading away for a week's break. Value for money this hotel was superb. If we wanted to go through the beach we walked through the new International Shopping Centre. The buses were basically just out the door. Most importantly it was so much quieter with less foot and vehicle traffic than the next street over by the beach. Great facilities - room lovely and cleaned - well serviced.

This hotel has been completely renovated to the point where everything is brand new! Its clean and modern and i especially loved the USB ports meaning a travel adaptor wasn't required for my devices! We stayed here for a week and had a great time. While the view from our 5th floor room wasn't particularly fantastic i did love the sundeck on our floor which over looked the pool and caught the late afternoon sun. Rooms are a typical size with lovely soft comfy beds and pillows to match. They all have a coffee machine and a microwave as well as a decent sized bar fridge. Loved the location of the hotel. Right in the centre of waikiki and across the road from the newly renovated international marketplace. The staff were helpful and friendly and we were able to check in early. Pool was a tad cold but pleasant enough. Lots of loungers to sit on. Just wish the bar had a happy hour! Would definitely stay here again

Very happy with our stay. All the staff were very friendly and a great location for shopping and close to a variety of restaurants. Beach was only a couple of blocks away. Would definitely stay here again.

Right across from recently constructed air conditioned mall, with upscale restaurants,bars and other eating places .only 3-4 blocks to the beach /OceanWe were graciously greeted by the staff who unloaded the luggage and brought to the room,registration was carefree.The room had a balcony and could see from the room,staff housekeeping was broom sweeping the terrace/balcony.Reasonable price unlike Hilton Hawiian village,Hyatt regency or Hyatt place.Charlies taxi ( have to call) will pick you up from hotel and take you to the airport for a flat fee of $29.00 unlike regular taxi which could be $40 or above

PROS CONS AND OVERALL:This is the Old Ohana West hotel BUT NEW NEW only the location is the same otherwise its all NEWPROS: Price $179 King city view, booked 2 days before arrival, New Hotel only 5 months oldFree Coffee by Kuerig unlimitedAcross the street Coffee/baked shop, good food to go CHEAP and a grocery store includes full selection of spirits and other refreshments, across the street new International world marketCleaned up neighborhoodLots of shopping and the beach is about a 5-7 minute walk if you don't get distracted by all the shopping and food along the wayLots of city buses and a stop at the end of the hotel property. Did i mention tons of food and entertainment at night? These locations are NOT expensive. People on a smaller budget you won't feel like your out of your spending allowance around here BUT you will still feel like you got the full Waikiki experience. SHOWER is BIG with an ADJUSTABLE shower head for height so tall AND short people alike can enjoy this shower and the shower has a WAND. This is my new go to location when passing through HONOLULU. FYI UBER Works to get here and it cost me $33.00 for a taxi from the Airport to this hotel. CONS:................... ..UBER and LYFT are banned from picking up at the airport so a taxi or shuttle service is your only option. FYI my taxi on a meter was $33.00 from the airport to this hotel. However a UBER from here to the airport was $26.19 at 3:20 Pm Tuesday Election DayOverall: this property and staff offer you a reasonable price with excellent care and amenities and to boot its new and updated with lots to do around the property while not gouging your wallet. I'm impressed and didn't have to wonder far to get food, entertainment or shopping.This is the way Waikiki should be! Stay at this property and FYI don't be shy to ask for more Kuerig coffee cups or bell help because at this property service is top notch and they all reach out to you!

My family and I stayed here for a week in October. The hotel is all new inside and really impressed us. We usually stay at beachfront hotels when it's just my wife and I, but since we brought a whole crew, a more affordable option was in order. Great call! The rooms were clean and quiet and modern. The service was amazing. And the location, despite being off the beach, really was perfect. The new international market place mall was really cool and there was plenty of food and shopping nearby. I'm coming back for sure. And you should too!

There was a problem when I'm checking in. And the desk staff was very rude and disrespectful. Pool is very small can barely swim, pool bar is little too pricy. Other then that the room is clean and comfy.

We had a staycation in Waikiki over the Halloween weekend. It was wonderful the hotel was within walking distance of shopping and restaurants. Wonderful hotel and staff. Our was big and had a view of kuhio which was really nice. The only thing that was a draw back was that we had no balcony to sit on. But the little mini store they had in the lobby was perfect to get snacks for the room.

Hotel is located on the back side of Waikiki so it's pretty accessible to sights. The rooms were renovated and felt very new. Staff was polite and very accommodating. The location of our room was not that great, and when asked to move they said there was no availability, yet our friends also staying there got great views... Parking is expensive, even for Waikiki.

We had a great time here, the staff are welcoming and helpful, the rooms were clean and had everything we needed including plenty of towels, and a comfortable bed. It is in a great location just a few minutes walk from the beach, so close to the newly opened International Market Place and on the bus route

We loved the hotel but wished it had some Hawaiian ambiance. I agree with others that the beds were great as was the shower. We were lucky to be on the top floor with a king bed, a great view and a big lanai. The problem was that the room itself was small, had no dresser and no place to put your luggage. The front staff (Holiday and Gary) were excellent as was Kazu who helped us with our luggage and was always cheerful. Hilton Hotels are lucky to have such great employees.The pool is located on the 3rd floor just above the busy street so sometimes it was a bit noisy and there was the odd smell of diesel. The pool is only 4.5 feet deep but is a good size and there are plenty of loungers. There were always plenty of towels and you could also take them to the beach.Great location with the Food Pantry right across the street and only a few minutes walk to the beach.Bonus: NO resort fee

The Hilton Garden is in a great location right across the street from the newly renovated International Marketplace. The lobby and rooms are clean. For what you receive the price is not the best value but not the most expensive either.

My family of five just spent 7 nights here and we loved every minute of our stay.Rooms were spacious and very clean. Excellent maid service. Beds were very very comfy. We had issues with the shower but this was able to be rectified. The free wifi was a winner. It always worked and the strength was great.The shop downstairs was a great addition and was very convenient. The staff who worked there were fantastic. The pool area is great. The bar makes awesome Lava Flow cocktails as well.We will 100% stay here every time we return to Waikiki.

I was at the Hotel with a friend and we were so happy there.the staff very helpful and friendly.you ask for anything and straight away they come.We just go across the Road and the Main Street is there,shops,Restaurants and Waikiki Beach 2 minutes walk.I highly recommend this Hotel.

Used to stay at the Hilton Beach but they got a bit pricey. Like this location for its access to Waikiki and the many restaurants and shops. Room is smaller than I expected and I wasn't able to upgrade like usual when I stay at Hilton. LOVE the spacious shower and way comfy bed. Disappointment in that the restaurant isn't ready so no HGI breakfast that I appreciate. There is the little amenities and wine/beer bar attached - but it has little for vegetarians BTW. Told I could get coupons for Dukes breakfast but not convenient to walk to when you're here for work and need to leave early in the morning. I'll stay again and would definitely recommend.

Next to Food Pantry, easy access to everything, comfortable beds, clean. Restaurant not yet open. We booked a Partial Ocean View Room and we're allocated room 1767 which had no ocean view at all. Moved to 1532 which was much better. Staff were happy to assist.

I stayed at this hotel for a week. The hotel was very nice. The pool is on the third floor and it has a bar and pool table for you to enjoy. The room was clean. It was equipped with a microwave and small refrigerator. The water pressure in the shower was not strong. The staff was very helpful and friendly. There is free coffee and tea in the mornings. There was free infused water (three flavors pineapple, orange or lime) and a Hawaiian desert in the afternoons. There is a concierge service to help you with vacation packages. I did not use those services I booked all of my packages before I left. The hotel has a café and a small store for convenience. The hotel is across the street from the International Marketplace where there is shopping and dining. The hotel is not far from the beach. It's just a couple of miles away. I would recommend this hotel.

Room and facility was very nice, appeared to be recently constructed or renovated. Only reason I would not say it was 5 stars would be things they could not prevent. Rooms are very small, the space is as efficient as possible but I do understand space comes at a premium in Hawaii. There is also no off-street parking, otherwise I would say it was a 5 star establishment.

I really wanted to love this place! It was clean, convenient, welcoming (bright and open lounge area) and has a great view from higher stories, in particular. There is only a fair sized pool - but who goes to Hawaii for the pool anyway (!); there is also a very decent small cafe adjacent (restaurant not opened as yet at the time of our stay), and restaurants including some of the best on the island just footsteps from the entrance. For these reasons, I would give it a definite 5! But that is where my lauding of the place ends and the nightmare begins. My major qualm with the hotel was that they MARKEDLY confused the hotel rooms that I had booked for a group (including myself) and that I had not just double but triple and quadruple checked on to ensure that no such confusion happened. Despite all of my time and effort in doing so, they still royally (and I mean royally) messed up the room bookings including overbooking the rooms that were supposed to be clustered together - despite notations on the rooms not to do so on their system - and without informing anyone, put us in rooms with some of the worst locations possible. It basically required me spending around 2 hours of my vacation (more including the time spent booking and double checking on the rooms beforehand) trying to rebook these rooms with initial lack of help from front desk staff (who either seemed new or not well trained... confused about why the rooms had been overbooked), until a manager (I believe her name was Christina) showed up, actually rebooked the rooms correctly, placing a "manager's hold" (not sure why that didn't happen in the first place or some equivalent does not exist to forego this problem in the first place) on the rebooked rooms. We got a complimentary night and a nice room for the one night because of all the stress. I would just say really lovely hotel for convenience in location and the remainder of comments formerly but wouldn't return because of the nightmarish dealings with booking logistics, as they seem to not have a hold on handling large parties and/ or their staff need to have better communication/ training because their system of booking/ checking in is flawed.

Both my wife and I recently stayed in this newly refurbished hotel and liked it very much. The rooms were clean, large comfortable beds and plenty of towels. Rooms were cleaned daily and supplies were replenished each day. Wonderful staff, terrific facilities including a nice pool, gymnasium. Hotel lobby was excellent and daily coffee offered each morning in lobby area was a nice touch. Hotel was located right opposite the international market place. Plenty of restaurant and shops surrounding the hotel was the ideal place for us to stay. Suggest getting rooms higher than level 5 or away from gymnasium directly below in level 3.

As others have noted, brand new interiors. Everything works, everything spanking new and clean, very nice shower. My room was tiny, even by Japanese hotel standards. Enough space for one person. Two people will bump into each other occasionally. More than two, even if a child, would be extremely awkward. Particularly unusual, again as others have noted, is NO desk, table, or workspace. Your laptop will have to be, well, on your lap in bed. This is probably the first time in almost 50 years of constant work travel that I have ever been in any hotel, at any price point, where there is no horizontal surface to work. Oddly, there is a terribly oversized padded luggage rack, that could easily have been replaced instead with a cheap, small table, although there would be no room for a corresponding chair. Again as others have noted, there are no drawers for storage of clothing, literally zero. The closet has two single horizontal shelves that could be used for this purpose, I guess, but they will be dusty very soon. The bathroom has no door, and a well-positioned mirror allows one occupant of the room to observe the other on the toilet!If you like Waikiki tourist attractions and a rather sadly narrow stretch of beach (I don't care for either), you are well-located, just one block from the water, McDonalds, Haagen-Daaz, etc. I would probably return to this property if traveling alone and staying for only one night in transit, as I was on this particular visit, due to the cleanliness and reasonably good value for money given the central location. I would not return for a holiday with my wife -- there's simply not enough space, and even if alone I would soon find the confinement dreary.

Hilton Garden Inn is a great option.We stayed with 2 teenagers for 10 days and it was adequate.Room was a good size, beds could have been bigger they were a double and we're used to Kings size.Rooms are great and fresh as it's just reopened.We stayed here a few times many years ago as it used to be the Outrigger West.It's across the road from the newly opened Internationl Market Mall.Shops there are WAY out of our price range, targeted for another market and that's not us Kiwi's.Pool area is good, but the pool would be alot better if it was deeper, targeted more for the kids i think, but it still does the job and cools you off.Washing and dryer's were free so that was a big bonus, but they only had one washer working, so there was abit of a back log.Would we stay here again, Yes we wouldThat was mine and hubbies 14th trip to Hawaii over 33 years, and this place would be our 2nd fav.

For what we paid was a great visit. Wifi was good, room was a decent size and all the features of the room were good. The shower though was terrible, the one thing you want after adventuring all day and the beach is a nice heavy pressured shower and it wasn't, it was just a drizzle. Also the balcony view was not that great, don't be fooled by the beach/mountain view photos - you'll likely be looking at concrete.

The staff here is amazing which is why I rated it very good. The room set up isn't great but was ok for my husband and I. Checking in was a breeze and we are in close proximity to EVERYTHING. A short walk to the beach, high-end shopping, tons of places to eat, a grocery store, a quick walk to the zoo and so much more. I'm already looking forward to returning to Waikiki and staying here. By the way, pack light....you can do your laundry here.

This is a updated hotel, despite the size of the rooms (small) it offers the comfort you need for a good stay in hawaii. The cleaning service is great, there`s microwave oven and fridge inside the room. The beds are small (queen size), but it was not a problem. It stays two blocks away from waikiki beach, close to many stores and restaurants. The staff was great. The only negative thing is the valet parking service, very expensive.

The hotel was nice; Marelyn with the cleaning staff exceeded my expectations. My only issue/concern was with the billing and how the process was handled. I feel like there could have been a better way after asking twice and still getting the opposite response.
user_name:
Jamie F
El Paso, United States

review_body: The Hilton Garden Inn is really nice, maybe a little far from the beach but not too bad. Lots to do in the area, the store attached to the hotel is great, especially for happy hour! The pool wasn't that good, very small and congested there (lots of chairs) but I guess most people are not going to the pool. The Mai Tai wasn't very good either. But, the hotel staff were exceptional! Nick, Paul and others were very accommodating to us, answering our questions and giving helpful advice. Rooms have been recently updated and were clean and designed well with a refrigerator (yay!) and Microwave.

First off, let me start with the positives. This was a new looking hotel and it was overall very clean. The location was also nice in that it was walking distance from many restaurants, bars, and shopping (international marketplace across the street). And despite its great location, the rooms were quiet at night...this is sometimes a rarity in Waikiki. Now the bad...we arrived very early in the morning after a 10 hour flight and the hotel was unable to accommodate an earlier checkin. We finally got a room at 3pm. This was pretty frustrating considering my husband and I are gold members with Hilton. We learned later on in our stay that the hotel did not have our gold status on our reservation and we missed out on traditional benefits (water at checkin and complimentary breakfast) for the first several days. Finally, I reported that our room smelled of cigarette smoke--not everyday but intermittently--and the hotel did not offer alternative accommodations. Despite these missteps, we did have positive experiences with housekeeping (always had lots of fresh towels and toiletries) and valet (rarely waited for our car). Overall, this was a fine hotel with very minor complaints.

Pros: clean, extremely friendly service, close distance to beach and shopping, free internet, provide pack n plays for babies, keurig, mini fridge, microwave, pretty quiet at night from nightlife bustle. Cons (for those travelling with young ones): rooms are a bit small (for 2 adults + 1 baby), no partition between sink area and room (for light sleepers), not a lot storage space (no drawers, closet space) so everything sat on long benches in the room.

This hotel has a very good location for getting around Waikiki, close to everything. The restaurant was not open as of 22 Oct and it will probably be another two months before its opens. The market in the hotel is great, has just about everything including a small bar with two great happy hours, I hope they don't change the happy hours when the restaurant opens. Hotel is handicapped friendly, I had no problem getting in and out or around the hotel in my scooter. In addition the hotel has great handicapped rooms, no problems getting around in the room.

This property scores 17.5/20 on our hotel-rating method.3/5 for peace and quiet. Loud Chinese tourists slamming doors, shouting down the hallway; considerable traffic noise. Normally I would not ID a nationality, but the Chinese government is trying to educate its folk on travel etiquette. Theirs are not the only folk that could use an education. But on this trip, theirs were the problem.4/4 for cleanliness, hot water, maintenance, physical appearance, in-room amenities, etc.3/3 for no smoking, no pets.2/2 for walkable neighborhood - The Ala Wai Canal is still a nice walk. Pick up trash as you go.2/2 for Free Wi-Fi (at least for HH members)2/2 for check-in, front desk, customer service (although we did not test their rowdy guest noise-abatement procedure)1/1 for security, locks, cameras, etc.0.5/0.5 for pool. Pool = not important for us, so doesn't carry much weight. Nevertheless, there's a nice pool.0/0.5 for restaurant/barMust score 20/20 for a "5" rating.This is a nice, comfortable hotel. Unfortunately it is in Waikiki which has become a sump hole. It was our mistake to rely on our experience of previous visits instead of the warnings of friends and family members who had visited more recently. The old adage applies: "Never return to a place where you were once happy."This is no reason to downrate the hotel. We use a criteria checklist to help remove personal biases. 17.5 is the highest score we've chalked up in the last 2 years of travel. Hilton is doing SOMETHING right!New visitors still might find Waikiki a fascinating destination.

The hotel is located in downtown Waikiki, a couple of blocks back from the beach, opposite Saks 5th Ave. Recently refurbished.We arrived about 8am, and were pleasantly surprised to be checked in early and given an upgrade. Our room was on the 18th floor & looked out towards the golf course, canal and mountains. The room was small but clean and comfortable, with a balcony. Not a lot of space if you plan on spending lots of time in your room, but for us, who spent most of our time sightseeing, it was fine.Facilities were great. Staff were friendly and accommodating. Wifi was free. There is no onsite restaurant yet, but apparently that will open soon.It was more expensive than we would usually pay, but reasonably priced for Honolulu. We would stay here again.

This is a very nice hotel. It has valet parking, a swimming pool and attached convenient shopping It has internet access and great coffee The room was very clean. Very polite an helpful staff. Wonderful view from my room and balcony, within site of the ocean, in very nice and convenient location..

No place for clothes or work. No desk, no chair, nowhere to sit except on the bed. The bench is odd, but not usable to see tv. As a diamond member, my expectation is business compatible at hgi. Checking in was awful. No welcome just a snarl "name". Not really aloha spirit. Can not believe that there is no cook to order breakfast. Solution is to walk 10 minutes to a buffet? That must be communicated when we book. Web site says restaurant open mid October. Lies. The deli was difficult. Has anyone from Hilton ever stayed here?Worst rooms in the house. Elevator is painful to use carrying breakfast from the deli to sit on balcony that overlooks a parking lot. Not appropriate for loyal guests. Did not acknowledge our two guests with diamond status. Didn't get bottled water except day three when I begged. Shower floor is so slippery I was afraid of slipping. Don't like the split bathroom. We like our individual privacy. Balcony looks like it belongs on a prison. Dingy, tight, paint, repair. Floor in room was lumpy. Called 5 minutes out for car, still waited for 25 minutes while walk ups were accommodated. Everyday we had to build time into our day for the Sub par service. But the cost is $35 per day so we expect service. Supervision of valet needs to happen NOW.Did not get room cleaned? Came back at 2 pm and called down to front desk, and was lectured about removing the do not disturb sign. It was not out. At 330 I called again and spoke with manager Kevin who said he would take care of. I requested that our room get cleaned daily, didn't think I needed to ask. Housekeeping staff did a good job. The location is 2 blocks easy walk to beach. Not a resort which appealed to us. Across from new shopping area that is not fully open. Hilton could not have approved this property and really needs to provide oversight and assistance to get it up to standards. Very disappointed in the Hilton property. Our client asked us if we would recommend this hotel for their needs. NO. I will not stay again unless they fix some of this stuff.Tried to get a zero balance and person at front desk couldn't get within 10 minutes. Did ask to have a couple of corrections and they were when I got it off my account. Should have credited the underwhelming valet but didn't ask. Oh yeah on check out nothing like how was your stay. I really think guests were in the way.

This place is great, great view from the room I stayed in, very clean. Staff was helpful and also friendly. The beds are so comfortable, and also the pull out bed in the couch was just as good. Didn't have any problems here

We stayed at the Hilton Garden Inn after my daughter's wedding, It was a great location, updated and the staff was outstanding! I can't say enough nice things about the front desk staff. Friendly, efficient and helpful. The valet staff was quick and helpful. Great stay!
user_name:
Rebecca R
Mission Hills, United States

review_body: A great place near a busy main road but there is construction yet and still a beautiful place nice staff clean beautiful rooms live my stay every time valet nice a little busy but you have to call :)!

This hotel was two blocks from Waikiki Beach, on a busy street. I liked this location because it was just a bit away from the height of hustle and bustle of Waikiki. And yet, close to everything you could want. Quiet at night. Pool deck on third floor with bar. Large reception area. Rooms clean and adequately spacious. We had microwave and small fridge which was handy for tea, fruit, oatmeal, drinks etc.

The Hilton Garden In Waikiki Beach is a great hotel in a central location right in the heart of Waikiki. The hotel has been recently completely refurbished and the rooms are very comfortable and exceptionally clean. The staff were very friendly and nothing was too much trouble. The hotel was great value for money and I would certainly stay there again when visiting Waikiki.

Friendly staff and very impressive rooms for the price which include big comfortable beds, a huge flat screen TV a fridge and microwave. The only things I could suggest are the need for movie rentals for those rainy evenings and maybe room service to be offered. Other than that it's pretty much perfect. We had a wonderful vacation and will certainly be returning.

Stayed here for business because the other Hilton properties were full. While I preferred a beach side resort I am very happy with this location. Being that this is a newer property everything is in great shape and the rooms well appointed. My room had a great balcony to sit on, except my view was to the parking garage over the International Market. All of the staff were very helpful and pleasant. I will consider this property when visiting on business.

Great location, rooms very clean, beds comfy. Rooms had microwaves and refrigerators. Staff very friendly and approachable. Refrigerator wasn't working but called Front Desk and moments later had maintenance at our room to fix problem. Would definitely stay here again. Have stayed in many hotels/condos in Honolulu but this was by far one of the best.

I am a diamond traveler so you have a set level of expectations at the hotel upon arrival. This property hasn't been open long so I understand. The rooms are nice, towels are great but water pressure to shower was meh. One criticism. Parking there is no reason to wait almost 1/2 Hr for your car. Figure this out. If I was informed I could call down for my car I certainly would have since the valet brought down 4 cars that SAT while we all waited for our cars.

This hotel was taken over by Hilton Management & renovated only 2 mos. when I stayed here in August 2016. Everything was new...fresh carpet smell etc. Staff was excellent! Restaurant next to lobby was not open yet...convenient Waikiki location directly across from the newly opened "International Marketplace". Small convenience store next to lobby & small deli-type take out coffee/smoothie booth. Only drawback for me - need a regular simple coffee shop in the lobby...had to walk down the street to eat a sit-down breakfast meal each morning. Other than that...staff was great!

I'm currently staying in the hotel. We've been here for 4 nights so far, and have 3 more to go. We are very happy with our choice so far.After reading reviews on other hotels (and this one) we decided to stay here due to the updated and clean interior. Reading the negative reviews of this hotel, people need to realize what you're getting here. This is a hotel, NOT a beachside RESORT. It is in the middle of Waikiki, which is a very busy area and constantly has construction going on everywhere. Downtown Waikiki is all hotels, resorts, shopping, restaurants, and nightclubs. So it's going to be noisey. If you want something quieter, you need to stay outside of Waikiki. Or if you want a beachside resort, you need to pay the extra money to stay beachside with all the amenities that offers.With that being said, the Hilton Garden Inn is a great place to stay in Waikiki. The rooms are very modern and clean, not too much storage for clothes, nice bathrooms, and a little balcony. A small mini fridge and microwave are in the rooms for leftovers and such. Keep in mind, this is a hotel and not a villa. You're not getting a full kitchen here. At the end of the day, it's a room to sleep in while you go out exploring during the day and eat out at restaurants, which Waikiki has plenty of at all price ranges.TL;DR: Great place to stay in Waikiki. Nice clean, modern rooms. Close to beach, shops, and restaurants. This is a hotel, not a beachside resort or villa.

I lost my credit card enroute to Oahu and Bradley, Andrea and Dez were very accommodating, empathetic and adapted to my situation. Their priority was to ensure I still experienced a seamless check-in process, even though it was very complicated.Thanks again to the 3 of you! My confidence in the Hilton brand and training has elevated to new level.Mahalo,Chris and Grace

It was an overall great experience. There hotel is newly renovated and very modern. The staff was very helpful and friendly. I particularly enjoyed the pool/bar area, which had a very friendly wait staff. The open to the elements elevator lobby was a nice feature that gave the hotel a great island feel. I would recommend this hotel.

Good location, used this hotel for a business trip and was very satisfied. Rooms were clean, bedding comfortable and staff was nice. It was just blocks away from the beach. I would recommend this hotel further.

Very busy modern hotel. Parking $35 a day. Call ahead for your car about 20 minutes. We used Uber mostly, no parking or traffic worries for us. Front desk service was very nice and helpful. The room was very clean with a modern design. We received a 2 bedroom with full size beds (not Queens). The hotel was full so we could not switch to a king room with sofa (what we would have preferred). Bell hops are very nice and eager to give you any advice and help you with your bags. We had a small balcony which was very nice for morning coffee (Keurig coffee machine provided). The rooms are very small no drawers for clothes only a closet to hang a few things. We kept our luggage on the bench for the table and the floor by the bathroom (not ideal). The sheets felt a bit plastic-y so I would perspire easily. But the bed was comfortable besides the odd sheets. Maid service kept us with clean towels, clean room and were very nice in the hallways.The bathroom had only the shower and toilet but average size (very new and clean). The vanity and sink were in the hallway. Which is nice if you want to brush your teeth when someone is on the John. Must use room key to enter each floor on elevator. Not sure if this is a common thing but it was hard to scan and very frustrating. scan card + push floor number = hope it works.The market attached to the lobby had some food, souvenirs and a small deli. The deli also sold alcohol and had a nice happy hour. It made up for the restaurant not being open yet. If you are visiting Waikiki and love malls you are in the right place. There is shopping and restaurants in every direction. You are 2 blocks from the very busy beach and about a 40 min drive to many big attractions. We were heading out and got a rental to drive up North. The valet was not happy about us parking on the street in front just to load our car. We were not long and were not blocking any driveways. You would have thought we drove the car into the building. Very unprofessional and not a good last impression.

This "new" Hilton has recently been acquired and completely renovated. From my understanding it opened in June this year under the Hilton banner. The restaurant on the ground floor is due to open soon and it just seems to be working through some final teething problems. For example they have a guest laundry on the second floor that has only 2 washing machines. This is a great idea, but with the number of guests they have you either need to wait for hours in the room to use them or come down at 4:00am to find an empty machine. My room had a full curtin, but no privacy curtain, so I had to choose between privacy or natural light. The curtains have automatic open/close functions, but I couldn't work out how to stop it part way. The rooms are fresh, well-appointed and up-to-date. I am sure the welcoming and obviously well-trained team will work out the kinks soon. The location is great with shopping and transportation close and handy. I look forward to going back in April 2017 to see how things have developed.

I really don't stay at Hilton often but decided to stay here for my 10 day stay. This property was totally renovated. The staff and amenities are great along with a good location. My only negative is the room we were in did not have any dresser drawers. It appears they took the dresser out and put in a bench. Except for a shelf in the closet and 2 very small drawers on night stands there is no place to put your clothes. If I was staying a night that is fine but a longer stay I suppose you would literally live out of your suitcase.
user_name:
Nyquistr
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: Great hotel in the middle of Waikiki, convenient to everything. Great in house café and coffee with good wines. A lot of rooms appear to have great views my side and floor did not but I chose the room.

I stayed at the hotel because it was listed as completely renovated and it was cheap well I guess you get what you pay for the room was so small the bathroom you literally needed too shower with the door open it was suffocating as was the balcony me and mud and could barley fit on it at the same time the walls were all beat up scratched and chunks missing from the paint the floor looked like it wasn't vacuumed the room never cooled off it was always hot in there!! We stayed 4 nights there every day we came home and our room wasn't clean and we would get back at like 3-4. Pm and there wasn't house keeping in sight never had any soap or clean towels my husband walked to the front desk too ask for scissors too remove tags from my jewelry and shoes he was told no they keep going missing he promised to walk them right back down and assured the women we were guest she still said no he had to go and buy scissors from the store next door my gosh people how much could scissors cost that they wouldn't let him borrow there's ! The men at valet wasent the friendliest either the one actually maid fun of me and my clothes we went hiking and our legs and feet were dirty and he mocked us! I hated this hotel it couldn't even compare to the Hilton Hawaiian village I stayed in 2 years ago like I said it was cheap and you get what you pay for but by no means did it look new or renovated!! Would not recommend to anyone!!

The Hilton Garden Inn in Waikiki is newly remodeled. The room was clean lines, simple and extremely comfortable. I wanted to take the bed with me. The service was perfect, the staff from the front desk to the housekeepers were friendly and helpful.

This is a brand-new hotel - they just opened in July 2016. The good part of that is that everything is shiny clean and beautiful. The bad part is that some things (like the restaurant) are not open yet. The room we had was beautiful and modern, but had a crummy view of the parking lot. If I were to stay here again, I would pay more attention to where the room is and maybe request one with a better view. The staff were phenomenal - very helpful and friendly. Great location!

Hotel opened 3 months ago - no restaurant on the property. They do have a 'store' 'cafe' which falls short of what I expected from a Hilton Brand hotel. We were in a Suite which was small for 5 people - 4 adults and 1 child. 1 bathroom is not sufficient, no closet space, no dressers or drawers that would fit your clothes. Had to live out of the suitcase for the entire stay.

I enjoyed my time at the Hilton Garden Inn. The new lobby and renovations were done beautifully. The staff is friendly, helpful, and knowledgeable. Kia was particularly of assistance with a business issue I needed support with. I would recommend this hotel for these reasons, as well as the central location at the new International Market Place.

Staying here for a work trip in early Oct 16, and was very pleased with the service. They moved rooms for us in an effort to get us to a quieter location away from the elevators which chime much too loudly to the point of annoyance if you're trying to sleep. They're supposed to have an onsite restaurant opening by November. Hilton Gold Members can ask for a meal voucher to Dukes restaurant for breakfast, a nice place about a 7 min walk from the property. If you're in a rush or schedule in the mornings Dukes doesn't open until 0700 and is generally relaxed of service, so be aware. Nice new choice for Hilton frequenters.

This hotel is a super location for everything from the shops, the beach, and the bus lines. Resturants are very accessible and you have many to chose from. The hotel has been renovated and they have done an excellent job. The rooms are clean and updated giving more amenities than before. Computers are available in the lobby along with comfortable seating. The grocery which is by the lobby with the coffee and pastry shop is very handy. Papers are avalilable in the lobby daily. Concierges are available to accommodate any of the guest requests. The updated pool is so much nicer since they have installed steps into the pool instead of just a ladder. Great place to kick back and relax!

Paul was amazing he was very polite very professional he checked me in earlier than my check in and he got me a beautiful room with partial Oceanview Beautiful room ..The only downside or is not enough dryers are washers for the entire hotel !

We stayed here for a week for our honeymoon, and we absolutely loved it! The location is excellent being only a couple blocks from the beach and on Kuhio Avenue right in the heart of Waikiki. We are not into resorts, which can sometimes feel like you are trapped on their site and swarming with people, so this was perfect for us. We booked a few things like a snorkeling trip and a luau beforehand through the concierge and once we got there we also booked a rental car, which you should definitely do for a day. The pool was great and so was the little shop downstairs where we ended up buying the bulk of our souvenirs for family. The room was modern and clean and we spent a lot of time on the balcony. Would definitely recommend and stay at again!

Very small room with no space available for the luggages; No replacement (at lest for us) for part of the courtesy set in the bathroom; Only Valet parking available (more expensive than the average rental car fare); Good position close to the beach and the shopping area.

Clean and comfortable rooms and lobby. Very service oriented and conscientious staff. Convenient amenities included in building or nearby and location is convenient to the beach, restaurants and to the highway. I was happy to have the very many options of food and access to various things and places to go to.
user_name:
Joe M
Castle Rock, United States

review_body: Very nice hotel in a good location. About a 5min walk to the main beach area.The beds and pillows were amazing as well as the shower.Nice little touches such as coffee in the reception area on a morning as well as some afternoon tea.The pool is great and a beautiful temperature but there needs to be more shade. There are umbrellas however they were always closed up and when you asked the staff to open them, they weren’t overly willing to do so. I know the hotel has only been open for approx. 3mths but it was also lacking a bit of atmosphere such as there are about 15 or so large pots all empty and leaves constantly on the ground. Overall, good price, good location, I would stay at this hotel again.

Although local, had to stay here due to a client also staying here for 2 nights. It used to be the old Ohana West I think. I'm always skeptical of Waikiki hotels being "refurbished" as 50% only throw on a new coat of paint and others go all out and change EVERYTHING. Thank god the Garden Inn is the latter. Was very satisfied with the room, queen bed, wood decor and standard amenities with coffee maker, etc. Best of all my room faced Kuhio and they must have changed the windows and sliders because the noise from the early morning garbage trucks was fairly insulated. Check in very quick off the app and thank goodness as the hotel is quite large as well as the people in the lobby. Room was decent sized with queen be and some sort of bench. Linen was comfy and the bathroom had the standard Hilton amenities so no complaints. While we didn't use the pool it did look inviting but the amount of people there you would have to get down early to get a lounger. Lots of places around to eat (its Waikiki) and I did use the grocery store down the street (Food Pantry)To be honest, the rooms are very nicely redone and are even nice than the non-renovated rooms at the Hilton Hawaiian Village! And at a fraction of the cost!As a Hilton member, I would definitely recommend staying at this totally refurbished property, Any by the way an Uber to the airport is about $25 and to downtown about $10. Uber does NOT pick up from the airport, they send a taxi instead that's about the same price!

Very tidy, clean, modern, excellent facilities, very friendly and helpful staff. Conscierge organised shuttles for me, bellboys and girls were a great bunch of people who were always smilling and answered all my questions. Room was very nice, lots of usb charging points, pool looked really nice but i never made it there. Could not ask for more and found nothing to complain about. Easy access to everything I wanted in the area.

I decided to stay at this Hotel because of the other reviews I read on Trip Advisor. Thank you to the other people that wrote the reviews. The rooms were not big but they were new and very clean. The bed was wonderful. I loved the location, it was easy to get to the beach, restaurants and shops.

I've stayed at the garden inn in NY in the past and it was really good that I wanted to try HGINN Waikiki . Upon arrival we were welcomed by a really sweet girl, she was friendly and helpful, we got an early check in, which was awesome after a very long flight.  There's complimentary WiFi, coffee and tea in the morning, flavored water (which we loved it) at the lobby in the afternoon.  Room is very clean, good size for a king, bathroom is clean and nice, Neutrogena toiletries, the toilet seat has a control that was interesting. Location is great! We had a great time and highly recommend this hotel!

Spent five nights at this hotel with two kids ( 8 and 9), and we all loved it! The size was perfect for us, and the location was super convenient!The pool and bar area is perfect for resting and relaxing- nothing fancy, but perfect when you get tired of being on the beach! The rooms were nice sized as well- and all the little touches like infused water and snacks were all wonderful touches to the stay! The cafe was also super convenient and served great food and drinks! The staff was extremely friendly, and from the moment we checked in to the moment we left- everyone was attentive and accommodating! We can't wait to return, and hopefully we can try the new restaurant opening there as well!

A great place to stay, good location for all walking distance to shopping, the beach, food and entertainment. I do recommend this Hilton Garden Inn Hotel for your next stay, and we will be returning in the near future.

My check-in process was fairly efficient. I applaud this property for recognizing my Hilton Gold status with breakfast coupons. The breakfast coupons allowed me to have a full buffet breakfast at Duke's (a short walk) or a breakfast sandwich or pastries in HOLO Cafe & Market which is connected to the Hilton Garden Inn. The flaky croissant at HOLO was amazing. The Hilton Garden Inn is centrally located to shopping, restaurants and bars. The beach was approximately 1.5 blocks away, if you cut thru the open air mall in front of the hotel. The room has a unique floor plan with a bench seat (no chairs) and table, The bed and pillows were very comfortable. The outside noise level was low. The bathroom had a nice frameless glass shower and granite top on the vanity. The room (1651) included a refrigerator and a safe. My overall experience was highly positive. I would consider staying here, during future trips to Honolulu.When I asked the front desk questions about how to get to Duke's, how the breakfast voucher worked and other basic questions, they did have clear answers. .Hopefully, they will improve with time. As a Hilton Gold or higher status member, you can forego the breakfast vouchers for 750 Hilton Honors bonus points.
user_name:
Rod1906
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: My husband and I stayed here for three nights in mid-September. We have been to Honolulu many times and have stayed in a wide-range of fine hotels including the beachfront 5-star Halekulani Hotel and the Hokulani Waikiki. In our opinion, the HGI Waikiki Beach represents great value. Nice, clean contemporary rooms combined with exceptionally hospitable staff. We will definitely be back.

There were 3 of us travelling together on a "girlie" trip. The room was spacious enough even with all of our luggage to store around the room. The whole hotel is clean & bright and the staff friendly and helpful. There is a store downstairs where you can't grocery items, coffee, snacks or breaky. It's also in a great location a short block back from the beach but across from the old international markets which has been pulled down and replaced but a new ultra modern centre with upmarket shops.

Nothing negative to really say about hotel. Me and my boyfriend stayed in a King room which was a little small but we didn't spend our time in the room besides sleeping. Staff was very accommodating. Incidental charge is kinda high, but it's Waikiki and was expected. Room was clean, very convenient market connected to hotel. We enjoyed our stay very much and would stay again. Every staff member was pleasant!

I had first hand experience with Hilton Garden Inn Waikiki of their facility of storing luggage, - which is a key and substantial service for a traveler who intends to visit other Hawaii islands and leave extra gear, like winter clothes, behind in the hotel. Hilton Garden Inn does not allow such.

This was a nice hotel, in a good location for the beach and shopping. The bus stop right outside was a bonus, as was the in-house shop (perfect for when we had a deluge of rain). A couple of restaurants close by, friendly and efficient service, very clean rooms and hotel, housekeeping was good, plenty of towels, good balcony to sit on (no view, but it is always nice to have an outside area), comfy bed.The bathroom was a good size, but the shower door opening up outward was awkward when you needed to get out of the shower cubicle, because the toilet was right in your way, so you had to take a long stride to the other side of the wall to avoid this. Not the hotel's fault, but if they ever upgrade the showers, that should be changed.The facility of being able to use a computer downstairs for free was good, especially when one of them was an Apple Mac (thank you!!).Overall, a very good stay and would recommend for those with a bit of money to throw away and if you like being around the very busy side of the beach at Waikiki.

This hotel appears to be newly remodeled. The rooms are spacious and well appointed. Service was very attentive. There was a free coffee service every morning. There is a convenience store adjacent that serves coffee in the morning and beer and wine in the afternoon. Like most hotels in the area, parking is valet. My only criticism is there was no desk. Instead, there was a small coffee table and long settee which would be more useful for families. I also missed not having wired internet.

My family stayed here and had a wonderful time. The hotel was recently renovated and everything is new and modern. Cool design throughout the lobby and inside the rooms, which were clean and quiet. The staff greeted us warmly and made us feel right at home. Location is great, directly across the street from retail shops, restaurants, and sundry stores. There's a fitness center and pool deck, but we didn't spend a lot of time there since it's only a 5 minute walk to the beach.We would definitely recommend the hotel for vacationing families and couples, as well as business travelers.

Spent 4 nights here, and really enjoyed our stay. The rooms are really modern, clean and spacious (we had a king room), and the staff were all really helpful and friendly.The connects to a convenience store with a bar area where we got a hot breakfast and coffee in the morning, plus water and snacks during the day. Very convenient.The pool isn't huge, but the area around it is. Lots of lounge chairs and a pool table.Would definitely stay here again.

What an incredible hotel!The location is wonderful being so close to the beach, great places to eat, places to shop, and the pick-up locations for all tours are within a five minute walk.There is also NO resort fee. There IS luggage storage so I'm not sure why somebody below said that.The room was clean, spacious, and views were great. The beds were super comfortable and I got great sleeps in between all the crazy Hawaiian adventures!The staff was INCREDIBLE.A special shoutout to Bradley who was great to speak with. He gave great suggestions about places to grab a bite to eat and was absolutely pleasant to deal with.Unfortunately the day we left we went to say goodbye and wish the staff well, and he was not there at the moment.I hope management gives Bradley recognition for being so wonderful and pass on our apologies for not seeing him the day we left.Mahalo!

Customer service improved considerably. The rooms no longer smell like paint. I hope the restaurant open soon. Accessing the valet can be a pain. NO good restaurants around. Lobby is nice. Lobby bathrooms are nasty. Thank you for the daily free newspaper, coffee, and afternoon refreshments.

We had a great time and close to everything,recommended hotel. I will come back again.I wish restaurant will open soon that would be great.I would like to say thank you to Evely from housekeeping for looking after our room during our stay,she's great and very helpful.

We visit Waikiki regulary and watched the start of the renovation of the old Ohana West when we were there last year. We decided if it was opened when we came back this year that we'd check in and give it a go. I'm glad we did. They've done a great job revamping this hotel.We arrived from New Zealand after our flight was delayed by four hours and it was a relief to be able to check in early as our room was ready. Our room #640 was spacious (one of the bigger rooms from what I can gather from the hotel map). It had the bathroom at the far end of the room and not as you walk in, so we were happy about that. There is no desk in the room and we work even on vacation so in the end we brought the outside table in and used that. There is plenty of room for a desk so it's weird that there isn't one and I see from other reviews that people really do miss a work area. That's the only complaint I have really. The bed was comfortably, fridge not crowded with hotel drinks etc, the bathroom was modern and worked well. Staff were friendly and helpful. The lobby is lovely and has some modern touches and is furnished well with lots of seating. The pool is small, but has plenty of shadey spots and a variety of places to sit or lounge. The lifts are quick. The store attached is well stocked with fool options and all the essentials you need when away.Now that the International Market place is opened the hotel is nicely placed and close to everything. Two blocks to the beach and an easy walk.This is a good value option in Wakiki and a treat as it's all so new and fresh.

I'm going to make this quick... This hotel is well kept. Most of the people that work here are friendly and definitely go out of their way to accommodate guests. I'd like to especially thank the valet attendants, those guys, men and women, were definitely on their J.O.B. and wetted extremely friendly and helpful.

So glad we tried this new Garden Inn. Location is fine for walking pretty much anywhere in Waikiki. Hotel is valet only at $35/night which to be fair is typical for Waikiki. If you can skip the car rental I suggest Uber which is fast and friendly here.The rooms are on the smaller side but are well appointed and clean. Ask for a room with a balcony as some do not have balconies.We loved the beautifully displayed infused water that was set out each afternoon along with freshly baked granola bars.The front desk staff were nothing but friendly and professional and we had a great time chatting and learning of fun things to do around town.The new Marketplace across the street is a great shortcut to get to Waikiki beach.Overall we were impressed and will be back.

The staff was very nice and rooms were a bit small but clean and comfortable. The market attached to the hotel was great. I was hoping their restaurant would be open but there were plenty within walking distance.

Stayed one week at Hilton Garden Inn Waikiki Beach. Very satisfactory with this hotel. This is one of the few hotels in Waikiki that doesn't charge resort fee. Hotel is very modern, staff are friendly. Room (king size) is not huge, but enough for me and my wife to have a good rest after some beach or shopping/tour days. Location was perfect right across the International Market place, buses, trolleys are just at the foot steps. Food pantry and ABC stores are across right next to the hotel. Few minutes walk to major attractions: Waikiki Beach, Royal Hawaiian Center, Beach Walk, etc. Swim pool, pool table, morning coffee, afternoon bakery, computer work station and printers are offered. Only complains are the expensive $35 Valet parking (which I didn't end up renting a car, but walk or bus it) and toward the end of my stays, they start missing some refills of k-cups are other toiletries in my room. I called them up and they bring back the missing supplies very quickly.

Not on the beach but a short walk 1 block over. Lots of shops and restaurants nearby. Room was nice but an odd thing, no desk! I had to sit on a bench along one wall or go to the lobby to work. Room had a safe, fridge and microwave. Very friendly staff. Parking is tough unless you valet. Attached coffee/gift shop.

This was my first time in Honolulu and the hotel was perfect. Ideal location, super staff and wonderful customer service. Room was clean and fully stocked. We were delighted to see the microwave and refrig. Certainly will return to this property. I recommend this property highly.

Great place to stay. Will be better when the restaurant is open. Close to beach and shopping. Had to pay for parking but staff made it easy to get and return car. The overall appearance of the hotel was very good. Recently renovated.
user_location: Salt Lake city, Utah, United States
user_name:
James G
Salt Lake city, Utah, United States

review_body: We stayed here because there weren't many other options in the area, but we enjoyed our stay. The location is great in Waikiki for shopping and the beach. The room we had was a bit small with all of our suitcases, but they are new, modern, and clean with large television and premium cable. The only drawback was the price ($35/night parking isn't included), but that comes with the location. Overall a very nice place.

I traveled to Honolulu on business in mid-September 2016, and this hotel was the only Hilton-brand hotel in Waikiki I could find that offered the government per diem rate. Apparently, there were several conventions in town at the time.Pluses:Facilities: The hotel is new and clean. The staff is friendly and service-oriented. The rooms are on the small side, but as depicted on the hotel web site. The business center is adequate (located in the large lobby). Apparently, the hotel has a laundromat on the second floor (did not use). The hotel also offers a free, limited breakfast at one of two locations - your choice. Duke's Waikiki (a walk from the hotel, but on the beach) and HoloHolo Coffee Bar (in the hotel lobby). Duke's opens at 7:00 AM; HoloHolo Coffee Bar opens at 6:00 AM. The hotel restaurant is not yet open.Minuses:Location and parking: The hotel is located on Kuhio Avenue, behind the new International Marketplace. The parking garage is off-site, valet parking only, $35 per day. The valet parking stand is on a side street, adjacent to the hotel and you have to make a block to access it from Kuhio, once you figure out where it is located. Valet parking takes 15 - 20 minutes to deliver your call, once you call for it, though they do have a good number of valets working the stand. It is a royal pain getting to and from this hotel by car what with its location in Waikiki, one-way streets, street lights timed with pedestrian cross walks, traffic congestion, etc.Net/net, stay at this hotel as a last resort, if nothing else is available at a reasonable rate.

Great Hotel to stay at I believe a restaurant is being added at the end of the year 2016, and that was the only draw back although there was shop plus Cafe Bar attached. It was a short walk to Waikiki Beach and an abundance of other restaurants and shopping very close by.

Close to beach only a 5 minute walk through the international market. To beach access. Great trait ants near by plus a grocery stor next to hotel. Laundry is across the street. So nice. Amazing location.

Just two blocks from the beach, this hotel was a great rate, just opened this year so everything was new and beautiful, rooms spacious and clean, convenient market in lobby for last minute sunscreen needs and quick snack breaks between pool and beach. Would stay again!

This brand new Hilton was a pleasure to stay in. The staff were very friendly and my basic room was outstanding. I stayed here on my trip over to mainland USA and also on the way back, where I was remembered by staff who welcomed me back. This is my first experience of staying at a Hilton hotel and would definitely return.

My time at the Hilton Garden Inn Waikiki Beach, Honolulu was wonderful. The room was beautiful and clean with a partial view of the ocean. The service was great, and Kia was exceptionally helpful. The location allowed for easy access to the beach.
user_name:
Lori H
Osage Beach, United States

review_body: Stayed here one night. No problems. Staff was very friendly especially our Porter. Only complaint was valet service. Made arrangements to pick up car in the morning at specific time. In their defence the valet person suggested we call 15 minutes before the time we requested and in a rush in the morning I forgot to call. I hoped requesting the vehicle at a specific time would workout ok but it did not. The car was not there at the requested time. Because Valet parking is off site it took awhile to retrieve the car. The Valet crew was very nice though, so just remember to call and it should be there for you. As I said it was a quick visit so we did not have any problems and would stay here again. New stores like Saks 5th close by.

I spent many hours trying to find nice (modern-ish) accommodation in Waikiki Beach that didn't cost me a fortune! In the end I chose the Hilton Garden Inn, and I'm glad I did.I stayed 8 nights in standard King Bed room. In summary, the hotel was in a great location, literally a block from the main shopping strip and 2 blocks to the beach. The rooms are very modern and very spacious, with nice updated bathrooms and good amenities (coffee pod machine/microwave/plenty of towels/nice shampoo, conditioner etc). The pool area is great, with plenty of sun from around 10am - 4pm (when travelling in August). WIFI in the hotel was very good also. There is a huge supermarket/bottle shop just across the road, which had everything I needed. Yes the hotel currently doesn't have a restaurant (I believe they are working on that) but you can get some snacks at the pool bar (get some drinks there too they are delicious). There is also a lot of construction going on across the road at the shopping mall, but that looked almost completed when I was there. So it does get quite noisy but I didn't really have much of a problem with it. The only time I did was when they decided to do some work at around midnight which kept me awake. But that was one night of my eight!The only issue I had was paying for the accommodation. Upon check in they take a portion of the nights you will be staying plus an amenities fee for each night (no bond required). I wasn't aware of this, and trying to get the front desk staff to walk me through this was difficult, and I speak English! They also weren't able to tell me how much I would owe on check out, until I checked out (I asked based on the assumption that I didn't charge anything to the room).So that was a little confusing to me, but we got there in the end. I would simply recommend to book and pay upfront.The only recommendation I would have for the Hilton is for there to be some form of crockery/cutlery in the rooms. There is a microwave in the room, it just made it difficult for me to eat anything from the microwave. Not that it was a huge problem, I went and purchased my own bowls/cutlery at the supermarket across the road.All in all I would definitely recommend staying and the Hilton Garden Inn, and if I was to come back to Waikiki I would stay here again.

Great staff with great location! Very near Waikiki Beach and across from the new International Marketplace. On all bus routes very near by. A very modern open based hotel layout.Swimming pool. Many food markets in the area with one in the hotel proper.

We were island hopping and decided to take in two extra nights in Honolulu. Looked around at hotel,options on TripAdvisor and based on reviews decided on this Hilton Garden Inn.We were lucky I think based on some reviews, but found our room to be spacious and clean. The hotel has been recently renovated so all the fittings were modern. I am however not a great lover of sliding bathroom doors.There was a small balcony that had a table and two chairs on it. We sat and had breakfast on there with a view overlooking the city and the ocean. The room was equipped with a microwave, fridge, free wifi and coffee making facilities. Did not use these as there is a small cafe and shop attached to the hotel that offered hot and cold drinks and food for either inside dining or takeaway.The staff were friendly and helpful and all in all our stay was an enjoyable one.

The hotel staff were very friendly, helpful and the location was great for walking and getting to the beach. Restaurant was not completed yet but breakfast was available at a small cafe attached to the hotel. Coffee bar as well.

Overall we enjoyed our stay at Hilton. Although it was expensive it provided cheaper accommodation than most others when we booked at short notice. The rooms are brand new but small (tiny bathroom which is the entry to the room). Location is great although not on the beach it is only one block away and is close to shops, restaurants etc. Improvements could be made, there is no mini bar, nor any cutlery in the room, only paper cups (we had to keep the plastic cups from the pool (plastic not ideal either!). There was a microwave but we would have liked a toaster also. Providing these amenities would make the rooms better!! Great wifi, cable and our rooms were serviced daily.

Very nice staff, in a good location, but there is a resturant - it is right next to a new mall so it is in a highly populated area. It is about a 45 min drive from the airport - I was just not totally impressed with this hotel as I am with other Garden Inn's I would not stay there again

great place to stay ticks all the boxes .central location walking distance to everywhere, rooms extremely clean and comfortable air conditioning works like a dream . all staff very friendly and could not do enough for you.

Hotel valet is a bit expensive but you have no other choice. It's either valet or driving up and down a few streets and pray you get lucky to park on the curve which also has limitations. The cafe/bar was ok, nothing to impressive.

Delightful place to stay. Walk right across the street and step into the International Plaza mall. Harry Winston, Prada, Coach, etc. on the avenue on the otherside of the mall. Who knew? Staff is consistently friendly and helpful. Valet gets the car quicly with a head's up phone call. Very convenient to walk to different sites; beach, a zoo (which is good for little one), lots of places to eat. Room was quiet. Elevator travels at warp speed. Seems odd to mention it but we were on the 9th floor and it took 5 seconds. Really. Had a couple of little glitches which were taken care of immediately. Shower clog, needed bedding for pull out sofabed, coffee maker not working. They came right away each time and were beyond apologetic.

Ok I was here for 12 nights for work and let me just say that the staff here are amazing at the front desk. The rooms near the elevator are awful if you are a light sleeper they have a loud ring anytime one of them stops on your floor so ask for a quiet room. The rooms are nicely appointed and the hotel is newly renovated. The pool has a BAR which is great but the need to advertise this more, however what the pool doesnt have is UMBRELLAS!!! They have a great pool, with an unknown bar, and no umbrellas, not a recipe for people knowing were to go or staying there. Please put some out there for shade it would make a world of difference. The gym is nonexistent except for a few treadmills and one set of weights so keep that in mind while visiting. Also they serve free coffee and tea in the lobby every morning and have a great on site cafe. As previously noted the Valet takes forever, also when you pull in they will take their time talking to each other and blatantly ignoring you so for $35 a day they may want to start looking at a new company or training to keep guests happy. Also housekeeping is very hit or miss, they always have carts blocking most of the hallways for a majority of the day but only occasionally made it to my room even if i was gone all day.Now location, location, location, this hotel does not charge a resort fee, which almost everyone else in Waikiki does so, grab the nice new towels on the third floor pool deck with no shade and after a quick walk through the newly opened international market you are starting at the Moana Surfrider, Outrigger, The Royal and Dukes! They are a quick walk and you can rent chairs for the day there at $40 but dont even think of going near another hotels pool, they are super strict. However the close proximity to all these great hotels, bars, and dining at a fraction of the cost make this location a no brainier. I truly believe with a few tweaks this could be a top notch hotel. It is not luxurious do not get me wrong but it is a good base if you want to get out to explore Oahu. You will not want to stay and play all day at this hotel so look else where if that is your goal.

I recently stayed at this recently refurbished hotel, now under the "Hilton" brand, and I was amazed at the transformation this former run down Hotel has undergone. It is truly a great looing and feeling Hotel now, the décor od smart and modern, which is often hard to find in Waikiki, the amenities are good, although having only just re opened there are still a few cosmetic things they need to complete like the planting around the pool area, glassware etc in the rooms, checking out was an issue as we wanted to split payment of the account and after 20 minutes we gave up, but over all I wold highly recommend it.

So, I'm not a Hilton guy, I'm a SPG guy, but I'm seriously thinking about staying here going forward when I'm on business in Waikiki. The hotel recently had a 100% remodel. Fresh paint, new furniture, fixtures, ect. It was really nice and right by the international market. There is also a well outfitted convenience store in the lobby of the hotel which as a lot of quick food options. The dinner benefit that comes with loyalty recognition is great right now too. Since there isn't a restaurant in the hotel, they give you free breakfast at Duke's which is a quick 5min walk from the hotel. If you have to stay in Waikiki for business or pleasure and don't want to spend the amount of some of the other properties, this one warrants your consideration!

Nice Hotel with a great location and the staff is very nice. Very nice Lobby but the rooms are small or at least they felt smaller than your standard hotel room. My room had a desk but no chair. Instead there was a vanity type bench. No way to comfortably get any work done. From what other hotel guest told me some rooms didn't have a desk, they just had a small round table No drawers to put your clothes away and the bathroom sink is in the door/entry way. The pool is very small and the poolside bar doesn't have enough shade. The drinks at the poolside bar are horribly overpriced even for Waikiki. Give yourself 5 to 10 minutes to get your car in the morning and calling down doesn't make the process any faster. This is not your typical Hilton Garden Inn. The hotel will probably be OK for a short stay or a weekend shopping trip for outer island visitors but not any good for my business travels to Hawaii.

Great hotel in a great location. The hotel is very new and the staff was great. It would have been great to have the restaurant open in the hotel but nevertheless, there were other restaurants nearby for lunch or dinner. The mini market was a plus, if we wanted to have a quick snack. Overall, the cleanness of the hotel and friendless of the staff made this experience very memorable.

Awesome stay enjoyed it. Didn't like we could have a beer in the lobby. Also didn't like how it was $25-$35 to park at the hotel on top of the price of the room. Beds are comfy and I slept amazing would stay again. Can't wait to see the new restaurant that was being built.

Since this is our first time in Honolulu, I did a lot of research before deciding on the Hilton Garden Inn.1) It is newly renovated. 2) The location is great.3) It is a short walk to the beach, near public bus and close to our tour bus pickup.4) The newly opened International Market is directly across the street. 5) There is a small store next to the lobby, where we purchased our breakfast items and water. 6)There are many eateries and a food pantry store nearby for guest that want to prepare their own meals.7)There is a self service laundry available with 2 washer and 2 dryers. 8) The computers in the lobby is very useful for guest to print out local maps, boarding pass, etc.. 9) In the morning, there is coffee, tea and hot water available.near the elevators. In the afternoon, there is fruit infused water available. 10) The staff is friendly. A few minor suggestions can make future guests have a more positive stay. 1) Install a few more washer and dryer, so guest will not have to wait, Add a wash basin. Provide or have a dispenser for detergent.2) Add cold/hot water dispenser on the floors where an ice machine is located, so guest will not have to go all the way down to the lobby in the mornings.3) Include plain water in the afternoon as an option.
