Leave water in the lobby until late evening as guest can check in during late hours. 4) Provide a clothes drying rack in the room for guest to hang their wet towel to reuse.5) Add a chair to the room. (There is bench seating, however, the table is round)6) Add a recycle paper bin to reuse the back side of paper, if guest chose to do so. Provide a few pens, tape, stapler near the computers.There was a minor incident early one morning announcing that everyone needed to go downstairs. Since we were staying on the 16th floor, we had to walk down 16 flights of stairs, only to find out that the smoke alarm went off in another guest room. Despite this incident, we will definitely stay at the Hilton Garden Inn again.

Hilton Garden Inn Waikiki is a gem. Great location directly across from brand new upscale International Markerplace and close to beach. The rooms are well designed, modern and clean. All staff members were extremely courteous and helpful. Very happy with our stay here and would highly recommend!

Rooms comfortable, great beds, nice bathroom/shower. Location opposite the new International Marketplace excellent. Pool good. Excellent staff who are very helpful. Plumbing issue needs review but overall stay very good.

I have a strong preference towards fine hotels. But because I was just on the island for a mere 30 hours (for work), I opted to stay at this property.What I liked:-The lobby! It looks upscale and vibe is very dynamic yet cozy. Lots of young good looking people wandering around (or was it just me?).-The Front Office Staff. I had a minor problem in the room I was initially assigned to so I expressed it politely. With no hesitations, I was moved all the way to the 16 floor (from the 6th floor). I believe it was an upgrade because I had a partial ocean view. Thanks to Lauren who was sooooooooo accommodating and warm. You won't find this kind of service at from a luxury hotel in New York! haha-Location. It's literally across the International Market. Thumbs up!What I didn't like:-Lack of amenities. I was surprise that no robes are offered. Of all the hotels that I've stayed at in my life, this is a first. -Snotty workers at convenience store. Probably not connected with the hotel, but can I just say what's up with the attitude of one of their cashiers? I bought a Musubi and I presented my one and only card I had in my pocket: An American Express Platinum. She inspected it in detail as if it wasn't mine and asked for my ID. I presented my global entry card, which she also starred at for at least 30 seconds ensuring it was me on the photo. Anyway, these are the only "meh" part. Would I recommend this hotel? Yes. But if you're accustomed to luxury offerings, then I suggest you go to the Conrad. But no Conrad exists in Hawaii. :D

Expect long wait times to retrieve your car from the valet. Not a good value considering the price for parking. Bathroom vanities are located outside of the bathroom, disturbing other room occupants with noise and light.

Hilton Garden Inn Waikiki.Had two night here as a weekend treat whilst visiting Big Island. It's just 30 minutes by air but the journey into Honolulu by car was painfully slow and took much longer. I had a car and used the hotels valet parking service which was very good but rather costly at almost $40 a day.On arrival the staff were friendly and efficient and I was allocated a room on the 16th floor. The room layout was a bit odd with the sink on the left as soon as you open the door. To the right was a WC and large shower. The room had two beds, large wardrobe and a huge TV. There was a balcony (Lanai) with a small table and two chairs but the city view was poor. As a diamond member I had hoped for s sea view but this was not offered.Breakfast was at Dukes, a hefty walk away from the hotel and we used it on our first morning. Service there was poor and the food poorer still. Indeed it was so bad at breakfast that I cancelled long held reservations for dinner that night.I did not take this up with the hotel but they need to look at this carefully. Dukes reflects badly on the hotel and there must be better alternatives.Overall a nice hotel, cash rates are high as they are at all Waikiki hotels and its perhaps not a place you want to linger in for more than a few days.

Overall, a lot of positives with my experience... I knew this hotel was new so it was a big reason why I chose it. I was happy to see that the hotel and my room was clean and modern looking. The other big positive is that the staff were super nice. As for the location, my feelings are mixed.... it's in the middle of Waikiki so you are close to everything; however, I ended up with a room with a lame view. As for my complaints, I'm not a fan of how small the room was. I guess you could consider that a positive since we ended up staying out as much as possible. Another con is that the pool is horribly small so we ended up avoiding it. Finally, I do have to mention that major construction was going on across the street which took away from our experience.

I was excited that this hotel was opening but was a little let down by the room. The king rooms are small- like a college dorm with only a desk chair as an extra place to sit. I did have a partial ocean room that you can only see the ocean from the balcony. Shower was big and room clean but nothing special. The bed was comfortable. The room did have a fridge and microwave which was nice. The gym had enough equipment but only treadmills and bikes. Pool is small and lounges all close together. Coffee in lobby in the morning was nice and cold drinks in the afternoon. The staff was all very nice. The hotel is across from the new International Marketplace which is now open. It is only a few minutes walk to the beach. There is a shop next door for snacks and drinks. I enjoyed my stay but would think twice about coming back because my room was too small.

We booked 2 facing rooms for our family vacation in late August, and are pleased to have found this hotel. Being there for the grand opening of the International Marketplace across the street Aug 25 2016 was a bonus and we enjoyed dining at the new Eating House 1849, which made up for the lack of an onsite formal dining restaurant. Waikiki Beach is a short 10 minute stroll through shops, restaurants, and surf rentals, so that forgetting to bring something is not a problem because you can just buy it in Waikiki. Parking is $35 (valet only). Friendly staff and newly renovated rooms made this a great facility.

Situated in the middle of Waikīkī, close to bus stop, eating places, and the staff is full of Aloha. Room very clean upon checkin, bell staff very friendly. Hard to believe you are in the middle of Waikīkī. Can't wait to go back.

My friend & I decided on this hotel as it had just recently opened. Figured on it being clean, fresh and comfy. It was exactly that.The hotel has a modern look and the staff were really friendly! Sorry, we didn't get her name but the gal on the front desk Monday Aug. 22nd around 1:00pm was super! She was helpful, pleasant and had a genuine smile that felt like a real Aloha welcome! All staff members were very pleasant! Thanks! The room was clean and the bed was super! Slept well! Really liked the spacious shower and having a microwave & coffee maker was handy as was the free wifi and no resort fee! My friend & I used the gym every morning before heading to the beach. Handy! There is a nice pool area with plenty of lounge chairs, but we opted to go to the beach everyday instead.There is a pantry type of a store near the lobby that sells similar items as the ABC store, which was handy. They are still working on the restaurant, but that's ok. There are MANY restaurant options all around Waikiki, so not to worry. There's an IHOP just down the road too within walking distance if you want breakfast. I knew the location before booking & it is handy to most shops & restaurants, but it is about a 15 minute walk to the beach near The Outrigger Reef Hotel where we like to rent umbrellas from the slightly cheaper Military stand & about a ten minute walk to the beach (Kuhio?) just out front of the Waikiki Marriott & Aston Waikiki Beach Hotel area where the wall protects swimmers from the big waves. If you don't mind a short daily walk, then you won't mind the location. If you prefer to step out & be at the beach in 5 minutes, then you may want to stay somewhere on Kalakaua Avenue, which is the street adjacent to the beach. All in all a very comfortable stay. Thank you!Tip, if you want to see a glimpse of of the ocean from your room, then I would advise staying in a room facing the International Market/Kuhio side of the hotel floors 15 & up.

This newly opened Hilton Garden Inn is right in the middle of Waikiki. It's about a 5 minutes walk to the famous Waikiki beach and the beach road with all the nice shops. Good restaurants are all around.The rooms are nice and the staff is friendly.What more does one need!

This is a beautiful hotel with clean modern rooms, and friendly staff. When staying here pack lots of aloha spirit, you'll need it. I don't know if it's island culture or what, but everything is done slow if it's done by a human. You'll have to be patient and I wouldn't recommend for a business stay.

Well what can you say...you're in Hawaii and the Hilton is a great chain. The hotel is very clean and the rooms are comfortable. The staff throughout the hotel were great, friendly and accommodating. The only thing is they only have valet and it was $35 a day, which was a little more than others in the area. Great location...close to everything. They are building a nice mall across the street.

On our arrival to Hawaii, we had booked out hotel (elsewhere) with the wrong date (time difference) and Hilton garden in was where we ended up for one nightThe staff were friendly and very accomodatingAs we didn't arrive until about 3am we didn't see much of the hotel or staff but at check in and out I was more than happy with the friendliness of the staff we dealt withThe room was clean, bed was comfortable. The only negative would be the room was pretty bright from outside lights and curtains that didn't close around the sides allowing light to come inAll in all, from a very short stay I would recommend

So we landed, we got to the hotel before noon…..and to my surprise 2 of my coworkers got in their room right away and I got “your room is not ready yet”….please check again after 12:00 pm. Which I did, and of course I got the same answer…. “your room is not ready yet”. My room got ready miraculously right after I mentioned that we are a pretty big group and all the rooms were booked at the same time by the same travel agency that our company is using….Overall the hotel is nice, but there is a lot of construction going on at this time around the hotel, across the street from the hotel and as a matter of fact everywhere else on the island.Location is pretty good, within short walking distance from beach, restaurants and shopping. My room was on the 14th floor –with a less than exciting view…..the parking garage across the street. There is a convenience store at the ground level of the hotel with a pretty good selection of fresh coffees and juices. Would I choose this hotel if I would go for vacation? Maybe…. And that’s only after all the construction is completed. But most likely I would book a hotel with a better view.

I have stayed at Hilton properties for many years now and the service has been consistently good. As a bonus, I have always felt an extra bit of effort from the staff as a honors member. Unfortunately, this is not the case as the HGI Waikiki. When we got to the hotel around 3pm, the front desk seemed incredibly under-staffed with two young ladies checking in guests and many other member (including a manager) standing around supervising. The whole process seemed a bit disorganized and we had people cut in front of us twice during the process. Once we got to the counter, our room was not ready. During past stays at Hilton properties, the staff would make sure they found an available room. We needed to adjust our plans in order to stay close to the property until it was ready. Once the room was ready, we were right next to the elevators on the 10th floor. Normally this wouldn't be a problem but the elevator bell (ding) is so loud you can hear it constantly from the room. The next morning, we went to take a shower and the shower would not work. Water would not transfer to the shower head from the faucet... The shower would work if you held the button down but the water pressure was extremely weak. After spending several days at a great non-Hilton property on Maui and having an excellent history with Hilton properties, this stay was very disappointing. A couple good notes on the property... Location is great if you want to be in Waikiki. If not, I would recommend staying outside of the city. Another highlight is that the property seems very new. The rooms were clean and updated.

There were eleven of us in four rooms on a family trip. Rooms were modern in all respects. Location was very good and allowed for easy access to all sights. The staff was very accommodating and extremely friendly. I would stay here again!!!Overall a better experience than I expected with no negatives at all.

newly opened hilton on kuhio across from the newly reopened intl market makes it smack in the middle of retail action but is it worth it?alot of rooms have no great views and rooms are small.having to walk .5 mile away to another restaurant if you want a buffet breakfast is a bummer and not having options with the continental one offered at their small cafe doesn't help.my small room had no view or lanai and while having a microwave and not very cold fridge is nice there is no towel bar in the bath area itself which made it messy to cross over to the vanity to retrieve one. staff was nice and the price was right but i might rather stay at the hilton down the street .
user_name:
Cynthia L
los angeles, United States

review_body: My family stayed in the conveniently located , Hilton Garden Inn Waikiki for 2 weeks. The hotel staff were very friendly and helpful , especially those in the valet and porter services . One particular Japanese looking Filipino employee by the name of Michael of the bell desk ) went out of his way to tell us the many spots to visit , which ordinary tourists don't bother with but are very popular with locals . Thank you Michael ! The only bothersome issue was the alarm that went off 3 times during our stay. I wish that there was a full service restaurant in the hotel, although there is a small mini mart cum gift shop that sells beverages , light snacks . In summary , our stay at the Hilton Garden Inn was a home away from home

It was the first day here at the hotel and I realized why HIlton decided to hang their flag here.. It was directly facing the redesigned INTERNATIONAL MARKETPLACE which will be opening up tomorrow. Guests at this hotel will only need to cross the street to get to prime shopping and dining.. Granted if you can afford to buy anything there. Lol. Anyways, back to the hotel. The hotel has been reopened and rebranded for the past few weeks in which I must say.. The design came out pretty well. The lobby is modern yet rustic not too grand but it goes with what they are doing. There's coffee in the morning near the elevators and after 3pm it is replaced by their awesome cookies and fruit infused water station which I must say is good! The rooms are nice of course it helps if you have a view. But the rooms are modern and up to date. The shower is huge and I'm a big guy so it tells you something. I had a king bed and the room was well spaced. Don't know if 2 beds will make the room smaller tho. But a solo traveler it works for me! But what really is the pride and joy of this hotel is it's staff. The front desk was super nice (Lauren, Melinda, etc) and I really got to know them over the pass few days ever since checking in late at night. The Housekeeping staff kept my room nice and tidy never skipping a beat even tho I slept in late most of the time. To the late night staff (Austin, etc) at Holoholo bar and grill, you guys are funny. Remember to always have fun even if it is work. From what I see, the hotel is going in the right direction. It'll be interesting to see how it progresses after the marketplace opens. Good job HGI!

Taking my daughter to UH Manoa perfect location to there, downtown and the beach all except the university within walking distance, convenient bus stop and trolley, grocery store right next door, staff is wonderful!

We enjoyed our stay and the hotel is well located to the beach, shops and busses. the rooms were very clean and well appointed with very helpful and friendly staff. The pool and gym was great. We will have no hesitation in staying again if we visit Hawaii

A good Hilton standard hotel though I would probably only use it for a short stay as it is more of a business hotel with facilities rather than a tourist/leisure hotel Valet parking $30 overnight . Access to the car anytime of the day and attended to without delay . There is very little if any street parking so the valet parking was well used It's unfortunate for the hotel at the moment (Aug) that there is a large shopping mall being finished across the road . It is allegedly due to open next week ( Sept) . Some building noise during the day and extensive roadworks outside on Kuhio Ave Checked in and out by Zach - pleasant , friendly and efficient - good customer service and recognition of Hilton members Room on 16th floor accessed by room card -2queen beds for a family of 4 . Not the biggest of rooms but as we were only using it as a base it was more than adequate . Big shower and toilet behind a sliding door - basin and vanity unit in main portion of bedroom by the door . Slightly unusual but does help when 3 of us are trying to get to a mirror at the same time with the other in the shower Coffee machine in the room- always welcome Safe Plenty of towels and some miniature toiletries Clean and modern fittings Free wifi available depending on status and booking conditionsCoffee available in the lobby early morningSome breakfast items available at the adjoining shop/cafe through the lobby .Swimming pool on the 3rd floor with numerous sun beds -though they are packed in to the limited space available - towels readily available You need your keycard to access all floors , the toilets around the pool and the stair well . Don't get caught without it as you could find yourself not a ale to move between levelsFor a short stay, it ticked all the boxes for us. - had everything we needed

Check InI arrived quite late in the evening (past 8 pm), having booked only a few hours previously through my corporate rate. I slipped the front-desk gent a $20 and asked him whether he could do some magic as I would appreciate better room (I booked cheapest twin room). He found me a top-floor King deluxe with 100% sea view (frontal) which I appreciated. I was asked whether I needed any help with my luggage (which I did not given my 2-day only stay with Hand-luggage). RoomThe room was not very big (which is understandable given how much premium one pays in Waikiki for each sq ft). What I immediately did not like was the way room was organised - one basically walks through bathroom as one opens the front door. One the right hand side there is a sink and all toiletries, whilst through a slide-door on the left hand side one can access restroom and shower (not rain-fall shower). I like having a sink in the restroom and a proper hall and this is organisation of the room is a NO-NO in my view.I did like that there were plenty of electric sockets and USB ports to charge my devices - this is great and a big +++ in my view!I also liked that air-conditioning was working properly (which you would expect in a new hotel), and was not very loud.There was also a small balcony with a couple of seats overlooking the ocean (and a parking lot on the opposite side of the street) which was very nice. The bed was comfy and TV had plenty of channels.DiningThe hotel restaurant is not yet finished, so for breakfast (as a Hilton Diamond member) I was offered full-buffet vouchers for the DUKE's. I pounced on these, as I quite like Duke's and it is directly on Waikiki beach, which is excellent.I also visited the pool and the pool-side bar. The pool is ok-sized, though not deep enough and not really made for swimming - more for family fun I suppose. The pool-side bar though was disappointing. I had a couple of drink vouchers, but these could only be redeemed for a couple of different drinks or mai-tai (even though other drinks on the menu cost the same as mai-tai). It was also very disappointing to find out that the management is already trying to save money and the free drink for Diamond members are served in 8oz cups (whilst the same drink when ordered and payed for is served in 10oz cup) - same for beer, when redeemed via voucher you get 12oz whilst normally you get 16oz.LocationHotel is about 400 yards from the Waikiki beach and is really close to some good eateries and shopping opportunities. My favourite nearby is the Marukame Udon, cheap and really worth waiting in the queue for!OverallI would probably come here again, though this hotel does not have exec lounge, unlike Hilton Waikiki, to which it is similarly priced. Some members of staff were really nice and definitely went out of their way to help (especially when I lost my wallet).

Good for a lone business traveler. Tiny rooms. The queen bed doesn't fit 2 people, uncomfortable. Apart from that, the usual Hilton. Centrally located, everything is walking distance. A very nice store with good eats, at 1st level.

From what I hear this HGI is only about 2 months old and that's a good thing. I love clean carpets, nice furniture and appliances that work, and a bathroom where nothing's broken. I thoroughly enjoyed my stay here and would strongly consider this Hilton brand again. Despite the noise across the street of the new marketplace (which is looking to be quite nice) I didn't have any disturbances considering how busy it is. Staff was excellent and valet you will pay the cost but they run a tight ship and will get you on your way!My only complaint here is the breakfast restaurant doesn't exist yet.. We have to go to Dukes which accepts us but they don't recognize your Hilton status nor treat you like one of their paying guest. Needless to say I'm looking forward to when the restaurant is up and running.Overall - Good job HGI!!!

Valet parking is mandatory and can be slow. Call fifteen minutes before needing your car. Tipping meant we wouldn't take the car more than twice a day. Standard rooms are small - one of the double beds is basically right against the wall by the sliding doors. Laundry room - not enough machines - 2 washers and 2 dryers for the entire hotel. Always waiting to use a washing machine. People sit and wait for up to an hour to use them and some people put it on the longest cycle possible - double rinse, double spin etc. Not very considerate. Tried different times, but always a wait.Fitness room - quiet and new machines (treadmills and reclining bicyles). Housekeeping - very good and timely. Very friendly staffBathroom - shower and toilet is in one room. Shower head can't be adjusted. The sink is outside of it. No tub.Had microwave, fridge and coffee machine. Pool area - lots of chairs. Very noisy due to construction of mall across the street. Potential guests should have been advised of this before booking their stay and rate should have been discounted. Hotel is at one end of Waikiki, near the zoo. Have to walk around the is handheld type. construction site of the mall to get to main strip of Waikiki. Once, it is done, you can cut through it. Great udon restaurant is around the corner - MarakumeWork is still being done on the hotel. Nothing major. Liked the complimentary coffee in the lobby each morning- nice gestureElevators - no problem

During my stay at this hotel my room was accesses and very expensive belonging were stolen including my iPad. Not only did I suffer a substantial financial loss but I also was subjected to emotional stress as I felt violated and disrespected. My vacation has been ruined as a consequence of the lack of basic security at the Hilton Garden Hotel in Honolulu. Management didnt even apologize or comfort me on the day of the incident. Later, after 4-5 days of going back and forth with the general manager and his assistant I was promised to receive a compensatory check and was told by the manager that there was nothing more that he could do for me and that he didn't want to make it a bigger issue than it was for Hilton. I would never stay at any Hilton hotels again and I wouldn't recommend this unsafe and poor managed hotel.

The Hilton Garden Inn Waikiki Beach is fairly new, located some 3 blocks in from the beach with easy walking distance to wide variety of restaurants and shops. Valet parking, check-in and accommodations- all very good with all staff friendly and efficient. There is a first level store with most necessities, fresh bakery items and sandwich fare for a quick meal. There is no service restaurant which would have been nice but one to be completed in the near future. This hotel is not the Waikiki style Resort and Spa but a nice stay for both business or a short vacation.

(We visited during the construction across the street. While we were not thrilled with construction sounds starting at 7:30am, 7 days a week, this shouldn't let that affect our total overall impression of our visit.)We selected this hotel based on location and to use Hilton points. They were very accommodating in letting us use points for some of our stay. The only problem was it was 2 separate registrations which was easily handled when we checked in.Thanks to other room tips for this hotel, we found using Charley's Taxi to/from the airport to be the way to go for only $29 each way.The room is very modern and contemporary. We found the sliding bathroom door to be "different" and enjoyed the large, walk-in shower stall. The sink outside the bathroom meant more than 1 person can get ready. We were disappointed that there weren't more towel hooks. There are only 2 small nubs on the walls in the bathroom. For a family of 4, this made drying towels difficult. Because the shower walls were glass, we couldn't hang towels over the shower. We did use the chairs on the small balcony to dry bathing suits and towels but had to make sure to anchor them down as were 11 floors up and it could get windy. One night, we pulled one of the metal chairs inside to use as a towel rack.The beds and pillows were comfortable. (Although I wish Hilton would switch to queen beds.)The room came with a small microwave and refrigerator (hidden within an armoire which hid the noises). There is a grocery store across the street we used to supply ourselves with snacks and breakfast (the onsite restaurant is under construction). We were offered 2 breakfast vouchers (family of 4) to a restaurant 1 block away from 6am-10am. We declined them and went for the Hilton points instead.There was one, wicker sitting chair that was somewhat comfortable. But the bench along the wall was very uncomfortable for sitting. So, it became the holding place for our luggage.The in-room safe was large enough to put all our valuables including a laptop!The location is fantastic! You can see the ocean from the ocean-side rooms (the rooms high enough that is). It's just a short 10 minute walk to everything -- shops, restaurants, Waikiki Beach. I would definitely stay here again!

The Hilton Garden Inn proved to be an excellent choice for our holiday on Waikiki! Staff were excellent and the amenities proved to be great. The location was central and all other areas were easily accessed.

I loved staying here. Even though the hotel is an older property, the Hilton folks have renovated this better than any other property I have stayed in. The rooms and lobby areas appeared brand new. The only challenge I had was with the valet area. Make sure you call ahead to get your car ready and plan for 15 minutes to leave the hotel.

Overall, a decent hotel but their restaurant is not yet open so breakfast requires walk to Duke's which is not convenient and doesn't open until 7am which is disappointing as here for work. One can go to cafe and get something using the voucher provided to Diamond and Gold members. The turkey bacon burrito at the store in the hotel is pretty tasty yet wouldn't pay $4.49 if had to come out of pocket. Fortunately, I have a voucher since I'm diamond. Seems that not all elevators are working which slows down the process of getting to room or leaving room. But it's not that bad. A gym without one elliptical machine is crazy to me. This is highly unusual based on my experience. Typically, ellipticals are used more frequently than treadmills. Also, I prefer running outside especially in Hawaii which is very picturesque. So, they should replace some of the treadmills with ellipticals. The absence of an elliptical will make me consider staying here again since the gym is important to me as I'm here for work and health oriented. Staff are friendly and rooms well designed for small room. A hotel room without a dresser is not my cup of tea especially if trying to attract business travelers on a long stay. This is what management should do to improve the experience: open the restaurant, put dressers in rooms under wall mounted tv. Is it necessary to have so much seating in the room? And lastly, ensure all elevators are operating and replace half of treadmills with ellipticals. If they make the changes then I would give them four stars.

If you can get up high and get the view of Waikiki Beach.. Spectacular ! The whole place has been renovated and has a wonderful, contemporary vibe with all the modern conveniences.. Great shop for the daily snacks and sundries. Location is superb! Zach checked us in .. Great customer service.. This was our first trip to Oahu and was a great start before we went to Aulani!! Well done HGI!

Nice location with good updates to the hotel, clean and worked for 5 people. Nice pool and close to the beach. Not overly thrilled with the restaurant options within walking distance. Inconsistent staff information about HHonors perks so didn't end up with a free breakfast or the points.

An excellent hotel to stay, rooms were well laid out and extremely well soundproofed as I heard no noises during my stay, so slept like a baby. Staff were excellent as were the hotel facilities and the location to everything Waikiki was superb. Hotel will only get better once the restaurant opens soon.

I come to Oahu 2-3 times a year over the past five years. I have stayed at many hotels. This was a trip I booked late and their wasn't many good options at a reasonable price. I knew the location cause I saw the construction last time I was here. Since it was a Hilton property I decided to give it a try.I checked in Saturday and after getting to my room I put some stuff in the safe. Unfortunately is wasn't working. I dial 0 and it rang and rang and rang ... After 20 or so rings I told the girl the problem and it was fixed before I got back.Sunday morning we wake up and try to use the shower but the shower head is broken. After that I try to call for the valet. I dial 0 again but this time it rings and no one answers. I go to the front desk and tell them about the phone and shower and they said they would check both.We return Sunday and shower is fixed but Monday and Wednesday same no answer when I dial 0 (Tuesday no problem). On Wednesday I ask for a manager and I'm told no one is available. I come back later and ask again ... No manager available. I question their customer .service with regards to addressing my issues and allowing me to speak to a manager. I finally get a manager who tells me he will address the issues.Thursday and Friday same issue with no one answering the phones. In addition when I get to valet it's a 20min wait every time.Friday I again voice my concerns to a girl at the front desk. She politely nods her head and states someone will look into it. She wrote nothing down, and never asked my name.I travel a lot... And more then most to Oahu and this was absolutely the worst customer service I have ever experienced

We spent 13 days here and were very happy with this hotel. It's close to everything, pink trolley bus stop is just a block away, Foodland is directly across the road. The only drawback is the construction across the road at the International Marketplace (which is scheduled for completion on 25 August) The staff were very helpful, and the adjoining Holoholo market had great food.

The hotel is second row hotels at Waikiki beach, located 5 minutes of waling for the beach front. And it is brand new, so rooms are fresh, clean, attractive and having very modern design. Some facing Pacific (you can see it between first line hotels) and some facing city/mountains view. As gold member I was up-graded from city to beach view at the higher floor, received vouchers for 1 drink per night at the pool bar (3rd floor basic facility) and breakfast in other hotel (Duke's) restaurant, as hotel's restaurant was not ready (summer 2016) yet. Breakfast was pretty generous with numerous hot dishes, omlette station, edd benedict offered, however the quality of food was not outstanding. Moreover the Duke's is very packed in the mornings, lots of famielies with unsupervised kids around. The other option was to use breakfast vouchers at Holoholo Café and Market located by the reception, when one could get complimentary coffee/tea/drink and hot breakfast sandwich or burrito, or fruit, pastry, yoghurt parfait option. The main problem was the noise coming for a street heavy construction works, but it seems they are coming to the end. Otherwise very good, fresh, new option to stay at Waikiki area.

I was amazed by the friendliness of staff and the front desk Kia made sure that everything was ready and taken care of. His professionalism and courtesy is what made this stay awesome. If you are in Waikiki stop by and you are always greeted with the Aloha spirit ❤️

Didn't love it. Tolerable. Room smaller than pictured. Fridge didn't work upon arrival. Bugs were found in the room. Service - some staff were just ok and some great. Nothing out of the ordinary to make it special hotel.

I really enjoyed my stay here and I will definitely revisit. My great experience all started when I received military orders to Pearl Harbor for 2weeks and there were no more hotel rooms available on the base. The HGI was one of two hotels out in town that I could reach a live person and speak with them that day. Not only did they help me with a room but it was for the military per diem rate which helped a lot! Once I got there, I really enjoyed the stay. The room was very nice, modern and perfect size for me. Though I was there for a long stay they made sure to clean my room for me every day so once I was off of work I had a clean cozy room to come back to. Everyone greeted me and they were all very sweet especially the managers Melinda and Kip that helped me greatly with a little car and valet situation I had while staying there. They provided the most hospitable service and even gifted me for my troubles. Wonderful people!!!The hotel is in the middle of everything, which can be a short walk away. The beach is only two blocks away so have fun enjoying the sunsets as I did every evening. I can't wait to return. They really made me feel at home there. Can't believe how much I miss the hotel, the island, the people and Wakiki itself. I would definitely recommend the Hilton Garden Inn.

We had a great stay for our three nights weekend getaway. Location of the hotel is excellent. It is close to shopping area and plenty of restaurants within walking distance. Also close to pickup location for tours. The room was very clean and the cleaning staff were friendly and helpful in giving up what we needed. The staff a the front desk was friendly and were quick to respond when needed.

Great place to stay while vacationing in Honolulu. At the current time of stay, the breakfast area was not opened and will not be open until October. Customer service and front desk handled each issue or concern from the customer.

The location of this hotel is excellent. It is one and a half blocks from Waikiki Beach, easily under a 5 minute walk. The hotel is full remodeled, some floors appear to not be quite complete. Housekeeping was great and all hotel staff was friendly and extremely helpful. I need to mention Jacob at the front desk. He went above and beyond what I was expecting and I travel a lot and have high expectations! You can tell the hotel staff is there to make your stay exceptional.

New hotel. Once bugs are worked out I sure it will be ok. Parking is a huge issue average wait 30-45 min Need to get restaurant open. 15 min walk to contract place. Alarms going off middle of night Pool is small

We traveled with our 10 month old baby so it took me a while to find a good hotel. Because of that, my main concern was having a clean room, crib accommodation, location, and good parking. I'm so glad I chose Hilton Garden Inn Waikiki. The hotel exceeded my expectations. The hotel had undergone a major remodel so it felt like we were staying in a brand new hotel. The staff was friendly. The location is very close to restaurants and shops. We were always out the whole day so we didn't get to use some of the amenities they offer except for the pool which was on the 3rd floor and open till 10PM. Overall, we are completely satisfied with our stay we will be back again!

Once completed, this would be a great place to stay. However, if you are planning to spend much time at the hotel, go elsewhere. The entire block seems to be under renovation, including the hotel. The fire alarm kept going off the last night we were there. They don't have a hot spa and their restaurant is not completed. There is no easy parking nearby and the valet takes long to retrieve your car.

You get Hilton level of quality and you're, literally, a block and half from the heart of Waikiki beach! The price was great compared to the other hotels and, as mentioned, you get Hilton quality service. Clean room, great housekeeping, friendly staff, great in-room wifi, great pool with a bar......you really cant ask for much more. Couple things to keep in mind: there is absolutely no free or long term parking in that area. This Hilton offers valet for $35 a night and it's totally worth it. You can come and go as much as you want at any time of day. Also, there is major construction of a luxury mall right in front. Didn't bother me at all but something to consider. Overall, if youre thinking about booking this hotel..DO IT!!

We stayed at the Hilton for 6 nights. The hotel has just went over a major remodel and what a wonderful job they did. The towels were still so new that they had the new towel lint (not a bad thing) and were super soft. The staff was amazing and very polite and went out of their way to assist you.The hotel in within walking distance to the beautiful Waikiki beach. I would say a 10 min walk. The beds and pillows were very comfortable and we had a nice balcony with a table and two chairs. We did have the ocean view.room but the city view room with a nice view of the mountains.The only draw back to this property is storage space in the room (this is why I did not give the hotel a 5 star rating). You have an armoire in the room but no drawers to put items in. We had 2 suitcases and had to leave one out in the room while we could put the second one in the armoire. There is a safe along with a refrigerator, microwave and a Keurig coffee maker in the room.

This hotel is conveniently located in Kuhio st and you can walk to the city centre within minutes. Nice and friendly staff. The hotel is brand new so everything looks freash.Our room was clean and tidy. Comfortable beds and pillows. No access to balcony. No nice view either! The room had a microwave which was very handy.Free wifi available in rooms .There is a convenience store located adjacent to the hotel lobby where you can buy freash fruits, coffee, pre cooked food, sandwiches, milk, medicine etc.Walking distance to the beautiful Waikiki beach.However there are a few things that lacking in this hotel that you may want to take into account if you want to book a room in this hotel. Hopefully the hotel will improve its services to its guests in the near future!First of all the hotel does not have a restaurant so you will have to depend on outside eateries all the time. Fortunately there are a number of food outlets and restaurants within the walking distance. The hotel does not have an in house kitchen so no room service.No complimentary water bottles in the room unless you are some Gold member.I requested a universal adopter from the hotel so that I could charge my mobile phone but the hotel staff advised that I had to buy my own from the nearby shop. Normally any 4-5 star hotel ( Hilton branded ones in particular) would have a number of universal adopters in stock to lend to their international guests however at this hotel I was asked to buy my own!We had a coffee machine in the room. Coffee pods were also available however only three flavours were there. The coffee machine did not make good coffee so I asked if I could have an electric kettle in the room so that I could make my own coffee but the reception staff said they did not have any so I had to buy my coffee from the convenience store next door.No minibar in the room.No shower cap in the bathroom so again I had to buy my own.

Whole hotel is brand new look and guest rooms are more space for their guests. The rooms have good glass windows so that you are not hear any noise from Waikiki streets. Each room has coffee maker, microwave and refrigerator. There is two fitness rooms for the guests. There is market the next to the front desk/lobby area. This is very convenient for grab and go or late night snacks.

Just a pleasant experience. The rooms, facilities, position are fantastic. But the staff really made it a pleasure to stay. Always smiling, and pleasant and communicative. They actually went out of their way to organize activities, and arrange laundry on a Sunday when it is normally not available because they knew we had to fly on the Monday and couldn't do it then. I wish I could mention them all by name ,but from bell men, to reception, concierge, even the girls who services the room , were a credit to the Hilton brand.

The Hilton Garden Inn Waikiki Beach is a newly renovated HGI in the WB area. The hotel restaurant is still under construction, but there is an adjoining mini market with snacks, beverages, coffee, morning pastries off the lobby area. The hotel room was comfortable, with an easy walk in shower. The room I was placed in did not have a balcony, but I was okay with that. Front desk staff were very friendly and welcoming. Valet staff were also great. Hotel has a poolside bar, including a pleasant lounge area. The female bar staff were exceptional. My major complaint about this hotel is that it has very close proximity to a mall that is under construction and hotel management did not notify me in advance that construction would be going on during my stay. Given how close the property and hotel pool are to this mall, I think guests should have been notified. The noise was terrible and started as early as 7:48am even on the weekend. As a result I did not use the pool my entire stay, which was extremely disappointing for me as I was only there for an extended weekend. I'm not sure I would return, as much as I liked the new rooms and excellent drinks at the bar, because there are so many choices and I don't care for how close it is to a mall, but it is a pleasant property that is easy to navigate. I would wait until construction is finished.

We stay at this 3 week old renovated hotel with the family. It's location by many of our favorite food places which was a plus!!! The pool was full of kids morning till night which was great for my kids to make new friends. A disappointment was there was no hot tub but I guess it already hot enough over in Waikiki. The hotel is located 1-2 blocks from the beach, mall, King village farmers market and everything is in walking distant. Downstairs is a coffee shop and little shop where you can buy snacks, but right accross the street is a small but fully stocked grocery store. They are building a restaurant downstairs so hopefully there will be room service or better poolside food options when it opens The staff was very friendly and the room were comfortable. I will definitely be back.

This hotel was perfect for the last day of our honeymoon. We wanted to beach in Waikiki and close to the beach, shopping, etc. During the early part of our stay, we were at the Four Seasons, Lotus Hotel and Turtle Bay. But, those hotels were a little further from the "action" on Waikiki beach. This hotel is a 5-10 minute walk from the beach and we were content because it was not too busy, crowded or noisy. The room was clean, spacious enough and filled it's purpose. No, this hotel does not have tons of amenities, but if you're looking for the resort feel there are other options in Waikiki. We stayed at resorts before this, so we didn't feel like we were lacking anything. We used the convenience store at the lobby level and took Lyft to the Manoa Falls. We also ate at Eggs n Things (a must). If you're looking for a huge pool, restaurants, and shops at a resort, you should find a resort. But, this hotel lives up to it's purpose and we were content for $200 a night, not bad at all!
user_name:
LaBelle101
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: Our room was tiny but everything is new and lovely. The staff were very helpful and we enjoyed the pool and the pool table. It's a great location away from hectic Waikiki and two excellent restaurants surf and turf tacos and the udon noodle place are on the next block. Also the only supermarket in the area is across the road. We'd come back.

No review others than what I gave in survey. No place to eat drinks over priced freezing pool and no hot tub. Parking was over priced 35 a day. Location was very good with several places to eat around the area

We recently stayed at the Hilton Garden Inn, Waikiki for 5 days & it was great! Our room was spacious, spotlessly clean & the bed was so comfortable! All the staff were very friendly & the hotel is in a great location. There is a supermarket right next door, a cafe on the premises & a restaurant opening soon. The buses run regularly from a few doors down. It is an easy 10 minute walk to the beach a few blocks away. I'd like to give a special mention to the staff who checked us in as they managed to organise for us to get into our room early. It was much appreciated after a long flight & early morning arrival!I would highly recommend this hotel & we will definitely stay there again.

We arrived early in the day and expected to have to store luggage until check-in time. The Staff confirmed that our room was ready early and allowed us to check-in. Turned out to be a blessing. We slept for about 2 hours, got re-energized, then, went out to tour the area. Located right across the street from Food Pantry, which provides the best price on just about everything you may need (from food to souvenirs). Located on the bus route for easy access to farther away activities. A very short walk to the beach, shopping, church, etc.... Nice rooms - large, extra space for luggage, comfortable beds and sleeper sofa.
user_name:
Kirk E R
Dallas, United States

review_body: This hotel was very nice from the lobby to the rooms. The employees were all so inviting and always with a smile. The rooms were very clean and the updated bathroom and decor was nice. The bacony gave you a chance to enjoy the view.

I spend three nights at this Hotel. It was recently renewed and it is still a work in progress. There is no restaurant on site yet but this is not a problem as there are plenty of places to eat as you are in Waikiki.(The restaurant will open in the future.) I am a Hilton Diamond Member and I got a breakfast voucher for a place near by. The breakfast was a really nice and the voucher even covered the tip. My room balcony only had the "Dark Curtain" and was missing the "Privacy" one that lets the light come in. I spoke to management about this and they explained to me that some of the rooms had them and some not due to measurement problems but that they should be in soon. This was not a problem with me because I was upgraded to a room with a partial beach view.Most of the Hotels charge a $30 resort fee. Not this one.  The staff is amazing and very well trained and will do anything to help you.Would I recommend this hotel? YES! As I said in my title, It was recently renewed and it is working hard at finishing a few minor things.

My husband and I chose this hotel due to the location, availability and price. It had only been open a week when we got there. I have worked in hotels and family that is hotel management. I must say that the cleanliness was incredibly impressive. We stayed 5 days. All staff was incredibly friendly and helpful. Valet was great, timely and courteous. The views were alright. I wish that for the price we paid that they would offer a little bit more such as free valet or complimentary breakfast. The showers were huge and the beds were comfortable. I would recommend staying on the upper 5 floors for a decent view.

The staff was very accommodating . Rooms are spacious, but need a little more lighting. The bellhop Michael was courteous and even saved me money. He let me know about an airport shuttle for only $14.00 versus the $ 42.00 cab fare. The hotel restaurants aren't open yet, there are several good restaurants nearby.

Good location to beach, restaurants and activities. Valet parking was awesome but it will cost you 35 dollars a day in and out as much as you want. Rooms are clean And new. They were no issues with my daughters guide dog accompanying her and it was close to ala wai canal for a early morning walk.

The service was average the hotel does not offer many tv channels therefore we were planning to connect our hdmi to watch movies but the technician could not connect it due to the furniture arrangement. Make sure you get an email confirming your stay and rates ours were changed from the quoted rate. Friendly but not helpful or accommodating

New hotel. Nicely renovated. Didn't have room service but this could be due to the hotel just opening and the restaurant not being open yet. So this could change when it opens so check before booking if your after a room service hotel. Enjoyed our stay

This hotel is apparently newly remodeled and the rooms were very comfortable and well lit and had a brightness that said fresh. The location to what matters in the area was great and within easy walking distance to many of the attraction. The beach was about 1 block over and there were many things to do.Now back to the hotel, the staff as a whole were very friendly and if you have read my past reviews on hotels you know I like a staff that is genuine, sincere and friendly and this staff rock it. The morning coffee was the best I had on the Island and sad I could not bring it home

Staff was great but if traveling for business pick another hotel. Tiny rooms, no desk work space only a small counter, no drawers for clothes, terrible AC, only valet available to park and rather slow each morning.

Brand new hotel, very well located and good staff. Good rooms and bathrooms.Some negative points: the constructions around, wich brings a lot of traffic, gym has almost no equipments for working out, the internet has ups and downs and my cable tv did not work during my entire stay, the front desk was aware, twice.Those issues can be fixed easily, hope they do.It is a very good place to stay for its price and location.

The hotel had just opened the week before I stayed there for four nights and they were still working out a few kinks like lights that didn't work, etc. Reception staff were superb and displayed a great attitude through it all. I really liked the "feel" of this hotel and I think it will be very good when all of the final details are finished.

A very relaxing venue in Waikiki. The staff is very friendly and helpful with all aspects of your visit. The lobby is very modern and pleasant to just sit back and hang out. The pool side bar is very new and they are developing as they grow. This is certainly a good value.

The location was good, close to beach, shopping and restaurants. The staff was very friendly and quick to respond to any requests. The price was fair. The hotel was updated and very clean. We would definitely stay here again.
user_name:
Eric B
Southern California, United States

review_body: It was the only hotel with the accurate per diem rate. Very nice rooms. Pool and sundeck very secure on 3rd floor. Hi Steak (fast food kind) right across the street attached to a grocery market. Very convenient location.
user_name:
Larry G
Newport News, United States

review_body: This is what I experienced on our 7-night mistake we made by booking this hotel. 1) Got into an argument upon check in with one of the supervisors regarding the $350 hold that Hilton applied to my credit card. I was never informed that this would be happening prior to checkin. I insisted the hold be released and my request was honored. But it required an argument to accomplish this. This is no way to start a vacation.2) Loud, intrusive construction going on across the street. Too noisy to deal with. Nothing could be done to improve this. The solution is stay at another hotel. This is a long-term construction project.3) Location is poor. It is a hike to the beach. The distance mentioned on the Hilton website is deceptive. You have to pass by all the homeless men & women to and from the beach.4) Housekeeping is inconsistent. My room was skipped 2 days in a row. This required me to inform the Front Desk Staff each time, and on both occasions the Front Desk Staff asked me in a very accusatory tone if I had the "Do Not Disturb" sign on the doorknob. Both times, no. The accusatory attitudes were unacceptable and seemed to always be there with particular Front Desk Staff.5) Towels seem to be in short supply. We had 3 people in our room (myself, my wife, and my daughter) and I continually had to request more towels. Of course, I had to wait a considerable amount of time for them, too.6) Shower drain continually clogged causing the bathroom to flood. This was mentioned to Engineering and never corrected.7) Questionable clientele floating through the hotel. The Hilton Garden Inn Waikiki is close to the homeless population center of Waikiki. The characters I saw walking around on the 9th floor were clearly not guests staying at the hotel. 8) Parking is a nightmare. There is no parking. Valet services were running me $40 per day, with tip. There is no parking on the streets other than metered parking with a 2-hour limit. 9) Garbage removal poor. I watched garbage pile up in front of the elevator daily. Mentioned to the Front Desk Staff and it was corrected. But why does a guest need to bring this to the attention of Staff? It should be handled routinely.10) Pool is murky and unclear. I went into it once and never went back. Too dirty, too murky. The pool deck is filthy. No cleaning is occurring on a regular basis.11) Exercise rooms. The photos on the website never matched what was actually available. The dried sweat all over the treadmills was enough to cause me to never use the room again. This hotel doesn't clean and maintain the Exercise Rooms. Again, brought to the attention of the Front Desk Staff.12) Every door is locked and requires a key card to access. The elevator, restrooms, and the exercise facilities because there are so many homeless people in the immediate area.13) Used condom was found outside my room. Again, the clientele at this hotel is unsavory.As a result, I can't recommend this hotel at all. The experience was awful. The hotel even provided us breakfast buffet vouchers to an equally awful restaurant. No thanks.AVOID, AVOID, AVOID.

The room was a little smaller than I had anticipated. They looked much larger on the website. The shower was really spa like and awesome!The beds were really comfortable. I loved the convenience of the location. It was near restaurants, shops, and the beach!

Great location, updated interiors and for most part very courteous staff and for waikiki the room size is actually very good. The wifi is definitely faster than most hotels in this area.The issue i have with this place is, it being new (to Hilton) you can see they have tried to get it up and running without it actually being ready. Some rooms (like mine) have curtains that do not close completely ( i mean atleast 6 inches or more gap). You can only valet here which is fine if you can get your car in 5 minutes or less. They have such limited parking space that they use other parking spaces (sometimes a few blocks away) and this often results in greater than 10 minutes wait times. Hopefully this situation will change.The desk are a huge accident waiting to happen. The bottom ends are heavy and hanging on rollers to cover the cables. You can basically dislodge them with a little push if you are not careful. This happened to somebody when i was there. I really hope they fix this or this an accident waiting to happen. In all fairness i would give this a good rating if one existed but i hope they can improve.

Awesome stay and had a wonderful sleep after a 11 hour flight. The view of the beach was superb. The walls were pretty much sound proof - can't hear your next door neighbor banging things. The staff was friendly and courteous. They provided great information on what's going on in the local area.
user_name:
Julio F
Fort Walton Beach, United States

review_body: Stayed at this hotel from July 3 to 16. It had opened only a couple weeks before I arrived. As a result - presumably to take advantage of the influx of visitors due to RIMPAC - of the early opening, the hotel restaurant remained unfinished and was not available. That was a significant limitation, but will presumably be rectified shortly. There were 8 of us staying at the hotel on a business trip. One of the 8 brought his wife and child, another was accompanied by his wife. All seemed to appreciate the hotel's location, cleanliness, the very helpful service at the front desk, and the accommodations themselves. All indicated they would be happy to return to this hotel. Location - about midway between Waikiki Beach and the Ala Wei Canal, easy walking distance to the beach and the restaurants and shopping there, while providing easy access to the H-1 highway to get to work or the airport. The 3rd floor pool is nice. The poolside bar would be better if it offered a wider menu (perhaps when the restaurant kitchen opens this will happen) and should stay open later than 9 p.m.
user_name:
James N
East Greenwich, United States

review_body: Family friendly hotel in a great location in Waikiki. Rooms not huge but have microwave and fridge. Food pantry next door. 2 blocks to beach. Great pool and bar. Waikiki is noisy but rooms are silent, some noise from adjacent rooms. Major construction outside but it didn't affect our stay. Nice view of the mountain.

Very nice hotel other than the rooms seemed small. The staff was courteous and helpful. The hotel restaurant was not open during our stay but they offered coupons for Dukes so within a 10 minute walk we had a great breakfast.

Room was incredibly clean, difficult for work since there was no office chair only a bench seat which didn't make much sense to me. The pool bar was outstanding, especially from the help of the bartenders Jacoby and Imee, although the drinks were overpriced and no Jack Daniels...who doesn't have Jack at the bar? Overall, a beautiful place to stay.

Overall my family and I were pleased with our stay at the Hilton Garden Inn. Housekeeping was great. The only real shortfall was wireless internet connectivity in the rooms, and parking service for our rental car at $35.00 per day. The wireless came and went for the first few days and stabilized for the last few days. We always could go to the business center to get internet access. For the car, it often took more than 30 minutes during the busy mornings when everyone was trying to get out.

Room flooded- towels actually floated and no one came to help. Forced to have and early checkout since no other rooms were available. It's been 4 days and the Hotel Manager has still not reached out to me.
user_name:
Songmail
New York City, New York

review_body: Family of 4 stayed for 1 night post-cruise at this newly renovated, modern hotel. As a Hilton Honors member, we were provided with complimentary breakfast vouchers to Duke’s as the hotel’s restaurant is still not ready for use. Breakfast at Duke’s was great and the walk there very easy. Experience at check in was below average. The front desk staff seemed apathetic and unsure. However, our experience with the Bell Desk is definitely worth mentioning and writing about! From the moment we walked in to the moment we checked out, every single one of the Bell Staff we encountered were warm and friendly. Special mention to Nolan who took care of storing our luggage and getting us to a cab. He was so welcoming and genuinely helpful. We could tell that he truly enjoys interacting with the hotel guests. True Hawaiian spirit!
user_name:
TravelFan678
New York City, New York

review_body: Great service. Many thanks to Ashley who ensured our room booking went through seamlessly which started our vacation to a better start. Housekeeping was superb especially with the kids room who had it clean and tidy consistently. The valets and bellhops were always upbeat and courteous; always helpful with directions. I appreciate the Keurig selection in our room too.

I stayed in the hotel for a couple of night and really enjoyed my stay. We were given a higher floor room on the 18th fl, there wasn't much view from the room but I was okay with it. The pool was nice with a pool table in the corner. The staff was excellent and definitely one of the best things about the hotel. One of the downfall is that they don't offer free parking and you always have to wait so long when you're picking up the car.It was close to waikiki beach and the mall which was very convenient.

This hotel has a good location but is still under construction. Combined with the road construction and downtown city noise of a big city it was a far from quiet stay. The room was small, there were no balcony chairs in fact no room chair either and I was not aware that the on site restaurant was under construction. I had to call maintenance to fix the room safe. Chad, the concierge was very helpful as were all the front desk staff. Next time I would probably stay somewhere else.

Brand new hotel, great service nice room and location. Breakfast at Dukes each morning, their restaurant was not open yet, being a gold member we got complimentary breakfast. The lobby is very well designed. Internet not working well. My bed was new but the spring was broken.

Great new hotel,clean,everyone is very professional,friendly,polite. Rooms are great. Close to beach,shopping,restaurants. Quite. Pool is nice. Clean rooms. Had a great time. If going to stay ask for Stacy Manzo great help.
user_name:
Helen M
Hayward, California, United States

review_body: Staff is excellent and location is not bad at all. Rooms are very small with little room to no room to maneuver. Brand new hotel, paint was still wet and very prevalent with the smell. Ice machine only worked on 7th floor and only one washer and dryer.

Was an ok place to stay for the price. Only a few blocks from Waikiki Beach and lots of stores. Main restaurant wasn't open yet and lobby food counter was ok. Wish they had something other then turkey bacon.

Overall great stay. Friendly welcoming staff throughout stay. Yes encountered some nose while construction going was aware & did not take away from stay. Good location close to everything stores shopping buses shuttles & beach a block and a half away

Great location. Clean rooms. Staff was very helpful The room was so Quiet even though the hotel was in the middle of everything. Very nice pool. Good internet Awesome views from all floors. We had an ocean and diamond head view.

I stayed here during their opening week right before 4th of July. Overall, I thought the hotel was clean and tidy. My room was a good size for just me. If I had my family with me, I may have found it cramped. View from my room was non existent since it look directly into the hotel behind us. The staff was accommodating and pleasant. The only downside of this place is the Parking situation. There is only valet parking and it was fairly slow. It probably took close to 20 minutes every time I wanted my car. I think as this place gets its routine down it will improve. I would stay again.

I truly enjoyed staying at this hotel. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The rooms were very spacious and very clean! This was not my first stay at a Hilton Hotel and I would highly recommend staying at any of their properties.
user_name:
Barbara R
Toms River, United States

review_body: Great new facility in a great location but still in the making. Restaurant still under construction and so no room service. Also some hiccups with getting your car...Major construction across the street so presently very noisy.

A few teething problems but I'm sure they will be sorted (bad internet, freezing pool, no breakfast available yet). the hotel will benefit from the mall opening across the street. Nice rooms, comfortable beds, plenty of space and very clean.

Brand new Hilton garden inn. Very well designed lobby and bedrooms. The staff was very friendly and the location of the hotel is great. A few minute walk from the beach. One downside - Waikiki is full of homeless people thought the day and night.

We loved our experience in staying at this Hilton Garden Inn, and felt very welcomed. Our room was very clean and modern. Only concern is that the room was very narrow and small, but I think this may be common in Waikiki? Either way it was a pleasant hotel overall. Give yourself a few extra minutes with the valet. They were nice people, just are still working the kinks out of the new hotel and it took longer than expected.

My daughter and I took advantage of what I am assuming was an intro price at the Hilton Garden Inn on July 2nd. The Garden Inn replaced the old Ohana Waikiki West and we were not disappointed. The front lobby was spacious and inviting, with a fully stocked convenience store attached to the lobby. The rooms were modern and stylish, with extremely comfortable mattresses- (My daughter felt: best sleep ever! I agreed :)

We stayed here for 7 nights in late June and early July. The hotel is beautifully renovated with pretty much everything brand new. Our room was a 2 double bed, city view, facing opposite the beach, and was a little tight size-wise. The balcony was nice even though it overlooked a parking lot and tall buildings in the city. We loved having a fridge and microwave in the room, but beware: there may be a master switch in your room that controls the lights near the bed and TV that also supplies power to the fridge! We found this out the hard way after the stuff in our fridge got warm. The pool and bar area are very nice, but the drinks at the bar are outrageously overpriced. There is a pool table in the bar area as well. Towels and lounge chairs are supplied; towels can be taken to the beach per the front desk. Be prepared to hear the CONSTANT construction noise from across the street (until International Center is done, anyway). Jackhammers and beeping, back-up noises became the background music of our stay. I know this is out of the hotel's control, but you should be aware of this and probably ask for a room on a higher floor or facing away from the construction. We couldn't really hear it from our room.It is clear that this hotel had just opened the week before as some of the kinks were still being worked out. The front desk staff were all very polite and accommodating as they learned the ropes and figured things out. The restaurant was not open yet when we stayed, but there are PLENTY of other options in the area. If you are a Hilton Gold Honors member, you will get a voucher for breakfast upon check-in (the Duke's breakfast buffet option is a MUCH better choice and not a far walk).The only complaint that we had during our stay was the housekeeping. One day they didn't service our room at all and I spent a half hour at the front desk trying to get it straightened out. I was told they sent someone up right then, so we went to the pool and waited a while. Upon returning to our room it was STILL not serviced (now it was 3:00 PM). We went back to the front desk and waited some more. They eventually completed it, but never left new coffee or condiments or cups. I had to go down the hall and grab some more from the housekeeping cart. The housekeeping was hit-or-miss for the rest of the stay. Sometimes it was done by 10, sometimes not until 1:00. They would often not leave replacements for things like cups, towels, or coffee. Maybe it will get better over time.Overall it was a very nice stay. We ended up getting a really good rate since, when we booked, it was supposed to be opening day (they ended up opening a week prior). I look now and I'm not sure I would stay here at the current rates, but would definitely return if rates come down.

Other than the constant construction and lack of garbage can inside my room- this hotel was nice, Updated and clean. The valet is pretty good too, a little frazzled when we were there but I think that had to do with the construction being right where they are and blocking everything.

Nice and clean hotel. Service was a little slow but was I patient considering it went into full operation just the week prior. Great pool area and just blocks from the beach. Got a great rate so pretty happy with our stay.

The staff were so friendly, sincere and embodied the spirit of Aloha. I highly recommend Kia Mason, front desk, kanoa- porter, and Maylene, housekeeping. All the staff were great, but I made a special connection with these 3.

We stayed at the Hilton Garden Inn July 25-28th. We were extremely happy with the service we received and the quality of the hotel. The personnel at the front desk was friendly, and quick to check in. The valet service was fantastic. The hotel itself is brand new so it is very clean. It is a very nice addition to the Hilton chain. It's located about a block and a 1/2 from the beach. We would stay here again.

First of all I really enjoyed and would highly recommend the Hilton Garden Inn Waikiki Beach to anyone who is looking for a perfect location right in the center of everything in Waikiki. Starting from the most friendly and helpful staff, to just wanting that feeling of getting away. Being from the island of Oahu and deciding to just have a staycation is something that we always do and that feeling of actually getting away was something that this new up to dated, beautiful hotel had to offer. During our stay we did had a problem with our microwave not working I went downstairs and I talked to this wonderful friendly guy named Micheal and right away without any hesitation he went to talk to his manager and they offered me and my friend a free complementary lunch upstairs at their pool side restaurant. For me having the microwave not work wasn't really a big deal but they really took the initiative and the effort to make sure that this stay for me was nothing but the best. Everything was quick and easy from checking in to checking out and I can really say that the rooms were spectacular. I am guarantee going to book my next staycation here again and from having that most wonderful experience I right away recommended this hotel to many of my friend and family. Thank you wonderful staff at the Hilton Garden Inn for making this staycation one to always remember.

Close to the beach and everything in Waikiki. Clean and newly remodeled, this was a fantastic experience at less than half the price of many hotels in Waikiki. The hotel staff were friendly and attentive to every need.
user_name:
Michelle M
New York City, New York

review_body: We booked two rooms two days after they opened for business. We are Hilton honors gold members and have never experienced an issue with any other Hilton hotels except this one. When we checked in the front desk systems were not working and the next day we got locked out of our room. The housekeeping was slow and the rooms were not cleaned till 4pm each day. Lastly at the time of check in when we requested for a late checkout and we were told it will be taken care of but the day we were supposed to check out we were told request cannot be taken care of as they are running full. The front desk supervisor was rude and not helping. Not a place you would want to stay for your holidays. .

AlohaWe are locals from Windward side and have stayed in many hotels in Waikiki. We were pleasantly impressed on the Aloha spirit from the staff. 10+ on our bed comfort and the shower area looked brand new. Internet coverage was great as a gold Member of Hilton
user_name:
Ken B
Kaneohe, Hawaii, United States

review_body: Very pleasant hotel, clean and new. The staff are very helpful and friendly. Location is convenient, close proximity to local farmers market, the beach and premium shops. Huge array of restaurants to choose from all within walking distance

We checked in on opening day and think they may have rushed opening. Every day while there was a different issue with housekeeping, no coffee, no cups, no towels. Our last day we were gone all day and came back to our room not being cleaned at 10 PM. Complained to front desk and was promised a comp day which has not been received. The rooms are extremely small, no where to place luggage or drawers to place things. Very disappointed!!!!!!!!

My family and I arrived at the Hilton Garden Inn Waikiki Beach and were met with amazing service at the valet and front desk. Throughout our stay, the staff gave us advice on restaurants, activities and more! The rooms were spotless, extremely comfortable and clean! A great way to start in Hawaii!

The good part is that the hotel is very pretty and in a great location. They also have a lovely, kid friendly pool. I'm told that the hotel was newly renovated and recently opened. Now on to the bad. The first room we were given was infested with gnats! This is probably due to all the construction still being done on our floor (4th floor) and in the room next to us. We spent our first night fighting and killing gnats/flying bugs. Every time my husband killed one we thought it'd be the last one. Nope, it wasn't. We really didn't want to cause a problem but by the next day we were grossed out and couldn't take it anymore. We immediately let the front desk know. They offered to move our room but informed us we'd have to immediately get out of our current room because they had to get our room "ready" for other guest. This left us without a room and they didn't seem to care of the inconvenience considering we had young kids with us! We decided to take the kids to the pool and wait it out. The hotel took all of our luggage and belonging and put it up for us. They told us that around 3pm is when we could get another room. Keep in mind that we paid for this vacation/room that we don't have access to. Then 3pm turned into 4pm. It was after 4pm when we were finally given another room. Great right? Nope. Once we got to the 2nd room the door was already ajar and we were greeted by a cleaning lady. To make a long story short the room was not ready! Literally! The room had not been cleaned and it had no iron, no clock, no front room curtain and the TV remote had no batteries. The maid had no screwdriver so she could not put the batteries in the TV remote and we had to wait on maintenance to do it. My guess is that this newly renovated room had not been finished when it was given to us. While we waited on maintenance we also waited on the nice cleaning room lady to finish cleaning and bringing in all the missing room items. Did I mention we were on vacation and already paid for our room? Now here comes the kicker, once the maid and maintenance man were finally done, my husband and I were set to finally head to the beach with our kids but then we discovered that our room door's key lock/card reader was broken! The front desk could not get the key cards to work which meant there was a problem with the door card reader. Guess what? We had to wait on maintenance again! AND on top of that Jacob the manager informed us that the hotel ordered "special" curtains to cover the front window in our room but they hadn't yet arrived! Soooo, the door doesn't work in room #2 and there is NO front room curtain and yes anyone that walked by our room could peek in on us and our kids! Talk about uncomfortable! At this time we are frustrated. It's not fair that they've charged us for this mess! The kids were getting restless so I decided to take them to the beach and my husband offered to stay at the room while maintenance continued to try and fix the door/key card reader. My husband was told that they'd move us if maintenance could not fix the door. For hours my kids kept asking when daddy was coming to join us at the beach. He never made it. That's how long it took for the door to get fixed! On day 3 we got out and did tourist stuff and had fun at the beach. We had a good day until we got back to our room for the 2nd time (It was after 4pm mind you) and the room still had not been cleaned and had no clean towels after calling the front desk earlier that day to notify them of this the 1st time we returned around 2pm. Instead of calling again, my husband went to the front desk and asked for a new room if no one was coming anytime soon to clean ours. The front desk said "they hadn't gotten around to it yet.” Our kids had sand everywhere and my daughter was quite itchy. We were then moved to a 3rd room. Yes a 3rd room. Day 4 was fine, no issue with our new room. I had a mysterious rash to appear, bummer, but I don’t think it was hotel related, or at least I hopped not. Day 5 had issues but I'm running out of typing space. **Update** We checked out of your hotel on 6/27/16 and we immediately headed to Las Vegas for the 2nd leg of our family vacation. So, imagine the horror when we discovered that most of our budget set aside for that part of the trip was gone because on 6/29/16 the Hilton decided to bill us a 2nd time! My husband has called you twice now and no one could explain the almost double what we already paid charge. He was told a manger would contact him and no one called us. He called again and was given a voicemail. Well it's been days now and still no one has contacted us about this mysterious charge that took place days after we checked out. Mind you we were already fully charged when we booked the hotel. We've since had to dispute the charge with our bank and you still have not called us back.
