I really wanted to like this place as the location was exactly where we like to be but this property just isn't up to standards I expect from Hilton.We arrived about 2AM due to flight issues. They people checking us in were very nice but had no clue what they were doing. A lot of back and forth on computers etc. Eventually got me checked in but think they screwed something up in the process as I had problems at checkout but more on that later. I had to remind the of Diamond member benefits etc. Was informed breakfast for Hilton Diamonds was at Dukes. I dont particularly care for Dukes breakfast buffet as I consider it a pretty run of the mill breakfast and it never changes.....never. It is however slightly better than most Hilton Garden Inn breakfast buffets and at least has a nice view. It is a bit of a hike over to Dukes so can be a bit annoying. We were upgraded to a partial ocean view room (partial is as good as it gets) in a "quiet" area. With the doors closed it was indeed pretty quiet but you really didnt want to be out on the balcony with all the construction going on. The room itself was new and modern but very cramped, we had two checked bags and barely could find a place to put them. We also didnt really care for the room layout with the vanity basically outside the toilet area and really felt like the room and vanity area were all in one room. The toilet and shower are in their own room with a slider door separating it from the rest of the room. I get that I am in Hawaii and shouldnt be spending too much time in my room but when I am in there it would be nice for it to be comfortable and functional. If you are there to do any work, good luck. There is just a bench that pulls out to sit on to work on what is kind of a desk. So, not very functional for a business traveler either. We were informed by the check in staff that the internet was problematic and that was definitely the case, it was very problematic.We do like the location as it is just one block over from the main Waikiki area and just a few blocks away from about anything but there is a lot of construction in the area and it can be loud and it starts early. We tried to go down to the pool one morning and there was no way we could stand to sit there as it was just too loud. The pool area is ok but the pool itself is not so big. The reason breakfast was at Dukes was because the restaurant was not done yet. We took a peak inside the construction area of the restaurant and it doesnt look like it will be done soon. The worst part is that they do not mention this on their web site. It would be important for people to know this as a part of their booking. We had a few other minor issues that the hotel did get fixed and most of the people working there are very friendly and seem eager to help and try but they have no leadership from people that know how things work.When checking out I was looking at my bill and the rate was wrong. I told the person checking my out and after several going back and forth's with someone "in the back" they couldnt get it figured out. I finally realized on my own that they were charging me for the free upgrade they gave me to the partial ocean view room. The "manager" that finally came out to discuss it was nice but really didnt seem to know anything about Hilton and the booking process. She started to inform me that since I used an AARP rate (on the Hilton site) that I had to be charged for the upgrade since 3rd party sites (I booked it on the Hilton site) dont earn benefits. I had to explain booking codes etc to her. She did finally fix it but I dont think she ever fully understood what was going on. What a mess.Finally, I just cant recommend anyone go there right now. If you are booking on Hilton points the other Hilton properties are definitely better value and even at a few bucks more you can better than the product they are offering right now. It is unfortunate as the location is good.

Summary: solid hotel, great refresh and quality improvement that is much needed on Kuhio, but get upper floor on side street until International Market Place rebuild is done - or jackhammers at 6am will be your alarm clock. Hotel will definitely want to update their website when the shopping center construction is done (my guess is Sept 2016).Details:Trepidation at checkin was my lead feeling on arrival at this newest HGI in Waikiki. The construction across the street was pretty much deafening and barely drowned out in what otherwise is a charming lobby with lots of inviting spaces to sit. Checkin staff was terrific, very friendly and at least made me feel welcome over the din. I had booked an upper floor partial ocean view "quiet room," and headed to the elevators as the relentless jackhammers once again increased my trepidation.The elevators were many and efficient and I was quickly to the top of the hotel. The elevator landing is open air, and actually a nice view to the ocean, but not without the din of construction below. Fearing I was on the Kuhio Street side of the hotel, I happily discovered my room was instead on the side street.The room could be best described as cozy and stylish. And, as I closed the door the feeling of trepidation shifted to serene calm. My "quiet room" was exactly that, no sound of construction, and it was blissfully quiet all night long. The king bed was wonderfully comfortable, firm yet plush top, nice pillows. Towels had that new hotel softness that added nicely to a bit of an upscale feel. No cups or glasses in the room, just plastic and paper, and similarly the bath products were reminders you're in a mid-range hotel. The partial ocean view could also be called partial Diamond Head and partial Ala Wai views. From the small but usable lanai the ocean did indeed appear in spots between the buildings. From within the room the view was towards Diamond Head. For the location, that's a pretty good view.The pool deck is nicely laid out, with rows of loungers, nice size pool, and pool bar on a guest access only floor. Until construction across the street is done I did not and would not visit the pool - you may have a higher tolerance for jackhammers than I did. After construction quitting time it was a nice space but needs a little more decor/pizzazz at what felt like a very utilitarian bar. The location is an easy walk to the beach, and in the middle of Kuhio and it's cheap restaurants, bars, etc., and two blocks from tourist central Kalakaua. You can easily use this as your base to suit your tastes, simply go left out of the hotel and a block over to fancier restaurants and shops and the area I call "Ginza-Waikiki," or go right for cheap eats and dive bars. Either choice is safe for walking and exploring, even take in the many sides of Waikiki. If I was in a lower priced, lower floor room, I would probably give the hotel 3 stars until construction is done. But if you do as I did and book a premium room, and if you plan more beach time than pool time, it is a solid 4 stars with room style reaching for 5 stars.

Hotel under construction, terrible customer service, low quality of food and drinks which will explain the low cost in comparing to the other local hotels. If you are planning YOUR trip to Hawaii please consider other sources as this can really ruin your magical investment, mine was.

A very nice hotel. Unfortunately Extremely Loud due to the construction across the street not Hilton's fault or Construction .was very impressed by the Bellman Kazuo we feel that he went above and beyond besides bringing the bags to the room he offered to go down and fill our ice bucket for us placed the" Hilton promise "on our bed and also the amenity Book listing operating times for pool and other Hotel amenities. Coming from Las Vegas and working at one of the Premier Properties on the strip hospitality is of the upmost importance and we definitely feel that Kazuo show that and went beyond.

Staff and rooms are first rate, rooms afford a quiet nights sleep and the mattress is comfy! I wish I could have stayed a few more nights to get more out of all the amenities available to me. I will definitely tell my friends about the Hilton Garden Inn.

Day 2 of 10 day stay and have asked to change rooms. Construction going on across from our room, noisy from 6am. The street traffic is really busy because of the construction. Not Hotels fault. Pool is looked over by construction, so noisy and dusty. Rooms clean, all amenities new, beds comfty, no glasses in room, only paper cups, no milk for tea & coffee. Not offerred the comp water bottles upon check in. Other guests did receive this.NOT TO MENTION I have been charged twice for this accommodation. I made 2 bookings (1 x Expedia and 1 x Bookings.com). Cancelled the Bookings.com one (1) month before trip, as found it all inclusive with Expedia. The Hotel has now charged my debit Mastercard (which is my spending monies for this trip) and told me this will be refunded in 7 to 10 days! Ill be back in Australia by then. This gives question on how secure my credit card details are with Bookings.com. This is the only party I provided my credit card with. The Hotel will not do refund, telling me it is only a 'Holding Fee'... that dosnt make sense when the funds have been withdrawn from my account! I will not stay at a Hilton again, nor use Bookings.com again!!!

Besides the valet attendants and a few bell boys, we thought that the quality of the hotel was below expectation and standard for the Hilton brand. It took three staff to check us in upon arrival. We were given a room where hair was found on the floor, the bed was not made, garbage was littered on the day bed/bench and random bits were found around the room. The rooms are quite small and contained double beds (not queens). The walls do not silence noise from your neighbours and the fitness rooms are inadequate. There are two fitness rooms. One for cardio and one for dead weights. Some times, one elevator was working and stopped on each floor going down.

First time staying in Waikiki and lucked out staying here. I am a Hilton diamond member and chose this because it was a Hilton. This is a new hotel in a great central location. Average uber ride to anywhere in Waikiki was $6.00. Easy walk to beach . Food and shopping. The rooms are every nice with plenty of elevators. Nice downstairs lounge and computer bar. The pool and bar are great as well - well staffed - pool area has a pool table. The rooms are very nice - I chose a room with a lanai with partial view of ocean - very quite when door is closed. Plenty of room to put items. The restaurant was not quite ready so I took the extra points instead of walking to dukes - but when it is will be very nice. Downstairs is a convenience store that is attached to the hotel - overall I lucked out - first person to stay in my room - it was fantastic !

The room and bed was comfortable, best try for a room with balcony facing Kuhio Avenue to relax at the end of a long day of shopping / sight seeing and watch the world go buy. Some rooms even have views of the ocean. Bonus with the room is that the room pass/keycard allows you access to the free shuttle trolley that passes every 10-15 mins with a circle loop of Waikiki and Ala Moana shopping centre. Only advice is the elevators are extremely slow so aim for a room on the 1st or 2nd floor and take the stairs. Good way to burn off all those Mai Tais anyhow. Overall good location, good rooms and great staff excellent value for money

Day 1 of 8 and already not too impressed. Room looks directly at next door hotel, no wine glasses in room, i was given plastic cups by front desk staff. Go to the pool bar and get the most unhappiest, bar staff who have referred to me as 'her' on no less than 5 occasions, i actually left and went to my room in tears. So, i now have to go to the beach and pay to lie on a chair as i cant go to the pool as i feel so uncomfortable. Way to make a guest feel unwelcome

This hotel from what I understood had just reopened after a major remodel. It is a very nice place to stay. Only one thing left to do this the restaurant next door. However there is a cafe type place along with a store attached to the hotel that had a lot of stuff to offer. The staff was excellent at all times. The bell folks included as well as the parking staff. The parking is strictly valet which cost but does have in and out privileges - just let them know that. Fee is added to your bill. Rooms are very nice and comfortable - very modern in style. I had a special business rate so my room did not have a good view - another building behind hotel - but it was OK - no time for sitting outside on patio anyway.Walk to all main areas - two streets or less from beach and many food places. I would recommend this hotel for anyone staying in the area that needs a moderate budget.

Checked in on the very first day that this newly renovated property opened. Staff was great, very eager to please. Everything was spotless. Five minute walk to the beach. Definitely will stay here again.Tip: Be advised that there is construction going on across the street. Recommend a high floor

We hoped to check in early upon arriving to Waikiki and were unaware that the hotel was officially opening that day as the Hilton Garden Inn. We were graciously welcomed by the staff and management and were asked to stay for the official blessing ceremony. What an experience! Our stay was excellent, the accomodations were superb and the customer service was top notch! We will definitely be staying again!
